The demonstrators reportedly chanted anti-president slogans and brandished their shoes as a sign of disrespect to the president and his entourage.
Matatu operators stage protest over police harassment
Residents protest over ongoing insecurity and cattle rustling
TNA supporters stage protest after their candidates certificate was revoked
Students from the 18-May Intermediate School staged a demonstration on the main road from Guuleed Hotel to the Ministry of Education in Hargeisa on 20/02 to protest against a lack of teachers.
Residents march to protest the alleged grabbing of a water catchment area by a private developer
TNA supporters protest when Jubilee candidate requests that TNA candidate step down for the sake of the coalition
Almost 20,000 people protest against al Shabaab in downtown Garoowe. The rally was organized by officials- a government and school holiday was in place to encourage participation.
Youths protest process the IEBC used for receruiting polling clerks
Youths protest process the IEBC used for receruiting polling clerks
About 200 members of the military abandon their positions Qansax Dheere and headed to Berdaale in protest of poor living conditions and no pay.
Employees of a flower farm protest managements decision to stop them from voting
Youths, elders and women groups held a demonstration on 04/03 in front of the Nugaal governors meeting hall in Garowe in support of the formation of a Jubaland state.
Protests and allegations of fraud after man found sneaking an envelope to an election officer while counting was underway

Hundreds gather in protest, demanding the removal of the recently appointed Bay Region governor, Adan Abdi Hasow, who replaced Abdifatah Ibrahim Geesey. The demonstrators chanted 'we don't want Hasow', demanding he step down. Protesters chanted that Baydhabo residents had no input in the new administration.
Traffic officers at weigh bridge stage protest over recent transfer orders
FORD-Kenya candidates supporters protest delay in releasing results; anti-riot police intervene to maintain order
Demonstrations by supporters of losing candidates
Government soldiers erect a road block in Jowhar to protest unpaid salaries.
Members of Luo ethnic group take to streets to protest and express disappointment when Kenyatta declared winner of the election
Protests after guards shoot a man cutting trees in the forest. Police disperse protesters who were blocking the road
Rice farmers protest Act aimed at phasing out parastatals
Municipal Council workers stage protest over the loss of their jobs
Riot police open fire on CORD protesters; several injured
Police arrest protesters upset over Italian memorial to WWII fascist military officer

Local resident of Xayira and Waridad villages demonstrated against the energy company operating in the vicinity of Xayira village (75km EN of Burco) in the morning of 18/03. The protest is linked to a dispute over the sharing of resources offered through the companies presence. The protestors forced a team of the company to return to Burco. No violence was reported.
Hundreds of students from elementary and intermediate schools in Darar-Weyne neighbourhood organized a demonstration to protest against a perceived lack of teachers on 18/03.
Maasai University students protest IDP resettlements plans
Businesspeople protest temporary relocation of governor of county assembly offices to Thika town
Workers at geothermal plan stage protest over working conditions as part of ongoing strike

A group of youths staged a peaceful demonstration in protest against the increasing number of telecommunication antennas in Ceerigaabo on 20/03. The demonstration followed reports that the towers emit rays that cause heart diseases which eventually caused the death of several people in the town. The protestors reportedly chanted 'we don't want agencies that erect towers in the town'.
Students protest over strict head teacher; police disperse protesters without incident
Residents protest poor condition of roads; police arrest protesters
Farmers stage demonstration to oppose land sale
Sugarcane farmers stage protest over lack of payment from factory
Sugarcane farmers stage protest over lack of payment from factory

Residents of Suryo, Isku Dhoon and Ballihiile villages demonstrated against an energy company operating in Burao District. The demonstration was organized following disputes over division of resources offered to the local communities by the company.
Sugarcane farmers stage protest over lack of payment from factory
Students protest after fellow student drowned in suspcious circumstances
Boda boda operators block roads to protest against Municipal Council officer; police intervene and disperse protesters without incident
Muslim residents protest insecurity in Eldoret
Residents demonstrate against Ministry of Gender and Childrens affairs officers
Residents invade and squat in forest to protest that the government had failed to resettle them
Council workers go on strike, block roads and office entrance in protest over unpaid arrears
A large number of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the mayor officers in Galkacyo North on 04/04 in support of the ongoing conference on the formation of Jubaland State in Kismaayo.

A small number of people staged a peaceful demonstration Garowe in the morning of 04/04 in support of the proposed Jubaland State. The demonstrators chanted pro-Jubaland State slogans during the demonstration.
Commercial trucks block highway to protest alleged corruption at weighbridges
IDPs stage protest over living conditions
Residents hailing from the Essa Musse clan protest the presence of a international corporation in their area.

A convoy carrying the governor of Togdheer Region and the mayor of Burco was ambushed at a place called Aroori near Kabadheere village, on the outskirts of Burco, at about 10:15 on 10/04. The ambush was carried out by local gunmen in the area. One policeman and one civilian were reported killed during a brief fire fight between the attackers and the convoys armed escort. Following the killing family members of the deceased carried out a short-lived protest after they were denied entrance to a nearby hospital.
Parents and pupils stage demonstration at primary school over alleged harassment by their neighbor
Residents protest after they were unable to locate the new constituency offices in their district
Prisoners stage protest over delay of their appeal cases
Thousands of citizens have demonstrated in the Somali capital to denounce Sundays assault at the courts building in Mogadishu that killed 35 people.
Civil society group stages protest to urge government to reduce military spending
Prisoners stage protest over delay of their appeal cases
Trans Nzoia IDPs invade stadium in Kitale to protest that the government had not yet resettled them
A small group gathered to protest a water shortage in the area.

Hundreds of civilians staged a demonstration in Cabuud Waaq in the morning of 17/04. The demonstration was in support of the decree issued by the local administration banning freelance militiamen from carrying arms in the town.
Machakos country assembly members stage protest over delay in salary payments
Residents demonstrate over water shortage
Students stage protest over poor sanitation conditions
Students stage protest over poor sanitation conditions; police block striking students
Ugandan traders block border post with South Sudan to protest the way they are treated in South Sudan
Residents stage sit-in to protest court order to evict them
Ugandan traders block border post with South Sudan to protest the way they are treated in South Sudan
Boda boda operators block roads to protest poor road conditions

About a hundred people staged a demonstration in Dacarbudhuq village (60km NE of Hargeisa) in the morning of 24/04. Reports indicate that the demonstration was related to the food aid donated by the Turkish government.
A group protests the distribution practices of aid.

Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in front of Villa Somalia (presidential palace) in Wardhiigley District in the noon of 24/04. The protestors accused the mayor of Mogadishu of selling their land to private companies and called on the military to intervene.
Turkana herdsmen protest after raiders from South Sudan attack their villages
URP MPs lead demonstration to demand party revoke nominations of members of county assemblies which they claim were unfair
Villagers protest over rising cases of mob justice

Residents of Kalabaydh village in Gabiley District on 04/05 staged a peaceful demonstration in protest against the delivery of small quantity of the Turkish aid. The protestors claimed that the government only delivered 30 bags to the village despite Kalabaydh being the only village with a large number of people.
Youth disrupt MPs speech to protest local elections to CDF committee

Residents of Bosasso took to the streets on 06/05 in protest against the refusal of 500 Shilling note by Puntland revenue department and business people in Bosasso. The revenue department rejected the bank note since they were old and worn out.
Patients protest over poor treatment at local hospital

Puntland soldiers travelling in armoured vehicles came into Bosasso, sealed off some government facilities in the town including Bosasso port and the central bank in protest to unpaid salaries. Prison guards in Bosasso, who have not been paid for three months, also threatened to release all their prisoners should their salaries not be paid.

Hundreds of civilians staged a demonstration in Dhusamareeb on 08/05 to express their support to the London Conference on Somalia. The regional governor and the district commissioner of Dhusamareeb took part in the demonstration.

About a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Qardho in the morning of 10/05. The protestors were opposed to the transition to multi-system of democracy and the planned local council elections to be held in Puntland. The demonstrators marched on the streets chanting anti-President Abdirahman Farole and anti-democratization slogans.

Pro-opposition supporters staged a demonstration in the area between Juba Hotel and SBC Radio station in Bosasso in the morning of 10/05. The demonstrators were opposed to the planned local council elections to be held in Puntland. The protestors were reportedly carrying placards with slogans expressing that the forthcoming elections would not be free and fair. The protestors erected road-blocks on the main road. Police fired in the air to disperse the protestors. Reports indicate that a number of demonstrators were arrested.
HIV activists stage march to plead with donors not to cut HIV funding
A group of truck drivers protest illegal extortion roadblocks.
Protesters march in front of parliament to protest legislators salary raise; police dispersed protesters after they released piglets and threw blood on the streets
Beach operators protest alleged harassment by Kenya Wildlife Service Wardens

About hundred pro-Khatumo supporters staged an anti-Somaliland demonstration in Madareemin neighbourhood in Laas Caanood in the morning of 18/05. The demonstration was staged at a time the when Somaliland was celebrating its 22nd anniversary of independence. Police dispersed the demonstrators.
Family of British man who died in police custody stage demonstration on anniversary of his death

A demonstration against the election of Sheik Ahmed Madobe as the president of Jubaland State was held in Kismaayo in the morning of 19/05. The demonstrators marched through the streets of the port city and finally gathered before the hotel where Somali government committee resides.
Protests as police raid newspaper offices on orders from the government
Truck drivers block roads at weighbridge to protest perceived unfair treatment

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration at Sayidka monument (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 21/05 in protest against plans by some Members of Parliament to table a confidence vote against the prime minister and his government. The demonstrators were carrying placards and chanting anti-MPs slogans.

Unnamed anti-al Shabaab forces in Bulo Xawo closed the border crossing point with Kenya in the morning of 22/05 in protest over unpaid salaries. The salaries of these soldiers were reportedly withheld after they refused to be deployed to Gabarhaarey to take part in planned offensive against al Shabaab. The soldiers also closed several business, telecommunication, and electricity offices.
Police based in Laag (27km S of Bosasso) reportedly erected a new road-block in protest against unpaid salaries in the morning of 22/05. The road block was removed shortly thereafter.
Students protest over perceived mismanagement of institution
Women groups, youths and community leaders and Khatumo State military staged a peaceful demonstration in Badhan in the morning of 24/05 in support of the formation of Jubaland State.

Protestors prevented officials of the Horseed Party from opening an office in Dharoor village (50km NW of Iskushuban) on 24/05. The group reportedly chanted anti-Horseed and anti-President Abdirahman Farole slogans, claiming that the process of transition to multi-party democracy was not in line with the constitution and thus they would not allow the opening of political parties offices in the village.
Eritrean refugees demonstrate against Eritrean regime

An unidentified armed man shot at a peaceful demonstration in support of Sheikh Ahmed Madobe as the president of Jubaland State in Kismaayo in the morning of 26/05. One woman was injured in the attack.
Sawmillers camp at governors office to protest against logging ban

About a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Qardho in the morning of 27/05. The group is opposed to the transition to multi-party democracy which the government of launched last year. The demonstrators marched on the streets of Qardho and chanted anti-President Abdirahman Farole slogans and blocked officials of Horseed Party from opening an office in Qardho.
Police assault and tear gas peaceful protesters outside newspaper offices

Members of the Issa clan gather to protest the detention of an elder at the hands of Somaliland police. The elder, who accused the local government of misallocation of land, was eventually released due to their efforts.
A group of residents of Dayniile District staged a peaceful protest against an increased number of rapes in the area.
Police assault and tear gas peaceful protesters outside newspaper offices
Students stage strike and protest over actions of college administrators
Protests outside newspaper offices which police shut down earlier in the month
Students stage strike and protest over actions of college administrators

About a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Qardho in the morning of 31/05 in protest against the statement made by Puntlands minister of information against the former Puntland president. The minister reportedly accused the former president of inciting acts of insecurity in Bari Region. The demonstrators reportedly chanted anti-minister of information slogans.
Semayawi (Blue) political party stages peaceful protest in Addis Ababa
Oil refinery workers protest at threatened closure of the facility

About a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Garowe on 10/06 in protest against the fighting in Kismaayo. A number of Puntland ministers and MPs addressed the rally and reportedly accused Somali forces of fuelling the clashes in Kismaayo. The rally ended peacefully.

Thousands gather to protest recent killings of Somali refugees in South Africa. The demonstrators criticized the South African authorities who they believe did not do enough to protect Somali nationals living in the country.
Demonstrations outside parliament to protest lawmakers plans to raise their salaries
Boda boda operators protest perceived police harassment
Hundreds of civilians staged a peaceful demonstration in Beled Weyne in the morning of 12/06 in protest against the killing of Somali nationals in South Africa.

A group of students from Farah Omaar Secondary School staged a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Education in Hargeisa in the morning of 16/06. The students were protesting against an examination supervisor, who reportedly ordered female students to remove their veils in an effort to check whether they were carrying materials that could be used for cheating.
Black Monday group occupies Finance Ministers office to protest heavy taxes and corruption
Police shoot protester while trying to break up a demonstration
Members of Albino Society of Kenya protest discrimination
Government workers stage protest over wages (Nairobi - Starehe).
Police open fire on peaceful protesters, injuring protesters and bystanders

Hundreds of Jareerweyne community in an IDP camp in Galkacyo North staged a peaceful demonstration in the main streets of Galkacyo North in the morning of 21/06. Members of the community were reportedly protesting against the fighting in Jowhar District (involving Jareerweyne and Abgal clans). The demonstrators reportedly accused government security of not doing enough to stop the attack against their clan (Jareerweyne) in Jowhar District.

Garbage collectors staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Berbera municipal council on 23/06 in protest against a decision by the council to offer free garbage collection service. The garbage collectors used to get small fees from business premises along with their salaries.
Police arrest Besigye and other leading figure with civic group 4GC (For God and My Country), after they gathered to stage a demonstration
Police arrest anti-corruption activists who were staging a protest outside the finance ministry

Horseed Party supporters staged a peaceful demonstration in Xin-Galool (141km SE of Ceerigaabo) on 29/06 in protest against the move in which Somaliland forces ejected a delegation from the Transition Puntland Electoral Commission (TPEC) members from Badhan on 25/06.

Supporters of Horseed Party in Puntland staged a peaceful demonstration in Badhan on 29/06 in protest against the move in which Somaliland forces ejected a delegation from the Transition Puntland Electoral Commission members from the town on 25/06.
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda

Resident of Bulo Xawo on 01/07 staged a demonstration in protest against KDF involvement in the armed clashes between Ras Kaambooni forces (RKB) and those loyal to Barre Hirale in Kismaayo on 29/06. A man affiliated with Raskamboni opened fire in the crowd, injuring one of the demonstrators.
Protesters march from Freedom Corner, Uhuru Park (Nairobi - Westlands) to the front gate of the parliament building against a proposed plan to give MPs a pay raise.

A demonstration in protest against the involvement of KDF in recent clashes in Kismaayo was held in Ceel Waaq in the morning of 01/07. The governor of Gero spoke at the event and declared the KDF was an enemy and a destabilizing factor in the region.
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
A demonstration in support of the possible appointment of Suleiman Hagla-Toosiye as the Somaliland minister of health was held in Buuhoodle on 02/07.

Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Garbahaarey on 02/07 in protest against KDF involvement in the armed clashes between Ras Kaambooni forces (RKB) and those loyal to Barre Hirale in Kismaayo on 29/06. The demonstrators reportedly shouted anti-Kenyan slogans and reportedly burnt the Kenyan flag.
Lobby groups staged protests in Uhuru (Nairobi - Westlands) to oppose the Value Added Tax Bill, which was being brought before the National Assembly at the time of the demonstration.

Hundreds of people staged demonstrations in Industrial road, Al-Baraka Junction, Trebunka, Maka Al-Mukarama road in Hodan District in the morning of 02/07. The demonstrators were protesting against the arrest of Sheikh Hassan Dahir Aweys by the Somali government. This is the second day demonstration held in Mogadishu in protest against the arrest of Aweys.
Police open fire on protesters; one killed
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda
Transport strikes and protests throughout eastern Uganda

A group of workers strike, protest for a salary increase near Mombasa city hall. The over 2,000 workers marched in the streets carrying a coffin, placards and chanting anti-Hassan Joho (Mombasa Governor) slogans. They marched along Moi, Digo and Nkrumah Roads.
Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration at Zero area in Ceerigaabo District on 06/07 in support of the UKs ban on khat. The demonstration was organized by local youths and elders.

Hundreds people staged a peaceful demonstration in Jowhar on 07/07 in protest against the presence of KDF in Lower Juba Region. The protestors accused the KDF of not being neutral in the recent fighting in Kismaayo and called for their withdrawal from the region.

Members of various opposition parties protest outside the building of the Transitional Puntland Electoral Commission (TPEC), who been training university students on election process. Police fired weapons into the air to disperse the group. A militia group loyal to the demonstrators attack the police in their defence.
Highway construction workers gathered at their companies offices near Turbo to protest over a delay in pay.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration along Mogadishu-Afgooye road in protest against the destruction of Xawa Cabdi Hospital (Xawa Cabdi settlement) in the morning of 10/07. The protesters, mostly women and children, chanted slogans denouncing SNG forces for demolishing the hospital.

About a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Iskushuban in the morning of 11/07 in protest against political parties. The demonstrators reportedly carried anti-political parties slogans. Horseed party official, who had been planning to hold a public rally in the town, were forced to cancel it following the demonstration.
Anti-democracy protesters demonstrate in Xaafuun.
A group of butchers blocked the Thika-Garissa highway outside of Thika in protest of increased slaughter prices.

About a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Xabado Stadium in Buuhoodle on 13/07 in protest against plans by Puntland to hold the local council elections in Buuhoodle. The protestors chanted slogans condemning pro-Puntland Dhulbahante officials who were organizing the elections to be held in the town.
Ethiopian opposition activists on Sunday demanded the release of journalists and political prisoners jailed under anti-terror legislation in demonstrations in two major towns.
Ethiopian opposition activists on Sunday demanded the release of journalists and political prisoners jailed under anti-terror legislation in demonstrations in two major towns.

About hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Xaafuun (115km NE of Iskushuban) on 14/07 in protest against the democratization process being spearheaded by Puntland government. The demonstration was organized by the community leaders.
Residents of Wajir gather to protest the delay of a sewer building project.

Residents held a peaceful demonstration over poor services by the Kiambere Mwingi Water and Sanitation Company in Mwingi. The residents led walked from Mwingi downtown towards Kimwasco offices and said they were tired of mistreatment by employees in kiosks.
Opposition protestors detained after rare show of dissent
Ukasi residents protest a recent spat of killings in their area. The nature of the violence is not clear. The group gathered along Garissa-Mwingi road.

A group of Boda Boda Riders (motorcycle group) gather to protest the killing of two of their colleagues by gangsters. The group called on the police to investigate the case. Police dispersed the group with teargas and made over 120 arrests.
Nigerians living in Nairobi gather at the High Commission to protest police harassment. The group believed authorities stereotyped them as miscreants and drug dealers.
A group of 500 Nakuru Matatu drivers protest a killing of one of their compatriots by police earlier in the week. Police fired tear gas to disperse the group.
Public transport drivers staged a peaceful demonstration against the customs department and their taxation practices.

The security guards of the District Commissioner of Guri Ceel shot in the air to disperse a group of people who staged a demonstration in front of the Commissioners office on 23/07. The demonstrators were protesting against the decision to ban the new Somali currency that was reportedly printed illegally. The protestors claimed that they money was already in circulation and it was too late to withdraw it. An elderly man was killed by a stray bullet.
For the second time in less than a week, Nigerians living in Kenya protest alleged police harassment.
Prison warders at Manyani Maximum Prisons blocked the Nairobi-Mombasa highway for several hours to protest the killing of their colleague who was run over by a lorry.
Police use violence to disperse opposition protest
Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Beled Weyne in the morning of 24/07 in protest against the new illegally printed Somali currency.
Students protest at school, claiming that they had been attacked by demons and witchcraft

Relatives of an alleged rape victim staged a demonstration in front of Sanaag regional court in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 25/07. The group was protesting against a court ruling in which the suspected perpetrator was released for lack of evidence. Police arrived and arrested a number of the protestors but released them in the evening.

Makueni boda boda operators demonstrated against the IEBCs (Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission) move to hire non-local transporters to ferry polling materials in preparation a Senatorial by-election.
Arrests Made After Muslims Hold Protest Rally

Wheat farmers of Narok County gathered at the offices of National Cereal and Produce Board in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) to protest the move by two millers to reduce the purchasing price of the produce.
Workers strike outside consulting engineers office
MP leads demonstration to protest conditions at hospital, police arrest him and others

About one hundred people demonstrated against the Puntland administration in the vicinity of Dharkayn-Geenyo village (67km SW of Laas Caanood) in the morning of 29/07. The demonstrators were protesting against the creation of a new Puntland district with its centre in the area.
Protesting students of Mwandango High School block teachers from entering campus in an effort to stop them from administering an examination.

A group of IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the local municipality office to protest against perceived misallocation of shelters provided by an INGO to vulnerable families in Koosaar IDP camp.
Reports over video of demonstrations in Bati town and South Welo Zone to condemn the recent killing of a Muslim cleric in the central Ethiopian town of Dese.

A demonstration in support of Turkey and attended mainly by women and children was organized in Dal Jirka Dahason area in Boondheere District in the morning of 01/08. The demonstrators were addressed by the Governor of Banadir Region who blamed the al Shabaab movement and politicians opposed to the stabilization of Mogadishu for a recent attack on a residence of the Turkish Embassy. The demonstration ended with no incident.
Reports over video of demonstrations in Bati town and South Welo Zone to condemn the recent killing of a Muslim cleric in the central Ethiopian town of Dese.
Boda boda operators in Rongo town protest against the increase of operating charges from Sh80 to Sh100.

A group of people living with disabilities protested at Ol Kalou town in Nyandarua county at the weekend. The group was objecting to the nomination of their representatives to the county assembly. The protesters said it is wrong for able-bodied people to take up seats reserved for people living with disabilities. The nominees are set to be sworn in next week.
A number of Berbera residents demonstrated in front of the police station in Berbera on 03/08, demanding the release of ten youths that had been arrested in Dara Godle on 31/07.
Inmates stage protest; refuse to disembark from bus to protest delays in court proceedings
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.

More than 2000 residents living near the Malindi airport yesterday held a demonstration protesting against a plan to expand the runway. The residents opposed the move and asked the authorities to relocate the airport to Langobaya claiming it will cause huge losses to over 25,000 households residing within the stipulated area.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.

Hundreds of matatu operators held demonstrations in the streets of Eldoret town following the shooting of a tout by a police officer after they allegedly differed on a Sh100 bribe. Police dispersed the crowd with rubber bullets.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.

Residents of Kanyaltin in West Pokot county protest over illegal logging at Kapkanyar forest by rogue traders. Led by Pokot South MP David Kosing, the residents asked the government to stop the cutting of trees that has now created tension in the area.
Striking Mombasa county workers took to the streets over for payment of their five-month salary arrears.

Armed men believed to be government soldiers opened fire on a group of protestors in Mogadishu, killing at least two civilians and injuring two others. A number of Hodan district residents were protesting the demolition of their residences by a group of armed men with bulldozers hired after the Hodan district administration warned residents to vacate the properties.

Disgruntled Raskamboni militiamen were reported to have opened fire in the air and blocked traffic in Kismaayo in the morning of 15/08. The militiamen were protesting against the reduction of their promised salaries from 200 to 100 USD. The incident affected traffic on all major roads and forced some businesses to temporarily suspend their activities.

A group of widows of the SNM (Somalia National Movement) fighters staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the presidential palace in Hargeysa in the morning of 18/08. The group reportedly protested against the governments failure to implement its pledge of including them in the governments pension scheme. Police arrested several women and a local online journalist.

Hundreds of people, mostly women and children, took to the streets of the southern Somali town of Jowhar to protest against the decision by the medical charity, Doctors Without Borders, to pull its staff from Somalia.

A group of women charcoal sellers staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the municipal council office in Borama in the morning of 20/08. The group reportedly protested against municipals act of forcefully evicting them from the business area. Reports indicate that the eviction was aimed to clear the way for the rehabilitation of the road. The protestors called on the municipal council to allocate them a place to sell the charcoal.
Tuk-tuk taxi operators protest newly implemented traffic routes and rules in downtown Mombasa.

A group of youths hold an unsanctioned demonstration and are arrested by Somaliland police several days later. The group staged the demo after they were left out in the recruitment of logistic assistants for a conference to reconcile Isse and Gudabirsi clans.

Raskamboni forces loyal to Madobe open fire on protesting civilians and destroy their property. Houses were demolished in Bula Abliko which is situated in the outskirts of Kismaayo. Ten injuries reported.
More than hundred pro-Khatumo supporters staged a demonstration in Taleex on 28/08 in protest against the visit of the vice-president of Puntland.

A group protests against a national reconciliation agreement reached in Addis Abba with the Somali government two days prior. The agreement reached articulated that Jubaland will be administered for a two year period in a semi-autonomous fashion by a Juba Interim Administration and led by the regions incumbent president, Ahmed Mohamed Islam.

Hundreds of residents in the city of Baidoa in Bay region took to the streets in protest against the agreement that the Somali government signed with officials from Jubbaland. The group wished to retain greater autonomy.
rally which was organized by Addis Ababa Inter-Religious Conference was flooded by residents of Addis

Employees of Al-Jaabiri Livestock Company staged a peaceful demonstration in Berbera on 01/08 in protest against unpaid salaries and benefits. The demonstrators accused the company of violating Somaliland laws and called on the government to address the matter with the company.

A peaceful demonstration was organized in Boondheere District in the morning of 01/09 to support the Addis Ababa agreement on Jubaland. The demonstration was attended by the Somali Minister of Interior and the Governor of Banadir Region.
A group of youths protest land developers from taking over a piece of land at the Imtiaz mosque on Lagos Road, in Nairobis central business district (Nairobi - Starehe).
Waving twigs and placards more than 200 internally displaced persons demonstrated in Nyeri town, demanding to be relocated.
City/county labours protest the county governments failure to increase their salaries as agreed upon in their collective bargaining agreement.
Unionized striking labourers hold a demonstration outside city hall (Nairobi - Starehe) demanding increased pay.
More than 100 boda boda operators protest outside the DC offices over insecurity and theft in the area.
Striking county workers continue a salary protest.
Striking county workers continue a salary protest.
Newly enlisted soldiers march to Villa Somalia in protest of government neglect toward their salaries.
Following the shooting and killing of two attendants at a petrol station, local residents protest, calling for increased security in the area.

Several hundred passengers holding flight tickets from Ethiopian Airlines demonstrated peacefully in front of the Ministry of Civil Aviation in Hargeisa on 07 and 08/09. The demonstrators were complaining about the cancellation of Ethiopian Airlines flights to Hargeisa these two days.

Several hundred passengers holding flight tickets from Ethiopian Airlines demonstrated peacefully in front of the Ministry of Civil Aviation in Hargeisa on 07 and 08/09. The demonstrators were complaining about the cancellation of Ethiopian Airlines flights to Hargeisa over these two days.
A group of residents of the Kibera slum (Nairobi - Kibra) in Nairobi protest forced removal.

Around 150 passengers holding flight tickets from Ethiopian Airlines demonstrated peacefully in front of the Ministry of Civil Aviation in Hargeisa in the morning of 11/09. The demonstrators were complaining about the cancellation of Ethiopian Airlines flights to Hargeisa and were requesting that the minister negotiates with the company to have their tickets changed with other airlines. Some demonstrators moved to the Ethiopian Airlines office in the afternoon and were dispersed by elements of the Somaliland police.
Farmers protested the NFRA not paying them on time
Farmers protested the NFRA not paying them on time
Farmers protested the NFRA not paying them on time
Traders at Burao livestock market staged a peaceful demonstration in Burao on 13/09 in protest against the new tax increase in livestock.

Local community elders and residents protest in Caroolay Village against a planned visit by the Puntland Vice president. Reports indicate that the elders mobilized their clans militias to prevent against any visit by Puntland officials.
After a pastor of a church attacked a parishioner during a private dispute 200 members of the church gather outside the church building to protest the behaviour.
Persons with disabilities protest potentially being thrown off their land.
Students protested over tuition

A peaceful demonstration against Brussels conference was held in Baidoa in the morning of 16/09. The rally was organized by the local authority and elders. Bay regional officials and elders addressed the rally and said that they were opposed to the conference.

A number of people, mostly youths, staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo in the afternoon of 16/09 to express their support to the president of Somaliland for laying the foundation stone for the construction of Burao-Ceerigaabo road. The group reportedly chanted pro-Somaliland president slogans during the demonstration.
Students protested over tuition. Police intervened and arrested some demonstrators.

District authorities in Yaaqshiid District organized a demonstration in support of the New Deal conference on 17/09. Local medias report that hundreds of residents attended the event. No incidents were reported.

Somaliland police and a group of pro-Somaliland government counter protesters attack a group of peaceful protesters demonstrated against the ban on Somali currency in Somaliland. At least ten injuries.
Students protested over tuition. Police intervened and arrested some demonstrators.
Bosasso police forces protest for unpaid salaries. Many of the protesting officers were arrested by the regional commander.
Hundreds of women in Nandi County staged demonstrations against the sale of alcoholic drinks to school children.
Boda boda protesters demonstrate against government harassment after refusing to pay a highway levy.
Hundreds of boda boda operators demonstrated in Malindi town against increased cases of brutal murders of their colleagues by suspected street gangs.

Hargeisa University students staged a demonstration in front to the university in the morning of 21/09 in protest against fee increment. The university increased the fees per semester from 180 to 200 USD. The students agreed to disperse after the minister of education and the police commissioner addressed them and promised to discuss the issue with the universities administration. No casualties or destruction of property was reported.

Members and supporters of Semayawi (Blue) Party held a demonstration on Sunday, 22 September 2013, at Janmeda in Addis Ababa. Semayawi Party was prevented from holding a public rally at Meskel Square on 22 September and forced to hold it at Jan Meda, a suburb in Addis Ababa

More than 20 IDPs from Koosaar Village (in the outskirts of Burao) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the office of governor of Togdheer Region in Burao on 22/09. The protesters complained that the villages head had been diverting their share of humanitarian aid.

Public transport drivers staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the parliament building (Hargeisa) in the morning of 22/09 in protest against governments plan to increase road taxes. The drivers reportedly submitted a memo to the speaker of parliament urging the parliament not to approve the bill.

A peaceful demonstration in support of the proposed formation of Southwest state which will bring together six south-central regions was held in ADC compound in Isha neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the morning of 24/09.
Boda Boda drivers were protesting police brutality.

More than hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood (Las Anod) on 28/09 in protesting against traders from southern Somalia. The protesters claimed that the traders were behind the increasing house rents in the town.
A leading Ethiopian opposition group gathered Sunday to protest against the countries anti-terrorism legislation, the head of the group said.

Pro-Somali forces in Ceel Barde on 29/09 reportedly vacated their positions in protest over unpaid salaries. The soldiers reportedly quarrelled with the Bakool governor after they were left out during payment of salaries received from regular forces recently. Reports indicate that the group went to the Ethiopias town of Godey and vowed not to return until they are paid.

The Yiaku community living on Kurikuri Group Ranch in Mukogodo division protest at the border of the Kurikuri and Makurian group ranches in what they alleged was bias from the provincial administration over a land division conflict.

Burao General Hospital staff held a peaceful demonstration in front of the hospital over a decision to lay off about 30 employees, after a sponsoring NGO pulled out of the country. The group explained their grievances to the media and accused the hospital management for their planned lay off.
Shorty after the assassination of prominent cleric outside a mosque a group mobilised at the Masjid Musa mosque to protest the act.

A group of people staged a demonstration in front of Burao water agency in Burao on 05/10.The demonstrators, who comprised of women and children, were protesting against acute water shortage that hit the town. They called on the government to sack the manager of the water agency.
Residents of Kismayo protest the killing of a mini-bus driver by a Jubaland soldier. Following the protest authorities arrested the perpetrator.

After a Boda boda rider was gunned down by a suspected police official for unknown reason, several of the victims delivery comrades protest the shooting. Several days later the group officially entered a labour strike in further protest. It is not clear when the protest to the shooting occurred, as it may have been the following day or later.
Truck drivers boycotted work to protest against an excess weight tax.

A group of Puntland Darawish forces maintain an illegal road-block in the outskirts of Galkacyo north in the afternoon of 07/10 in protest over unpaid salaries. The group had shot and killed a man the previous day in a toll dispute.

Hundreds of IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration against the Somali Government in Afisiyooni neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the morning of 07/10. The demonstration was triggered by a letter written by the government ordering the IDPs to move from state land in Afisiyoni neighbourhood. The IDPs again staged another demonstration in the morning of 08/10.
Parents and teachers of a school protest a private land developer who has allegedly used a 1.5 acre plot belonging to the school for his own purposes.
Truck and bus drivers boycotted work to protest against an excess weight tax.
Darwish soldiers continue a salary protest by maintaining an illegally erected roadblock for the third consecutive day.

Hundreds of IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration against the SNG in Afisiyooni neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the morning of 07/10. The demonstration was triggered by a letter written by the SNG ordering the IDPs to move from state land in Afisiyoni neighbourhood. The IDPs again staged another demonstration in the morning of 08/10.
Darwish soldiers continue a salary protest by maintaining an illegally erected roadblock for the fourth consecutive day.
Darwish soldiers continue a salary protest by maintaining an illegally erected roadblock for the fifth consecutive day.
Puntland forces manning Garowe airport attempted to block access to the airport in the morning of 10/10 in protest over unpaid salaries.
Truck and bus drivers boycotted work to protest against an excess weight tax.
Slum dwellers gather at the Lands Ministry (Nairobi - Westlands) to protest recent forced evictions.

Residents protest the lack of title deeds provided by the government in Macalder town in Nyatike district. They asked President Uhuru and Lands Secretary Charity Ngilu to give them the deeds to their property.
Students of Tsimba Secondary School in Kwale on demonstrated to protest what they said is mistreatment by their principal.

A large demonstration against the arrest by the Belgian government of former pirate leader Mohamed Abdi Hasan [aka] Afweyne and former Himan and Heb president Mohamed Abdullahi Adan Tiey has taken place in Cadaado. Protesters at the demonstration demanded that the Belgian government release the two men.

A number of people, mostly youths, staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the Ministry National Planning office in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 19/10. The demonstrators were reportedly complaining that the ministry used nepotism in the recruitment of enumerators. Sanaag regional governor and the mayor of Ceerigaabo intervened and postponed the recruitment exercise.
Somali government soldiers and orphans of deceased service members stage a protest in Mogadishu over not being paid their stipend from the government.

A group of people staged a demonstration in Wanla Weyne on 20/10 in protest against increased in the number of illegal checkpoints in the district on 20/10. Somali government soldiers opened fire to disperse the demonstrators. A civilian was injured in the shooting.

Hundreds of civilians staged a peaceful demonstration Cadaado on 21/10 in protest against the arrest of the former president of Himan and Heeb by Belgium police. The protestors asked the SNG to intervene and secure his release. This is the second demonstration held in Cadaado following the arrest of the former regional leader.
Bar owners protest unjust regulatory practices by the government.

More than a hundred people, mostly youths and women, staged a peaceful demonstration in Xabado stadium area in Buuhoodle in the morning of 23/10. The demonstrators expressed their support to the ongoing meeting of Khatumo 3 conference in Taleex.

Street hawkers operating in Nakuru town protest against allocation of public land to two developers. The hawkers marched to the Kenya Railways yard and brought down a wire fence said to have been erected by the developers.
About 200 pupils of Osasame Primary School in Teso North protest the lack of instructional materials.
Residents in Keroka protest poor delivery services.
Tullow Oil Kenya halts production due to demonstrations by area residents demanding to be employed at the companies sites, including Ngamia 1 and Twiga 1, which are its biggest operations.
A group of jobless youth in Kitui have protest the high qualifications set by the county in employing its staff.
Othaya More than 100 students from Kagonye Mixed Secondary School in Othaya, Nyeri county stage a walk-out from their classes in protest of school administration.
Street vendors gather to protest the killing of their donkeys by suspected thieves.

A group of youths in Borama on 29/10 staged a demonstration in protest against the Minister of National Planning and a UN agency for not recruiting them as population census clerks. The protestors claimed that the clerks conducting the census were not from Borama but from Hargesia. The demonstration briefly disrupted the exercise. No security incident was reported.

A group of students from Tima-Cade University in Gabiley on 29/10 staged a demonstration in protest against the Minister of National Planning and a UN agency for not recruiting them as population census clerks. The protestors claimed that the clerks conducting the census were not from Gabiley but from Hargesia. Reports indicate that despite the protest, the census went on smoothly in the district. Police dispersed the demonstration. No security incident was reported.

More than 200 residents of Ragati village of Karatina, Nyeri protest the alleged grabbing of community land. They marched to the Mathira East sub county commissioners office where they accused their chief and senior lands officers of aiding unscrupulous businessmen to grab more than six acres set aside for social amenities in the village.

Youth in Limuru barricaded the Nairobi-Nakuru Highway protesting against a Kiambu County financial bill. The bill proposes to charge fees for county cemeteries, church crusades and slaughtering of animals among other charges proposed by the county government.
Residents of Flamingo estate in Nakuru town protest poor area sanitation.
Several hundred Kenyan protesters marched on police headquarters to deliver a petition demanding justice after a young girl is raped.
The drivers were protesting against the failure by the water agency to repair water generators of bore holes where they used to draw water for sale, resulting in acute water shortage in Burao.

Police dispersed a large group of people who had gathered in front of the Kulmiye (ruling) Party headquarter in Shaab area in the morning of 02/11. The gathering follows the current internal struggle for power and control within the party. The minister of finance and the current interim chairman of the party are competing for the post of the parties chairman.

A group of youth blocked the Kitui-Machakos road to protest against sand harvesting at Tiva River. The youth put boulders at Mulutu trading centre at 7am to intercept lorries ferrying sand from the river.

Students from Farah Omar Secondary School staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the Ministry of Education in Shaab area in Hargeisa in the morning of 03/11. The students were complaining of lack of sufficient teachers. The students went back to school after the minister of education pledge to respond to their demand.

Residents of Sala Location in Tana River County at the weekend staged protests against a company building the 37.5 billion Sala Gravity Canal. The protest arose over differences between the residents and the company over employment opportunities and sub-contracts for locals.
Journalists in Northern Kenya took to the streets to protest a recently passed media bill which they believe would set limits on the press freedom.
Students demonstrated for better facilities and timely release of grades.
AP officers in Kisumu protest against rampant ongoing theft in their houses. The group pushed for greater security.
Students protested the lack of teaching staff at Kyambogo University. Police intervened and fired teargas at the protesters.

University students from Kenya Science campus blocked a section of Ngong road (Nairobi - Westlands) to protest poor management of the institution. Police were on the scene, but did not engage the group.

Government soldiers shot and killed a shoeshine boy at Zope junction in Mogadishu while the boy crossing the side road. Witnesses told Radio Dalsan news desk that the soldier killed the boy without reason. Following the shooting the boys colleague and the people in the area start a protest against the Somali military .
1,000 market traders protest a move by the Taita-Taveta County Government to relocate them near the Kenya-Tanzania border.

Hundreds of residents from Kwanza constituency converged at Namanjalala along Namanjalala Zea road today and demonstrated against impassable roads. Carrying placards and chanting songs for their rights, the residents planted bananas on the road from Namanjalala to Liyavo, a distance of two kilometres, blaming local government officials.
Ethiopian police used force Friday to disperse hundreds of people protesting against targeted attacks on Ethiopians in Saudi Arabia. One protester was allegidly beaten by police forces

Somali army clashed with Biyo Maal clan militia in Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 15/11. The fighting is believed to be related to dispute over tax. No casualties were reported. Residents in Janaale staged a demonstration the following day (16/11) calling on the army to leave the village.

Residents of Maili Tisa in Kwanza constituency hold a demonstration to protest impassable roads. The residents, mostly farmers, said it is difficult for them to transport maize and milk to nearby Kitale town for sale.
Traders closed their shops to protest taxes on electronics

Residents in Narok block the entire Mai Mahiu Narok highway near Lake Turkana to protest the killing of about 40 goats by a lorry the previous evening. The group who saw the road as treacherous demanded they be compensated for their loss. The protest disrupted traffic, but caused no reported damage.

Protesters, angered over parliamentary bills which limit press freedom, marched through the streets of Nairobi to present a petition of voters to lawmakers. This protest is unrelated to Miscellaneous Amendment Bill protesters, occurring either elsewhere or at a different time in the city.
A group marches to demand that the government withdraws the Miscellaneous Amendment Bill on the NGOs from Parliament.
Hundreds of pro-Puntland residents of Garoowe hold a demonstration against the Somali National Government. The protesters believe the central government encourages clan clashes.
A group of street traders protest a proposed move of their booths by blocking roads with their wares.

Residents of Ngerenya village in Kilifi county protest a high crime rate in their area. The group demanded redeployment of administration police officers withdrawn from Ngerenya before the March 4 general elections.

Police arrested four officials of Wadani (Somaliland National) Party in Hargeisa over the course of two days - 26-27/11. The motive of the arrest is currently unclear. In response the parties supporters staged a demonstration in protest against the arrest of the officials.

Traffic was disrupted along the busy Kitale-Lodwar road after angry Pokot residents blocked it at several points, causing vehicles to stop over at the Marich police station. The group was protesting the death of a motorcycle mechanic who was murdered in previous days.
Journalists protest against a proposed amendment to the Kenya Information and Communication Bill through the streets of Eldoret.
Journalists in Nyeri and Kiambu gather to protest a proposed media law that would limit press freedom.
Journalists protest against a proposed amendment to the Kenya Information and Communication Bill through the streets of Kitui.
A group of journalists from Kilifi and Malindi gathered in Malindi town and demonstrated against a proposed media bill.
Journalists in Nyeri and Kiambu gather to protest a proposed media law that would limit press freedom.
Journalists hold a silent demonstration to protest the proposed amendment to the Kenya Information and Communication Bill which will limit their freedom.

The Somalilands RRU (Rapid Response Unit) police dispersed a group of journalists who held a peaceful demonstration in front of Hubaal newspaper premises in 26 June District in Hargeisa in the morning of 03/12. The journalists were reportedly protesting against the release of one the masked gunmen who attacked Hubaal newspaper premise in the night of 24/04/13. The journalists claimed that the man was released without being taken to court. The RRU police reportedly used clubs to disperse the journalist and arrested four of them. They also confiscated equipment from the journalist during the arrest.

Residents of Mumias town protest threats by Kakamega Governor Wycliffe Oparanya to evict Mumias Sugar Company managers from the firm. Traders closed their shops to join the protestors who sang anti-Oparanya songs. The residents wished the government would subsidise the company financially.

Journalists in Nandi held a peaceful demonstration on Kapsabet town streets to protest a proposed media bill. The scribes appealed to MPs to reject it as they believe it would violate the constitution.

A small group of people staged a peaceful demonstration at Sayidka Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 04/12 in support of the vote of no confidence in which the Somali prime minister was ousted. NSA officers dispersed the demonstrators.

Hundreds of residents of K-50 Village (20km SW of Afgooye) on 08/12 staged a peaceful demonstration calling on the Somali government to liberate the region (Lower Shabelle) from al Shabaab. The demonstrators waved banners with anti-al Shabaab slogans and called on the army to continue with the operations to liberate the whole region from al Shabaab. The villages chairman said the demonstration was the first of its kind in the region since government forces backed by AMISOM took over a number of districts in the region which were under al Shabaab control last year.

Police dispersed supporters of UCID (opposition) Party after they gathered at the parties office in Hargeisa on 09/12. The move followed a call made by the parties leaders for nationwide rallies in protest against the blocking of the parties presidential candidate from visiting Gabiley town by the government. Police were also deployed in the parties office in Berbera and Borama, though there was no reported protests in those cities.
Street traders in Kisumu protest an increased amount of street crime occurring in their area. The protest was held at the town square of Kisumu.

A group of journalists staged a peaceful demonstration in Borama on 10/12 in protest against the arrest of journalists and continued harassment of media workers. Reports indicate that the protest coincided with the World Human Rights Day.

Youths hailing from a minority clan (Muse Dheriyo) staged a demonstration in Daami neighbourhood in Hargeisa in the evening of 16/12. The demonstrators were protesting against the murder of a woman hailing from the clan by youths from Habar Awal/Isse Muse, date and circumstances unknown.
Matau operators in Mwingi Central district protest the influx of probox vehicles in Mwingi town. The group claimed the probox vehicles do not have hold the proper certifications.

More than 300 residents from Kamukunji village in Solia, Nakuru held a peaceful demonstration over a power black out that has lasted for five days. The residents said the Kenya Power has not rectified the problem despite numerous reports.

A group of people-prominent elders, councillors, and other prominent individual-staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo liberty garden on 17/12. The group was protesting against the chairman of Somaliland food coordination whom they accused of stopping food aid donated by a UN agency to Sanaag Region. The demonstrators reportedly called on Somaliland government to address the matter.
Sand miners and transporters blocked Mombasa Road at Mlolongo Town for close to five hours in protest of an alleged police shooting of one of their co-workers the previous evening.

group of people staged a demonstration in Borama in the morning of 18/12 in protest against the arrival of the former leaders of Awdal state. The visit followed talks between Somaliland authorities and the Awdal state officials in Dubai and Hargeisa.
Employees of a supermarket chain boycott their shifts and demonstrate for higher pay.

A group of people staged a demonstration against the inland revenue office in Lawya Caddo Village in Zeylac District on 20/12 in protest against the new tax rates imposed on commercial vehicles and passengers crossing the border to Djibouti. The demonstrators comprised of local residents and passengers of five vehicles held in the village. The protestors reportedly burned tires during the demonstration. Police arrested a number of people.

A number of people, mostly drivers and business people staged a demonstration in front of the custom and inland revenue office in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 21/10. The demonstrators were reportedly protesting against new tax rates imposed on goods being ferried from Bosasso and Burao. Police arrived at the scene and arrested four demonstrators.

Fishermen in Berbera staged a demonstration in front of the offices of the mayor and the governor on 22/12 in protest against plans by the government to hand over a local fishing company to a businessman. The fishermen reportedly called on the government to stop the transfer.

A group of university students staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Mogadishu airport in the morning of 22/12 in protest against the killings of Syrian doctors by unidentified gunmen in Sinka Dheer area on 18/12. The students called on security agencies to arrest the perpetrators. The student staged the demonstration at a time when two Syrian doctors, who were injured in the attack, were being evacuated from Mogadishu airport for further treatment. Reports indicate that some of the slain doctors were lectures at local universities.

A delegation led by four cabinet ministers arrived in Burao in the morning of 23/12 on a mission to defuse the tension resulting from violent demonstrations over the transfer of Togdheer police divisional commander. The ministers held a protest against the violence, asking the public to remain calm.

Drivers of water bowsers staged a demonstration in Hargeisa in protest against Hargeisa Municipal Council on 26/12 for imposing tax on water ferried by the bowsers. The drivers parked the more than 100 water bowsers near Araweello and Shiracle hotels during the protest.

Taxi drivers operating at Egal airport in Hargeisa staged a demonstration in the morning of 26/12. The taxi drivers were reportedly protesting against a decision in which the minister of civil aviation awarded the passengers services at the airport to a private taxi company.
Members of the Muslim community of Mai Mahout, Naivete protest the move by the provincial administration to ban Madrassa due to controversial teachings.

Al Shabaab fighters opened fire at a group of locals who gathered in the centre of Buur Dhuxunley Village (60km SW of Yeed) on 30/12 in protest against the sale of land by al Shabaab to individuals. Reports indicate that a number of people were arrested but most of them were later released. No casualties were reported.
Residents of Rironi shopping centre in Kiambu county protest a recent high crime wave.

A number of people - mostly women - staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo municipal council office in the morning of 31/12. The group was protesting against the destruction of their kiosks by the municipal council.

Drivers of trucks transporting goods to Sool and Sanaag regions staged a peaceful demonstration at the eastern checkpoint in Burao on 01/01 in protest against new tax imposed on goods to other regions. The new tax was imposed by both local and central government. The owners of the goods held a meeting with local authorities on the matter without any consensus.
A group marches in protest of an unknown issue in Oodweyne on 01/01. It is not clear if the protest is related to a second demonstration the following day.

A group of small business owners staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Borama municipal office on 02/01. The groups reportedly were protesting against plan of demolition on small kiosks along the main road due to construction and rehabilitation of the road. The protestors plead to the local government to allocate for them land for their business

A group of people mostly youths and women staged a peaceful demonstration in Buuhoodle on 02/01 in support of Puntland new MPs from Dhulbahante clan. The protestors chanted pro-Puntland slogans during the demonstration.

A group of civilians staged a demonstration in front the local municipal council in Odweyne where a delegation led by the minister in the office of the president was holding a meeting in the morning of 02/01. The demonstration was sparked by an attempted arrest to a local councillor in the orders of the minister in the office of the president after the councillor requested to address the locals during the meeting. RRU (Rapid Response Unit) police escorting the minister opened fire at the demonstrators, injuring five people.
A group of traders protest against the arrest of their kinsmen. The nature of the arrest is not clear. A photo journalist was arrested during to protest.

Hundreds of supporters of the SSC/Khatumo administration staged a peaceful demonstration in Taleex on 04/01 following the termination of Mr. Karash and Mr. Biindhe from the governing office of Khatumo state. The two leaders were been accused of political sabotage against SSC/Khatumo state and they were not performing their state duties as required.

A group of civilians from Badandad village (27km N of Baki) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of municipal office in Baki on 04/01. The protestors were complaining about government reluctant on their suffering after their village were hit by heavy floods. The mayor of Baki addressed the group and promised that their call will be answered and the issue will be taken to the central government.

More than hundreds of people mainly supporters of the ruling party (PUDP or 'Kulmiye') staged peaceful demonstration opposing recent protest in Odweyne on 04/01. The protestors were expressing their support to the current government and also in response to earlier protest against the minister of presidential office during his visit in Odweyne. No clash or security incidents were reported during the demonstration.

A security guards for a local NGO open fire to crowd of women and children in the centre of Kismaayo in the morning of 04/01. Reports indicate that one child was reportedly killed and a woman was injured. Further reports indicate that large numbers of IPDs mainly women and children gathered in front of the NGO office demanding cash vouchers and the security guards open fire to disperse the crowd. The local NGO was implementing cash distribution project and the IDPs accused it of giving the vouchers to their relatives and friends instead of the target beneficiaries

A group of water bowser drivers and other public transports staged a peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood on 05/01. The protest followed after the government imposed heavy tax on water delivered by water bowsers. Reports indicate that the demonstrators had parked their cars outskirt of the town and suspended water supply to the town.
Parents of students enrolled at a primary school protest near its entrance, demanding the head teachers transfer following a poor school-wide test result.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Xabado Stadium (Buuhoodle) in the morning of 07/01. Reports indicate that the demonstrators were protesting against previous demonstrations supporting the newly Puntland elected MPs hailing Buuhoodle.They also expressed their opposition to the defection of Ahmed Karash (one of the Khatumo leaders) to Puntland as well as new Somaliland political influence for starting road project from Caynabo to Buuhoodle. The protestors chanted anti-Somaliland and Puntland slogans.

The employees of sheikh district Hospital (Fatouh Hospital) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the Mayors office on 08/01. The protestors were complaining of not been paid their salaries for several months. They also demanded from the government to take action against the hospital manager

A group of people had staged a peaceful demonstration in Madaremin neighbourhood (Laas Caanood) in the afternoon of 08/01 to voice their support for the election Puntland new president, Abdiweli Mohamed Ali. The protestors reportedly fired in the air for celebration but immediately dispersed after Somaliland forces arrived at the scene. No casualties were reported.
Students staged a sit-in protest, shutting down their against the transfer of their principal.
Protests held by Bajaj riders in Mazwi/Mkoani area 'against a decision made by authorities to bar them from operating along the Mandela -Darajani-Majengo-Mwisho routes.'
Staff at the University of Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) protest the non-payment of allowances.
Mtune villagers at Vanga-LungaLunga in Kwale protest lack of water, secondary schools and health facilities.
Parents of enrolled students gathered at Pap Oriang Primary school in Siaya county to protest the transfer of its head teacher.
Boda Boda drivers protest police harassment and extortion.
Traders protest the forced government destruction of their kiosks. Police fired into the are to disperse the group.
Street traders situated in the Central Business District of the city protest a planned forced eviction of the area.

Kiaga Coffee Factory farmers demonstrate outside the company premises in protest of slated sale plans. The protesters believed the planned sale to a cooperative society, which typically pay less than that of private millers.

Police have dispersed over 5000 traders who took to the street to protest hiking of county levies and brought business to a standstill in Thika town. The protesters accused the Kiambu County Government of increasing the county levies by over 100 % and demanded that Governor William Gitau Kabogo leave office. Following the demonstration the trader found their shops had been looted. It is not clear if there is a connection between the demonstration and the robbery.
Traders in Muranga have protest against new tax rates proposed by the county government. The demonstrations began late 21/01 and continued into 22/01.
Traders in Muranga have protest against new tax rates proposed by the county government. The demonstrations began late 21/01 and continued into 22/01.
More than 300 traders operating in Nakuru town staged a demonstration along Nakuru, Eldoret highway after they found their stalls destroyed by officers of county government.

Residents of Badhan town staged a demonstration on 22/01 and called on the new president of Puntland to re-appoint the current interior minister who hails from Warsangeli in his planned cabinet. The demonstration ended in a peacefully.
A group of youth protest a rally held in Kisumu by Cord leaders.
Traders in Kinoo demonstrated against 'punitive' levies. They closed down their businesses before marching for five kilometres to the Kinoo sub county offices in Kikuyu town.

Bus drivers and civilians demonstrated in Mogadishu against increased roadblocks by armed groups on the main corridor between Afgoye and Mogadishu, calling on the government to immediately intervene the matter.

Hundreds of demonstrators marched from 15-May School to the Wardhiigley District administration office in the morning of 25/01 to express their anger against al Shabaab claims of having held meetings with elders from the Habr-Gedir clan in Buulo Mareer on 18 and 24 January. Several MPs, DCs and local officials from the Banadir regional administration joined the protest. The demonstrators stressed that clans from South-Central Somalia should not support the al Shabaab movement. The anti-al Shabaab rally ended peacefully.
Residents of Berbera gather a police station to demand the release of education demonstrators that had been arrested earlier in the day.

Police in Berbera arrested 14 students on 25/01 after they stormed the regional office of the ministry of Education. Reports indicate that the students were blaming the local Education Officer for failing to have them benefit from employment opportunities offered by his office, and to have instead recruited individuals who were not residents of Berbera. The families of the detained students staged a demonstration in front of the police station demanding their release.

A group of bus drivers and owners of public transport staged a peaceful demonstration in ex-control Afgooye (Dharkeynley District) in the morning of 25/01 to express their concern over increased road-blocks along the routes connecting Mogadishu to Lower Shabelle Region. The drivers strongly complained about illegal road-blocks manned by armed groups who extort money from public transports and called the government to take action against such groups.

Jubaland authorities staged a large demonstration in Kismaayo, Dhobley and Afmadow on 26/01 to oppose the deployment in the Jubas of additional AMISOM troops from different countries and the reduction of the AMISOM/Kenya contingent.

Jubaland authorities staged a large demonstration in Kismaayo, Dhobley and Afmadow on 26/01 to oppose the deployment in the Jubas of additional AMISOM troops from different countries and the reduction of the AMISOM/Kenya contingent.
Residents of Somalias Jubba and Gedo regions gathered at Wamo Soccer Stadium in Kismayo to protest al Shabaabs presence in the region and to show support Kenyas military deployment in the area.

Jubaland authorities staged a large demonstration in Kismaayo, Dhobley and Afmadow on 26/01 to oppose the deployment in the Jubas of additional AMISOM troops from different countries and the reduction of the AMISOM/Kenya contingent.

Tambach High School in Elgeyo Marakwet has been closed following student protests during the night time hours. The students were protesting the banning of weekend night entertainment and teacher harassment. Police were called in after the students threatened to destroy property.

Following a road accident involving a AMISOM convoy that struck an individual, killing him, several angered residents stage a protest against AMISOM, who refused to take the body for burial. Police forces arrived at the scene and dispersed the crowd.
Coffee farmers demonstrate in the streets surrounding their factory over pay.

Residents of Kismayo in Somalia demonstrated against the relocation of Kenya Defence Force troops from the city. Recently, a plan had been devised to replace Kenyan AMISOM forces with those from Sierra Leone.
Some clan elders (Dashiishle, Siwaqroon and Ali Jibrail) from Bari region staged a demonstration to protest against the composition of the new Puntland Cabinet in Bossaso on 29/01.

A group of local residents held a peaceful demonstration in Buuhoodle on 29/01 in protest against the newly nominated cabinet of Puntland. The following day, the president of the governing council of the Khatumo state issued a statement on 30/01 condemning the newly appointed cabinet.
Following Friday prayers, residents of Baraawe protest against the presence of Ethiopian forces in the city. Al Shabaab leaders reportedly addressed the crowd.

More than hundred pro-Khatumo supports staged a peaceful demonstration in Buuhoodle on 03/02 in protest against the move in which the Puntland administration appointed members of Khatumo administration to its cabinet. The protestors marched on the streets of Buuhoodle chanting anti-Puntland slogans. Khatumo leaders reportedly took part in the rally.
Youth groups staged a protest in front of the Nugaal Regional Governors Office when it was holding a traditional concert on 03/02. Police shoot at the air to disperse the group.
Kenyan journalists have joined international journalists outside the Egyptian Embassy (Nairobi - Westlands) in Nairobi to protest the imprisonment of three Al Jazeera correspondents in Cairo.

Most of the secondary students in Borama staged a demonstration on 04/02 complaining about lack of teachers and high school fees. Police arrived at the scene and arrested an unspecified number of the protestors.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Awr-Boogays Village (72km SE of Ceel-Afwayn) on 06/02 in support of Puntland administration for appointing Ahmed Karash-one of the leaders of Khatumo State-to its cabinet. The demonstrators marched in the village waving Ahmed Karashs photos. No incident was reported.

Police tried to stop the convoy of the vice-presidential candidate for Justice and Welfare Party (opposition) from entering Borama on 07/02. Party supporters staged a demonstration in protest against the police move. Police later allowed the party official to the town and hold a public rally.
Hundreds of sacked soldiers and disabled army veterans staged demonstration in front of Villa Somalia presidential compound in protest of their dismissal due to 'irresponsibility.'
A gay rights group protested outside the Ugandan Embassy (Nairobi - Westlands) against Ugandan homosexuality laws.

Hundreds of students from Mohamed Dayib School in Ahmed Dhagah District (Hargeisa) staged a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Education in the morning of 10/02. The students were protesting against lack of teachers. Police dispersed them.

Residents of Got Nyango village in Karachuonyo sub county, Homa Bay county held a peaceful demonstration over iron ore mining in the area. The residents said the company has not honoured the agreement they made previously.
Lorry and matatu drivers and touts protested against the poor state of the Makutano-Alale road in Makutano town, West Pokot county.
Hotel and bar attendants protest for higher wages.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the main gate of Villa Somalia (presidential palace) in Wardhiigley District in the morning of 11/02. The demonstrators were protesting against the demolition of residential houses and business premises by Kaaraan district administration. They protestors reportedly chanted anti-Kaaraan authorities slogans during the demonstration.

More than 300 clerics in Nyeri county protested against the proposed county Finance Bill on 12/02. They peacefully demonstrated in the town against the introduction of taxes and levies in churches by the county government.

Police use tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse a group of anti-government corruption protest in Nairobis CBD (Nairobi - Starehe). The group accused the government of mishandling US aid. The group had planned to march to the National Assembly building before the authorities had deemed the demo illegal.
Kaya elders, backed by human rights activists, demonstrated in the streets of Kilifi to condemn the killing of an elder as well as the police reaction, which they believed is indifference.

A demonstration organized by the mayor of Mogadishu took place in front of the Wadajir district office in the afternoon of 15/02. Residents of Wadajir, Dharkeynley and Dayniile districts attended the event to support recent security operations in the three districts. The Mayor of Mogadishu encouraged residents to provide information about whereabouts of al Shabaab supporters and weapons caches, in exchange for financial rewards. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Around 40 persons demonstrated in front of a compound of a local mining company in Boon (Borama District) on 15/02 to protest against perceived unfairness in the allocation of jobs to members of different sub-clans by the company. Borama police forces forcefully dispersed the protesters and arrested around 35 of them.

Relatives of prisoners detained in Borama central prison demonstrated in front of the prison on 18/02 to protest against the transfer of some prisoners to Mandheera (80km NE of Hargeisa).
