The transfer was reportedly decided due to the congestion of the Borama jail, and would make difficult visits to detainees from Awdal Region. The governor Awdal Region and the mayor of Borama addressed the demonstrators and promised that they would attempt to find a solution to the issue. No violence was reported.
Students at Kyambogo University blocked the Chancellor fromentering the campus. Police fired teargas at the students.

Members of the Sikh protest the lobbying of a Christian group to remove a sacred statue. No report of violence, though reports describe the protesters as a 'mob.' Exact date of the protest is not known.

A group of people from Habar Jeclo/Ali Bare staged a demonstration in Oog Village (23km E of Caynabo) on 21/02 after a kinsman succumbed to his injuries in a Burao hospital. The man was shot and injured by a man hailing from Habar Jeclo/Biciido on 22/01 following an escalated land dispute. The demonstrator stoned the homes of members of Habar Jeclo/Biciido clan. A number of women and children suffered light injuries. Police arrested several people the following day.

Al Shabaab authorities in Buulo Burte on 23/02 organized a public rally at the towns Independence Park. Al Shabaab officials urged the community to support the Mujahidin in defending the town from possible attacks from AMISOM (ENDF) and pro-Somali forces.
A women's group holds an anti-al Shabaab protest in the Hamar Jabjab area of Mogadishu. The protest is likely a response to a recent attack on Villa Somalia.

Members of the Ogiek community protest against the bid to evict them from the disputed Ngongogeri Farm in Nakuru County by police authorities. Government authorities claimed the settlers were harming the local wildlife.

A group of youths staged a demonstration in Xariirad Village (58km SE of Borama) on 24/02 in protest over the decision by Awdal regional health office of not recruiting them in the ongoing vaccination campaign. The group reportedly accused the health office of only employing youths from Borama. No security incident was reported.
More than 5,000 traders in Muhoroni sub county have threatened to boycott paying taxes due to lack of proper market facilities during a demonstration.

An Anti-Gay Bill and Anti-Pornagraphy Act has encouraged attacks against women and banned mini-skirts. In response, women protesters demonstrated against the Act and attacks. Riot police tried to stop the march.

Two hundred Thika boda operators and quarry workers and owners from Munyu in Thika East yesterday protested over poor roads. They said the Munyu-Makongeni road is impassable leading to loses. The protestors walked from Makongeni estate to the Kiambu county headquarters in Thika and demanded to be addressed by Governor William Kabogo or Deputy Governor Gerald Githinji. They were however stopped from entering the offices by the county government security guards and told to send representatives.

Residents of Beled Weyne protest against military operations of government and AMISOM forces in the area. Radio Andalus, a pro-al Shabaab news source, claims police dispersed the crowd using live ammunition. No report of injury or causality.
Sugarcane farmers in Trans Mara District protest a tax on their product.

A big anti-Somaliland rally was held in Buuhoodle on 03/03. The demonstrators were protesting against the activities of the Somaliland District Commissioner for the district. Reports indicate that the DC has been holding meetings with some elders to pave the way for the visit of Somaliland minister of health (the former commander of SCC) to Buuhoodle.

A group of people staged a demonstration between the police station and main market in Afgooye in the afternoon of 02/03 following the arrest of a number of elders. The elders were reportedly detained after they attempted to stop the police from demolishing small kiosks on the road side.
Over 100 are detained by police for participating in a protest against the local administration.
Farmers protest against 'strict rules' on obtaining subsidized fertilizer.
Bondeni residents in Mvita constituency protested over the increased use of drugs by youths.

About a hundred IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Togdheer governor office in Shaab neighbourhood (Burao) in the morning of 05/03. The protestors were reportedly complaining against the minister of aviation who failed to fulfil his promise of allocating them land to settle after evicting them from 'their land' which had been used for the expansion of Burao airport last year.
Owners and drivers of matatus and taxis block roads within Nairobi to protest over increased parking fees. Arrests reported.
Residents held a peaceful demonstration over the poor state of Mpeketoni District Hospital.

A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Zeylac on 08/03 following the visit of the Minister of Rehabilitation & Resettlement in the area. Reports indicate that the demonstrators were protesting against resettlement plan for refugees returning from Djibouti. The minister was on a mission to assess land allocated for the returnees.
Small scale miners staged a demonstration against new mining regulations, such as licensing.
Residents protest traffic fines from police, believing they are overly hash and unwarranted. Exact date of the protest vague.

A group of Somaliland war veterans staged a peaceful demonstration in Shacab neighbourhood in Burao in the morning of 16/03. The protesters reportedly accused the government of failing to fulfil its pledges to assist them. No incident was reported.

More than 150 families from Manda-Maweni village in Lamu county have protest the alleged grabbing of a quarry. The families stormed the county government offices and demanded that a tycoon in the area be ordered to leave.

Youths from Othaya protested over a local CDF project, saying they were left out of its construction. The youths from Witima village said there was favouritism in the award of the tender for the Sh1.5 million Unjiru Community Hall.

Residents of Mukogodo division in Laikipia North district demonstrated against 'sand theft'. They said they have been deprived of revenue. The residents obstructed the Ilpolei-Doldol road for several hours, blocking lorries that transport sand from the collection points.
Traders whose shops were last week demolished by the West Pokot government held a peaceful demonstration in Makutano town. They said the government gave them a short notice before the demolition.

A group of people staged a demonstration in front of Universal TV office in Hargeisa in the morning of 18/03. The demonstrators destroyed the signboard of the office and reportedly called on Somaliland government not lift the ban imposed on the television station saying that it has a hidden agenda against Somaliland.
Residents of Butere constituency demonstrated against MP Andrew Tobosos portraits on CDF projects. They said Toboso has been using CDF projects for political mileage.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Jowhar on 20/03 in protest against an increase in robbery incidents involving Somali forces. This follows after Somali forces robbed 12 million Somali shillings from a shopkeeper in the town.
A group of traders staged a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Finance office in Borama on 21/03 protesting against new tax increment on imported goods. No security incident was reported.
Employees of Ceerigaabo general hospital staged a demonstration in front of the hospital in protest over seven-month unpaid salaries. Police arrested 10 protestors. No security incident was reported.

Managers of the a water point used by AMISOM in Baidoa removed the generator from the site on 25/03 in protest against AMISOM giving protection to Sharif Hassan Sheikh Adan. AMISOM forces deployed extra forces in the area.

Hundreds of people staged demonstration for the third day running in the streets of Baidoa. Militia loyal to the former SNG Speaker, Sharif Hassan Sheikh Adan, (who is behind the three-state conference) opened fire at the demonstrators. A small boy was injured in the shooting. Reports indicate that the business and schools remain closed for the third day in Baidoa.
Kenyans protested against discrimination and harassment by Ugandan security forces on the island. The Ugandan police have arbitrarily arrested fisherman and disallowed fishing in certain areas.

Hundreds of people staged a demonstration against the election of the president of the three-region states in the Baidoa stadium in the morning of 27/03. Reports indicate that the protestors were chanting slogans against the Somali National Government and the former speaker of the parliament Mr. Sharif Hassan Sheikh Adan. The protest continued on 28/03.

Several Muslim clerics reportedly conducted sermons denouncing some NGO programs against Female Genital Mutilations (FGM) during Friday prayers in Burco on 28/03. While stating that FGM was against Islam the clerics explained that Christian ideology was behind anti-FGM programs conducted by a specific LNGO. The sermons had been reportedly triggered by the installation of anti-FGM banners by a LNGO in the town, some of which being judged offensive or ambiguous by the clerics. People attending the sermons went to the streets to remove these banners. Other banners that were judged conform to Islam were left in place.

Hundreds of people staged a demonstration against the election of the president of the three-region states in the Baidoa stadium in the morning of 27/03. Reports indicate that the protestors were chanting slogans against the Somali National Government and the former speaker of the parliament Mr. Sharif Hassan Sheikh Adan. The protest continued on 28/03.

More than 100 persons staged a demonstration against Somaliland in Buraan village (122km SE of Laas-Qoray) on 29/03. The demonstration was in reaction to a meeting of anti-Puntland Warsangeli elders in the village.

Residents of Xarrirad held a peaceful demonstration in front of the local authorities office to protest against the perceived lack of response to water scarcity in the town and the absence of local government officials from the town. The demonstrators demanded the election of a new local council. The police did not intervene.

A few persons gathered close to the General Dauud Secondary School and Ex.Total fuel station in Hargeisa in the afternoon of 30/03 to protest against power cuts that had occurred in the two previous nights. The demonstrators were dispersed by the police.
Demonstrations against the SNG president resumed in Baidoa town in the morning of 31/03.

South Sudanese Nuer students in Kampala protested and threatened MPs from Jonglei State, South Sudan. The MPs were delivering a message from Salva Kiir for Nuer diaspora and refugees to not join the SPLA-In Opposition. The MPs left since the students expressed anger but before rioting took place.

A group of mini-bus drivers staged a demonstration in front of Baidoa police station (Baidoa) on 03/04 in protest against a decision by Bay Regional police commander to transfer two detained drivers to Mogadishu. The two are reportedly suspected of being involved in the cold murder of eight elders near Buur Hakaba. Police shot in the air to disperse the protesters and also arrested eight of them. The eight drivers were later released. No casualties were reported.

Police allow opposition rally in Arua, where former Forum for Democratic Change party president Kizza Besigye and other oppositions leaders peacefully launched their drive for free-and-fair-election campaign at Arua Hill Grounds.
Somali residents of Eastleigh, Nairobi protest against a police raid on a compatriots home, calling the raid 'harassment against the Somali community.'
Embu residents protest, having accused the county government of not involving them in governance.

Hundreds of people turned out in Ceelasha Biyaha settlement located between Mogadishu and Afgooye in protest against an increase in the number of road blocks in the morning of 09/04. The demonstration was organized by public transport owners and drivers that ply the route. No incident reported.

Security forces blocked a group of people from staging a demonstration in Soobe neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 09/04. The demonstrators had been planning to protest against the Kenyans governments security operation against Somali nationals living in Nairobi.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Galkacyo (North) in the morning of 10/04 in a protest against the killings of UNODC staff in Galkacyo airport on 07/04. The demonstrators marched on the streets of Galkacyo and later gathered in front of the governors office. Reports indicate that they governor and other Mudug regional officials took part in the rally and condemned the incident. They also called on Puntland government to bring the perpetrators to justice.
Students protested against the national agenda at Jimma university. Security forces responded violently. 9 student protesters were killed in total in the first round of Oromo protests.

ODM party youth in Migori town held demonstrations against the construction of a road to a Supreme Court judges home. They raised concern that the road construction is a way to bribe the charge ahead of a Supreme Court case set in the near future.

Hargeisa University students staged a demonstration near the former Pepsi factory (near the University of Hargeisa) in protest against fees increment on 13/04. Police led by Somaliland police commissioner accompanied by the governor addressed the students and urged them to return to the university and submit their complaint to the administration which the declined. Police then shot in the air and arrested 40 of them.
Students protested against the national agenda at Haro Limu secondary school.
Students protested against the national agenda at Bila secondary school.
People protested against the national agenda at Jima teachers training college.
Students protested against the national agenda at Kiremu secondary school.
People protested against the national agenda at Nekemt teachers training college.
Students protested against the national agenda at Sibu Sire secondary school.
Students protested against the national agenda at midajgni high school, west Shewa.
Students protested against the national agenda at Gida secondary school.
Students protested against the national agenda at liben mecha secondary school.
People protested against the national agenda in Anfillo Ashi. Security forces responded violently, killing one protester.
People protested against the national agenda in Ejere. Security forces responded violently, killing one protester.
People protested against the national agenda in Shenen. Security forces responded violently, killing one protester.

Students protested against the national agenda at Jarte secondary school. Security forces responded violently. 3 student protesters were killed in total in Jardega Jarte in the first round of Oromo protests.
People protested against the national agenda in Robe. Security forces responded violently, killing 2 protesters.
People protested against the national agenda in Seden Sod. Security forces responded violently, killing 1 protester.
Students protested against the national agenda at dire enchini secondary school.

University of Nairobi students protest outside their schools main administration building (Nairobi - Starehe) to demand the release of 12 of their fellow students who had recently been arrested for the possession of a weapon.
Students protested against the national agenda at Adama university.

Supporters of the six regions staged a peaceful demonstration in Baidoa in the morning of 16/04. Reports indicate that demonstrators accused SNG of hindering developments in the region. Cabinet ministers of the six region state reportedly took part in the rally.
500 members of the Masaku Teachers group protest a move by the Machakos Teachers Sacco to acquire one of their buildings in Machakos town.
Residents of Mogadishu district of Daynille have started protesting over recent fighting between two groups of Somali government forces organized along clan lines fighting over land in the area.

A section of residents of Ikutha market in Kitui county have demanded the transfer of area police boss. Boda boda operators, hawkers and hotel operators held a march against Korir on the streets of Ikutha market. The protesters believe the chief is too 'heartless.'
Students protested against the national agenda at Metu university.

A large anti-Somaliland rally was held in Boocame (Laas Caanood District) on 21/04. The demonstrators were protesting against the activities of pro-Somaliland traditional elders who had been laying foundation stones of projects funded by the Somaliland government and form a pro-Somaliland administration in the village.

Residents of four villages in Mukogodo division, Laikipia North subcounty held a peaceful demonstration against a private ranch for being sidelined in employment. The residents from Lekiji, Ilmotiok, Koija and Tiamamut said Mpala Research Centre is sourcing for workers, including watchmen and guides from outside the subcounty.
Police allegedly shot dead a boda boda operator and injured another during early morning protests. The operators were demonstrating against what they term as harassment by county council askaris.
Students protested against the national agenda at Ambo university.
Students protested against the national agenda at Bule Hora university.
Protest at funeral of former chairman of parliaments Budget committee; protest against Fox Odoi, who has spearheaded the fight against the Anti-Homosexuality Act.
Students protested against the national agenda at Welega university. Security forces responded violently. Five student protesters were killed in total in the first round of Oromo protests.

Traders at Kiganjo market in Gatundu South, Kiambu county protested over the lack of toilets at their premises. They said five years after the open-air market was rehabilitated, toilets have not been built yet they pay rates and levies to the Kiambu government.
Students protested against the national agenda at Welega university.
Students protested against the national agenda at Gedo secondary school.
Students protested against the national agenda at Nekemt secondary school.
Students protested against the national agenda at Sasiga secondary school.
Students protested against the national agenda at Alibo preparatory school.
Students protested against the national agenda at Meda Welabu university.
Students protested against the national agenda at Haromaya university.

A massive demonstration was held in Mogadishu by widows and children of government officers and soldiers that were killed in attack on the presidential palace on 21st February 2014. The demonstrations were held outside the Parliament building, only minutes away from Villa Somalia.
Oromo students at Ambo campus protested against the expansion of Addis Ababas administrative area into parts of Oromia
Rival protest groups, one for and against the re-impeachment of reinstated Embu Governor Martin Wambora held demonstrations in Embu. Police were present but did not engage the protesters.
Police cordoned off the Sidist Kilo and Arat Kilo campuses of Addis Ababa university due to fears that student protests from these campuses might spark violence
Students protested against the national agenda at Adama university.
Students protested against the national agenda at Cheri elementary school, Ambo.
Students protested against the national agenda at Mendi secondary school.
Farmers who had gathered at the Bukembe market protest a delay of dues from the sugar cane production company they had contracted under.
More than 200 traders from Malindi Old Market stormed the county offices protesting against demolition of their new temporary structures.
Students protested against the national agenda at Balemi secondary school.
At least 8 killed in mass protests in Oromia state by students; observers claim protestors were peaceful and death toll is much higher than that given by the government of Ethiopia
Students protested against the national agenda at Gimbi secondary school. Security forces responded violently, killing two students.
Students protested against the national agenda at Dire Dawa university.

On 30 April 2014, a group of drivers staged a peaceful protest in front of Ceerigaabo municipal council (Ceerigaabo,Sanaag). The drivers reportedly accused the municipal council of using nepotism in the recruitment of drivers for Ceerigaabo-Burao road project. Police dispersed the drivers. No security incident was reported.
People protested against the government agenda in Abuna Gide Beret.
People protested against the government agenda in Albo.
Students protested against the national agenda at Meda Welabu university.
Students protested against the national agenda at Guder high school.
Students protested on the Sidist Kilo campus against the expansion of the Addis Ababa administrative area into Oromio, and the killing of student protests in Ambo and other towns
People protested against the government agenda in Ayra.
Students protested against the national agenda at Burayu secondary school.
People protested against the government agenda in Mendi.
Students protested against the national agenda at Genji secondary school.

On 2 May 2014, residents of Tog Wajaale town in Gabiley District took to the streets in protest against the arrest of the former mayor on 02/05. The former mayor was arrested after his successor accused him of grabbing public land and instructed police to arrest him. Police fired in the air to disperse the demonstrators. A bystander was hit and killed by a stray bullet. 1 fatality.
People protested against the government agenda in Nejo.
People protested against the government agenda in Incinni.
People protested against the government agenda in Kiremu.
People protested against the government agenda in Kombolcha.
People protested against the government agenda in Sire.
People protested against the government agenda in Sebeta.
People protested against the government agenda in Shambu.

A number of people, mostly youths staged a demonstration in front of the Sanaag University in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 04/05. The demonstrators were reportedly complaining against a group of Ceerigaabo local councillors, government officials and prominent elders reportedly trying to influence the interview panel for enumerators to use clan system in the recruitment process, a move opposed by the already shortlisted enumerators. Police shot in the air to disperse the demonstrators. One person was slightly injured.
People protested against the government agenda in Ayra.
People protested against the government agenda in Gidami.
People protested against the national agenda in Guliso. Security forces responded violently, killing one protester.
People protested against the government agenda in Sheno.
People protested against the government agenda in Bedele.
People protested against the government agenda at Dembi Dolo teachers training college.
Teachers in Nyamagana District in Mwanza City staged a demonstration, claiming their salaries after the Mwanza City Council management failed to pay them on time
People protested against the government agenda in Gimbi.

Hundreds of ex-soldiers staged a demonstration against the government in Sayidka Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 10/05. The protestors accused the government of neglecting them after they have been dismissed from their forces. Reports indicate that the Defence Committee of the Parliament met the representatives of the protestors in the Parliament building to listen to their grievances and promised that they will table the matter for discussion.
Several gather at Konis football stadium in Abdiaziz district to protest for the removal of the president of the SNG. Elsewhere in the city other gathered for a support rally of the protest.
Around 150 young people gathered in Zanzibars stone town recently to discuss how to face the problem of unemployment; asked government to curb unemployment

Hundreds of Khatumo supporters and officials staged a peaceful demonstration against the Somaliland Administration in Buuhoodle on 12/05. The protestors were chanting anti-Somaliland slogan while expressed their support to the Khatumo state administration and the forthcoming Khatumo III conference in Taleex. No insecurity incident was reported during the demonstration.
Students protested against the national agenda at Seyo secondary school.
Students protested against the national agenda at Welega university.

Former Somali military officers recently dismissed from their positions as well as army veterans have today staged a joint protest in Mogadishu. Former government soldiers and veterans today staged a demonstration in Sayidka grounds quite close to Somali presidency, Villa Somalia, and complained of unfair treatment. Dismissed Somali soldiers said they were not paid for a year before receiving news of their dismissal.
Students protested against the national agenda at Welega university.
Students protested against the national agenda at Nejo secondary school.
Residents of Bale Zone protested against people behind the recent violence in Oromiya Regional State

Pro-Somaliland residents in Badhan have celebrated to mark 18th of May which was held in the office of the DC on 18/05. Reports indicate that pro-Puntland group staged a peaceful demonstration in the street of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. No insecurity incident was reported.

On 19 May 2014, a group of people, mostly youths and women, have staged a peaceful demonstration in the Seventh-Street of Ceerigaabo on 19/05 to express their anger against the recent arrests of a group of teenagers with no reasons. Reports indicate that the protest came after Police in Ceerigaabo transferred 42 out of the 54 teenagers arrested to Gar Adag central prison. Further reports suggest that 12 girls out of 54 were still in detention in Ceerigaabo Police station. The Police have managed to disperse the protestors. On 22/05 police in the area arrested several people involved in organizing the demonstration.
Report over video of residents of Ginchi town demonstrating to condemn previous violence in the regional state
Report over video of residents of Holeta in Oromiya Regional State protesting against the recent violence in the regional state
Report over video of residents of the southern town of Shashemene demonstrating to mark Victory Day and condemn the recent violence by university students in Oromiya Regional State
A women's group in Mombasa held a protest on calling for the removal of women's representative Mishi Mboko from office. The women accused Mboko of nepotism.

Two men, suspected to be Somali al Shabaab, attack a group of police and military personnel, and are shot. Following the attack residents protest the killings, asserting that at least one of the attackers were known Sheikh in the region.
A women's group protest a political candidate electoral nomination fee at Baraza Park in Kwale.
Street traders hold a demonstration in protest of the demolition of their shops. The demonstrations took place throughout the town.
Students protested against the national agenda at Hamacho secondary school, Ambo.

Residents of Gatanga constituency, Muranga county, protested against political interference by TNA. They accused some politicians from the area, who were defeated in last years general election, of undermining area MP Humphrey Njuguna and sabotaging his development.
Residents protest along the Nyeri-Nyahururu road against rising insecurity on the area.

Transport on the Narok-Mai Mahiu highway was paralysed for more than four hours when youths blocked the road at Ntulele trading centre in Narok county. The residents protested over the takeover of a probox stage by another community whom they say have refused to employ Maasai youths from the area. They complained of harassment by traffic officers.
Transport operators in Kuria West sub county held a demonstration at Kehancha town over poor roads. The demonstration proceeded to Ikerege and Taranganya towns for several hours.
Transport operators in Kuria West sub county held a demonstration at Kehancha town over poor roads. The demonstration proceeded to Ikerege and Taranganya towns for several hours.
Transport operators in Kuria West sub county held a demonstration at Kehancha town over poor roads. The demonstration proceeded to Ikerege and Taranganya towns for several hours.
More than 200 residents blocked the Nyeri-Nyahururu highway near Mwiyogo (Moyo Drift Farms) to protest against rising insecurity. This was the second such protest in five days.
University of Eldoret students protest the disappearance of a fellow student. The group blocked roads with rocks and sticks. Police made several arrests.

Teachers from South Kisii sub-county held a demonstration against area DEO Gilbert Oloo and quality assurance officer for mishandling education matters. The protesters attempted to storm the educations offices, but were barred by police forces.
A group of mourners staged a protest outside the Naivasha Subcounty Hospital mortuary over the killing of their relative. A relative said the victim was killed after a business deal went sour.
Ugandan police dispersed hundreds of people protesting in Fort Portal against President Yoweri Museveni for calling their 22-year-old king a 'child'; about 70 people were arrested

Residents of Mpeketoni in Lamu County have held protests in the town following the killing several people by gunmen on Sunday and Monday nights. The residents held placards and lit bonfires in the town to protest the deaths and the destruction of property by suspected al Shabaab militia which occurred on Sunday followed by fresh attacks the previous evening.

A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo court on 17/06 to express their anger against the regular postponement of cases against youths being held for petty crimes. The demonstrators were mostly parents of the detained youths. Police dispersed the protestors. No casualties reported.

A group of journalists held a peaceful demonstration in front of Hargeisa Regional court on 19/06 to express their anger against arrest of journalist and suspension of media institutions by Somaliland. The protestors gathered in front of the court where a case against a publisher and an editor of Haatuf newspaper was ongoing to show their solidarities. The demonstrators were carrying placards written on freedom of expression for Somaliland media is clearly defined and protected in the national constitution of Somaliland.

Two anti-corruption protesters released piglets into the countries parliament in a protest against corruption; the animals were painted in the colours of the ruling party president and had slogans written on them; the men have since been arrested

A group of Berbera residents staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Berbera Regional court on 20/06 against the government for the arrests of reporters and banning of Haatuf newspaper in Hargeisa. The protest was staged concurrently with another demonstration in Hargeisa to express support for the detained journalists.
Dozens of residents of the town of Fiche protested over electric power shortages

Hundreds of protesters marched through Busia demanding justice for a schoolgirl who was brutally gang raped, ahead of the trial of suspects who were originally punished by being made to cut grass as punishment.
Constituents of Gatundu South protest the result of a special election, which demonstrators believe was rigged.

The Supporters of the South West Six State Region staged a peaceful demonstration in front of ADC compound (Baidoa) in the morning of 25/06 to express their oppositions against the recent signed agreement between Six and Three South West Regional States.
Hundreds of mourners in Tetu, Nyeri county protested the murder of a mentally ill man. They said the suspect who killed the 48 year old man has not been arrested, a month after the killing.

Supporters of six region state staged a peaceful demonstration at ADC area and Dr. Ayub Stadium in Baidoa in the morning of 26/06 and 27/06. The demonstrators were protesting against the agreement signed between the six and three regions states in Mogadishu. No insecurity incident was reported.

Supporters of six region state staged a peaceful demonstration at ADC area and Dr. Ayub Stadium in Baidoa in the morning of 26/06 and 27/06. The demonstrators were protesting against the agreement signed between the six and three regions states in Mogadishu. No insecurity incident was reported.

Supporters of three region state staged a peaceful demonstration in Qansax Dhere in the morning of 27/06.The demonstrators were protesting against the agreement signed between the six and three regions states in Mogadishu. No insecurity incident was reported.

About hundred pro-Khatumo supporters a staged peaceful demonstration against Somaliland forces in Taleex on 27/06 following the withdrawal of Somaliland forces from the town. The demonstrators marched on the streets of Taleex chanting anti-Somaliland slogans.

A group of youths stormed the Olkaria geothermal plant in Naivasha to demand for jobs. Armed with crude weapons, the irate youths paralysed operations at the Green Energy Station involved in the construction of wellhead generators. Though armed, it is not clear if the protesters used their weapons in violent manner.

St Josephs Kocholia Secondary School in Busia county was closed indefinitely. Education officials in Teso North ordered the closure of the institution after the more than 500 students boycotted classes. The students marched to the district education offices in Amagoro to seek audience with area education boss Genetrix Amatha. The students demanded the resignation of the schools Board of Management chairman Dudovicus Okitoi. They accused Okitoi of being behind the high turnover of principals at the institution.

Angry members of the Maasai communities residing within the Ngorongoro Conservation Area Authority area staged a demonstration and demanded to have an audience with a minister over the latest reports that new hotels are about to be built in the Ngorongoro Conservation Area Authority despite being restricted by the State House

Puntland Prison elements guarding Bossaso main prison staged a demonstration on 02/07 following after the government paid a salary of one month instead of three months. Reports indicate that the protesting soldiers fired in the air and vowed to free all the criminals in the jail if they didn't receive the complete three month salaries. The Governor and Mayor of Bossaso accompanied by Police Commander in the area addressed the protesting soldiers and assured that their grievances will be taken to the government. The protesting soldiers called off the demonstration and resumed their duties.
Hundreds of Muslims protesters demonstrated, demanding the release of 17 of their leaders jailed under terrorism charges in 2013

Puntland military forces in Garowe staged demonstrations on 05/07 over unpaid salaries. Reports indicate that forces in Base 54 denied their senior commanders to enter the camp while shooting in the air in a protest. Further reports indicate that some forces erected a road block between Garowe and Bossaso on the main road to express their anger.

Thousands of protesters demonstrated in Mpeketoni over insecurity . They carried placards and twigs as they appealed to the government to curb runaway crime. They condemned the recent killings in the county and asked for speedy investigations .
Police in Kisumu use tear gas to disperse protesters along the streets who were marching in support of Saba Saba day anniversary.

Police fired tear gas in central Nairobi to disperse a crowd of several hundred anti-government demonstrators in the streets (Nairobi - Starehe). The demonstrators are opposed to President Uhuru Kenyatta and carried posters of opposition leader Raila Odinga, chanting 'Uhuru must go.' No reported violence.
Students from Khabukoshe Mixed Secondary School in Matungu embark on a protest against the school head, accusing the headmaster of mismanagement.
Residents of Bomet County protest poor road construction in Cheboingong location.

Two groups from Dhulbahante sub clans (Farah Ali and Samo Kaab Ali) reportedly staged peaceful demonstrations in Taleex on 10/07. The Farah Ali sub clan group was protesting against the presence of Somaliland while the Samo Kaab Ali group was expressing their support to Somaliland administration. No clash was reported.

Two groups from Dhulbahante sub clans (Farah Ali and Samo Kaab Ali) reportedly staged peaceful demonstrations in Taleex on 10/07. The Farah Ali sub clan group was protesting against the presence of Somaliland while the Samo Kaab Ali group was expressing their support to Somaliland administration. No clash was reported.
Residents protest poor roads in Kisumu. The exact date of the protest is not known.

A group of people mostly, women and youths, staged a demonstration against Somaliland in Buraan village (87km NW of Qardho) on 14/07 and accused Somaliland government of interfering into the affairs of eastern Sanaag (Warsangeli areas) by creating conflict in the area. The demonstrators among them Puntland DC in Buraan chanted Anti-Somaliland slogans and urged the residents of eastern Sanaag to drive out Somaliland administration in the area.

Residents of Ngumu village in Tanadelta sub county protest against harassment by police in the ongoing operation to root out street gangs that have been killing people in the past month. The residents allege the police force witnesses to publicly point out gang members, which causes them to fear attacks from the gang.
Demonstrators embark on a 'peace walk' from Kilifi to Kwale County to protest against recent insecurity in the area.
Demonstrators embark on a 'peace walk' from Kilifi to Kwale County (specific locations within Kwale not known) to protest against recent insecurity in the area.
Residents protest the death of a woman who they allege died in police custody.
Residents in Nyeri town demonstrated against poor road conditions. They said the road leading to the Nyeri Provincial General Hospital is filled with potholes.
Police officer candidates protest unfair hiring practices by the police forces.

A big anti-Somaliland rally organized by Khatumo officials was held in Xabado Stadium (Buuhoodle) on 17/07. The demonstrators were protesting against the recent armed clashes between Khatumo and Somaliland in the region. Reports indicate that the protestors marched in the streets of Buuhoodle chanting anti-Somaliland slangs. No insecurity incident was reported.

Operations at a Kitui West police outpost were temporarily disrupted after members of public stormed the premises demanding speedy investigations into the killing of a villager. The exact date of the protest is not known.

Hundreds of civilians staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Banadir Regional Administration Office (Heliwa District) on 20/07 against insecurity created by al Shabaab fighters in the region. The protesters were chanting anti-al Shabaab slogans. Later the Governor for Banadir Region and other officials addressed the demonstrators and urged them to collaborate with the security apparatus and report any suspect or al Shabaab operatives in the area.
Residents of Kitengela forced a local factory to close after staging a protest against 'foul smells and dust' caused by the factory.
Machakos Pivot Institute of Community Development & Social Work college students protest a university student fee mishap.
Residents hold a demonstrations against their districts police hiring practices.

A group of Nugaal residents staged a peaceful demonstration at Barhada Square on 26/07 amid at sending a sorrowful signal for the brutal death of a well-known Somali singer and federal MP in Moqadishu by unidentified militia men.
Ugandan Muslims stage a peaceful demonstration in protest of the current bombardment of Gaza.

A group of people staged a demonstration in Dhagax Tuur neighbourhood (Afgooye) in protest against new tax increase on taxi business on 29/07. A SNG police officer opened fire at the demonstrators, injuring two.

Residents of Xarrirad Village (58km SE of Borama) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the local authorities office on 30/07 in protest against acute water shortage that hit the village. The demonstrators also demanded the election of a new local council after claiming the current was incompetent.
Hundreds of residents of Idudi Town in Iganga District on Wednesday blocked the Iganga-Bugiri highway in protest demanding the transfer of the officer-in-charge of Idudi Police Station.
About 100 temporary health workers in Baringo county protest in Kabarnet for permanent placement.

Students under the UNSA umbrella protest against the current form of the students' loan scheme and the non-uniform grading system in higher institutions of learning. 20 are arrested for unlawful assembly

Kenyans held peaceful demonstrations outside Kakuma refugee camp in northwest Kenya over the sacking of pregnant female employees from an international aid agency. Hundreds of local residents marched outside the UNHCR compound, demanding the reinstatement of the three employees allegedly sacked by the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) after they became pregnant.
Leaders of African Inland Church in the Tudor area of Mombasa protested the sale of their land to private investors in a process they termed as illegal.
Ugandan police arrest 12 youths Monday carrying a coffin 'mourning' their unemployment. The youths belong to the same group who in June sneaked piglets into parliament protesting corruption.
More than 30 villagers protested the arrest of a resident in Barwesa division, Baringo North sub county who was arrested recently for poaching. The protesters maintained his innocence.
Residents protest at a police station for the release of suspected elephant poacher, whos innocence theyve maintained.

More than 600 boda boda operators protested against harassment by traffic police officers. The protest began at 7am after an operator was pushed off his motorcycle by two officers in a tinted Probox car and got hurt. Governor James Ongwae was caught up in the protest, with the operators refusing to let him pass until he addressed their grievances.
Homosexual Ugandans march through Entebbe to celebrate the annulment of Ugandas anti-homosexuality bill.
M-Pesa agents protest increasing levels of area violence following the killing of two traders by robbers in Kibuye market.

Commuter buses and taxi drivers staged a demonstration in front of Borama municipal council on 13/08 in protest over a new private transport company licensed in Hargeisa to operate in Borama. The drivers reportedly blocked the road to the municipal council with their buses and taxis.
A group of 2,000  students hold an anti-Israeli protest in Mogadishu.
Hundreds of women and youths protested against a illegal abortion providing medic on Bungoma town streets.

More than a hundred people staged peaceful demonstrations in Buuhoodle and Taleex towns to express their support to the election of Ali Khalif Galaydh as the new president of Khatumo state. The election of the new president took place in Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood). The protestors reportedly marched in the streets of the two towns chanting pro-Khatumo slogans.

More than a hundred people staged peaceful demonstrations in Buuhoodle and Taleex towns to express their support to the election of Ali Khalif Galaydh as the new president of Khatumo state. The election of the new president took place in Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood). The protestors reportedly marched in the streets of the two towns chanting pro-Khatumo slogans.

More than a hundred people a staged peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood to express their support to the election of Ali Khalif Galaydh as the new president of Khatumo state. The election of the new president took place in Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood). The protestors reportedly marched on the streets of Laas Caanood chanting pro-Khatumo slogans. Police reportedly fired in the air and dispersed the demonstrators. No casualties were reported.
Residents of Kimangaru village, Embu West sub county protest the poor state of the Kimangaru-Embu road. They dug a trench across a road blocking motorists from accessing the towns.

Residents of Wadajir (Medina) and Kaaraan districts staged demonstrations in the streets of the two districts on 15/08 protesting against the lethal force that AMISOM and NISA forces used during the operation against the residence of the former DC of Wadajir District, Ahmed Hassan Cadow 'Daci', in which the eight people including civilians were killed. SNG forces opened fire and killed one protestor.

Residents of Wadajir (Medina) and Kaaraan districts staged demonstrations in the streets of the two districts on 15/08 in protesting against the lethal force that AMISOM and NISA forces used during the operation against the residence of the former DC of Wadajir District, Ahmed Hassan Cadow 'Daci', in which the eight people including civilians were killed. The demonstrators burned tires and blocked roads. SNG forces opened fire and killed one protestor.

More than 500 employees of Bungoma County at the weekend (precise date not known) camped at the county headquarters in Bungoma town to protest against perceived favouritism in a employee selection process.
Residents protest the poor state of a road.
Residents protest the poor state of a road.

More than one hundred people held a demonstration in front of the Hargeisa local Government, shouting and denouncing that the Mayor of Hargeisa had taken land illegally and sold it out. The demonstrators claimed ownership of a land which is in front of the Ministry of health.

Vendors staged a demonstration in protest against an alleged decision by the local municipal council to allocate the towns livestock market to investors from the diaspora on 22/08. The demonstration started from the livestock market and ended at the municipal council office. No incident was reported.

Hundreds of people from the Somali Bantu Wagosha community demonstrate in Kismaayo in protest of killings, arrest and many other forms of alleged mistreatment against the community by Ahmed Madobes clan administration.
A group protest a Jubilee Government 'pyramid scheme' which caused many financial ruin.
Colleagues of a man beheaded by al Shabaab in Bothai protest in Maua, demanding the arrest of the perpetrators.

Residents of Bulo Burte on 23/08 staged a demonstration in protest against AMISOMs failure to open the road towards Beled Weyn which is under AS economic blockade. The demonstrators demanded AMISOM to either open the road or leave the town. They accused AMISOM of establishing a helicopter-landing site to receive their food supplies but doing nothing to help the starving residents due to the AS blockade on the town. AMISOM forces stayed in their base during the protest.

SNG forces in Bulo Burte protested against three months unpaid salaries in the morning of 23/08. The soldiers complained that they cannot buy food anymore. The soldiers reportedly ordered all business premises to close during the protest.

A big demonstration in support of the disarmament operation launched by the SNG and AMISOM forces took place at Daljirka Dahsoon square (Boondheere District) on 24/08. SNG forces backed by AMISOM forces tightened the security in the area. The demonstrators expressed their support to the governments disarmament operations and the improved security in the capital. One of the clerics in Mogadishu, Sheikh Abdikadir Somow, who addressed the crowd, explained the importance of security to the population and urged them cooperate with the security agencies in maintaining the general security in the country and Mogadishu in particular.

Traders at Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) closed their premises on 24/08 in protest against tax increase. The traders reportedly said that the government is taxing them twice; at the port and in the market. The closure of premises affected business in the market. Reports on 25/08 indicate that the market remained closed. Latest reports on 26/08 indicate that the market was opened after the government and the markets business committee agreed that the traders to pay tax only once.
A group of 200 Boda Boda operators gather at Kabarnet stadium to protest against heavy handiness from police.

Pro-SW6 (SouthWest 6) staged a demonstration in Adaada area in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in protest against the planned arrival of the SNG prime minister in the morning of 25/08. The demonstration started at ADC compound (the headquarters of the SW6). The protesters marched towards Bakiin Hotel (the headquarters of SW3) where militia of SW3 tried to block them by shooting in the air. One person was hit by a stray bullet and another injured after he was hit by a vehicle. Later reports record two deaths.

Hundreds pro-Khatumo supporters staged a demonstration in Laas Canood in protest against the takeover of Saalax Dheer Village (59km S of Laas Caanood) by Somaliland forces on 28/08. The demonstrators marched on the streets of Laas Canood chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. No casualties were reported.
Residents protest against the principal of a school whom they believe is corrupt.
Trucks from Bosasso stopped their movements from Bosasso to Garowe on 31/08 to protest on rising insecurity and fears of possible al Shabaab raids.
West Kenya Company farmers in Bungoma county demonstrated at the Misikhu weighbridge over reduction of cane prices by the firm. Police officers monitored the protest from a distance.
Migori town boda boda operators have protested against high levies by the county government. The operators held a demonstration on Administration road on Wednesday.
Police in Yatta stopped a demonstration against Kalonzo Musyoka by residents of Matuu town.

Residents of Narok county staged a demonstration at Duka Moja Thursday morning to protest the death of four men and a woman who died after consuming illicit brew on Wednesday night. The protesters mounted roadblocks along the Mai-Mahiu - Narok road at Duka Moja shopping centre and accused police of laxity in dealing with the sale of illicit brew.
Parents of school children block roads in protest of the appointment of a new principal of whom they disapprove.

'More than 40 employees with Johnson Group construction equipment hiring firm have lodged complaints with the Iringa Regional Commissioner demanding pay rise and other perks' after walking to the Regional Commissioners office.
Artists and actors staged a peaceful demonstration at the National Theatre to protest the courts decision to stop police from arresting film pirates.

Hundreds of Mogadishu residents staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Banadir Regional Administration (Heliwa District) on 05/09 in support of the ongoing Anti-al Shabaab military offensives known as 'Indian Ocean Operations'. Reports indicate that the demo was organized by Banadir administration and the protestors were shouting anti-al Shabaab slogans. Some of the SNG Ministers and other officials addressed the gathering.
Residents protested, calling for the arrest of a police officer after he had killed two criminals, who the protesters believe were innocent.
Residents of Githurai again gather to protest, calling for the arrest of a police officer who they believe killed two innocents.
A group of pupils and teachers protest against a county government measure of overtake public utilities.

Hundreds of pro-SW6 supporters staged a peaceful demonstration in front of ADC Compound (the headquarters of SW6) in Isha neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the morning of 09/09. The protesters were reportedly opposed to the SNGs plan to establish a three-state administration.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Galkacyo (South) the morning of 09/09 in protest against reports that the Saudi government is planning to remove Prophet Mohammed from the Medina. The demonstrators marched on the streets of Galkacyo South chanting anti-Saudi slogans. The VOAs Somali service and several British newspapers reported last weeks that the Saudi monarch is planning to remove the tomb from Medina-a claim strongly denied by the Saudi government.
Police had to shoot in the air several times to quell demonstrators who blocked Thika Superhighway in Nairobi as they protested the prosecution of a police officer charged with murder.

Boda boda operators protest against a group of youth who had heckled President Uhuru at a nearby event on 08/09. [The group] marched on the Migori-Kakrao road, cursing the youth who embarrassed the Head of State.
Demonstrators protest the prosecution of a police officer for a second day. No reported police involvement.
A 'massive' demonstration against al Shabaab is held in Buulobarde.
Demonstrators protest the prosecution of a police officer for a third day. No reported police involvement.

Public passengers staged a demonstration in Lawya Caddo (27km NW of Zeylac) on 12/09 following after Somaliland authorities introduced custom fees of ($31) both entry and exit at the border. The protestors were opposing the new law which had caused many travelers to be stuck at the border.
Traders at a market protest their forced relocation.
Maungu residents in Voi protested against the extraction of stones from Marasi Hill by the China Roads and Bridges Company that is constructing a railway.

Residents in Kakamega stormed Governor's offices demanding his attention over insecurity. Carrying twigs, the protesters marched to the governor's office after the body of a six-year-old girl was found dumped in a trench at a residential estate in Kakamega Town.

Hundreds of street vendors staged a demonstration in Borama market after police and municipal council workers tried to evict them their business places on 15/09. Reports indicate that the protestors reportedly stoned the police. Police used tear gas and life bullets to disperse the street vendors. Six people were reportedly injured.

Hundreds of civilians staged a peaceful demonstration in Daljirka Dahsoon area (Bondheere District) on 16/09 to express their supporting to the on-going military offensive 'Indian Ocean Offensive' against al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate that the protestors were chanting anti-al Shabaab slogans. Bondheere District Commissioner and a spokesman for Banadir Regional Administration addressed the protestors and urged them to collaborate with SNG security apparatus.
Residents of Emsoo ward, Keiyo North have demonstrated against the building of a planned training institute in another village.

Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Xararyaale neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 18/09 to express their anger against AMISOM following yesterdays accident where an AMISOM police vehicle hit and killed a small boy in the neighbourhood. The demonstrators called for the perpetrators to be brought to justice. The demonstrations ended peacefully.

A small group of people staged a demonstration in Dila town on 19/09 in protest against the killing of the commander Somaliland forces in Qorilugud Village on 17/09 by a Somaliland soldier. The demonstrators blocked the main road in the town and called on the government to arrest the perpetrator. No incident was reported.

Transport in Kabarnet town bus stage temporarily stopped when more than 200 drivers protested against hiring and firing of Baringo county vehicles drivers. The group later proceeded to the office of the Governor.
A protest against a reconciliation meeting between and takes place in Baidoa. The protest was mainly against the proposals and plans of the SW-6 group.

Drivers of commuter buses staged a demonstration in Borama on 22/09 in protest of a new transport company that started operating on Borama-Hargeisa route. The drivers complained that the new company is not registered with Borama municipal company but with the central government in Hargeisa. The drivers reportedly blocked the road to the municipal council offices in Borama.
Over 250 traders in Biharamulo in the Kagera region closed their shops to protest the use of Electrical Fiscal Devices by the Tanzania Revenue Authority.

At least four people were shot and seriously wounded by police after a meeting to discuss the ouster of Makueni Governor. Those wounded include [the Governors] chief of staff, a bodyguard and two county officials who were allegedly shot when the county assemblys security personnel opened fire to disperse a charged crowd.

Dockworkers at Mogadishu port (Xamar Jab Jab District) demonstrated over plans to reduce the workforce in the morning of 24/09. The protest follows after Al Bayrak, a Turkish company, managing the port, announced that it will reduce the dockworkers from 6000 down to 3500. SNG police opened fire to disperse the dockworkers, injuring two. Another demonstration took place in the vicinity of the port.

Countrywide protests planned by CHADEMA opposition party were stopped by a heavy advanced presence of armed police officers. CHADEMA is organizing against the Constituent Assembly, who they claim are wasting taxpayer money.
Students at Mathenge TTI protest a lack of a television station broadcast at their institute.

The employees of sheikh Hospital (fatouh Hospital) and Sheikh Water Agency staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Mayors office (Sheikh) on 26/09. The protestors were complaining about unpaid salaries over several months and they demanded from the government to dismiss both managers of (the Hospital and the Water Agency).

A group of fishermen and their families staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Lughaye local government office on 27/09 following the arrest of Djiboutian fishermen and suspension of the fishing station. The protestors also requested from the government to be allowed to export fuel from Djibouti for their fishing boats.

Staffs working for Puntland state TV staged a demonstration on 27/09 following unpaid salaries over two months. Following the protest Puntland forces arrested some of the staffs from their houses. Latest reports on 28/09 indicate that most of the detainees have been released and the TV is back to the air.
Students at Moi University protest over 'delayed learning' after claiming they had not been taught for several months.

At least 1,000 passengers were stranded on the Mbeya-Malawi road after a driver blocked the road in protest of acts of corruption among Rungwe District Council officials. The protestor alleges that one of his lorry drivers was beaten when he refused to pay a bribe.

Residents of Mukunike village in Kilimambogo, Kiambu county protested the demolition of 50 houses by a local quarry operator. They used boulders to block the Thika-Garissa road for 3 hours bringing traffic at Kilimambogo centre to a standstill.
Residents of Mijikenda area protest over the selling of land by the local government without giving notice to the current owners.
CHADEMA protestors marched through the streets to the parties main offices to protest the Constituent Assembly. Police dispersed the crowd using tear gas before they reached their destination.

A group of street vendors stage a peaceful demonstration in front of Zeylac local government offices on 29/09 following a security operation targeting to demolish temporary shops built along the main roads. The protestors requested from the government to allow them to conduct their businesses.
Believing their jobs in jeopardy to foreign Turkish labour, port workers protest outside the Parliament building to express their grievance.
Machakos University College students protest over absentee lecturers, many of whom have not been attending classes. Six arrests reported.
Dedan Kimathi University students protest over two consecutive days over delayed loans from the Higher Education Loans Board. The protests caused the institution to close on the second day.
Dedan Kimathi University students protest over two consecutive days over delayed loans from the Higher Education Loans Board. The protests caused the institution to close on the second day.

CHADEMA protestors ignored police warnings not to demonstrate without a permit, and the leader of the women's wing led a group to the State House and the parties headquarters. Police dispersed the protestors with water cannons and pepper spray and Mdee and eight other members were arrested and charged with unlawful assembly and disobedience.
Protestors participated in worldwide demonstrations to stop the poaching industry, particular in light of dwindling rhino and elephant populations.
Demonstrators protest on Nairobi (as well as other World Cities) against rhino and elephant poaching.
Residents protest insecurity in the area. The protest comes after an increased number of armed thefts in the village in recent weeks.
Boda boda motorcyclists in Kinale, Lari sub county, protest against an AP officer after an arrest of a colleague which they thought unjustified.
Residents of Kinangop in Nyandarua county held a demonstration to protest the murder of a businessman. The protesters accused a local for the death.

Residents of Teso North took to the streets to protest against the state of roads in the sub county. The protest, which drew more than 100 participants from Angurai, Aedo Moru and Kakapel, blamed politicians for the poor infrastructure. The exact location of the protest was not reported.
Two independent MPs taunt the government after police repeatedly obstruct their planned processions in Masaka.

More than a hundred people staged anti-Somaliland and Puntland demonstration in Buuhoodle on 13/10. The rally was organized by Khatumo officials and reportedly follows reports that Puntlands vice-president is planning to visit Buuhoodle. The rally ended peacefully.
Students demonstrate against the decision by management to close the university.

Protestors gathered outside the US Embassy and submitted a letter to an embassy representative demanding the arrest of individuals who desecrated the Ethiopian flag in the US recently. The event was peaceful
Students demonstrate against the decision by management to close the university.

Drivers in Makutano and Kapenguria towns, West Pokot protested against the poor state of the Makutano-Alale road outside of Makutano. They blocked the road to the governor and county commissioners offices for several hours.
Members of the Olomismis Group Ranch in Trans Mara protested against their officials mismanagement. The exact location of the protest is not known.

Drivers in Makutano and Kapenguria towns, West Pokot protested against the poor state of the Makutano-Alale road outside of Makutano. They blocked the road to the governor and county commissioners offices for several hours.
Students demonstrate against the decision by management to close the university.

Police disperse students protesting against the closure of Busitema University with teargas. There are no reported injuries or reported instances of the demonstrators turning violent or destroying property.
200  Muslims demonstrated against the 6pm-6am curfew in [Kenya] on Lamu Island. The group asserted the curfew hurts the local fishing economy.
A group of traders protest over tax increases.

Hundreds of civilians staged a peaceful demonstration in Beled Weyne in the morning of 19/10 accusing AMISOM (Djiboutian contingent) of siding with the Dir clan in the ongoing conflict between Dir and Hawadle clans in Deefow Village (29km NW of Beled Weyne). The demonstration follows after the Djiboutian forces left for Deefow Village but returned before reaching the village.

Police fire live rounds to disperse striking students. Several students are hit by bullets and injured. The students, from the capitals Makerere University, were calling for graduation fees to be lowered.

Police fire live rounds to disperse striking students. Several students are hit by bullets and injured. The students, from the capitals Makerere University, were calling for graduation fees to be lowered.

University of Eldoret students took to the streets in protest over a directive that they sit special exams. The students claimed that they were not ready for the exams and that they were not given time to prepare.

Residents of Maguguni protest along the Mombasa-Nairobi highway for five hours to protest grabbing of the land by CORD corporation leader Raila Odinga. CORD is apparently interested in petroleum prospects on the plot.
Residents of Majengo town in Vihiga county protest, demanding an audience with the Governor of the region to express their grievance over a recent spate of robberies.

Supporters of SW6 region staged a peaceful demonstration in Baidoa in the morning of 26/10, following the arrival of SNG delegates led by the Speaker. The protestors were shunting anti SW3 region slogans. The demonstration ended peacefully.
Residents of the Milano area of Malindi town demonstrated against the buying of land by a business tycoon.

More than hundreds of residents of Bossaso staged a peaceful demonstration on 27/10 in support of the Somalia Prime Minister over the recent cabinet reshuffle which led political difference between him and the president. The protestors matched in the streets of Bossaso shunting anti-Somalia president slogans.

A group of youth and intellectuals staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Gandhi Public Library 27/10 following after a report emerged regarding the government is reportedly selling the library to private companies.

Mutige Secondary School students walked out in protest against the administrations failure to address their grievances (the students want medical attention for the injured, new toilets, transport and leakage in classrooms and dormitories fixed). The more than 200 students marched to the counties headquarters in Kerugoya.
Students of Laikipia University in Kitale and Kapenguria protest the college CEOs decision to relocate them to the Eldoret campus.
Students of Laikipia University in Kitale and Kapenguria protest the college CEOs decision to relocate them to the Eldoret campus.
Students protest over the high number of missing lecturers and cancelled classes at Gulu University.

Lamu residents have again taken to the streets to protest the continued extension of the night curfew which has been in force for more than three months now. Police were deployed to disperse the protesters.
Residents protest against the state of the roads in the local municipality.
Traders in Lamu protest for a second consecutive day. Police reported involvement.
Dock workers protest at Mombasa port against inter-political union activities.
Residents of Homa Bay town and its environs protest against a three-day power blackout.
Residents protest against an MP over a tax law violation.
Following heavy-handed treatment by police against a MP, residents of Cheptiret protest the action, calling for the local police station to be shut down. Exact date not known - source date is 07/11.

Students protest in Lodwar, Turkana county over recent insecurity in the region. The group threatened to halt oil exploration in the area if the government did not act. The protest is mainly a reaction to an attack on a police post in Kapedo over the weekend.
Residents protest in Lodwar over area insecurity for a second day.

Residents of Garbahareey staged a peaceful demonstration to express their support to the prime minister in the morning of 12/11. The protestors matched in the street of the town chanting slogan anti SNG president. The protest ended peacefully.

A group of resident of Xariirad (56km NW of Borama) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the local authorities on 12/11, to protest against the perceived lack of response to water scarcity in the town. Officials from water agency in the town addressed the crowd and promised that they will solve the problem.
A women's group in suburban Nairobi protests lenient penalties on the sale of illegal alcohol.

A group of people, mostly youths and women, staged a demonstration at liberty garden in Ceerigaabo on 15/11 to express their anger against the ruling Kulmiye Party to oust the Speaker of parliament in a vote of no confidence. Police and the army dispersed the demonstrators. Five people were reportedly arrested during the demonstrators. On 16/11, police arrested 10 people who reportedly organized the demonstration.
Hundreds of residents invaded a 60,000-acre ranch in Taita Taveta belonging to a cooperative in protest of land grabbing by a third party.
Molasses traders protest a buyer over perceived favouritism given to conglomerates.
A group protests attacks on women based on wearing revealing attire.

The parents of a child who was killed by a Kampala Capital City Authority vehicle try to bring the infants body into parliament to protest against the KCCA and demand a formal apology. They are physically blocked by police, but there are no reports of injuries.
A group of internally displaced people in Gilgil protested at the office of the deputy county commissioner demanding to be given relief food.

More than hundreds of Maydh residents staged a demonstration on 21/11 against Somaliland minister of Interior. The rally was organized by local elders following after Somaliland minister reportedly ordered custodial guards to transfer all Yemen boats to Berbera to get their fishing licenses. Further information suggests that the order was later lifted and the fishing boats will get their licenses in Maydh. The protestors were allegedly accusing the minister of undermining the port of Maydh. Police dispersed the protestors peacefully.

The residents of Badhan mostly, women and youths, staged a peaceful protest on 22/11 to express their support to the Somalia prime minister and also to condemned Somali parliament of planning to impeach him. The rally ended peacefully.

Civil society groups took to the streets, torching coffins to protest against recent Mandera violence and rising insecurity in the region. Police dispersed the crowd when they neared the Office of the President, Harambee House (Nairobi - Starehe).
A group continues a protest against insecurity in Nairobis CBD (Nairobi - Starehe).
University of Nairobi students protest a policy that would not pay interns.

Hundreds of disabled people staged a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Interior at the former Otto Otto Building in protest for lack of assistance from the SNG. The protesters said they were in deplorable situation and accused the government of not even assisting them with basic necessities.

Residents of Buuhoodle town staged a peaceful demonstration on 02/12 to express their solidarity with the people of Laas Caanood who protested against the killing of a policeman (Dhulbahante) at the eastern checkpoint of Laas Caanood on 01/12. Somaliland authorities claimed that the police man was killed by Khatumo forces who attacked the checkpoint earlier in the day but was immediately refuted by Khatumo interior minister. The protestors matched in the streets of the towns chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration led by the vice-president.
Hundreds of women staged a demonstration to protest against their husbands neglect of family responsibilities.

Hundreds of civilians staged peaceful demonstration in Cadaado town in the morning of 03/12 denouncing the fighting between Saleban and Ayr sub-clans of Habar Gidir in Warshubo Village (100km NE of Ceel Buur). The demonstrators called on the warring sides to end hostility and end their differences through dialogue. This comes a week after the two Habar Gidir sub-clans clashed in the village in which 20 people were killed.
Elegeyo-Marakwet residents protest over a road overgrown with foliage, causing passage difficult.

Berbera municipal council workers and police demolished kiosks built near the main roads of the town on 14/12. The affected traders staged a demonstration in front of the municipal council but were immediately dispersed by the police.
Residents of Matuu town, Machakos county, took to the streets to protest demolition of kiosks by the county government.
2,000 Maasai gathered in Loliondo to protest against lands being converted into hunting grounds for the UAE royal family.

Puntland army troops based in Tulo Raq (49km E of Laas Caanood) left for Garowe in protest against unpaid salaries in the in the morning of 05/12. The unit set up a temporary base in the outskirts of Garowe.

Federal police beat protesters with clubs, injuring several, and arrested dozens of opposition leaders, including Yilikal Getnet from the Semayawi party. The protest was organized by nine opposition parties and the government claims they violated a protest ban. Those arrested were denied bail and not released until Dec 11.

A group of local residents mostly youth and women staged a peaceful demonstration in Caynabo town on 07/12. The demonstrators were protesting against the Caynabo Police Commander whom they accused of allowing police torture during security operations. They were chanting slogans calling the government to replace him.

Hundreds of physically challenged people in Mogadishu gathered in front of the Ministry of Interior in Otto Otto area in Waberi District in the morning of 08/12 to protest the lack of assistance from the Ministry of Interior. Protesters staged a similar protest in the area a week prior.

A group of people staged a demonstration in Dila (25km SE of Borama) on 11/12 complaining that they have been left out in the recruitment process by an international company involved in mining activities in the village. The demonstration ended peacefully.

A large number of disable people staged a demonstration at K4 Junction (Hodan District) on 13/12 in protest against the SNG for failing to assist them. The demonstrators reportedly closed the junction and disrupted traffic at the busy junction. This is the third time the disable demonstrated in the streets of Mogadishu in two weeks.
Residents of Kainuk protest insecurity in their area after a spate of increased armed banditry along the Lodwa-Kitale road.

Children at Hargeisa Orphanage Centre staged a peaceful demonstration in protest against plans by the government to construct a vocational centre at a local football pitch adjacent to the orphanage centre. The children said they play soccer at the pitch during their leisure time. The demonstration follows amid reports that the Office of the President and the Ministry of Information are jointly planning to develop skills training centre at the football pitch.

A large number of people staged a demonstration in central Borama on 14/12. The demonstrators were protesting against the deployment of Somaliland army in Borama to arrest a traditional leader who reportedly mobilized a clan militia to fight Somaliland government. Police shot in the air to disperse the demonstrations. They also arrested 14 demonstrators. Police also arrested two councillors who were involved in the protest.

Hundreds of CHADEMA supporters gathered on Msati Street in Tarime demanding a re-vote from Dec. 14 elections. CCM: Party of the Revolution supposedly won the original vote, but protesters claimed that results had been nullified and a re-vote had been promised for Dec. 16. A Regional Crimes Officer calmed the crowds and told them to return home.
About 600 members of the Ogiek community evicted from Cengalo forest in South Nandi catchment area protested along the nearby Kapsabet-Nabkoi highway against lack of compensation.
Police opened fire to disperse protesters who were marching to stop a government-led demolition. Three were reported dead and several injured.
Police open fire on a group of youths who disrupted a wedding at a IDP camp. The nature of the disruption is not clear; it is unknown if the youths were armed. Six injuries reported.
Hundreds of residents of Jowhar stage d a peaceful rally in the morning of 22/12 in support of SNG newly appointed Prime Minister Omar Abdirashid Ali Sharmarke.

A group of local residents mostly, youth and women, staged a demonstration in Caynabo on 23/12.The protestors were expressing their anger against individuals turned large pasture land in to a private use. The protestors requested the government to intervene the matter since their animals left no land to grass.

Civil servants staged a peaceful demonstration in Garowe in the morning of 23/12 in protest against a new directive to test the qualification of all civil servants. Under the new directive, all civil servants will undergo an examination to test whether they qualify for the posts they are holding.

Students from Farah Omar Secondary School staged a demonstration along the main road near Imperial Hotel on 23/12 to express their anger of lack of teachers in the school. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the students. At the time of reporting the students were reportedly regrouping to continue their protest.

About 200 residents of Ngangarithi held a demonstration in Nyeri town over the proposed new land rates. The residents opposed the new rates in the County Finance Revenue Bill, saying the increased taxation is too high.
Persons charged with murder staged a boycott in the Kisutu Resident Magistrates Court in Dar es Salaam, demanding an explanation for the delay in their case.

Berbera municipal council workers backed by police demolished kiosks built near the main roads of the town on 29/12. The affected traders staged a demonstration in front of the municipal council but were immediately dispersed by the police.

SPUs static guards assigned to the UNCC on 30/12 complained and showed a kind of protest about unpaid/delayed of their stipends for two months. The SPU commander later clarified that the payment has already been processed and they will be paid on 31/12 while the situation returned to normalcy. On the same note SPUs static guards for INGOs compounds claimed that they have received their stipends on November and still waiting for December to be paid.
Police break into a mosque and evict protesters who occupied the building in a demonstration against the mosque s current clerical leadership.
Boda boda riders and traders protest a new law that prohibits animals to travel through the CBD of Bomet.

Khatumo state supporters held a demonstration in Buuhoodle on 04/01 to protest against the opening of a political office in the town by Wadani political party. The demonstrators were chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and were carrying pictures of victims from previous clashes between Somaliland and Khatumo.

Youths took to Ngong Road in Nairobi (Nairobi - Westlands) and adjacent streets to protest the death of former Prime Minister Raila Odingas son, who died in unclear circumstances. The protesters demanded to know the cause of death. The demo lasted several hours.
Residents of Tegeta Boko demonstrated against being charged for water despite having poor water service.
Teachers strike, protest over poor working conditions.
Hundreds of Athi River sub county workers protested over a irregular payment from Machakos county government.
Following an attack by armed robbers in Ol Moran village of Laikipia residents protest insecurity.
