More than 1,000 teachers from Buuri, North Imenti, South Imenti and Meru Central sub counties protest in Meru. The teachers were on strike, calling for better salaries.
Traders at Kalundu market held a demonstration in Kitui town, protesting against high market charges by the county government.
Two demonstrators were shot and injured by police in Mau Narok during a protest against increased road accidents.

Pokot cattle rustlers struck Namawanga village inhabited by members of the Luhya community and shot dead a local farmer before stealing three bulls from his home. In revenge, Luhya tribesmen hacked to death a Pokot man after they found him ferrying two passengers to Karnyarkwat market. The killing of the man sparked off protest from members of the Pokot community who thronged to Kapkoi market vowing to revenge over the killing of their tribesmen.
URP supporters disrupt a demonstration in Bomet concerning the location of a university, no reported violence. Police forces dispersed the two groups.
Activist youth group - National Association of the Unemployed - demonstrates in Kampala .
Journalists march to Naguru police station to protest against the beating of a journalist by a member of the police forces. They are intercepted by police and dispersed with pepper spray.

A group of Nairobi-based journalists were ejected from a reception area at the United Nations complex (Nairobi - Westlands) in Kenyas capital after launching a protest over Al-Jazeera journalists jailed in Egypt.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Balambale in the morning of 14/01 in protest against the planned conference on the formation of Somali central state in Cadaado. The demonstrator called for the organizers to change the venue to Dhusamareeb, where all communities in the region are present.
University of Dodoma students marched on campus at dawn on Jan. 14, demanding disbursement of meal funds. 84 students were held for questioning; ring leaders arrested.

Local residents staged a demonstration against the president of Somaliland, Ahmed Mohamed Silanyo, in Fara Weyne Village in the morning of 16/01. The locals were reportedly complaining against lack of development in the village. Police arrested a number of protestors.

Hundreds of university students in Mogadishu held a demonstration near Hawl-Wadaag Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) on 17/01 in protest against the French Charlie Hebdo Magazine. The demonstrators were chanting I am a Muslim in French. Some Islamic scholars who addressed the demonstrators urged them to spread Islam and warned Western countries against hurting the feelings of Muslims.

About a hundred IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration in Burco airstrip area against the Minister of Civil Aviation on 19/01. The demonstrators were complaining about an order from the minister to remove IDPs from the airstrip land. They appealed to the Somaliland president for intervention.

Berbera local authority with the support of Somaliland police conducted operations to demolish illegal kiosks along the main road in Berbera. Kiosk owners demonstrated in front of the local authority office. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators.

Some of the residents in Borama held a demonstration in the central market to show support for Suldan Waber, the traditional leader turned rebel and demanded Somaliland forces to leave Borama and Gurijeed. Somaliland police shot in the air to disperse the crowd and arrested 14 teenagers for participating in the demonstration. No casualties were reported.
Residents protest against French magazine Charlie Hebdo for publishing a caricature of prophet Muhammad.

A demonstration in protest against reports that Ethiopian Liyuu Police is taking part in the ongoing clashes between Hawadle and Dir militias in Defow Village (30km NW of Beled) took place in Beled Weyne on 21-22. The demonstration, which took place at night, was sparked after large number of the Liyuu police crossed the border to back the Dir militias.

A demonstration in protest against reports that Ethiopian Liyuu Police is taking part in the ongoing clashes between Hawadle and Dir militias in Defow Village (30km NW of Beled) took place in Beled Weyne on 21-22. The demonstration, which took place at night, was sparked after large number of the Liyuu police crossed the border to back the Dir militias.
Boda boda operators in Amagoro town protest alleged police harassment.
Hundreds of civilians have staged a peaceful demonstration condemning Charlie Hebdo Magazine in Dhusamareeb in the morning of 23/01. The protestors burnt the flag of French flag during the protest.

Hundreds of people including religious leaders, students, women and youth groups staged a peaceful demonstration at Cawale Football Stadium in Galkacyo (North) in the morning of 23/01. The demonstrators were protesting against the French Charlie Hebdo magazine. The demonstrators carried placards condemning the magazine. The demonstrators chanted anti-Charlie Hebdo and anti-Western slogans. The demonstrators shouted that they will not tolerate anyone ridiculing the Prophet. Police were deployed to ensure the security of the demonstrators. The event ended peacefully.

Residents of Masalaha neighbourhood in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) staged a peaceful demonstration in protest against the illegal sale of public land by the government. The demonstrators who included the chief traditional leader of Somaliland, prominent elders and religious leaders claimed the land, which served a football ground, was sold to a businessman.
At least 26 protesters were injured when Ethiopian police broke an opposition protest rally in the capital, Addis Ababa, today.

Hundreds of people including religious leaders, students, women and youth groups staged a demonstration in Bosasso in the morning of 25/01. The demonstrators were protesting against the French Charlie Hebdo magazine over the publications of cartoons of Prophet Muhammad. The demonstrators carried placards condemning the magazine. The demonstrators chanted anti-Charlie Hebdo and anti-Western slogans.

Berbera municipal council workers backed by police demolished kiosks built near the main roads of the town on 25/01. The affected traders staged a demonstration in front of the municipal council but were immediately dispersed by the police.
Transporters blocked the highway near Mlolongo on 26/01 to protest the closing of access roads by police, who they charged with corruption.
Students of Limuko Secondary School in Bahati protest, demanding the transfer of their principal alleging 'highhandedness.'

More than 30 Civic United Front supporters staged a demonstration in Dar es salaam to mark the 14th anniversary of party members being killed in a protest in Zanzibar over the alleged rigging of the general election in 2000. CUF chairman Ibrahim Lipumba and others were arrested and beaten. Police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.

Traders in Dar es Salaams Kariakoo area staged a two-day protest by closing shops, demanding the release of businessman Johnson Minja, who has led the opposition stance against Electronic Fiscal Devices.
Puntland soldiers protest at Bosasso palace over pay delays. Date not clear, source dated 27/01.
Traders in Iringa staged a protest by closing shops, demanding the release of businessman Johnson Minja, who has led the opposition stance against Electronic Fiscal Devices.
Traders in Mbeya staged a protest by closing shops, demanding the release of businessman Johnson Minja, who has led the opposition stance against Electronic Fiscal Devices.
Traders in Songea staged a protest by closing shops, demanding the release of businessman Johnson Minja, who has led the opposition stance against Electronic Fiscal Devices.
Traders in Tanga staged a protest by closing shops, demanding the release of businessman Johnson Minja, who has led the opposition stance against Electronic Fiscal Devices.
Students in Wajir protest a teacher shortage in the area.

A handful of youths staged a peaceful demonstration while initially gathering at the Barhada (Garowe) in the morning of 29/01. The demonstrators were protesting against the French magazine Charlie Hebdo over the publications of cartoons of Prophet Mohammad. The demonstrators carried placards condemning the satirical magazine and shouted slogans against it. Puntland Police forces later dispersed the demonstrators.

A group of youths staged a peaceful demonstration at the soccer stadium in Bosasso on 31/01 condemning the French Charlie Hebdo Magazine. The protestors chanted anti-Charlie Hebdo slogan during the rally.
Political activists (affiliation not known) march in Kapsabet for unknown reason.
800 Mandera teachers protest al Shabaab spurred insecurity in their region at the KNUT headquarters in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe). After several hours the group marched to the parliament building.

Police fired teargas at students of Kenya Medical Training College (Nairobi - Langata)who were protesting over the death of their classmate. The student had committed suicide after being removed from an exam over unpaid fees.

Employees of Hargeisa electricity company (state-owned) staged a demonstration in front of the company on 08/02 demanding their redundancy pay following the privatization of the company. No insecurity incident was reported.

NRM members occupy the office of Lira Resident District Commissioner, complaining that their names had been erased from a list of beneficiaries of shs 200 million pledged to 65 party loyalists from Lango by Museveni.
Residents of Kabete constituency held a demonstration at Wangige trading centre over the pace of investigations into area MP George Muchais murder, which occurred on 07/02.

A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in protest against the Sultan Wabar and his militias in Qulujeed Village (25km NW of Borama) on 13/02. This demonstration came after an armed clash between Somaliland army and the militias loyal to the Sultan in the village on 10/02. The demonstrators cautioned Sultan Wabar and his militia to desist from attacking the village.
Residents of Umande, Laikipia East sub county, held a demonstration against the abstraction of Sirimon River by a privately held dam.

A Senator and ten others are assaulted by riot police when they staged a protest at the University of Eldoret in an effort to force the removal of the vice chancellor Teresa Akenga, whom area leaders accused of nepotism and skewed employment. The protest was reported as peaceful.
Hundreds of Voi residents took to the streets on 19/02 in a protest for the arrest of a Marungu ward rep over alleged sexual abuse.
Residents of Ukasi, Mwingi Central, hold a peaceful demonstration to protest against prolonged water shortage.
Street traders hold a 'mostly peaceful' demonstration in Kutui over a tax levied against them. No report of violence.

Pro-Khatumo local residents reportedly staged a peaceful demonstration against the deployment of Somaliland forces in Geed Dheer Village (59km NE of Buuhoodle) on 24/02. Tension reportedly ran high between the locals and the Somaliland forces. The locals said they were opposed to clashes between Khatumo forces and Somaliland troops in the village. The Somaliland forces later withdrew after a meeting with the local elders and moved towards Dharkeyn-Genyo Village.

More than 200 businesspeople in Kisii town staged a demonstration to protest against grabbing of land where they operate. The traders protested against a decision by the county government to move them from outside the Kisii Municipal Market.
Three quarters of students at Leshau Boys High School boycotted classes, protesting alleged poor hygiene in the institution. The students marched peacefully to the Nyahururu-Nyeri highway.
Boda boda drivers protest a tax increase over two consecutive days in Mumias.
Boda boda drivers protest a tax increase over two consecutive days in Mumias.

Television viewers protest analogue signal switch off at outside Communications Authority offices on Waiyaki Way, Nairobi (Nairobi - Westlands). The switch off forces viewers to purchase a digital apparatus.
Demonstration by Zeylac residents over the closure of a border. The protesters were dispersed by police.

A group of milk traders demonstrated in front of the local authority offices in Borama on 02/03. The demonstrators were unhappy with new taxes and the confiscation of vehicles used for milk transport by the local authority. The mayor of the town later intervened, released the vehicles and said the new taxes are no longer valid. Most of the protestors were women.
Students of Chebara Boys Secondary School, Marakwet West, held a demonstration, demanding the removal of principal, whom they accused of mismanagement.
Residents of Tseikuru protest, demand the removal of the local district commissioner. Police dispersed the group.

Sheikh Bashir Secondary School students staged a demonstration in Burao on 07/03 to protest against the transfer of one of their teachers. This follows after the Ministry of Education transferred the teacher to another school. The protestors called on the Ministry to bring back the teacher.

More than hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Buuhoodle on 07/03. The demonstration was meant to show support to the recent decision by SNG to halt the talks with Somaliland administration. The protesters marched along the streets chanting anti-Somaliland and Somali unity slogans.
Residents of Mukurwe-ini marched to the sub-county hospitals mortuary and took away the body of a man who was allegedly shot by a police officer in protest of the killing.

Pro-Khatumo Dhulbahante locals staged a peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood on 08/03. The demonstration was meant to show support to SNG decision to halt talks with Somaliland administration. The protesters marched along the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland and Somali unity slogans. Somaliland police arrived at the scene and shot in the air to disperse the demonstrators.
More than 200 Kisii county government employees demonstrated at Governor James Ongwaes office protesting they have not been paid for nine months.

Protests in front of a house in Pasua Ward in Moshi, in which a 17 children were being housed for the purpose of Islamic education. Protesters also gathered in front of the police station in Moshi. Anti-riot Field Force Unit used tear gas to disperse the crowd. Owner of the house said the children's parents consented to his teachings and housing of the children. Police held the house owner and several of the parents in custody for further investigation.

More than hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Xamar Lagu Xidh Village (32km E of Buuhoodle) on 09/03. The demonstration was aimed to express their support to the decisions taken by the SNG in suspending talks with Somaliland. The protesters marched along the main street in the village chanting anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans. The demo was organized by the Khatumo officials.

More than hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Tuka-Raq (48km E of Laas Caanood) on 09/03. The demonstration was aimed to express their support to the decisions taken by the SNG in suspending talks with Somaliland. The protesters marched along the streets chanting anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Saalax Dheer and Boocame villages (59 and 64kms SE and SW of Laas Caanood) on 10/03. The demonstration was aimed to express their support to the decisions taken by the SNG in suspending talks with Somaliland. The protesters chanted anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans. The demo was organized by the Khatumo officials.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Xamar Lagu Xidh and Geed Dheer villages (59 & 75kms NE of Buuhoodle) on 10/03. The demonstration was aimed to express their support to the decisions taken by the SNG in suspending talks with Somaliland. The protesters chanted anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans during the demo.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Xamar Lagu Xidh and Geed Dheer villages (59 & 75kms NE of Buuhoodle) on 10/03. The demonstration was aimed to express their support to the decisions taken by the SNG in suspending talks with Somaliland. The protesters chanted anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans during the demo.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Saalax Dheer and Boocame villages (59 and 64kms SE and SW of Laas Caanood) on 10/03. The demonstration was aimed to express their support to the decisions taken by the SNG in suspending talks with Somaliland. The protesters chanted anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans. The demo was organized by the Khatumo officials.
Traders protest an eviction notice along the Malaba-Eldoret road.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Taleex on 14/03. The demonstration was meant to express support for the SNG decision to suspend talks with Somaliland administration. The protestors marched along the streets in the town and were chanting anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans.
Employees of Kenya Methodist University protest a reduction of their allowances by the institution (Nairobi - Starehe).
Protests in Tunduma related to the clashes between police and political parties in a land dispute. Police fired tear gas and live bullets in the air to disperse the crowd.

Hundreds of local residents took to the streets in Daljirka neighbourhood (Boondheere District) in the morning of 17/03, calling the Italian oil company (ENI) to leave the country. The protesters carried placards and banners with slogans such as Italy stop stealing our resources. They also condemned the illegal fishing by foreign vessels in Somali territorial waters. The demonstration was organized by Somali Students Union.
Hundreds of Mandera County residents took to the streets of the border town on 20/03 protesting over recent insecurity in the area. The protesters called for the removal of the county commissioner.

More than hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Godaale and Arooley villages (45km SW of Taleex) on 20/03. The protestors were expressing their support to the decisions taken by the SNG in suspending talks with Somaliland. The protesters marched along the main street in the villages chanting anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans. The Khatumo officials reportedly organized the demonstration.

More than hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Godaale and Arooley villages (45km SW of Taleex) on 20/03. The protestors were expressing their support to the decisions taken by the SNG in suspending talks with Somaliland. The protesters marched along the main street in the villages chanting anti-Somaliland and pro-Somalia slogans. The Khatumo officials reportedly organized the demonstration.
Residents of Mandera County demonstrate against recent area violence by al Shabaab. Date not known: source dated 21/03.

A group of youths staged a demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo local electricity company called Beder on 21/03 in protest against loose electric poles and pendulous light cables in Ceerigaabo streets. The demonstration followed after an electric pole collapsed injuring a woman and killed several goats. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the protestors. No arrests were made.

Hundreds of residents of Yaaqshiid District staged a peaceful demonstration in Suuq Bacaad neighbourhood in the morning of 22/03 in protest against the rise of insecurity in the neighbourhood. The demonstration started shortly after the killing of two SNG soldiers in the area by unidentified armed men.
A groups of youths protest the Mandera Deputy Governor during a rally in Mandara.
Parents of two schools in Nakuru hold a demonstration to protest the grabbing of a section of the school land by a private developer.
Students of Rongo University College state a protest after a residential hall is burned. The protest and fire may be related to a recent election which caused tension in the area.
On 23 March 2015, a woman was killed, allegedly by police, during a demonstration in Malindi to protest against the tax increase by the Kilifi county government. Police deny they used live rounds.
Fruit factory workers protest poor working conditions in Bibirioni, Limuru. Date not clear - source dated 24/03.
Traders blocked the Eldoret-Nakuru highway at Burnt Forest, protesting against increased licence fees and poor services.
Baringo county residents protest reoccurring attack by Pokot bandits. The protesters marched throughout the county, eventually ending in Kabarnet.

Residents in Wadamogo (18km E of Caynabo) held a peaceful demonstration that was attended by elders and residents mainly women, to show their full support to the decision made by Habar Jeclo elders to end the dialogue between Dhulbahante and Habar Jeclo. The elders noted through the media that the Dhulbahante have tied the talks with the conditional release of Jama Kutiyee, a Dhulbahante man who is currently being held in Somaliland prison after he was reportedly convicted of terrorism charges.
Makerere University Muslim students stage a peaceful demonstration and demand that police renounces allegations labelled against Muslim theological and Koran schools (Madrasas) as terror cells.

A peaceful demonstration was staged in Dhusamareeb attended by the public to voice their support for the Central State building conference to be held in Dhusamareeb in the afternoon of 01/04. No insecurity incident was reported. Reports indicate that Somalia president has postponed his planned visit to Dhusamareeb.
Garissa residents protest a recent al Shabaab attack on a school in their town. Date unknown - source dated 04/04.
Hundreds of Kenyan residents have rallied at a state sponsored protest in the capital Nairobi to condemn recent Al-Shabaab attack on Gaarisa University premises.
Hundreds of Somalis took to the streets in the Nairobis Somali-dominated Eastleigh neighbourhood on Sunday [5 April] to protest against the recent deadly attack on Garissa university.

A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Ceel-Afweyn court on 06/04 to express their anger against the regular postponement of cases against local youths. The demonstrators were mostly parents of the detained youths from Habar-Jeclo/Biciide sub-clan and Habar-Yunis/Sacad Yonis sub-clan following clashes between rival youth gangs.

Jubaland Darawish forces staged a peacefully demonstration in protest over salary non-increment in Kismaayo in the morning of 07/04. The Darawish forces have been demanding increment since the beginning of this year. The soldiers refused to collect their March salary.
Students protest the Garissa attack in Nairobi, calling on the government to do more for security.
Factory workers protest a dispute with management.
Traders in Limuru protest increased fees. Date(s) not known - the protest was described as 'ongoing.'
Traders in Kisii protest a tax increase.
Students at Bukalasa Agricultural College protest against the colleges policy of charging late-registration fees. Police fire live ammo in the air to disperse the rioters.

A group of women strip naked before two government ministers and hundreds of people in Apaa village in Pabbo Sub County in Amuru and protest against a planned demarcation of a disputed boundary between Amuru and Adjumani district

Transport on the Nairobi-Mai Mahiu road in Lari constituency, Kiambu county was disrupted by a four hour demonstration (it is not clear if the demonstrators blocked the roadway) by transporters of building materials. They were protesting the new Sh400 per trip levy.
Traders protest county taxes in Thika.
Hospital workers protest unpaid dues.

Local media reported that a peaceful demonstration organized by Garbahaarey district administration in protest against the selection and distribution of local MPs in Kismaayo took place in Garbahaarey on 22/04. The demonstrators were shouting slogans against Jubaland Interim state. No insecurity incident was reported.
10,000 members of the National Hospital Insurance Fund in Nyandarua county protest against a rate increase in Ndunyu Nderu.
Naked protesters in Apaa demonstrate in front of Internal Affairs minister Aronda Nyakirima and Lands minister Daudi Migereko. Ownership of Apaa is currently contested by both Amuru and Adjumani
Protest by cleaners who stopped working two weeks ago.

Residents of Sinai neighbourhood (Hargeisa) held a peaceful demonstration on 24/04 in protest against arrest of one of their local religious leader. The arrested religious leader was accused of violence, inciting the public and criticizing the government of hosting so many foreigners in the country.
The more than 100 traders held a demonstration in Gakindu town over a closed slaughterhouse that they claim cannot be reopened due to bureaucratic oversight.
Residents of Byafura held a demonstration to protest electricity outages in the town.
Workers protest poor working conditions and pay in Jomvu.
Hundreds of traders from Nairobis Woodley-Jamhuri market protested alleged grabbing of their market by a private developer.
To denounce abuses, and demand better work conditions, workers of Busoga area protested.
Residents protest against Baringo county insecurity in Marigat.

A group of people held a demonstration in Masalaha area in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 04/05. The demonstrators were claiming the ownership of a piece of land given to a group of businessmen by the government. Local traditional elders also held a press conference and said they will not allow the government to give their land to the business people. Police arrived at the scene and shot in the air to disperse the protesters. No arrests were made.
Teachers protest suspicious deductions and delayed payment of salaries.
Tenants continue protests for a second day following a forced eviction and resident shooting. No violence reported.
Somali journalists, (among others) protest AMISOMs use of sniffer dogs. Location not known; likely in Mogadishu.
Nurses at Meru teaching hospital protest over non-payment of salaries.

Supporters of Somaliland opposition parties staged a demonstration against the decision of the Upper House to extend the term of the current government for another one year and ten months. Police arrived at the scene, shot towards the protestors and arrested several Wadani opposition party supporters. Seven protesters were injured in the demonstrations.
Women in Makueni county held a peaceful demonstration to oppose a bill on the implementation of the two-thirds gender rule. The protest took place in Wote town.
Peaceful demonstration of NRM Poor Youth in front of the home of ex-Ugan Prime Minister Amama Mbabazi to call him standing for the next presidency.
Opposition supporters protest in Gulu town to denounce campaign posters of NRM ruling party.
Residents protest the removal of a roadblock by police believing the action to be 'suspect.'
Kabale Health Workers protest against unexplained salary reductions.

A group of youths staged a peaceful demonstration Barhada Square neighbourhood in Garowe on 15/05 in protest against arrest of one of their local Quran teachers. The arrested religious teacher was accused of violence, inciting the public and criticizing the government of hosting so many foreigners in the country.

Supporters of Khatumo state staged a demonstration in protest against a planned Somaliland national day (18 May) celebration in the town on 16/05. The demonstration came after logistics for the preparation of the Somaliland day were delivered in the town by pro-Somaliland Dhulbahante officials. Khatumo officials who addressed the demonstrators said that they will accept Somaliland national day to be commemorated in Buuhoodle.
Eyl residents protest against increasing illegal fishing activities in the region on 16/05.

Hundreds of pro-Khatumo staged a protest in Saalax Dheer (60km SW of Laas Caanood) on 18/05 in protest against Somaliland presence in SSC area. The protestors marked the day as cleaning day in Khatumo controlled areas to clean up the haters of Somali unity. No insecurity incident was reported.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.
Disagreement between residents and Chinese Road contractor over destruction of graves led to clashes. Resident District Commissioner mediated the situation.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.

Pro-Somaliland residents in Badhan held a celebration to mark the 18th of May - Somaliland independence day - in the office of the DC on 18/05, while pro-Puntland and Khatumo staged a peaceful demonstration in the street chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The protest ended peacefully.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.

A group of local residents in Garowe staged a peaceful demonstration in Barhada Square in the morning of 18/05. The protest was meant to express the rise of insecurity in the region and was organized by a well-known local politician. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Pro-Somaliland residents of Laas Caanood marked the 18th May to join the rest of Somaliland in a celebration held in the offices of the mayor and the DC on 18/05. However another group of residents, pro-Khatumo have staged a demonstration against Somaliland calling the 18th of May a cleaning day while chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. Police open fire and dispersed the protestors. No casualties were reported.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.
Residents of Muoroto Kamiti village in Kiambu Town constituency protest against the grabbing of 2,400 acres by a private developer.

Hundreds of pro-Khatumo supporters staged a protest against Somaliland government in Widhwidh (49km NE of Buuhoodle) on 19/05. The protestors marked also 18th May as a sanitation day in Khatumo controlled areas. No insecurity incident was reported.

ISWA organized a demonstration in Baidoa against Jubaland selection of MPs. Police was deployed in strategic places and most businesses have closed as local Administration was addressing demonstrators in the foot-ball stadium.
Students demonstrated at Uganda Christian University to denounce difficulties to access campus, high tuition and long lectures. Police was deployed to stop the strike.
Traders protest a killing of two of their colleagues in Bakaara Market on 21/05.
After the arrest of UNATUs Chairperson, hundreds of teachers stormed the police station.

Municipal council workers backed by Somaliland police demolished kiosks built near the main roads of Laas Caanood on 25/05. A group of local traders staged a demonstration in front of the municipal council office after the demolition but were immediately dispersed by the police.

Somaliland authorities in Lawya Caddo destroyed several illegal constructions that were used for smuggling goods in Xamamka area on 28/05. The residents of the area protested and refused to clear the area. The police arrested several people and transferred them to Zeylac central prison.

A demonstration against KDF forces for destroying buildings on Somali Kenyan border organized by Beled Xawo administration took place in Beled Xawo in the morning of 30/05. All businesses in the town were closed during the demonstrations. No casualties or other problems were reported during the operations.

A group of people staged a protest at liberty garden in Ceerigaabo on 31/05 to express their anger against the killing of Yusuf Dirir, a Somali-MP (Habar yonis) who was killed in Mogadishu on 23/05. The protestors were chanting slogans against SNG president and accused the SNG of being behind the killing of the MP. They demanded quick and fair trial of those who were behind the attack.

Residents of Beled Hawo held demonstrations against 'colonial tendencies' of the Kenyan government on 01/06. The protest may also be related to a potential plan of the Kenyan government of construct a wall along portions of the border between Kenya and Somalia in an effort to protest border towns from al Shabaab attacks.
A number of Somali MPs protest a plan by the Kenyan government that would construct a wall along portions of the border between Somalia and Kenya in an effort to stem al Shabaab attacks in Kenya.

The Somaliland authorities in Lughaya have destroyed several illegal constructions that were allegedly used for fuel smuggling and Illegal fishing. The area residents demonstrated against the destructions and refused to clear the area. The police continued the demolition and arrested several people who were transferred to Borama central prison.
Local authorities organized a peaceful demonstration against the approved motion of no confidence by the Somali Federal Government in Mogadishu against the JL parliament. No casualties were reported.

Hundreds of residents of Dadaab took to the streets on 06/08 to protest over the alleged sacking of 13 local employees by the World Food Programme (WFP). Waving placards, demonstrators marched through the town before heading to the main UNHCR headquarters offices gate where they camped for several hours.
Kigezi Tea Workers demonstrated in Kabale from their workplace to the Central Police Station. They protested over pay.

Roads in Kismayo town were closed together with shops and restaurants in preparation of an organized demonstration against the Central Government Parliament decision to declare JL parliament illegal. Rumours indicate that JL authority and their supporters want to declare an independent state of Jubaland. The demonstrators met in the stadium and the demonstration ended peaceful without any reported incident.
Youth employed to repair roads at Jomvu in Mikindani, Mombasa county held a protest march on 08/06 over delayed pay.

A demonstration organized by local population against AMISOM forces based in Garbahaarey town took place in Garbahaarey town in the morning of 09/06. The local residents were protesting against AMISOM forces for not doing anything about the insecurity.

SNGF staged a demonstration outside Jazeera training camp, close vicinity to Jazeera Gate at noon of 09/06 to express their anger over the non-payment of salaries for the last six months. AMISOM troops deployed to bring the situation under control and to disperse the demonstrator. Some gun-shot were heard but so far no casualties are reported.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration and marched through the streets in Buuhoodle on 10/06 to show support to the recent peace agreement reached by Habarjeclo and Dhulbahante elders. The rally was organized by the locals and was attended by senior Khatumo officials led by the DC. Khatumo officials and the protesters both condemned the small groups that are opposing the recent peace agreement.

ASWJ organized a peaceful demonstration in Dhusamareeb on 10/06 against the state building conference in Cadaado and the expected outcome. They rejected an appeal by the UN SRSG and Minister of Interior and Federalism to return to their bases and pledged not to recognize any outcome from Cadaado.
Residents of Baraka Estate (Nairobi - Embakasi South) protest over poor roads in their area.
Marsabit non-local residents protest over insecurity following a recent spate of killings in which they were targeted.
Women protested over a land dispute over the Soroti Universitys land. Police fired bullets in the air to disperse mob.

Borama residents staged a peaceful demonstration in front of local government offices on 15/06 in protest against garbage collection company that was contracted in the collection of waste in the town. The protestors were complaining about litters lying on the roads and all over the town. Police arrive at the scene and dispersed the protestors.
Protesters demonstrated in Nsasi to denounce poor state of road.
Residents in Bombo and Nyimbwa sub counties protested to denounce pollution from a nearby factory.
Residents in Bombo and Nyimbwa sub counties protested to denounce pollution from a nearby factory.

Police in Siaya were forced to shoot in the air several times when a group of 'rowdy' youths disrupted a meeting chaired by Governor Cornel Rasanga in Yala. Chanting anti-Rasanga slogans, the group claimed the governor had no place in Yala, which is in Gem constituency. No causalities reported.
Protesters demonstrated to denounce Kivoora stone quarry closure.

The Somaliland authorities in Lowyacado have destroyed several illegal constructions that were used for goods smuggling. The area residents demonstrated against the destructions and refused to clear the area. The police continued the demolition and arrested several people who were transferred to Zeylac central prison. The police arrested an officer working for Zaylac local government accusing him of involvement on organizing demonstrations against the demolition. This was the third one since last month.
Hospital staff protest staff leadership in the suburban Nairobi area of Moi (Nairobi - Starehe) on 19/06.

About a hundred pro-Puntland people staged a peaceful demonstration in Dhahar village (170km S of Laas-Qoray) on 20/06. The demonstration was aimed at expressing support to the recent reshuffle of Puntland cabinets. The protestors marched in the streets chanting slangs in which they are supporting the Puntland administration and welcoming the newly appointed ministers from Warsangeli.

The Somaliland authorities in Lughaya have destroyed several illegal constructions that were used for fuel smuggling and Illegal fishing. The area residents demonstrated against the destructions and refused to clear the area. The police continued the destruction activity and arrested several people and transferred to Borama central prison.
Residents from Obunga slums in Kisumu on 22/06 held demonstrations in support of a politician they believed is being unfairly criticised.
CUF members of the house of representatives protested alleged cheating in voter registration in Unguja, Zanzibar.

Youths attached to the National Youth Service slum-upgrading project in Kisumu on 23/06 staged a demo in Nairobi centre (Nairobi - Starehe) to protest against calls by Cord leaders that the project be investigated on financial corruption grounds.
Staff of a garment company in Athi River protest after the suspension of their chief shop steward.
Parents of Muslim students in Kwale protest after it is alleged their children were forced to attend church services while attending school.

Thousands of Eritrean refugees in Ethiopia yesterday held demonstrations in Addis Ababa, Afar and Tigray refugee camps demanding the international community to take urgent action to stop human rights abuses and oppression by the Asmara regime.

Thousands of Eritrean refugees in Ethiopia yesterday held demonstrations in Addis Ababa, Afar and Tigray refugee camps demanding the international community to take urgent action to stop human rights abuses and oppression by the Asmara regime.
Ethiopian Muslims held peaceful protests on Friday 26 June to demand the release of their leaders who were arrested in August 2012

Thousands of Eritrean refugees in Ethiopia yesterday held demonstrations in Addis Ababa, Afar and Tigray refugee camps demanding the international community to take urgent action to stop human rights abuses and oppression by the Asmara regime.
Due to decision to forbid visits from opposite sex friends at the Bishop Barham College, students protested.

Hundreds of people, most of them IDPs, staged demonstration against government officials over corrupting the humanitarian aid in the afternoon of 26/06. The demonstrators accused some government officials for diverting the humanitarian aid. The police responded the scene and dispersed the protestors. No incident was reported during the demonstration.

Youths from Chuka Igambangombe Constituency demonstrated in Chuka Town during recruitment by the National Youth Service, criticizing the criteria used to fill the 1,440 vacancies. The protest lasted the majority of the afternoon.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration against Somali Federal Government and the UN Special Envoy to Somalia, Nicholas Kay, in Garowe in the morning of 28/06. The demonstrators expressed their anger against the upcoming Galmudug state that claims the ownership of entire Mudug region. They strongly criticized the Federal Government over its federalism policy while waving banners that read slogans such as 'Puntland will never accept violation of the constitution'. Similar demonstrations also took place in Bosasso.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration against Somali Federal Government and the UN Special Envoy to Somalia, Nicholas Kay, in Garowe in the morning of 28/06. The demonstrators expressed their anger against the upcoming Galmudug state that claims the ownership of entire Mudug region. They strongly criticized the Federal Government over its federalism policy while waving banners that read slogans such as 'Puntland will never accept violation of the constitution'. Similar demonstrations also took place in Bosasso.
Seven pro-Mbabazi youth arrested, including NRM Poor youth national coordinator, during a protest. Police forces said the demonstration was non authorized.

Borama residents staged a peaceful demonstration in front of local government offices on 29/06 in protest against local garbage collection company of not cleaning the town. The protestors were complaining about waste lying on the road and other parts of the town and they blamed both the local government and the contracted company. Reports indicate that the local people are pushing for the new mayor to address the issue.

Hundreds of residents of Burtinle stage a peaceful a similar demonstration as that of Galkacyo in the morning of 29/06. The protestors also criticized the Somali Federal government and the UN envoy to Somalia, Nicholas Kay for their support of the upcoming Galmudug state.

Hundreds of residents of Galkacyo led by local Puntland authorities in Mudug staged a peaceful demonstration on 29/06 against the Somali Federal government and the UN envoy to Somalia, Mr. Nicholas Kay, in Galkacyo (North) in the morning of 29/06. The residents were protesting against the upcoming Galmudug State which according to its interim constitution states that the central states border will stretch up to Nugaal region. The demonstrators who criticized the president, the Speaker and the UN envoy to Somalia, terming them as clannish, spoiler and imperialist respectively, while waving placards announcing that Puntland will never accept destruction, new era of civil war and clan hatred. The governor of north Mudug region told the media that they will force President Hassan Sheik Mohamud to seek entry visa for Mudug Region.

Residents of Isiolo town in Eastern Province held a demo on 30/06 over the disappearance and abduction of several men. Hundreds of women held a peaceful rally demanding answers from the government. Many of the protesters accused the Kenya Wildlife Services for the disappearance of the men.

Hundreds of residents in Bossaso have taken into the main streets of the town on 30/06, protesting against the president of the Federal Republic of Somalia, Hassan Sheikh Mohamud, Parliament speaker Jawaari and the UN Special envoy to Somalia, Mr. Nickolas Kay. The protestors called the Puntland government to cut all relations with the central government. Bari regional officials who were taking part in the rally addressed the protesting mass.

Similar demonstrations were held both in Iskushuban and Ufeyn towns (67km NW of Iskushuban) on 30/06 to protest against president of Somalia, the Speaker of the parliament and the UN envoy to Somalia over their support to the central state formation. The protestors were demanding Puntland government to cut all the relation with the central government and they addressed by district officials.

Similar demonstrations were held both in Iskushuban and Ufeyn towns (67km NW of Iskushuban) on 30/06 to protest against president of Somalia, the Speaker of the parliament and the UN envoy to Somalia over their support to the central state formation. The protestors were demanding Puntland government to cut all the relation with the central government and they addressed by district officials.
A Besigye supporter is shot by a member of Police Forces during a protest by the opposition in Najjanankumbi. The protester survived the shooting.
Hundreds of boda boda operators hold a demonstration outside City Hall in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) accusing city askaris of harassment.
Nude Nakasongola residents protest about land demarcation issues.

Hundreds of residents in Bacaadweyn staged a demonstration against the president of SNG, Speaker of Parliament and the UN envoy to Somalia in the morning of 04/07. Local officials and elders who addressed the rally called on Puntland government to cut all relations with the SNG.
Kinyara cane cutters protested due to payment issues.
A group protests against homosexuality in Nairobi.

Resident community including women, children, young people, and elderly carried out a peaceful demonstration voicing concerns about insecurity and instability in the town after violent incidents against civilian occurred previously in the town. Demonstrators used slogans of security, stability demands from the local authorities. Gedo region governor Maxamed Cabdi Kaliil and Iiman CadbowKaarshe Garbaharey district commissioner addressed the demonstrators on their demand for security, peace and stability.
Protests in Mbale prior to the visit of Mbabazi - 2016 presidential hopeful.

Protesters gathered in front of the police station where Besigye is detained an asked for his released. Police forces had to disperse them using tears gas. Several protesters were arrested including FDCs Iron Lady Ingrid Turinawe.
Several groups of protesters gathered In Mbale after Mbabazis arrest earlier in the day. Police forces had to disperse them, and several protesters were arrested.
Hundreds protest after Ethiopian Arline suspended its flights.
Residents protest the killing of a traveller by a SNG soldier the previous day.
Residents protest against forced evictions in Hodan evictions.
Re-election of a former Imam, who had previously fired for being unqualified for the position, caused protests during Eid day in Soroti.
Butchers in Addis Ababa closed their shops on the eve of the end of a one month fasting season for orthodox Christians, in protest over tax confusion.
Protests erupted in Kabale Referral Hospital due to lack of security and violence against health agents. Police has been deployed to strengthen the security.

Hundreds of worshipers from Al Huda mosque staged demonstration in Sheikh Bashir neighbourhood (Burco) on 20/07 in protest against a bill-board installed by Somaliland Ministry of Labour and Family Affairs in partnership with a UN agency campaigning for gender balance in the town.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Hobyo on 22/07 to express their support to the newly elected Galmudug president, Abdikarim Hussein Gulled. Local officials, elders and the residents requested the president to support the construction of Hobyo seaport.
Residents of Athi River protest the police release of a man accused of rape.
Poor Youth NRM protested in front of the US Embassy in Kampala to denounce alleged arrests of some of their members. Police officers stopped the protest.
Residents of Gulu demonstrated against the local MP.
Police officers arrest four demonstrators at an illegal protest.
An anti-Puntland rally was held in Buuhoodle on 29/07 in protest against the presence of Puntland revenue authority and their forces who are recently involving tax collection in the region.

Strike:At least 6 universities (Mbarara, Kyambogo, Busitema, Gulu, Muni (Arua) and Makerere) were shut down on Monday while non-teaching staff engaged in a strike due to budget issues. Police forces were deployed.

Anti-corruption protests were held when Minister Byandala was welcomed in Luweero.
Demonstration staged against a charge of AMISOM human rights abuses by the local government.
Protests against the merger of two sub-counties in Namutumba District. Police fired tear gas and bullets to disperse crowds.
Shiite Muslims protest outside Jinja Central police Station, demanding the release of members arrested during riots at the courthouse earlier in the day.
Police fired tear gas to disperse crowd of supporters for CHADMEA presidential candidate Lowassa.

Tensions rose between the resident community and the newly announced administration of Jubaland in Garbarhaarey on 15/06. ENDF troops dispersed demonstrators gathering in a public place in Garbahaaarey and no casualties were reported.
Pro-Somaliland demonstrators protest the President of Khatumo during a visit by the latter.
Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Dhoobley (118 KM SW of Afmadow) on 16/08. No incident was reported.

Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Hoosingo (98 KM NW of Badhaadhe) and Kulbio (33 KM SW of Badhaadhe) on 16/08. No incident was reported.

Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Hoosingo (98 KM NW of Badhaadhe) and Kulbio (33 KM SW of Badhaadhe) on 16/08. No incident was reported.
Female APs took to the streets of Kakamega town on 17/08, in a protest against elections from which their representative was allegedly barred.
Protesters outside of the regional passport office demand the return of 9 people from Uttarakhand, India, that have suppoesdly been trafficked in Kampala.
A demonstration was organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election on 17/08.

A group of residents of Ceel-Afwayn mostly, youth and women staged a peaceful demonstration on 17/08 in protest against scarcity of water in the town. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the protestors. No arrest was made.
Teachers in Garissa protested over deteriorating education standards in Northeastern.
Mandera residents held a demonstration to press the government into deploying teachers to the region.
Youths from NRM demonstrate against former PM Mbabazi.
Farmers in North Rift on 24/08 held a peaceful demonstration on the Iten-Eldoret road, Eldoret to protest over the planned introduction of genetically modified crops.
Property owners affected by expansion of Mbarara-Kikagati-Murongo bridge protest delayed compensation by road authorities.
Protests against the destruction of crops.
Makerere students protest new policies on sexual morality, alcohol and gambling.
Democratic Party members protested outcome of grass root elections in Masaka.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Kitgum streets on the International Day of the Disappeared, to remember people abducted by the LRA.
Protest to denounce funding cuts for health facilities.
Association of meat suppliers (meat sellers) in Hargeisa staged a demonstration in Gacan Libaah district (Hargeisa) on 02/09 over a new tax.
Motorists protested to denounce poor tarmacked road, despites recent repair.

Acholi MPs and LCV Chairperson camped at a police station in Pabo sub-county over MP Olanyas detention. Olanya was detained on allegations of inciting violence in the Apaa contested land between Amuru and Adjumani districts. He was released on bail on 10 September

Al Shabaab fighters burned down 10 houses in Buulo Xaawo (59 KM SW of Baidoa) after residents strongly condemned and protested against the previous days beheading of a well-known religious leader. No injuries reported.
Striking teachers protest over pay in Nairobi. The teachers had been striking for two weeks.
Rubber planters protest against unpaid wages at North Pemba police station.
Hundreds of Voters stormed Kabale NRM Party Offices Over Irregularities in the parties primary elections (inflated vote registers vs. Spending questions)
Teachers in Eldoret protest over pay, cause schools to close.
Protests erupted after the nullification of NRM primary election polls in Morto; police deployed at the Moroto movement offices .
Striking teachers renew a protest over pay at Uhuru Park (Nairobi - Westlands).

Small scale traders staged a demo in front of the local municipal council in protest against the demolition of their premises on 10/09. The demonstrators demanded that the municipal council to allocate them an area where they could re-establish their businesses.
Striking Bondo subcounty teachers protest at the TSC office(Nairobi - Kamukunji) after a threat to dismiss several of their colleagues.
Teachers protest for pay increase in Muranga.
Residents of Bula Rahma village in the outskirts of Garissa town protest a water shortage in their area.

Puntland Darawish soldiers staged a demonstration in protest over unpaid salaries and took the control of 54 military camp in the morning of 13/09. Gun shots from unknown origin were heard in Garowe city which made the local panic among the residents.
National Youth Service employees protest the termination of colleagues in Nairobi.

On 15 September 2015, Somaliland authorities in Lughaye destroyed several illegal buildings that were used by fuel smugglers and illegal fishermen on 15/09. Local residents demonstrated against the destructions. Police arrested some of the demonstrators.

NRM members expressed their discontent with the Jinja district NRM administrative secretary and police who they accused of engaging in malpractices. Protesting youths rolled in the mud, drunk muddy water or tore NRM party membership cards.
A group protests against genetic food mortification in Nairobi.
A group protests in Tetu against the actions of an ODM politician who had derided one they support.
Tabliq faithful gathered in hundreds in protest against Constitutional Court Judge Eldad Mwangusya declination to release nine jailed Muslim leaders including the leader of Tabliqs sect Yunus Kamoga
Health workers strike and protest in Kisumu over non-payment of salaries.
Police teargased Idah Nantaba, the minister of state for Lands and her supporters after they complained of rigging during the NRM elections

A group of people staged a demonstration in front of Somaliland immigration offices in Lowyacado after the border with Djibouti was closed on 25-26/09. The demonstrators comprised of local residents and passengers stuck at the border town. The reason behind the closure of the border is unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate it was a security measure during the celebration of Idd al-adha festival.

A group of people staged a demonstration in front of Somaliland immigration offices in Lowyacado after the border with Djibouti was closed on 25-26/09. The demonstrators comprised of local residents and passengers stuck at the border town. The reason behind the closure of the border is unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate it was a security measure during the celebration of Idd al-adha festival.
Residents of Ceel Cadde (52km SW of Gabahaarey) staged a demonstration against KDF forces after two local men were arrested by KDF on suspicion of aiding al Shaba.

More than 100 people staged a demonstration against Puntland government in Hadaaftimo Village (82km E of Ceerigaabo) on 03/10. The demonstrators were protesting against the incident in which Puntland coast guards killed a man from Warsangeli and injured another in Laas Qoray on 28/09. The Puntland forces seized three Iranian boats reportedly over illegal fishing.
Protest of Puntland forces over unpaid salaries in Garowe on 04/10.

More than a hundred people, mostly drivers of three-wheelers staged a rally against the local government police forces in the western part of Burco on 05/10 following a directive issued by the local municipal council regarding three-wheelers plying routes. The drivers fought with the police forces and blocked the roads with their three-wheelers. Additional police arrived at the scene and arrested a number of protestors.

At least 60 of the 93 families that are awaiting resettlement from land earmarked for an oil refinery staged a peaceful demonstration in Hoima town, protesting governments failure to relocate them three years after acquiring their land.

A group of fishermen gathered in front of Somaliland coast guards office in Zeylac on 07/10 to protest after rumours were circulated saying that a foreign fishing boat which was seized by Somaliland coast guards on 04/10 was released. Police commander and other government officials addressed the protestors and denied the rumours, saying that they are still waiting for answers from Hargeisa and investigation are still ongoing.

A group of people, mostly youths, staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 09/10. The demonstrators were complaining about a civil-society organization which runs Ceerigaabo hospital and the authorities of the hospital over the expulsion of two local laboratory technicians.
Residents of Kiangombe village in Thika held demonstrations to protest against land grabbing by a private developer.
Chadema and CCM supporters gathered demanding to put up party posters and flags. Police fired shots to disperse the crowds.
Residents of Kabete, Nairobi area hold a protest demonstration over poor roads. Police dispersed the group.

Angry voters throwing pelting NRM party cards after disagreeing with NRM party officials. NRM Officials Rush to at Endinzi sub county headquarters in Isingiro district Bukanga County to Calm Down Angry Voters

Local workers at Mogadishu seaport staged a peaceful demonstration in Daljirka Dahsoon (Boondheere District) in the morning of 14/10. The demonstrators were protesting against decision of Albeyrak company of reducing the casual workers at the port. The Albeyrak is a Turkish company currently running the port. Latest reports indicate that the protest was called off after successful negotiations with the workers.
Protesting vote rigging and other electoral malpractices, angry NRM supporters in Masaka District urinated on party T-shirts and burnt membership cards.

Demonstrations against the new regional administration appointed by the president of Jubaland for Gedo Region was held in Garbahaarey in the morning of 17/10. The demonstrators said they will not work with the new regional administration officials. The demonstration was reportedly organized by the former governor of Gedo Region.
Ntungamo Residents Protest Destruction of Their Property
Police have had to fire tear gas and live bullets while enforcing an attached property order in Gulu town.
Hoima campaign violence suspects were released after Dr. Lawrence Bategekas supporters stormed the police demanding their release.

Many fishermen demonstrated against the governments inaction against foreign boats fishing in the area. Many people gathered in front of Cost guards office and the police station, the mayor and the police commander talked to the gathering and denied that there were foreign vessels fishing in the area. They added they would seize any fishing vessel found working in the area without a permission from the government.

Residents of Xarrirad held a peaceful demonstration in front of the local authoritys office to protest against the perceived lack of response to water scarcity in the town and the absence of local government officials from the town. The demonstrators demanded the election of a new local council. The police did not intervene.
Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds during voting in Zanzibar.

CUF activists gather in Stone Town after CUF frontrunner Seif Sharif Hamad declared himself the winner of presidential elections. Police used water cannons and tear gas to disperse crowds. Reports of 5 injured from bullets.
CUF activists gather on Pemba Island after CUF frontrunner Seif Sharif Hamad declared himself the winner of presidential elections. Police used water cannons and tear gas to disperse crowds.
Chadema supporters march in Arusha Region, shouting victory for Edward Lowassa.
Protesters in SandaliA and SandaliB wards of Dar es Salaam await election results. Anti-riot police standing by.

A group of tuk-tuk drivers (tri-cycle) staged a peaceful demonstration at Sayidka Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 26/10 in protest against banning of tuk-tuks to use Makah Al-Mukarama road especially areas close to main entrance of Villa Somalia. The ministry of Interior stated that the ban is related to security matters and not suspending tuk-tuk operations. A police officer at the scene shot and killed one of the protestors. Other SNG police at the scene arrested the perpetrators.
Traders in Gatundu Market protested on 26/10, accusing the county government of failing to provide security.
Security forces gathered to contain protesters outside of main voting polls in Stone Town, shots and tear gas fired.
Police fire tear gas and water cannons to disperse Chadema protesters calling for election results in Iringa.
Jamhuri residents protest the allocation of public land for private development.

Local resident staged a demonstration against the DC of Buur-Hakaba on 29/10. Traditional elders and key community members opposes Ali Hassan Olympica the current DC, who was nominated by ISWA as a district commissioner for Buur-Hakaba District. The locals complained that the nomination was not free and fair election process and requested from SNG/ISWA state to intervene the matter immediately. The protestors demanded free and transparent election of the position of the DC and should be fully approved by the entire community.

A group of lorry and public transport drivers together with passengers protested in front of Lawya Caddo custom office on 29/10 following after the drivers were accused by the custom office of using irregular paper work. Police arrive at the scene and arrested several drivers and passengers.

Angry Democratic Party Members from Mukono South Constituency led by their Chairperson have stormed the party HQ at City House in Kampala, accusing the party Executive Committee for halting party primaries in favor of one candidate.

Hundreds of civilians held huge demonstration near the Mogadishu Football Stadium on 30 October, protesting against the AU Mission in Somalia [AMISOM] forces, which allegedly killed a young boy last month [September] who was playing football.
Christians at Kitanga Catholic parish in Kabale district staged a peaceful demonstration against police brutality and failure by government to offer quality services to citizens

Over 200 people demonstrated peacefully in front of the Governors house and along the main road in Belet Weyn in protest against the setup of the technical committee for the upcoming Hiraan and Middle Shabelle state. No casualties were reported.
Residents protest al Shabaab following a deadly attack on an area hotel.
ENDF occupied the regional administration offices in Garbahaarey on 08/11 following prolonged dispute between the current administration and the former.
Youths protest leadership corruption at the offices of the EACC on 10/11.

Presidential candidate, Joseph Elton Mabirizi was allegedly kidnapped by six armed men who dumped him in Namasoga bush in Iganga the following day. Police was forced to shoot in the air to disperse a group of people who wanted to block them from taking Mabirizi

A group of Ministry of Livestock employees demonstrated in front of the ministry headquarters against the director general of the ministry in Hargeisa on 15/11 due to lack of payment of two months salaries.

A group of students and teachers demonstrated in front of the office of the regional director of education in Xariirad (133km SW of Zeylac) on 15/11 over the poor infrastructure of the town. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed them.

Police fired teargas, rubber and live bullets to disperse Lukwagos supporters who were opposed to a move by police to block him from walking to the Electoral Commission headquarters in Kampala to return his Mayoral nominations papers
Peaceful demonstration by women activists in Fort Portal town against a lower court verdict in a domestic violence case

Hundreds of students from two public high schools staged a protest in front of the ministry of education headquarters in Hargeisa on 16/10 over mismanagement of scholarship scheme by the ministry officials. The students voiced their concerns over corruption allegations by some of the ministry officials. The protest later ceased after senior ministry officials informed students that their complaints will be considered.

High school and university students protested following the governments renewed plans to implement a master plan for the expansion of Addis Abeba and the move by local officials transferring part of the school land for another use. The protestors are however met by excessively armed police men.

High school and university students protested following the governments renewed plans to implement a master plan for the expansion of Addis Abeba and the move by local officials transferring part of the school land for another use. The protestors are however met by excessively armed police men.
Dozens of musicians stormed the ruling NRM party headquarters demanding for payment for the songs that they composed for President Museveni ahead of his campaign for a fifth term in office.

NRM supporters and Amama Mbabazis supporters face off in Mbarara town. Mbabazis supporters accuse Museveni supporters of tearing down his postsers. There are reports of scuffles but no serious violence or clashes. One person has been arrested and detained at Mbarara police in connection with the act.

A group of families of Burco police staged a peaceful demonstration in Burco on 23/11 over reports of new plans by the local municipal authorities to sell the residential houses of police. The protestors accused the mayor and his associates of trying to sell state-owned properties. They also said that seven police officers were arrested by the mayor and his team after expressing concerns over the new plans.
Residents of Nayeni, Kilifi county, held a peaceful demo in Malindi town, protesting against the grabbing of 230 acres by the government and private developers.

Haji Adan secondary schools students staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the ministry of education office in Ceerigaabo on 24/11 over the replacement of their principal. The protestors marched along the streets that pass the government offices chanting slogans against the ministry. The regional officers on education denied the allegations, saying that there are some people in the city who want to disturb the peace and are behind this protest.
People protested against the government agenda in Ginchi as part of the second round of Oromo protests.

Hundreds of students gathered to protest against the violent police repression in Weliso following a protests in nieghbouring areas in Oromia. Police began shooting. Standoff between student protesters and police in Weliso continued between 25 and 30 November.

Protest started at Adama university in the last week of November in response to the increasing numbers of federal and regional police forces on the compound. More than 600 students gathered at the canteen for lunch and received their lunches but left their plates untouched. Police responded with gunfire, injuring students and persistent protests ensued. No reports of demonstrator violence.
Standoff between student protesters and police in Weliso continued between 25 and 30 November. No reports of demonstrator violence.

Students protested against the government master plan and for the release of imprisoned students in Shashamane end December. Three people were killed and two others injured after an explosion went off in a vehicle within Mandera town on 28/12. Al Shabaab suspected. Residents of Buuhoodle town staged anti-Somaliland rally on 16/01. The rally was aimed to express the locals support to Khatumo forces following the takeover of Balli Cad Village by Somaliland forces. The protestors matched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration led by its president. Key speakers at the rally called for attacks against Somaliland forces.
