More than a hundred people staged an anti-Somaliland demonstration in Ceel-Buh Village (116km E of Ceerigaabo) on 18/01. The demonstrators were chanting anti-Somaliland slogans over unfulfilled developmental pledges made by Somaliland government to Warsangeli-inhabited areas. Unconfirmed reports indicate that anti-Somaliland politicians lobbying for the formation of regional state for Dhulbahante and Warsangeli sub-clans in Sanaag Region were behind the rally.
Protests have taken place in North Shawa, Dagam district, yhaya Haro village, where farmers have been protesting since the 19th January
Protests continued in Mieso. The regime deployed Somalia regions Liyu Police, killing 2 people.
A protest took place in Waheel town near Dirre Dawa today on January 19, 2016
People protested against the government agenda in Gefersa as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
People protested against the government agenda in Kiremu as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
Oromia protests have continued in the town of Miesso.
Protests took place in Kokasa, Oromia.
Protests have taken place in North Shawa, Dagam district, yhaya Haro village, where farmers have been protesting since the 19th January
Protests in Finfinne were held around the African Union buildings.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in East Hararge.
Protests reportedly took place in Asabot (West Hararge) as Timket celebrations in Asabot turned into opportunity for protest.
More than 200 unemployed youths stormed the offices of the firm, Sinohydro, the Chinese company building the 600MW Karuma power dam, expressing their plight of being unemployed.
People protested against the government agenda in Cahaki as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
People protested against the government agenda in Gefersa as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
A Timket protest took place in Ambo in Oromia.
Protesters are celebrating Timket with protests in Dadar East Hararge.
Protest took place in Nekemt during Timket festivities.
A protest took place at the Birbirsa elemtary school students in Shashemene.
Protest took place in Bedesa during Timket festivities.
Protests have taken place in North Shawa, Dagam district, yhaya Haro village, where farmers have been protesting for the last three days.
A protest occurred during Timket celebrations in Tulu Milki, Salale (North Shawa).
Protests in Finfinne were held around the African Union buildings.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a student protester in Goban, Jimma Rare District, Horo Guduru.
11 students have been injured when soldiers attacked Walaga University students in Naqamte
Protests continue in Asabot (West Hararge). People marched through the town. Federal police and soldiers have fired on them, killing two and wounding several.
Protests have continued in Geba Dafeno, Jarso, West Wellega.
People protested against the government agenda in Anano Mixe as part of the third round of Oromo protests.

Residents of Buuhoodle town staged anti-Somaliland rally on 16/01. The rally was aimed to express the locals support for Khatumo forces following the takeover of Balli Cad Village by Somaliland forces. The protestors matched in the streets of Buuhoodle chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burned the Somaliland flag. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration led by its President.

More than a hundred Rahanweyn traders staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo on 23/01. This follows after governor of Sanaag Region gave Rahanwayn traders a seven-day ultimatum to leave Ceerigaabo. The demonstrators requested Somaliland president to intervene and give them enough time to prepare for their exit. Police dispersed the demonstrators. Reports six traders were arrested during the protest.
People protested against the government agenda in Arjo Gudetu in Diga as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
People protested against the government agenda in Girawa as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
Students at Walaga university in Nekemt protested against the Governments master plan. They were met by violent repression from soldiers on the campus.
Oromo people protested in Bordode town. Heavy military response was reported.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed an Oromo student protester at Mizan Tepi University in the Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples Region.

A group of Ethiopian Oromo ethnic staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Somaliland ministry of Interior in Hargeisa on 24/01 in protest against new instructions issued by Somaliland government to deport Ethiopian national, mainly Oromos. The protestors requested from the government to reconsider the instructions and review the issue case by case while also asking for more time if the government fail to honour their request. Some protestors stated that they stayed in Somaliland over 40 years and owned assets. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators.
Oromo people protested in Gurawa town, East Hararge
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Shenen.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Doba.
People protested in East Walaga, Digga district, Arjo Gudetu village. Ethiopian soldiers fired on protesters, wounding at least three. One of them later died of his wounds.

A group of people from southern Somalia staged a demonstration in front of the immigration office in Borama on 25/01. The group were protesting against the decision by the Somaliland government to expel all non-citizens. The protestors appealed to the government to reconsider its deportation decree. Police dispersed them and arrested five of them after they refused to leave the area.
Students protested at Biftu Secondary school in Nekemt
Students at Charchar Prep School in Chiro (West Hararge) boycotted class and instead marched to hospital to visit their wounded classmates
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Arjo Gudetu village, Digga District, East Welega
Protests and repression by soldiers continue in Nekemt
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Arjo Gudatu, East Welega.

Local residents of Maydh (50km N of Ceerigaabo) held a peaceful demonstration on 27/01 in protest against the director of health in the region from Warsangeli. The protestors accused the director of diverting all health facilities to eastern Sanaag where his clan dominates and they called government to intervene the matter.
People protested in Guji zone, Goro Dola district, Harqallo town, calling for the release of political prisoners, and against Al Amudins Gold mining in Shakiso, Sakaro and Okkote.
People protested in Goro Muxi town, Metta district.
People protested in Guliso.
People protested in Shararo town (North Shawa). 40 people were arrested and taken away by soldiers following the protests

Students at Walaga university in Nekemt protested against the Governments master plan. They were met by violent repression from soldiers on the campus. Several students were injured and rest are chased out of campus into the adjacent forest.
Garowe residents staged a peaceful demonstration against 4.5 formula in Barhada square in the morning of 28/01.
An anti-al Shabaab protest is held in Abdul-Aziz 28/01. The protest was a direct response to an attack on a Liido beach restaurant.
People protested against the government agenda in Guliso as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
Students protested against the government agenda at Welega university in Nekemte as part of the third round of Oromo protests.

A peaceful demonstration supporting the 4.5 formula for allocation of parliamentary seats took place in Baidoa town in the morning of 29/01. The demonstration was organized by the local administration.
A large number of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the mayor offices in Eyl on 29/04 in support of Puntland Presidents decision to oppose 4.5 formula. The mayor addressed the rally.
People protested in Gidami.
Police fired tear gas in Igorora, Ibanda district, to disperse a crowd that had gathered after the official campaign deadline of 6pm and asked FDC presidential candidate Besigye to 'greet' them
On 31 January 2016, more than 400 residents of Mpeketoni in Lamu County (Lamu West) protested over increased insecurity and frequent attacks by Al-Shabaab militants.

Garowe central jail forces demonstrated over unpaid salaried and denied access to officials who tried to enter the jail on 31/01. The protesting forces stated that the protest will continue until the dispute is resolved. The central jail was built by UNODC for pirates during presidency of Abdirahman Farole.

Local taxi drivers staged a large demonstration in front of the local municipality and on the main Garowe tarmac road, halting businesses and traffic movements in Garowe in the morning of 31/01. The protest was a response to governments decision to ban local taxis from carrying khat sellers. The ban followed suspicions that alcohol is being smuggled together with khat. Unspecified number of protestors were arrested.

A group of women and children from Daray Macaane staged a peaceful demonstration complaining about the piles of garbage which had been dumped in the area. The piles from the town had been dumped thus affecting the Hygienic situation of the area and caused many diseases to the area inhabitants. The police came to the scene and dispersed the gathering, there is no arrests or casualties reported.

A number of Renting Vehicle owners demonstrated in front of the governors office venue complaining about the National Electoral Commission (NEC) renting regulation. Those drivers accusing the NEC of making the regulation difficult for those drivers to work in the NEC Registration Campaign. The NEC has made a condition for the renting vehicles in which new models for Land Cruisers 4X4 and should be in good condition and verified from a certain Garage which became a difficult to majority renting vehicle owners in the town.

Street protests turned violent after security forces tried to break up anti-government match in Bosasso town on 01/02. Puntland soldiers fired into the air with volleys of gunfire being heard across the city. The protesters were taking to streets in support of detained Youth leader identified as Abdiasis Farah Haji Saed. Two deaths reported.
Oromia people protested in rural part of Baddanno (East Hararge)
People protested against the government agenda in Sirti as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
People protested in Sabbaa Boruu district of Guji zone against the national agenda and against the exploitation of minerals by Al Amudin with no benefit to locals.
People in Hoima protested delayed road works in the municipality.
People protested against the government agenda in Midega as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
People protested against the national agenda in Dogo town, Girawa district (East Hararge)
People protested against the national agenda in Jeldu (West Shawa)
People protested against the national agenda in Waliso (South West Shawa).
People protested against the government agenda in Arjo as part of the third round of Oromo protests. Soldiers shot and killed at least one protester.
More than 3,000 Oromia people protested in Bulehora town. Soldiers fired at protesters, killing at least one and wounding three. Protesters burnt down the Revenue Office in retaliation.
Protests against houses being demolished in Dar es Salaam.
Youth under the association of Youth Liberation Front (YLF) have stormed Buganda Road court in protest of the delayed ruling in the case of battered WBS Journalist Andrew Lwanga
People protested against the government agenda in Bule Hora as part of the third round of Oromo protests. Soldiers shot and killed at least two protesters.
People continue to protest in various districts of Guji Zone against the national agenda and against the exploitation of minerals by Al Amudin. Oromo farmers marched to Jiddola town.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed an Oromo student protester at Dilla University.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Nekemt.
People continue to protest in various districts of Guji Zone against the national agenda and against the exploitation of minerals by Al Amudin. Oromo farmers marched to Jiddola town.

Students from Farah Omar secondary school staged a peaceful demonstration on the road from Radio Hargeisa to the Ministry of Education in 26 June District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 06/02 in protest against an order from the Ministry of Education of allegedly transferring best teachers in the school to other schools according to the students claims.
People protested against the government agenda in Jidola in Bore as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
People protested against the government agenda in Girawa as part of the third round of Oromo protests.
People protested against the national agenda in Chiracha town, Girawa district, East Hararge.
People protested against the national agenda in Dogo, Girawa district. Soldiers intervened to disperse the protesters.
People protested against the national agenda in Awaday.

More than hundred people staged a demonstration in front of Sheikh police station on 07/02 in protest against the arrest of a group of elders by Somaliland authority. The arrest of elders followed after local clan militias clashed with Somaliland police in the previous day in Qarasgoy mountain over a land dispute and the government is trying to put pressure on the elders to surrender the escaped gunmen. Reports indicate that an ongoing construction belonging to a Kuwaiti foreign investor has been suspended following the armed clash, arrest of elders and subsequent demonstration. The rally ended peacefully.
People protested against the national agenda in Dongoro town, Lalo Asabi district, West Wallaga.
People protested against the national agenda in Abaro in Shashamene, West Arsi.
People protested against the national agenda and against the exploitation of minerals by Al Amudin with no benefit to locals in Hara qallo town, Goro Dola district, Guji Zone.
People protested against the national agenda in Biyyoo Karabaa, Madda Bilisummaa District ( West Hararge)
Soldiers in Guliso allegedly beat up a man in the street over allegedly spying on them. It set off another round of protests against the national agenda in the district.
Primary and secondary students in Waliso and the neighboring towns boycotted their final exam in protest against the national agenda.
People protested against the national agenda and against the exploitation of minerals by Al Amudin with no benefit to locals in Sabba boru district, Guji Zone.
Farmers protested against the national agenda from Chifra Misra village in Dobba District. A young man was wounded by soldiers
People protested against the national agenda and against the exploitation of minerals by Al Amudin with no benefit to locals in Sabba boru district, Guji Zone.
Over 300 people staged a demonstration around Kamuswagas palace in Rakai district to protest the manner in which their chief was arrested.

A group of students and teachers in Dila town staged a peaceful demonstration on 09/02 in protest against poor education facilities in the town. Police arrived at the scene, dispersed the protestors and arrested three people after they allegedly refused to leave the scene.

Local residents staged anti-Somaliland rally and expressed support for Khatumo administration in Buuhoodle on 10/02. The rally comes a day after militias loyal to Somaliland Minister of Health attacked guards of Khatumo president in the town. The protestors marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The rally is believed to be organized by the Khatumo administration led by its president.

People protested against the exploitation of minerals in Saransari town, Goro Dola District, Guji. Farmers from Dhoqqo, Raare & Algee marched to Saransari demanding immediate halt to minerals exploitation___ and the release of all political prisoners.
People protested against the national agenda in Chorora town, Anchar district , West Hararge. 11 people have been arrested during the ongoing protest.
Farmers protested against the national agenda from Chifra Misra village in Dobba District. A young man was wounded by soldiers
People protested against the national agenda in Mendi, Mana Sibu district in Oromia.
People protested against the national agenda in Gurawa town, East Hararge
People protested at the Anwar mosquein Addis Ababa to call for an end to the mass killing and incarceration.
People protested against the exploitation of minerals in Qancha town, Guji.

A group of youths demonstrated against a local NGO in Xarrirad on 12/02. The youths were complaining that the local NGO had not recruited them in the voters registration awareness programme in the village. The urged the National Electoral Commission (NEC) to look into the matter.
People protested against the national agenda in Shashamane following clashes between police and civilians in Aje, West Arsi.
People protested against the national agenda in Siraro following clashes between police and civilians in Aje, West Arsi.

More than a hundred people, mostly drivers of tricycle (Tuktuk) staged a demonstration against the local authority in the western part of Burco on 14/02 in protest against a directive issued by the local authority and municipal council of relocating them to a new stage and also changing the routes they play in the town. The drivers fought with the police forces and blocked the roads with their tri-cycles. Additional police arrived at the scene and arrested a number of protesters.

A group of youths demonstrated in Gabiley town in the morning of 14/02 in protest against a delegation from Hargeisa, comprising of Minister of Finance and the first lady. The protestors interrupted the first ladys speech and accused the government of being corrupt. Police arrived at the scene and arrested about 15 demonstrators.
People protested against the national agenda in Lafto in Girawa.
People protested against the national agenda in Aje town, West Arsi. Soldiers shot and killed five protesters.
People protested against the national agenda in Shashamane, blocking the main road passing through the city. Police killed three people in its effprts to quell the protest.
People protested against the national agenda in Senbete town,West Arsi. Soldiers allegedly killed four people.

A Group of Ceerigaabo Toyota vehicle owners staged demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo ministry of Planning office in the morning of 15/02. The protestors accused the Ministry of Planning official of been favouritism in renting services and bringing vehicles from Hargeisa. This followed after Somaliland Ministry of National Planning conducted a survey in Ceerigaabo town in which most of the vehicles responded to the survey were from Hargeisa. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators. No arrest was made.

A group of youths demonstrated against a delegation of vice president and chairman of Kulmiye party during their visit to Qol ujeed village (25km NW of Borama) on 15/02. The protestors were complaining about poor socio economics of the town and blamed the government of not supporting the region. Police arrested nine protesters and transferred them to Borama.

People protested against the national agenda in Kofele, blocking all roads to and from the city. Soldiers reinforcements were sent to the town. They killed five people and wounded several.

A group of people, mostly businesswomen, staged a demonstration at Laas Caanood grocery market on 20/02. The demonstrators were protested following reports that the market has been sold to a local businessman.

A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo court on 20/02 to express their anger against the regular postponement of cases against local youth gangs and grass land disputes. The demonstrators were mostly parents and nomads. Ceerigaabo police arrived the scene and dispersed the crowd.

A group of local residents in Lughaye staged a peaceful demonstration on 21/02 in protest against the recent attack against voter's registration office in Sabawanag on 17/02. The protestors called for the government to solve disputes on district boundaries in the area.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in KM4/ in front of the parliament/Dajirka along Maka Al-Mukarama road in the morning of 21/02. The demonstrators urged the government to mention the status that Mogadishu will have after 2016. The protestors had slogans indicating the need for Mogadishu residents to have equal rights as the other residents living in other regions. The provisional Constitution of the Federal Republic of Somalia states that Mogadishu will have special regulation that will be endorsed by the parliament.

A group of drivers and conductors of lories staged a peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood on 21/02 in protest against tax increase by Somaliland authority. Police arrived at the scene, dispersed the protestors and arrested unspecified numbers of demonstrators.

Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Hiddi Lola town, Borana
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Sichawo village, Gawo Qebe district, Kelem Welega
Oromp people protested against the national agenda in El Waye town, Yabello district, Borena
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Iteya. Mass arrests followed the protest
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Dallo Mana, Bale. Soldiers opened fire on them.
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Culul, Dinnaba & Burqa Badhaso villages, Bedeno District
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Deefo town and Dikicha village, Habro District, West Hararge
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Waliso , Shewa. Soldiers allegedly fired at protesters.
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Milqaye, Darolebu District

A number of people demonstrated in Lughaye against the attack carried by gunmen against voters' registrations office in Sabawanag area on 27/02. The demonstrators called on the Somaliland government to arraign the suspects in court. They also called on the government to intervene in the ongoing dispute over boundaries between Hargeisa and Lughaya districts.
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Culul village, Bedeno District
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Dikicha, Habro District, West Hararge
Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Magado village, Shakiso District, Guji zone. Three people were killed and more than 15 wounded by soldiers.
Protests broke out in Dabat, North Gonder over an identity issue and lack of good governance. Protesters blocked the roads linking Dabat to Mekele and Shire.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed 3 protesters in Metta village, Jimma Arjo, East Welega.

A group of parents staged a peaceful demonstration in Badhan (106km E of Ceerigaabo) on 28/02 in protest against Puntland ministry of Education. These demonstration came after the Ministry increased fee for the forthcoming Puntland secondary and intermediate exams in 2016. They urged Puntland ministry to solve the issue otherwise their students will not sit for the exam. Somaliland and Puntland holds their secondary & intermediate exams in most of eastern Sanaag districts (Badhan & Dhahar) every year.
Somaliland police arrested three protestors in Lawya Caddo on 28/02 after they were allegedly accused of disrupting the voter registration exercise.
A woman was killed and two other civilians were injured following after security forces open fire to disperse local people that tried to storm Baidoa hospital searching for their family members.
People protested against the national agenda in Meda, Borena.
People protested against the national agenda in Ogolcho, Arsi zone.
People protested against the national agenda in Gawo Kebe, Kelem Wellega.
People protested against the national agenda in Habura, Ziway Dugda in Arsi zone.
People protested against the national agenda in Amuru, Misraq Ellega.
Public transport drivers and the public have closed the road at Tefki and Asgori towns to cut off traffic between Jimma and Addis Ababa in protest against a new Traffic Control Regulation.
Public transport drivers and the public have closed the road at Tefki and Asgori towns to cut off traffic between Jimma and Addis Ababa in protest against a new Traffic Control Regulation.

A group of SNG forces staged a demonstration at the General Dhagabadan Training Centre and erected road-blocks in front of the main gate to the centre. A senior Somali national army official addressed the group and they returned back to their barracks. No casualties or damages were reported.

A demonstration in protest against the arrest of Yemeni fishermen and their boats was held in Qandala on 01/03. The demonstrations were reportedly organized by individuals harbouring alleged illegal foreign fishing vessels following the arrest of the Yemeni fishermen by PMPF in Qandala on the same day. The demonstration ended peacefully.
People protested against the national agenda in Karra Horda Village, Girawa District
People protested against the national agenda in Ambo village, Kombolcha.
Highschool and Vocational School students in Amuru, walked out of school and marched to the town to protest against the national agenda.
Public transport drivers and the public have closed the road at Tefki in protest against a new Traffic Control Regulation.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Kellay Village, Lalo Asabi District, West Welega.
Two people were reportedly killed by soldiers during a protest against the national agenda in Kersa, East Hararge. Villagers from surrounding villages marched to the town.
Delegates of the Regional Electoral Commission in Masaka protested over allowances
People protested against the national agenda in Bengua village, Mana Sibu District.

A decision by the Narok County Government to close 15 camps in the Maasai Mara Game Reserve has sparked protests on 02/03 from the local community, mostly from tour operators and hoteliers who benefit from the tourism industry.
Students protested against the national agenda at Metu University
One student was killed when soldiers fired on protesters at Gidda Biqiri school, Boji Choqorsa district, Mirab Welega.
Students protested at Walaga University in Nekemt against the national agenda and were met by violence from soldiers.
Kabale residents pitched camp at police station over the arrest of two polling agents
Students protested against the national agenda at Jima University
People protested against the national agenda in Gidda Biqiri, Boji Choqorsa District, Mirab Welega.
People protested against the national agenda in Dubuluq, Borena.
Students protested at Walaga University in Nekemt against the national agenda and were met by violence from soldiers.
Soldiers allegedly killed a student at Nekemt Teachers College and injured at least 17 when they broke into campus and opened fire.
People protested against the national agenda in Koma town, Limu Saqa District
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in West Shewa.
Konso ethnic group protested to demand self-governing province and improvement in basic development. Konso also blocked the road leading to Yarbello and Jinka.

Somaliland police in Allay Baday village (37km SW of Gabiley) arrested at least 15 teenagers on 06/03 after they staged a demonstration against a visiting minister of Agriculture. The protestors accused the government of been corrupt and failed to meet the promises they made during last election adding that the authorities also neglecting their village. Reports indicate that the demonstrators were supporters of WADANI party (opposition) while the police accused them of causing disturbance.

Dozens of university students protested in front of the US embassy in Ethiopias capital, demanding an end to police crackdowns. At least 25 were injured and 49 were arrested when police intervened to disperse them. 20 of the students were charged on charges of 'inciting the public through false rumors', and face up to three years in prison if convicted. The remaining 29 were released on bail.
On 8 March 2016, students protested against the national agenda in Nekemt at Chalalaqi, South Wacha, ASK schools and Bethel High School. Soldiers later arrested several of them.
People protested against the national agenda in Jarte Jardega.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed 2 protesters in West Arsi.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed 2 protesters in East Wellega.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Boke Tiko, West Hararghe.
On 10 March 2016, Police arrested 40 students and 3 teachers from Burayu secondary and preparatory school who took part in a protest in Addis Ababa.
Students protested against the national agenda at Chalalaqi, South Wacha, ASK and Biftu Nekemt schools in Nekemt and were met by military forces.
People protested at Nor Mosque in Addis Ababa
Students protested against the national agenda in Lagahare school in Dire Dawa. 6 students were arrested by police.
Hundreds of women in Malindi staged a demonstration following an assault of a person during the recent parliamentary by-election.
People marched to Deder town to protest against the national agenda. At least 45 were arrested by military forces.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Awaday.
Students protested against the national agenda at Hawassa University in Awasa. Soldiers reportedly responded violently.
At least three people were killed and dozens injured when soldiers opened fire on protesters in Debana kebele in Konso
Students protested against the national agenda in Bedesa. 40 students were arrested following the demonstration
Elementary and secondary school students protested against the national agenda in Kiremu, East Welega
Soldiers reportedly fired at protesting students at Abdi Bori Secondary School in Metu, Ilubabor region.
Soldiers allegedly fired at protesters in Babile.

FDC protesters were dispersed by anti-riot police in Luwero as they were converging for Free my vote campaign prayers in protest of the outcome of the February 18 presidential election and the subsequent home detention of their parties leader Besigye.
Massive rally in Karat town in Konso to protest against the killing of three protesters on 13 March
Soldiers allegedly attacked protesting students and residents in Kersa, Arsi.
Students protested against the national agenda in Harawacha, east Harerge
Students protested against the national agenda in Shambu, Horo Guduru
Security forces allegedly shot and killed 2 protesters in East Hararge.
Soldiers reportedly attacked protesting students in South Wacha school in Nekemt, injuring several.
People, including students, protested against the national agenda in Adaba town, West Arsi. At least one student was killed. 220 were arrested following the protest.
Soldiers reportedly injured 13 students when responding to their protest at Sabata Secondary school. An official of the Oromo Peoples Democratic Organisation (OPDO) also sustained injuries
Massive rally in Karat town in Konso to protest against the killing of three protesters on 13 March
Mombasa residents gather to protest a county plan to demolish old houses in their area.

Residents of Zeylac on 17/03 held a peaceful demonstration in protest against the killing of a Somaliland coast guard by Djiboutian marines on 14/03. The protesters accused Djibouti government of violating Somaliland territorial waters. They called on Somaliland government to defend its borders.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Biftu, Girawa, East Hararghe.
People protested against the national agenda in Midhaga town, Midhaga Tola district, East Hararge
Students protested against the national agenda in Odaa School, Meki town, Dugda District, East Shawa. Soldiers reportedly attacked students in response.
Massive rally in Karat town in Konso to protest against the killing of three protesters on 13 March
People protested against the national agenda in Dansha in Tigray province.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Lalise, Gida Ayana, East Welega.
People protested against the national agenda in Gida Ayana.
People protested against the national agenda in Nekemt.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Agemti, Daro Lebu, West Hararghe.
Students protested against the national agenda in Alge town, Ilubabor. Soldiers fired at protesters.

More than 200 people staged a peaceful demonstration in Bosasso on 22/03 to support and celebrate the victory of Puntland Defence Forces in their recent clashes with al Shabaab fighters in Suuj Village (Bandar Beyla). The demonstrators marched on the main tarmac road, near the market and municipality council of Bosasso. Police took all security measures and the rally ended peacefully.

A group of Toyota Noah drivers from Dhulbahante staged a demonstration in Laas Caanood on 22/03 in protest against Salama Bus Company after it brought buses from Burco which have cheaper fare than the Noah vehicles. These new buses will ply from Laas Caanood to Hargeisa. They were chanting of not tolerating this new company.
Students staged a sit-in to protest against the national agenda in Sibo town, Bure District, Ilubabor.
Students and Oromo people protested against the national agenda in Alge, Ilubabor.
Students at Walkite University protested against the national agenda. At least 23 students were arrested after the protests.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a student protester in Ambo, West Shewa.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Barodo, Toke Kutaye, West Shewa.

A group of youths demonstrated against the governor during a visit to visit to Ceel Gaal (50km SW of Zeylac)on 25/03. The group was complaining of the current severe drought in the area and lack of response from the Somaliland government. They also accused the government of not initiating development projects in the village. The youths reported shouted anti-Somaliland slogans. Efforts by the governor to persuade them calm down bore no fruit, forcing him to leave the village. No violence reported.

A group of youth from a local sports organization staged a demonstration against the regional sports director in Laas Caanood on 26/03. Although the motive is unclear, unconfirmed reports suggest that the demonstration might have been organized by pro-Khatumo diaspora who are on visit to Laas Caanood and organizing a football tournament.

Hundreds of Mogadishu residents staged a public rally against UN's Somalia and Eritrea Monitoring Group (SEMG) in Daljirka Dahsoon (Boondheere District) on 26/03 morning. The demonstrators demanded the Federal Government of Somalia to take serious measures on the threat posed by SEMG to Somali people and public institutions. The rally was peaceful and it was organized by leaders of civil society. The protestors were waving slogans highlighting the alleged violation of the SEMG on both public and private individuals in Somalia, which dedicated its resources to defame individuals to the extent of alleging innocent citizens as suicide bombers in one of its reports.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Soka, Deder, East Hararge.
Workers at Kagadi Hospital in Kibale district staged a sit down strike over alleged delayed payments for their services.
Police open fire on a group of anti-Hassan Sheikh Mohamud protesters, wounding three. No reported violence from the demonstrators.
Lira residents protested against deterioriating security in their district since the presidential elections last month.

Teachers in Ceel-Afweyn staged a demonstration against Education Director of Sanaag Region on 27/03 and accused him of not paying them their training per diems following after Sanaag Ministry of Education held a training in Ceerigaabo for all teachers of the region. Ceel-Afweyn Police forces arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators but no arrest was made.
Residents of Kirimon in Samburu Central Sub-County protest over what they say is illegal grabbing of 10,000 acres of public land meant to benefit their community.
Students protested against the national agenda at Asela Teachers College. Soldiers arrested 13 students following the protest.

Following several high-speed automobile accidents in their area, residents of Mairo Inya erect several speed bumps on a thoroughfare. Following their action, a group of motorists stage a protest of the poor driving condition.

Members of the Akorino religious sect protest at 47 churches throughout Embu county over alleged discrimination after their children were sent home from school after refusing to remove their headgear.
Students protested against the national agenda at Asela Teachers Training College and preparatory school.
People protested against the national agenda in Fadis district, East Harerge.
Soldiers reportedly attacked student protesters at Bedelle High School in Illubabor, injuring several students.
Over 90 head of cattle have been abandoned at Pader district headquarters by over 200 residents of Barajwa village in a protest over invasion of unfamiliar pastoralists grazing on their land.

A group of youths together with community leaders staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 30/03 in support of the postponement of the ongoing voters registration exercise for a month in order to address the current drought in the country.

Supporters of the old LA in Buur Hakaba organized a demonstration in Buur Hakaba town against the newly appointed ISWA authorities for Buur Hakaba on 30/03. The protesters demanded that the newly appointed administration is taken back by ISWA to Baidoa.
People protested against the national agenda in Fadis district, East Harerge.

A lecturer and students at Makerere University protested the governments continued house-arrest of former FDC presidential candidate Kizza Besigye by marching barefoot. Police officers initially tried to block the demonstrators.
Youth in Kampala protested against the Supreme Courts ruling validating President Musevenis reelection. At least 11 were later arrested by police.
Police arrested three youths in Kampalas Katwe Market who had chained themselves to electric poles in protest against the Supreme Courts ruling validating President Musevenis reelection.

Police arrested 15 FDC supporters in Mbarara for allegedly holding an unlawful demonstration. The group was reportedly protesting the Supreme Court's decision to dismiss a petition filed by Amama Mbabazi to challenge the February presidential election results.
Students protested against the national agenda in Bishoftu Secondary School, East Shewa.
Police arrested five youths in Kampalas Kisekka market who had chained themselves to electric poles in protest against the Supreme Courts ruling validating President Musevenis reelection.
Residents of Kirinyaga County protest a law that would move the counties headquarters. Date of protest not known - source dated 04/04.
Soldiers allegedly injured several student protesters from Jimma university.
Soldiers allegedly fired at student protesters in Sululta. At least seven students were later arrested.

Residents of Ndoto Ward in Samburu North Sub County on 05/04 held protests at Lesirkan trading centre over the recent police recruitment exercise which they claimed was unfair and marred with corruption.
Students and teachers protested against the national agenda in Sebeta secondary and preparatory school. Soldiers attacked protesters, wounding several, and later arrested several teachers.

On 6 April 2016, following the death of a clan elder in prison, reported yesterday, a group of people (mainly youths and women) staged a demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo hospital (Sanaag), in protest to a report stating that the incident was a natural death. The protestors claimed that the prison guards refused to take the victim to the hospital before his death. Military forces responded to the protest in order to disperse them; in the process a female protestor was seriously injured. The soldier, the injured woman and the deceased elder all hail from the same sub-clan.
People protested against the national agenda in Doba, Darolebu and Mieso.
People protested against the national agenda in Doba, Darolebu and Mieso.
At least three persons were shot and wounded by soldiers during a protest in Hirna town.
People protested against the national agenda in Doba, Darolebu and Mieso.

Local residents of Buuhoodle staged a peaceful demonstration on 09/04 in protest against the Somali Federal Government while expressing their support for Khatumo administration. The demonstration was organized by Khatumo administration over the recent visit by Somalia Prime Minister to Puntland and the 4.5 election agreement. The Khatumo administration says that they are being ignored, and have not been included in the new deal. Protestors marched in the streets of the town chanting slogans against the recent deal.

On 9 April 2016, ASWJ militia reportedly opened gunfire against a group of women who demonstrated against them in Dhuusamarreeb town (Galgaduud) in the morning. The motive behind the demonstration is said to be related to land dispute. ASWJ authority did not comment on the incident. Three of the women injured in the shooting are receiving medical treatment in Dhusamareeb hospital.
Students at Ambo University protested against the national agenda.
Students at Ambo University protested against the national agenda.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Chamola, Shakiso District, Gujii zone.
Masinde Muliro University students protest examination fees, causing the school to temporarily close. No reported violence.

Tens of business owners in Embu Town Wednesday (13/04) afternoon held a peaceful demonstration protesting alleged harassment by Kenya Bureau of Standards (Kebs) officials. [The demonstrators] marched to the Embu County government and county commissioners offices seeking to be addressed but were repulsed by police. Kebs officials had accused many of the traders of selling counterfeit items and threatened them with arrest.
Fishermen protest in Karatu district against a ban on activities in Lake Eyasi.

The Somaliland authorities in Lowyacado have destroyed several illegal constructions that were used for smuggling. The area's residents demonstrated against the destructions and refused to clear the area. The police arrested several people, which were transferred to Zeylac central prison, and proceeded with the demolitions.
A research fellow at Makerere Institute of Social Research (MISR) stripped in public to protest against the Institutes Executive Director. She was later suspended from the school.
Students protested against government forces violence against students, residents and teachers in Badelle.
Makerere University students in Ethics and Human Rights staged a peaceful demonstration near the University main building demanding the reinstatement of their programme.
Hundreds of citizens staged a peaceful demonstration in Gambella demanding the release of hundreds of children abducted in a recent cross-border raid.

Group of youth staged demonstration against SONYO Umbrella organisation and Ministry of Youth in Ceel-Afweyn on 22/04. The demonstrators requested Somaliland president take action against the two institutions for their failure to create youth development projects to prevent illegal migration to Europe. This demonstration comes days after a boat heading to Europe carrying many Somaliland youths sunk.

Group of youth staged demonstration against SONYO Umbrella organization and Ministry of Youth near Imperial Hotel in Hargeisa on 22/04. The demonstrators requested Somaliland president against the two institutions for their failure to create youth development projects to prevent illegal migration to Europe. This demonstration comes days after a boat heading to Europe carrying many Somaliland youths sunk.

Uganda Christian University (UCU) students demonstrated over what they define as unfair adjustments in fees in Mukono. UCU dismissed two students and suspended two others for one full academic year over the protest one month later.
Residents protested against legislators move to exempt their allowances from income tax MPs in Kabale.

More than 200 local residents staged a peaceful demonstration in protest over the increasing exchange rate of the dollar against the Somali shilling in the proximity of Bosasso Main Market (milk section) and the main tarmac road in the morning of 04/05. Business premises were closed during the protest. The event ended peacefully.
Security forces allegedly shot and killed a protester in Wolenkomi, West Shewa.

A group of residents in Emurua Dikirr Constituency protest outside the Ward Administrators office over the poor state of the roads which led to a number of local deaths. Another group launches a counter protest at the same location and accuses the demonstrators of illegal protest and undermining the county leadership. There is no reports of violence between the two groups.

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations
Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Bushenyi. Police arrested a journalist covering the protest.

Police raided the opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) party office in Tegwana Parish, Pece Division in Gulu Municipality, as some FDC supporters had gathered to follow a nationwide call for protests against the results of the presidential elections. Several of the supporters fled and stayed in hiding until the next day for fear of being arrested.

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations
Demonstrators rally in support of Galmudug State forces who are clearing illegal checkpoints in Galkayo.
Demonstration to support Somalias Supreme Court chairman held in Mogadishu.

Small scale traders staged a demonstration in front of the parliament building in Garowe on the morning of 07/05 in protest against the depreciation of the Somali shilling against the dollar, which caused inflation. The protestors called on Puntland government to look into the current inflation caused by the depreciation of the Somali shilling.
Police arrested 20 people for holding unlawful demonstrations in Kanungu against the delayed construction of the Rukungiri-Kanungu road. They were part of a group of 150 protestors.

Ceerigaabo local municipal council supported by the police destroyed small kiosks constructed illegally at the central grocery market in Ceerigaabo on 07/05. A group of kiosk owners attempted to stop the operations but three were arrested by the police.
People protested against the national agenda in Hirna, West Harerge. Soldiers allegedly arrested seven.

Hundreds of bus drivers gathered and demonstrated against increased taxation by the ISWA administration in the morning of 09/05. The protestors were waving slogans demanding a stop of the tax collection. The gathering was not addressed by anyone and it concluded peacefully.

In Kwale, a group of opposition CORD supporters made their way to the IEBC offices in Diani, Msambweni Sub-County, peacefully handed a letter to the assistant returning officer Mwamize Achani and left. Source dated 10/05.
A CORD protest in Kisumu is met with 'heavy police presence.' No reported violence. Exact date not known - source dated 10/05.
Students of Business and Economics College in Asella protested today by boycotting exam.
Students of Business and Economics College in Asella continue to protest today
youth march through streets of Adama after a book signing ceremony
Residents and students protested against the national agenda in Kombolcha, Guduru district. Several people were injured when soldiers responded, including one critically.
Hundreds of students at the Business and Economics College in Asela are being beaten and jailed for peacefully presenting the demands to college admins.

Several ODM supporters in Kisumu sustained injures after police broke up a weekly demonstration to eject Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission officers. It is not known if the violence against the protesters was blatant or intentional. No violence reported from the protesters.
People protested against the national agenda in Asabot, West Hararge. Soldiers arrested seven people following the protests.
People protested against the government agenda in Asabot. Security forces arrested and detained 7 people after the protests.

Pro-Khatumo residents staged demonstrations against Somaliland's 25th Anniversary in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) on 18/05. The protestors marched in the streets, chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. Somaliland army officers reportedly fired live bullets in the air and dispersed the protestors. No casualties were reported.
Students at Karamile Preparatory School staged sit-ins demanding the release of arrested students in the country and the postponing of national exams.

Hundreds of local residents took to the streets to stage a peaceful public rally against the National consultative forum in Mogadishu at Daljirka Dahson monument in Bondhere District. Protesters demanded for FGS to take serious measures to have their power sharing and autonomous regional administration.

Soldiers fired at protesting students, farmers and residents who had marched to Masalaha town in West Hararge from neighbouring villages to call for the release of 18 students arrested two days earlier in the district.
Students at Haramaya university protested against the national agenda. Military forces responded violently, injuring dozens of students, and arresting over 60 over a period of three days.
Students at Haramaya university protested against the national agenda. Military forces responded violently, injuring dozens of students, and arresting over 60 over a period of three days.
Students at Haramaya university protested against the national agenda. Military forces responded violently, injuring dozens of students, and arresting over 60 over a period of three days.
People protested against the national agenda in Kombolcha, Guduru District. Several people were injured when soldiers responded.
Residents and students protested against the national agenda in Haro, East Welega. One student was killed when soldiers responded.

Students started to boycott classes at Haramaya University demanding the immediate release of all arrested students and the removal of armed forces from their campus. The boycott was continuing as of 28 May.
People protested against the national agenda in Kombolcha, Guduru District. Several people were injured when soldiers responded.
Students protested at Walaga university in Nekemt. Soldiers allegedly responded violently.
People protested against the national agenda in Kurfa Sawa Village, Mieso District. Two people were severely injured when police intervened.

Three people died during clashes which erupted during opposition protests against actions of the electoral commission in two towns. Two people died of gunshot wounds in the western town of Siaya, and one from a head injury after falling over while running from tear gas in Kisumu. Police in Siaya opened fire 'in self defence' after 'a mob with catapults' approached a municipal office. Twenty-nine police injured in the clash. The actions of the demonstrators in Kisumu are not clear and may have been attacked without provocation.
CORD members protest in Homa Bay, marching toward county election commission offices. Police intervene, 6 protesters were wounded. It is not known if the protesters were violent.
People protested against the national agenda in Kombolcha, Guduru District. Several people were injured when soldiers responded.
People protested against the national agenda in Ginchi town, Dendi District. Several people were arrested after the protest.
Over 3,500 people protested against their eviction from the Aller Community Farm in Lira.
Puntland Custodial Corps protested against non-payment of salary for the last five months.
Police allegedly beat a student as he was returning to Kotebe College in Finfine, Addis Ababa. He sustained a severe injury. Students protested against the event the following day at the College.
People protested against the national agenda in Kobbo town.
People protested against the national agenda in Alge, Illubabor.
People protested against the national agenda in Dire Dawa.
People protested against the national agenda in Togowachale town on the Ethiopia-Somaliland border. Two people were injured when soldiers responded and 10 were arrested.
People protested against the national agenda and government arrests in Kobbo.
Students marched to town in Chalanqo, East Hararge, after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results.
Students marched in Fincha town, Horo Guduru, after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results.
Students marched in Gimbi, West Welega, after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results.
Students marched in Malka Balo, East Hararge, after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results.
Students marched to town in Jarso District after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results.
Students marched to town in Qimbibit, North Shewa, after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results.
Alibo school students marched to town in Jardega district, Horo Guduru, after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results.
Students marched in Shashamane after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results. They were chased by police.

Students marched to Yabelo town in Borena Zone, after the cancellation of nation-wide exams following a leak of the results. Soldiers allegedly responded with violence, prompting residents to join the protests.
Police officers protest over unpaid salaries.
Youth in Malka Balo, East Hararge marched to town to protest against the national agenda.
People protested against the national agenda during a celebration of the Oda Roba Gada system in Gandhir, Bale zone.
People protested against the national agenda in Asabot.
Protest over the warring clans of Jajele and Galjacel in the area.
ASWJ soldiers protest over unpaid salaries.
Students at Dilla University boycotted their meal demanding the release of 10 fellow students who have been held in Maeekalwi prison for four month without trial.

Residents Qarsa and Kontoma villages in Lafto Subcity of Addis Ababa marched to the Prime Ministers palace to protest against the planned eviction from their homes during four days. Several were stopped and arrested by police during the protest.
CORD youths protest in Kibera.

Residents Qarsa and Kontoma villages in Lafto Subcity of Addis Ababa marched to the Prime Ministers palace to protest against the planned eviction from their homes during four days. Several were stopped and arrested by police during the protest.
Police used tear gas to disperse an anti-government protest. CHADEMA leader accused security of using excessive force but no further reports confirming violence or injuries.
Hundreds of athletes protested in Addis Ababa against the Ethiopian track federations selection process for the upcoming Olympic games.

Residents Qarsa and Kontoma villages in Lafto Subcity of Addis Ababa marched to the Prime Ministers palace to protest against the planned eviction from their homes during four days. Several were stopped and arrested by police during the protest.
MPs protested at a nationwide address by Ugandan president Museveni to demand the release of opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) leader Besigye.

Residents Qarsa and Kontoma villages in Lafto Subcity of Addis Ababa marched to the Prime Ministers palace to protest against the planned eviction from their homes during four days. Several were stopped and arrested by police during the protest.
Students in Mekele protested against exam leaks.
Jubilee supporters in Eldoret held a peaceful demonstration and condemned intra party political remarks that appeared to go against a pact between coalition affiliates TNA and URP.
Puntland soldiers protest non-payment of salaries in Gaalkacyo.

On 15/06 CORD protests broke out in 'western Kenya' (exact location not known - coded as Bungoma) following the arrest of opposition leaders for hate speech allegations. The source implies the location was a reference to either Kisumu or Siaya county.
Samara University students protested over water and food shortages in Semera.
Students in Ambo protested for the second day over examination scheduling by authorities.
People protested in Shashamene against a recent string of night-time stabbing attacks that killed seven people and injured several others.

SPU groups serving UNSOM, UNICEF and others from NGOs staged a protest over delayed payments. They suspended supporting operations and gathered at GIH. Subsequently, UN representatives intervened and held dialogue with the SPUs.
Students protested against the governments lack of support to prepare exams in Kobo, East Harerge.
Students in Shashamane protested against the killing of their classmate by unknown assailants. Police allegedly arrested several people in relations with the killing.
People protested against the government agenda in Chelenko. Soldiers allegedly fired on protesters, killing one and injuring several others.

Residents of Kole District, led by the ruling National Resistance Movement (NRM) leaders, marched in the town to protest President Musevenis revocation of the appointment of former Kole woman MP and UPC member as Minister of state for Fisheries, over alleged pressure.
Police open fire on 'mostly peaceful' CORD protesters in 'Nyanza region', killing five 'since Monday' (source dated 22/06).
At least 300 tuberculosis (TB) and HIV/Aids patients in Isiolo protested against plans to convert a regional TB isolation centre into county assembly offices.
Police open fire on 'mostly peaceful' CORD protesters in 'Nyanza region', killing five 'since Monday' (source dated 22/06).
More than 200 residents on 21/06 staged a peaceful demonstration over what they termed as neglect by the county government.
Crowds protest against the arrest of a Ayr clan leader.

There was a demonstration against the arrest of HCTV journalist by Ethiopian authorities in Wajaale town of Gebiley. Demonstrators demanded for the immediate release of the journalist who was accused of false propaganda against the Ogadeen Administration on Jama Dubad killing.

Students and residents in Shashamane marched through the town to protest against a recent string of night-time stabbing attacks that had killed nine people as of 22 June. Soldiers allegedly fired on the protesters.
Persons with disabilities staged a demonstration in Mbale to protest Ministerial appointment.
Police open fire on 'mostly peaceful' CORD protesters in 'Nyanza region', killing five 'since Monday' (source dated 22/06).

Hundreds of Eritrean refugees and dissidents demonstrated outside the headquarters of the African Union in Addis Ababa against the alleged human rights abuses committed by their government back home, following the publication of a new UN Commission of Inquiry report that accuses the government of crimes against humanity over the past 25 years. Similar protests occurred in refugee camps across Ethiopia.

Hundreds of Eritrean refugees and dissidents demonstrated outside the headquarters of the African Union in Addis Ababa against the alleged human rights abuses committed by their government back home, following the publication of a new UN Commission of Inquiry report that accuses the government of crimes against humanity over the past 25 years. Similar protests occurred in refugee camps in Ethiopia by the Eritrean border.

Similar protests occurred in refugee camps across Ethiopia.
People protested against the government agenda in Deder, East Harerge.
People protested against the government agenda in Guliso, West Welega.
Students marched to the administrative office in Masalaha, West Hararge, to protest against the government agenda.
People protested against the government agenda in Kersa, Arsi.
People protested against the government agenda in Asasa, West Arsi.
People protested against the national agenda in Deder, East Harerge.
People of Lafto and Kontoma districts of Addis Ababa protested against the cities plan to demolish their houses.

Supporters of the ruling National Resistance Movement (NRM) marched to the grave of a famous war hero at Kikandwa village in Nakaseke District, protesting against the marginalization of their area by the government.

A group of people held demonstrations to denounce the arrest of a TV journalist in Wajaale town and demanded his immediate release. Ethiopian authorities held him following the broadcast of a programme on Jamac Dubad incidents.

Soldiers allegedly shot 6 people and closed all roads leading to Lafto Sub-city of Addis Ababa, as the planned destruction of homes in this area gets underway amid protests by the current residents. No reported fatalities.

At least four people were killed in Awaday when soldiers allegedly opened fire on people who came running to put off a fire in the town. People staged a mass demonstration following the event to protest against government violence.
People staged a night time protest against the government agenda in Bordode town, West Hararge.
Students protested against the government agenda at Haramaya university. Police forces responded with violence, allegedly killing four and injuring five with bullet wounds.
People protested against the government agenda in Amuru district, Horo Guduru Walaga.
People of Bate and Damota villages near Haramaya protested against soldiers violence in Awaday, following the killing of 5 people the day before.

Parents and members of Christians of Lutheran Church hold a demonstration on July 4, 2016 opposing a move by the Teachers Service Commission to sack principals in whose schools there were burning of dormitories at Boys High School in Kisii.

A group protests in Uhuru Park (Nairobi - Westlands) following the murder of a lawyer. The source claims protests were also took place in 'major towns and urban centres countrywide,' though did not make any specific names or instances.
Protests in Eldoret following reported domestic violence in the area.
People protested against the government agenda in Jima, after Eid Celebrations.
People protested against the government agenda in Kofele, after Eid Celebrations.
People protested against the government agenda in Boreda, Goro Gutu district in East Hararge, after Eid Celebrations.

People protested against the government agenda in Hidilola, Borena, after Eid Celebrations.
People protested against the government agenda in Shirka, Arsi, after Eid Celebrations.
People protested against the government agenda in Deder, after Eid Celebrations. Soldiers allegedly fired at protesters, leaving one critically injured.
People protested against the government agenda in Mesela, West Hararge, after Eid Celebrations.
Students protested against the government agenda at Haramaya university after Eid Celebrations.
People protested against the government agenda in Aweday, after Eid Celebrations.
People protested against the government agenda in Harar after Eid Celebrations.

People marched from Nsozi to Kyangwali Sub County headquarters to raise community awareness on the need to conserve the Bugoma tropical forest in Hoima district, Bunyoro sub region. The march was allegedly stopped by Bunyoro kingdom loyalists protesting against the march by blocking advances on the road.
Tea farmers protest poor current market price of their product at Kiangai market.
People and students protested against the government agenda in Ginchi, West Shewa. Soldiers allegedly fired at protesters, killing one student and leaving several others injured.
People protested against government violence at a funeral service in Ginchi, West Shewa.
People raised the resistance flag in Galessa town, near Ginchi, to protest against the government agenda.
Hundreds of protesters staged demonstrations in Somali capital Mogadishu on Monday against recent suicide attack on holy city of Madina.

Hundreds of people, mainly civilians, gathered in front of Isbaheysiga (alliance Mosque) in Hamarjajab district protesting against the recent explosions that rocked the holy Mosque in Medina, Saudi Arabia on Monday 4 July 2016. The protest was a sequel to the call for Muslim leaders in the community to condemn the attack. Protesters waved banners decrying the militant act. The demonstration was peaceful and there were no restrictions imposed on movement.
In Xiyoo district of Arsi zone, people prevented trucks carrying fertilizers from continuing their journey, demanding the fertilizers for themselves.
People protested against the government agenda at the funeral of a protester who died from injuries suffered during a protest in Adaba six months prior.
Military forces in Marka abandon their posts, leave the town in protest of pay.

Residents staged a protest against land grabing in Luwero, disrupting a meeting between the Buganda Land Board and Luwero Deputy Resident District Commissioner, demanding for his arbitration to stop their eviction.
Farmers in Lira protested against the late distribution of seedlings and other farm inputs, which is affecting the planting process.
Students at Asasa Preparatory School marched to town after completing their 12th grade exam, calling for freedom.
Women from a village in Arsi went to the town and closed all roads with their cattle to protest against the earlier shooting of two boys by a government soldier.

Farmers protested against the new waste disposal and recycling centre of Addis Ababa at Sendafa Landfill, refusing to allow garbage to be dumped at the site. The strike was still in force ten days later, as Addis Abebas solid waste was piling-up across the cities neighbourhoods.
Hundreds of demonstrators gathered in Mogadishu to protest the attempted coup in Turkey.
People protested against the government agenda in several towns in Jeldu district. Soldiers allegedly shot 6 protesters in Gojo town, while people closed the roads in protest in Shikute town.

People protested against the government agenda in several towns in Jeldu district. Soldiers allegedly shot 6 protesters in Gojo town, while people closed the roads in protest in Shikute town. No fatalities reported.
People protested against the government agenda in Asabot, West Hararge. Soldiers allegedly shot a protester.

People protested against the government agenda in Yabelo, Borena.
Farmers protested against the government agenda in Boni town, Jeldu district.
People protested against the government agenda in Asabot, West Hararge. Soldiers allegedly fired on protesters. Several people were injured and arrested.
People protested against the government agenda in Awaday, East Hararge.
Traders and vendors from the Mbizzinya Market Traders and Vendors Association protested on the Kampala-Masaka highway in Mpigi District against unfair market dues levied by their leaders.

A business woman operating a butchery in Galkayo town organized a demonstration against a private butchery company that slaughtered goats, cows and camels. Puntland local government in Galkayo town convened a special committee to resolve the issue.
AMISOM/Djibouti forces clash with SNA forces during an attempted arrest of the latter. An SNA soldier was reported dead. Following the clash local residents demonstrated, condemning the incident.
People protested against the government agenda in Yabelo, Borena.
Soldiers allegedly shot and killed a student in Ejaji town, West Shewa. People from the town and nearby villages marched to the towns police station in protest.
People protested against the government agenda in Hirna by closing the road to the town. Soldiers allegedly fired on protesters.

Pro Puntland supporters conducted a demonstration in Xin-Galool, Badhan and Dhahar Districts of Eastern Sanaag to protest against Somaliland voter registration process and deployment of troops in Sanaag region. Tension in the area remained very high.

Pro Puntland supporters conducted a demonstration in Xin-Galool, Badhan and Dhahar Districts of Eastern Sanaag to protest against Somaliland voter registration process and deployment of troops in Sanaag region. Tension in the area remained very high.

Heavily armed police stopped a demonstration by lawyers protesting the arrest of a colleague.

A man from Baadi Cade sub-clan stole a vehicle from the town. The man was pursued by AMISOM Djiboutian forces. The man shot at the AMISOM troops injuring one soldier. The AMISOM soldiers shot and killed the man in apparent self-defence. The clan of the deceased held a demonstration. Unconfirmed reports indicated that AMISOM troops compensated the clan and the demonstration was halted.

People and students protested in Haramaya, East Hararge, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia. Soldiers allegedly shot and killed 5 protesters. Another protester died of her wounds a month later.

People protested in Holeta, Finfinne, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia. Soldiers allegedly arrested and beat an elder.
People protested in Bordode, West Hararge, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia.
People protested in Sababoru, Guji zone, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia.

People protested in Baima Keransa, west Arsi, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia. Soldiers allegedly shot and killed a protester in Bayima Qeransa.

Doctors and nurses protested in Harar, East Wellega, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia. Police allegedly shot and killed at least one protester.

People protested in Adama as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia. In Adama, soldiers allegedly shot on protesters.
People protested in Ginir, Bale, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia.

People protested in Rayitu, Bale, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia. In Rayitu soldiers allegedly shot and killed two protesters. The following day, armed farmers ambushed a military unit, killing seven soldiers, capturing one, and leaving several farmers injured.
People protested in Deder, East Hararge, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia.

At least 20,000 people protested in Dodola, West Arsi as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia. Soldiers allegedly shot and killed two people killed and injured several.
Soldiers allegedly shot and killed a protester in Shashamane. People held a protest during his funeral the following day.
Soldiers allegedly shot and killed 14 protesters in Asasa, West Arsi. People held a protest during their funeral the following day.

People held a protest during the funeral for those killed in Nekemt in the previous protests.

More than 200 residents of Busowa Town Board in Bugiri District protested against poor service delivery and the state of affairs at Busoga Health Centre II.The protest was led by the area local council representative.

More than 50 casual employees at Menengai Oil Refineries in Nakuru claim they have not been paid their salaries and they are subjected to poor working conditions. The aggrieved workers on Wednesday evening downed their tools and held a demonstration demanding settlement of their salary arrears.

People in Mbarara protested against the government, notably calling for the dismissal of Genral Tumukunde involved in allegations of violence against opposition FDC party supporters. Police intervened to block the demonstration and arrested 8 protesters.
Ministry of Agriculture employees protest over unpaid salaries. Police dispersed the protesters.
Employees of the Bahir Dar regional health office have refused to go to work, demanding the release of arrested people in the context of regional protests against the government agenda.
People protested against the government agenda in Debre Markos. Soldiers allegedly shot at protesters to disperse them.

Small-scale protests against the government agenda allegedly took place over the weekend in Dessie (South Wollo Zone), Bati, and Senbete areas of Amhara, and Kemese of Oromia, but were quelled by security forces. Police was heavily deployed across towns in Oromia and Amhara to prevent fresh anti-government protests planned over the weekend.

Residents of Buikwe District whose property was destroyed to pave way for the construction of a 74km road between Mukono and Katosi, protested through Katosi Town against delayed compensation by the government. Police intervened to block the demonstration.

Legislators raided the Luwero Police station to protest against the lack of willingness by police officers to arrest suspects in an abortion case.

There were also protests in Iten town over the same issue.

Protest occur in Gaalkacyo over two days in regard to war against al Shabaab. Specifics not known.

People in Goro town, Meta Walkite district, West Shewa, protested against violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before.

People in Ejaji, west Shewa, protested against violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before.
People protested against the government agenda in Sendafa during the funeral service for a person killed the day before during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu.
People in Robe, Bale, protested against violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. All activities were closed in the town. Protests continued the following day.

Oromo students at Jimma universities Kito Furdisa campus protested against the government agenda following violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. The protest continued the following two days, involving students from all ethnicities and boycotting of meals.
Demonstrations continued in Ambo in reaction to violence during Iresha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. Soldiers allegedly fired on the protesters.
People in Bule Hora protested against violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. Soldiers reportedly fired on the protesters.
People in Dembi Dolo protested against violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. Soldiers reportedly fired on protesters, killing five.
People in Ziway town, east Harerghe, protested against violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. Soldiers reportedly fired on the protesters.

Demonstrations erupted in Aweday in reaction to violence during Iresha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. Soldiers allegedly fired on the protesters.

Amhara and Oromo students at Hawasa University boycotted meals for two days to protest against the government agenda following violence during Iresha festivities in Boshoftu. Soldiers allegedly responded violently to the student boycott.
People protested against the government agenda in Adami Tulu, east Shewa, during the funeral service for a person killed the day before during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu.

About hundreds of Xudun residents staged a demonstration on 03/10 in protest against the arrest of a quranic teacher suspected of having links with AS by the Rapid Response Unit (RRU). The protestors marched in the streets with placards calling for the immediate release of the teacher. On 02/10 sources reported similar demonstrations for the teacher's release in Laas Caanood. The RRU has transferred him to Hargeisa for further investigations.
People protested in Bishoftu against violence the day before during Iresha celebrations. Soldiers reportedly dispersed the protest violently.

A group of khat traders demonstrated in front of local government offices in Borama on 03/10 in protest against the new taxation rate issued by the local authority. Police arrived at the scene and arrested 5 people, after they refused police orders to disperse.
People protested against the government agenda in Dire town, Ada district, during the funeral service for a person killed the day before during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu.
People in Robe, Bale, protested against violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. All activities were closed in the town. Protests continued the following day.

Oromo students at Jimma universities Kito Furdisa campus protested against the government agenda following violence during Irecha festivities in Bishoftu the day before. The protest continued the following two days, involving students from all ethnicities and boycotting of meals.

People protested in Alem gena near Addis Ababa, against the government agenda following violence during Iresha festivities in Bishoftu three days prior.
People protested in Midega Tola, East Hararge, against the government agenda following violence during Iresha festivities in Bishoftu three days prior.
