People protested against the government agenda in Dire Dawa, following the death of dozens of people a few days prior during Iresha festivities in Bishoftu.

Local business people demonstrated in front of Tog Wajaale government offices on 07/10, near the main border crossing between Somaliland and Ethiopia. The demonstrators complained of tax hikes recently imposed by the local government. They also accused local government officials of excessive corruption and nepotism.
Students at Haramaya university boycotted meals in protest against the government agenda and the recent violence in Bishoftu during Iresha celebrations.
Students at Jimma University in Oromia protested against the state of emergency announced by the government the day before. Police reportedly arrested about 200 students during the protest.
Peaceful demonstration against the planned movement of a regional capital.
Arsi university students protested against the government agenda in Asela, Arsi.
Protesters blocked the busy Eldoret-Malaba highway after five guards were killed by unknown persons the previous evening. Police fired in the air to disperse the protesters.

Ceerigaabo frankincense traders demonstrated in front of the municipal office on 10/10. They were angry about a group of frankincense businessmen in Hargeisa who received funds from The World Bank by falsely claiming that they represent Ceerigaabo frankincense traders. They asked the town authorities to evict the Isma'ala Frankincense Company, which they accused of illegally surveying Ceerigaabo frankincense resources.
Isiolo County staff protest a work stoppage.
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.

Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.

Police in Burco conducted a security operation in the vicinity of Mohamed Ali neighbourhood in the evening of 14/10, and arrested youth suspected of being gangsters. Later, parents of the arrested youngsters gathered in front of the police station, and police fired several shots in the air to disperse them. No casualties are reported.
Elders protested a meeting at Chuka University on Saturday, accusing a patron of favouritism.
People protested against the government agenda in Kofele, west Arsi.

Somaliland authorities in Lugahaye destroyed illegally built houses on 15/10. The buildings where used for storing fuel and fish which are smuggled to Yemen. Several locals who have demonstrated against the demolition were arrested by the police.
Over 100,000 protested against the government agenda during the funeral of a civilian killed the week prior in Xaxaxo town, Meta Robi district.

Gonder residents in Amhara began a three day stay-at-home campaign to protest against the government agenda and the recently imposed state of emergency, paralysing schools, businesses and transportation in the town.

Puntland authorities destroyed illegally built houses along Garowe's roads on 22/10. The buildings were used for business and residence. Some of the owners were arrested after they demonstrated against the demolition.
The day following a clash between Gaaljacel militia and AMISOM, locals gather to protest the AMISOM presence, but are quickly dispersed by police.
Protesters attempted to enter the US Embassy at a demonstration to support Trump in Kampala. 2 men were arrested.

Hundreds of local residents staged a demonstration in Qorilugud (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 25/10. They were protesting the death sentence which Togdheer Regional Court handed to two men hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Soolomodaw sub-clan, who killed a man from Dhulbahante/Samokaab-Ahmed sub-clan in Burco on 14/03.

Borama public transport drivers conducted a peaceful demonstration in front of local government offices in Borama on 26/10 in protest against a new fee that been issued by the local government. The drivers were claiming that the fee has not been decided on in a legal manner by the local government committee, and was only decreed by the mayor.
On 26 October 2016, students at Moi University's Coast campus in Mombasa protested after lecturers have not been paid and classes have been disrupted.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a school teacher for unknown reason. Shortly thereafter, area residents organized a protest to call for justice in the death.

Women, youth and elders from Warsangeli/Nuux-Cumar sub-clan staged a demonstration against Puntland in Yubbe village (62km SE of Ceerigaabo) on 27/10. The demonstrators were chanting anti-Puntland slogans alleging failed promises made to Warsangeli/Nuux-Cumar. The motive of this demonstration remains unclear yet it seems that their sub-clan candidate has failed to be elected to one of Puntland's upper house seats.
Residents of Muranga protest after the local county bought land below market price. The demonstrators attempted to enter county officers, but were dispersed by police.
Students of Nyabururu Girls High School in Kisii County are protesting the interdiction of their principal after reports of abuse.
Police disperse an anti-corruption protest with tear gas.

Ethiopian police arrested at least 38 South Sudanese university students from the universities of Mekelle, Bardar, Jimma, Awasa and Technical Vocational Training Institute (TVET) on government scholarships after they protested in front of their embassy in Addis Abeba against delayed living stipend over the past 14 months. A representative of the students claimed that the South Sudan acting ambassador ordered their arrest. The students were reportedly released five days later after having been beaten in jail.

On 3 November 2016, police beat anti-corruption protesters with batons and fired volleys of tear gas to disperse them from the location at Uhuru Park. They also attacked journalists covering the protests.
Residents of Uruku in Meru on Saturday held demonstrations outside Uruku police post protesting the death of a suspect in one of the cells.
Jubilee supporters protest at the appointment by the Deputy President. Police made arrests.

A group of people staged a demonstration in Barhada roundabout in Garowe in the morning of 05/11. They accused some of the elders involved in the selection of the members of Somalia's Lower House of nepotism. The protesters chanted anti-traditional elder's slogans and called for the intervention of the international community.
On 7 November 2016, over 50 Kisumu based journalists protested against police brutality.
Report of up to 85 prisoners killed at Tolay military camp in Jimma after they protested harsh punishment in the form of physical labor and starvation.
Taxi operators protest competition from Uber in Nairobi.
Dozens of students from Kisii Universitys Eldama Ravine campus demonstrated against the closure of the university.

An AMISOM soldier guarding Galmudug State House shot and killed one of the electoral delegates in front of the election venue in Cadaado on the morning 16/11. The slain delegate, who was protesting against the process of the election, reportedly barred other delegates from the entering the election venue and this provoked the AMISOM soldier to shoot him. The perpetrator was arrested.
Overnight protest by students at Jimma university against the detention of fellow students by security forces. Soldiers arrested 28 students in relations to the protest.
Soldiers arrested 18 protesting students in Bale in the week of 20 November.
On 20 November 2016, hundreds of National Youth Service (NYS) cohorts in Chuka protested that they could not access their savings. They chanted anti-Jubilee slogans.
Students at Walaga university in Nekemt protested on campus. Gunfire was being heard (source unknown).
Students at Ambo university protested increased harassment by soldiers stationed on campus. Several were reportedly injured in their response to the protest.
Students at Ambo university protested for a second day. Soldiers fired tear gas to prevent them from getting out of their rooms.
Students at Jimma university protested on campus. They were reportedly beaten by soldiers.
On 22 November 2016, Uber drivers demonstrated in Nairobi over low prices.

2nd and 4th year students of veterinary pharmacy at Gonder University boycotted class complaining about lack of qualified teachers. Soldiers arrested 104 in response to the protests and suspended them from school for the academic year the following week.
Traders protest forced eviction in Isiolo.
Workers of a tea company strike and protest over pay.

AS abducted a businessman from Ceel Gamboole village (48km NW of Jowhar) on the afternoon of 28/11. The abductee hails from Galjecel/Caloofi sub-clan. The local residents staged a demonstration demanding his release.
On 28 November 2016, activists demonstrated to protest against rising cases of sexual and gender-based violence in Uhuru Park, Nairobi.

Residents of Kathwana in Tharaka-Nithi demonstrated over a statement made by the Deputy President which appeared to suggest the national government does not recognise the town as the counties headquarters.

Students at Woldia university protested against the government agenda at Woldia university, specifically denouncing the political and economic domination by Tigrayan oligarchs in the region, defying the state of emergency. At least 45 were arrested.

Construction workers employed by a foreign company demonstrated in Xumba Wayne area against what they claimed to be low wages and delayed payment of salaries. The workers are working at a dam construction project funded by the UAE Red Crescent.
Students at Woldia university boycotted classes, demanding the release of their colleagues arrested for protesting three days prior.
CSOs held a march to protest a proposed bill to exempt MPs from paying taxes
On 8 December 2016, striking doctors and nurses protested in Kitui town as a country-wide boycott enters its fourth day.

A group of Puntland soldiers interrupted and stopped a reconciliation meeting between Puntland and Galmudug local authorities which was taking place at the green line market in the morning of 12/12. The soldiers, who were complaining of delayed salaries, then moved on to the Puntland bank and briefly took control of it. They later moved back to their base after their commanders intervened.

Residents of Haybe Yaabe village held a peaceful demonstration in front of Borama local authority's office to protest against a perceived lack of response to water scarcity in the town and the absence of local government officials from the town. The demonstrators demanded the election of a new local council. The police did not intervene.
Police arrest three and use tear gas during an anti-government corruption protest in Kenya. No violence reported from the protesters.
Residents 'recently' protest the high number of traffic accidents in the area.
Migori government workers strike and protest over pay.

A group from women from the Milk Marketers Association held a demonstration in front of the local government offices following a directive of new taxes targeting the milk business. The local government had previously seized vehicles transporting milk after they refused to pay the taxes. However, the mayor of Borama intervened and told the demonstrators that the new policy has been rescinded, effectively ending the demonstrations.
Nurses at the Nyeri County Referral Hospital have on 16/12 held a peaceful demonstration protesting over delayed payments and promotions.
Students protest at Wollo University
Lawmakers from major opposition parties in Kenya staged a walkout from a parliamentary session to protest the passage of a contentious legal provision.

The Somaliland authorities in Lowyacado destroyed several illegal structures that are used for selling smuggled goods. The area residents refused to vacate the area and demonstrated against the destruction of the structures.
A group of students and school teachers demonstrated in Garbodadar village over lack of facilities and insufficient number of teachers. Police dispersed the demonstrators but made no arrests.
Workers are demonstrating and striking to protest sexual harassment at a Chinese-owned construction company.
Around 500 people held a demonstration to call for the protection of elephants and the banning of the ivory trade.

A sitting-in protest in front of PL Parliament, took place this morning comprising mainly, women and children, (max 30-40). The group was non-violent and were addressed by some Parliamentarians. The protest is in relation to the fluctuation of Somali shilling against the dollar and general complaints of goods being expensive in the market.
A number of youth are arrested after a demonstration during the Epiphany celebration in Lafto sub-city, Addis Ababa.

On 19 January 2017, Egerton University lecturers protested in Nakuru. Lecturers in several parts of the country defied a court order and began their strike for the government to implement a 2013 pay rise agreement.

On 19 January 2017, Machakos University lecturers protested on Makueni-Machakos road. Lecturers in several parts of the country defied a court order and began their strike for the government to implement a 2013 pay rise agreement. Machakos University lecturers protested on Makueni-Machakos road.
Puntland Darawish forces withdrew from Qandala to Laag area in protest of salary issues from the government.
On 19 January 2017, medical students in Nairobi protested disruptions to their studies during the doctors' strike.
Three are killed in a land dispute in Kanyakwar. The following day a group protest at the office of the 'assistant chief', claiming he 'had a hand in the dispute.'
On 22 January 2017, residents in Kitungati village (Kitui) blocked police from removing the body of a man killed the day before by Somali militants.
Youth in Isiolo Town protest over what they termed as delays in the vetting process for issuing national identification cards.
Protesters force an ODM rally in Changamwe to end prematurely.
Tea farmers on Kirinyaga protest against the sale of company land. Location not known.

A large crowd demonstrated at Dal Jirka Dahsoon monument in support of International Court of Justice (ICJ) decision regarding the Somali - Kenya maritime border dispute. Banadir Regional Administration officials attended the rally and addressed the crowd.

A group of single men have gone public to protest over the inflated dowry in Somalia. In the photos, the Somali men holding signs that read 'Still I am Single', where said to have held their protest at the Mansoor hotel in Hargeisa. According to them, they said the brides' parents are extorting men through the inflated bride price in the country.
On 6 February 2017, a protest was held over the death of a motorist who was hit by a speeding vehicle. Protesters called on the government to erect speed bumps.

A group of people peacefully demonstrated at Alaybaday in connection to a SLP officer who was arrested by Ethiopian liyuu police on 01 February 2017. The demonstrators demanded for the release of the police officer and for immediate action to be taken by Somaliland authorities on the issue.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in front of Burao Central Police Station after it was reported that part of police station was sold to private businessmen. The reports were later confirmed to be true. Police fired warning shots in an attempt to disperse the demonstrators which failed. Three demonstrators were injured.

Vendors at Burao main meat and vegetable market closed their businesses and demonstrated at the main street. Demonstrators later marched to the office of the Governor where they demonstrated for several hours. The vendors protested due to the difference in exchange rate of the US Dollar.
Youths protest during an address by the Kisii governor at Ekona. The demonstrators were demanding better government services.
Residents protest in Subukia after a student is killed the previous day by 'thugs.'

A small group of protesters, mainly airport casual workers and transporters, gathered near Jazeera hotel on airport road at the temporary residence of the newly-elected president. The protesters protested against a newly-established and locally-owned commercial transport company that operated from its office at KM 4 near CP 1 area which took control of the business of ferrying passengers and their luggage to the main airport terminal inside MIA.

A group of former casual port workers demonstrated outside Mogadishu sea port for about an hour over the change of management of the port by a foreign company. The port workers chanted slogans against the company which made them jobless. He requested the newly-elected President to remove the company from port administration. There were no reports of casualties during the demonstration.
On 14 February 2017, university lecturers protested in Nairobi after doctors were jailed for refusing to call off their strike. They are also protesting over low wages.

150 individuals, working in a vehicle rental company, demonstrated peacefully in Burao. The demonstrator protested against the oil exploration company for being biased when issuing contracts. The company issued a warning stating that they would be forced to react if no action would be taken.

A group of people, said to be relatives of seven AS members who were executed by Puntland Military Judicial Court, conducted a peaceful demonstration in Gaaca area near the office of the Governor, in protest to the decision made by the Bari Military Court. Four protesters were reported to be arrested by police.

An AMISOM Caspir hit and damaged a civilian vehicle that was exiting a nearby garage at Afisyoni road in Waberi district. Students and angry civilian bystanders blocked the AMISOM convoy. Police forces intervened and the incident was discussed with the AMISOM commanders. There were no reports of human casualties.
Kilif nurses protest unpaid allowances.

Residents of Cadale district in Middle Shabelle region protested against the nomination of the cabinet of the President of Hirshabelle. A large demonstration was attended by local intellectuals and traditional elders. The various communities in that area expressed their rejection to the ministers that the president appointed.

The residence of Qoryale peacefully demonstrated over the arrests made of civilians by the local municipality without any charges. It was reported that the Mayor ordered for the arrest of an unspecified number of civilians.
Clinical officers in Narok County on 22/02 staged demonstrations and camped outside the county headquarters demanding promotions and harmonisation of their salaries.

Hundreds of people who hailed from Jarar weyne clans demonstrated on the main street of Beletweyne town. They chanted slogans against the President of Hirshabelle after he appointed 23 cabinet members on 20 February 2017 in Jowhar town. The Jarar weyne clans of Somali Bantu, allegedly, expressed satisfaction with their portion of the appointed minsters. There were no reports of causalities.
Traditional leaders, elders and community members in Borama protested against the extension of the fence of an airstrip by the Borama Municipality towards the nearby neighbouring community farms.
Striking universities lecturers hold a peaceful demonstrations in Nairobi to demand implementation of a 2013-2017 collective bargaining agreement.
A protest was reported in Chinaksan, East Hararge against invasion and killings by Liyu Police. Protesters demand the Liyu Police and Federal troops leave the area.
Boda boda riders in Maralal Town held demonstrations over alleged misappropriation of funds meant for construction of shades.

Vendors at Burao closed their businesses and demonstrated at the main street and later marched to the Office of the Governor in protest to the rising inflation of the Somaliland Shilling to the US Dollar. The demonstration lasted for several hours. The regional authorities promised to resolve the issue and deal with forex traders.
Protests reported in Babile, with demonstrators taking to the streets to demand the removal of federal troops from the region.

People in Xidhxidh (75km NE of Buhodle and 43 W of Lasanod) took the streets in condemnation of the recent clashes between SLA and Militiamen from Kalabaydh. The demonstrator strongly condemned SLA and gave full support to the militiamen. Some of the demonstrators were in military uniform and displayed heavy weapons. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Local business people in Suuq-Boocle Market, Dharkenley district briefly closed the market protesting against extortion by municipal government tax collectors. They requested government officials' intervention in this issue. No incident was reported during the peaceful demonstration.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.
On 6 March 2017, a peaceful demonstration was held in Borama, Awdal region, where civilians protested against the local government and perceived ineffectiveness of the response to the drought.
Protest in the Rhamu over a proposed county budget.

A 6 year old girl was found dead at the periphery of Adado town. Three suspects were arrested in which a woman among the detainees admitted to the crime. The local residents demonstrated against the killing of the young girl after which the security forces opened gun fire on the crowd, killing a man.

Angry Loliondo residents block the road trying to prevent a convoy carrying legislators from the Parliamentary Lands, Natural Resources and Tourism Committee, from leaving the area before solving their problems in Arusha Region.

It was reported that Galmudug Police forces abandoned the police headquarters and other government facilities in Cadado town in protest of unpaid salaries. Galmudug officials did not release any statement regarding this issue.

For a second day former Berbera port workers demonstrated in protest of their company management strategy. Protesters gathered at Hargeisa - Berbera - Burao junction roundabout and later dispersed. No incident was reported but tension remains high.
The Dulbahante Liberation Front organised an Anti-Somaliland (SL) demonstration in Buhodle in protest of SL-Khatumo talks and requesting SL Administration to leave the area.
People peacefully demonstrated in Erigabo town to denounce the embezzlement of food donations intended for the victims of the drought.
Residents of Lasanod rallied to protest continuous inflation and rising commodity prices. The demonstration ended peacefully.
A group protests poor security following a spate of attack from Somali 'bandits.'
In the town of Burqa Tirtira, Ethiopian military personnel have violently repressed an opposition rally, wounding 3 people and arresting 16 more.
Police officers 'torture' a youth for unknown reason. A protest against the act followed.
Dozens of residents from Sook, West Pokot County held a protest in Kapenguria over corruption and mismanagement of the county's bursary fund.
A group of several minor political parties protest at the office of the electoral commission to demand a meeting with leadership in an effort of moving an electoral deadline.
Protests denoucing the Liyu Police invasion into Oromiya state were conducted. Protests were peaceful and no injuries were reported.

Security forces opened fire on a group of people protesting house demolitions in Bahir dar, killing 2. A young girl was also killed in the stampede that ensued as people frantically fled the area. The Ethiopian government has put forth plans to demolish 2,500 houses in the area.
Kenyans in Namanga [border town] demonstrated against Tanzanian leader John Magufuli on Monday [27 March], saying he had deported their counterparts.
Protest against an oil company in Burco. A similar protest took place the following day.
Beach operators protest against a competitor's construction of a sea wall.
Fighters of Ahlu Sunna Waljama'a (ASWJ) protested at the group's headquarters in Dhuusamarreeb to protest of the non-payment of their salaries.
Oodweyne residents demonstrated against oil exploration in the region by a Chinese company. The police did not intervene and the demonstration ended peacefully.
Protest against an oil company in Burco. A similar protest took place the following day.
When police blocked Hassan Joho's supporters and the press from following him into the police headquarters, the supporters protested in the streets of Mombasa.
Secondary students from Ambo town protested the arrest and detainment of political prisoners. Several students were arrested following the protest.

Residents of Kisumu protested peacefully over a delay in the opening of a mall. The opening has been delayed by ambiguities of bank loan payments. The protest was led by the director of Youth Reconciliation Forum of Kenya Eric Okello.
Fishermen demonstrated in front of the office of the coast guard of Awdal against foreign fishing vessels in Somaliland waters.
Traders at Arua Park held a peaceful demonstration to protest an increase in rent. A private security guard shot at the protesters, killing 1.
It was reported that workers at Berbera port stopped working due to lack of proper contracts from DP World. The demonstration ended peacefully.
Sex workers protest at the deputy county commissioner's office demanding justice after a murder of a colleague.
Sex workers in Mombasa staged a protest after a colleague was murdered by a client.

205 medical interns at Mulago National Referral Hospital and its subordinate hospitals of Kiruddu and Kawempe protested over their three months allowance arrears, paralysing operations at the hospitals.
Security personnel deployed at Conoco airfield abandoned their position due to unpaid salaries. The security forces later returned to the airfield.
Dozens of Kisumu residents protested over an alleged plot by the government to auction a local Sh4.2 billion mall.
Residents protesting the demolition of homes by the Ethiopian military were fired upon by federal military troops. 1 fatality and several injuries were reported.
Somaliland forces arrest three journalists covering a demonstration in Hargeysa. The nature of the protest is not known.

Supporters of MP Paul Otuoma of ODM protested the announcement of provisional results of the ODM Busia Governor nominations. Supporters shouted at the chairman of the county elections board and security agents had to take two men out of the hall, where the results where announced.

Protests broke out in Kabete, Kiambu County on 15/04 following the disappearance of a parliamentary aspirant. The politician was reported missing the previous night, while his car, riddled with bullet holes, was found early Saturday in Gitaru. The fate of his person is not known.
ODM party has cancelled nomination results for Khwisero constituency due to irregularities, resulting in protests. No reports of violence

The Rwandan community in Uganda and their friends took part in a Walk to Remember at the Uganda Christian University (UCU), Mukono Uganda.The walk was organised by the students studying at the University and the Rwanda High Commission in Uganda. They carried banners and placards with messages denouncing genocide ideology.
Members and supporters of ODM protest the use of IEBC registers during party primaries.

Some 55 cashewnut farmers from Lihimalyao village in Kilwa District, Lindi Region demonstrated to District Commissioner's office to seek government intervention over delay to receive their payment from a local cooperative union.
Jubilee supporters held protests in Baringo (in Kabarnet town) following accusations that the primaries were rigged.

Senior three students staged a sit down strike on Tuesday evening at Kabale Brainstrom high school protesting the delay by the school administration to avail them new uniforms. They also accused the administration of 'torturing' during punishment.
Business owners in Borama, Awdal region, took to the streets to protest against the inflation of the Somaliland shilling on 18 April.

A group of people demonstrated peacefully in Jowhar town against the arrest of a director of an NGO and the closure of the only hospital serving the community in the town. The man was later released by Hirshabelle authorities. Police opened fire to disperse the crowd. There were no reports of casualties.
Dr Thuo Mathenge and his supporters protest outside Jubilee Party headquarters in Pangani on April 19, 2017 over the outcome of Nyeri governorship nomination.
Hundreds of Ugandans protested against Chinese traders and businesses.
A group of people at an aid distribution site in Dharkenley district protested during the distribution of aid donated by an INGO.

In Embu, voting in various parts was disrupted by a group of aspirants amid claims of rigging. Led by Runyenjes MP Cecily Mbarire and Manyatta MP John Muchiri, the aspirants stormed Kirimari Secondary School, where the ballot papers were being supplied, and demanded that the process be halted.
Police disperse crowds protesting the against the delayed polling material for the Jubilee primaries.
Supporters of MP Badi Twalib and aspirant Dan Aloo demonstrated outside a polling station over delays in the start of voting.
Anti-riot police disperse angry voters at Hola who were prevented from voting by the agents of a gubernatorial aspirant

GSU officers disperse angry supporters of Nicholas Wanyepe who were on April 23, 2017 protesting at the ODM Kilifi officers after he lost the Kilifi South parliamentary ticket to businessman Ken Chonga
FORD-Kenya supporters burned their ballot papers at Masaba primary school, Kiminini after it was learned that other papers were not sent elsewhere in the constituency.
Protests in Mwea, Kirinyaga County as voters apprehend returning officer and hand him to over police over allegations of rigging in Jubilee primaries.

Communities in Muhanga Town Council, Kabale District are protesting the increase in the cost of water supplied by National Water and Sewerage Corporation-NWSC.They accuse National Water and Sewerage Corporation of estimating consumption prior to billing adding that often, units reflected on the water bills are always different from the reading on their meters
Residents of Kabale are protesting closure of the operations of Kabale Youth and Elderly Association, a non-government organisation. The organisation has been operational for the last seven years.
A crowd of people protested about the construction that was ongoing on a disputed land. Police fired warning shots to disperse the crowd. There were no reports of casualties.

There was chaos at Kanja Primary School in Embu during the Jubilee Party nominations after a group of youths prevented Runyenjes MP Cecily Mbarire from forming a second stream at the centre. The youths protested outside the poll centre and threatened to eject Ms Mbarire

Police fired shots in the air to quell chaos that erupted in Homa Bay following the declaration of incumbent Governor Cyprian Awiti winner in the Orange Democratic Movement nominations.Police were called in to contain the situation after supporters of his opponents vowed not to accept the result of the hotly contested nomination, in which he was facing off with Kasipul MP Oyugi Magwanga and businessman Sammy Wakiaga
ODM supporters at Kariokor polling station (Nairobi - Starehe) protested when the authorities announced that the ODM Nairobi primaries had been cancelled.
Voters in Bonchari protested the fact that the incumbent MP was given a direct nomination in the primaries. Voting was suspended.

Workers and farmers attached to Chemelil Sugar Company have called for resignation of top managers, accusing them of poor performance.The workers, who staged protests said the management and the board have failed to pay farmers and transporters since 2014.

In Kisumu town, police used teargas canisters to disperse youths who were protesting the award of the ODM ticket to Kisumu central MP Ken Obura.The youths argued that Mr Obura had been rigged in at the expense of Gem Central MCA Fred Ouda. An entourage of boda boda riders led by Kisumu governor Jack Ranguma, who were protesting the win of senator Anyang' Nyong'o for the ODM governorship ticket, were caught in the melee.Hundreds of Mr Ouda's supporters thronged the streets chanting his slogans.

A large crowd of people gathered in Jowhar at Balcad and Warshiekh districts of Hirshabelle state in protest of the decision of FGS to suspend flights carrying khat to Hirshabelle State Airport. The dispute between government and the khat business community was later resolved. There were no reports of casualties.
There were protests in Kiamaina ward in Bahati following cases of missing names in the register.
Somalia forces opened fire on protesters in the central town of Beledweyne, injuring three. The protest over the ban of khat in the area.
Nyali residents protested the decision of the ODM election tribunal in Mombasa on 26/04/2017. The tribunal recommended repeating Nyali MP nominations.
Jubilee voters in Mvita, Mombasa, protested when they realised that names were missing from the ballot papers.
Jubilee supporters protested at polling stations in Kiamaina (south of Gingalili village) over names missing from the register.
Jubilee supporters in Kabazi blocked voting temporarily to protest the low numbers of ballot papers available.

Buganda Kingdom wants Kigo Prison Primary School relocated.This comes days after Buganda Land Board announced that the school will be relocated to Nakawuka village, a distance of nearly 20km away.But on Thursday, pupils, teachers and some parents held a peaceful protest at the school appealing to the Kabaka to prevail over BLB and spare their school
Jubilee supporters in Nairobi protested when Maina Kamanda won the primaries.

Residents of South Horr protested against the cancellation of the nominations in the Jubilee Coalition primary elections on 28/04/2017. They sat on the border of Samburu and Marsabit counties questioning why the nominations are held in the neighbouring Samburu and all other wards in Marsabit county but not in South Horr. No fatalities. The source does not indicate the exact time of the event.
Youth in Naivasha protested the incumbent governor's defeat in the primaries.

Several Wadaani party supporters demonstrated in Berbera to demand the release of the two Wadaani Officials arrested in Hargeisa two weeks ago. Protestors marched peacefully on the main road to the party main office in the centre of Berbera. No arrests or injuries were reported.
Residents of Mairo Inya township in Ndaragwa protest along the streets against alleged rigging out of Ndaragwa MP Waweru Ndiritu

Transport in Busia Town was disrupted for more than one hour Monday as matatu operators held a demonstration to protest the deplorable condition of the main bus park and roads.The protesters planted banana tubers in numerous potholes around the park and nearby roads.Traders also joined the protest, saying they have been losing customers because the roads are rendered impassable when it rains.
ODM youths protested in Langata when the primary results were announced.
Supporters of candidates who had lost the Jubilee primaries thronged outside the Jubilee headquarters (Nairobi - Westlands) to protest for their candidates.
The announcement that Prof Nyong'o had trounced Governor Jack resulted in protests in an unspecified location.

Over 15 Makerere University students have been arrested for taking part in the demonstration that took place today morning at the main campus. Students went on strike protesting the failure by the university to release their results for the last semester, failure to issue Identity Cards to first year students and transcripts to graduates. The police fired teargas and rubber bullets to disperse students and by press time the situation was looking a bit calm.

Business in Kitgum town is back to normal following a protest by passengers at Kitgum Bus Park on Wednesday that led to police firing gunshots.The development came when Bus operators woke up and found the park under lock and key after the Kitgum Central Division officials maintained that no bus would be allowed to exit the park without paying a daily levy
Demonstrations were in most of the major towns in Nyandarua on Thursday afternoon following claims a woman representative hopeful rigged nominations.

Doctors protest over unpaid salaries. Medical interns posted in government hospitals across the country have protested against the reversal without explanation of salaries that were paid into their bank accounts 'last week.' (Source dated 16/05) At least 335 out of a total 725 interns posted in different State hospitals are pointing fingers at their employer, the Ministry of Health, for the confusion.

At least 396 traders in Arusha City yesterday vowed to close shops in protest of an order issued by authorities requiring them to vacate their rented premises. The traders, who own shops in rented buildings at the main bus terminal, have arrived at the decision following an ownership dispute related to the premises. Already, ward councillors in Arusha city have allied with the traders in the row, against City executive director Athuman Kihamia. The councillors have reported the matter to the President's Office Regional Administration and Local Government (Polarg), accusing Mr Kihamia of failing to honour the councillors' decision on matters of public procurement procedures.

Demonstrations erupted in Eldoret after it emerged that Jubilee was planning to repeat the primaries at the station. Unknown people attacked three Governor Jackson Mandago's campaigners (Jubilee Party). No fatalities.
Presiding officers and clerks hired by Jubilee Party during the Nakuru County nominations on Friday staged a demonstration to demand for their pay at the party regional headquarters in Milimani.
Ngecha residents demonstrated on 07/05/2017 urging the government to prevent crime in the area. The demonstration was sparked by recent murders.

Police in the eastern Mbale District last Sunday shot and injured three people, who were partaking in a protest against suspected thieves living inside a police barracks. According to AIGP Kasingye, in the heat of the scuffle, a police officer Habib Sunday (SP) opened fire, shot and injured three of the protesters.

Three people were shot and injured by police at Kyengera trading centre in Wakiso District as taxi operators used live bullets and tear gas to stop taxi operators who operate at Kibuye - Kyengera stage who were demonstrating against what they referred to as oppressive policies imposed on to them by their colleagues.
Afternoon, Cadaado, Galgaduud: unpaid Galmudug soldiers occupied the Galmudug administration headquarters over their unpaid wages.

Njiru residents held demonstration early today in protest of a hit and run accident.The residents claim a young man was last night hit by a driver who did not bother to stop the car or take the man to the hospital.The angry demonstrates blocked the road bringing all activities in the area to a standstill.

Teachers took to the streets of Iten town to protest an alleged grabbing of 100 acres of land belonging to Prime Time Sacco (PTS), formerly Keiyo Teachers Sacco (KTS). The protest brought teachers from Keiyo and Marakwet with unions from two Sub-Counties meeting in Iten town to fight for their rights in the Eldoret land valued at Sh3 billion. Led by Keiyo Kenya National Union of Teachers (KNUT) Executive Secretary, Musa Busienei, the teachers said they legally purchased the land from National Social Security Fund in 2004 but Kenya Prisons and MTRH later laid claim to the same land.

A boda boda rider has died Tuesday morning after a collision with a KDF truck in Isiolo Town.There was tension as angry locals threatened to set a blaze the truck.They were also threatening to lynch the driver of the lorry.Police officers had to shoot in the air to disperse the crowd and allow them to collect the body of the boda boda rider.Two other people were seriously injured in the crash and were rushed to the Isiolo County Referral Hospital.

16 May around 200 Darawish soldiers loyal to a former pirates' leader, Isse Yulux, withdrew from Qandala to Unuun area (ca.100km southwest of Qandala) as a form of protest due to delayed salary payments.

Four Makerere University students have been arrested at Buganda Road Magistrate's Court where they had gone to attend the hearing of a case against Dr Stella Nyanzi who is charged with computer misuse. The students, donning the Makerere University gowns, said government should release Dr Nyanzi because they are missing her lectures. The students, whose details could not be readily established, were taken to Kampala Central Police Station.

Medical interns posted in government hospitals across the country have protested against the reversal without explanation of salaries that were paid into their bank accounts 'last week.' (Source dated 16/05) At least 335 out of a total 725 interns posted in different State hospitals are pointing fingers at their employer, the Ministry of Health, for the confusion.

Operations of Kotido Chief Magistrate's court hang in balance after unidentified protesters took off with the court keys on Friday. It all started after Kotido chief magistrate, Charles Yeteise fined a businessman Shs 300,000 for transporting a lorry of charcoal from the district without a license. Residents protested when they learnt that the businessman had bought back the impounded charcoal.

University students from around the country protested against the employment policy of the Standard Gauge Railway construction in Voi on 12/05/2017. They blocked the Nairobi-Mombasa highway, accusing the China Roads and Bridges Company of employing foreigners, even though the President had ordered the company employ locals. Seven youth were arrested by the police, because of blocking the highway. No fatalities.

Police Paramilitary Unit (Birmadka) from Alhamdulilah and Qardho staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Armo Police Academy in demand of two months' unpaid salaries. There were no reports of casualties or arrests.
residents of Ndarangwa protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.
residents of Ol Kalou protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.
residents of Miharati protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.
residents of Engineer protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.

residents of Kinangop protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations. The protesters engage in running battles with police.
Police in Masaka District stopped a planned rally in Nyendo-Masaka by Mukono Municipality MP and Masaka Municipality MP without using the usual tactics of firing teargas.

One person was shot dead and another injured during protests in Nyandarua town on Saturday evening. Anti-riot police were forced to fire in the air to disperse the residents who accused the Judiciary of overturning the will of the people.The residents were protesting the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.

Residents in Igayaza Trading Centre in Birembo Sub-county, Kakumiro District protested against the proposed diversion of the road. Police from Kakumiro dispersed the few residents who had been incited by some local leaders.

Kakamega journalists held a peaceful demonstration over increasing attacks and threats against them from police and politicians. They demonstrated along the busy Kakamega-Mumias Road from Shianda market to Mumias East Sub-County offices and presented a petition to Deputy County Commissioner Willy Cheboi.
Hoima Road workers impound equipment over non-payment. The workers threatened to impoundmore equipment unless the company clears their wages worth Shillings 10M.

The Kenya County Government Workers Union recalled all their Nairobi members from their work station on Wednesday morning to hold a protest march at City Hall (Nairobi - Starehe). The workers are protesting over unpaid April salaries, although the county government received Sh1.021 billion from National Treasury on Tuesday to pay off the salaries.

Scores of residents took to the streets in support of area Jubilee gubernatorial candidate, Anne Waiguru, from claims that she was involved in the NYS scandal. The residents, who held a peaceful demonstration in Kutus town, accused MPs who want Waiguru barred from vying for the seat in August of having a sinister agenda. Led by the county Jubilee interim committee treasurer, Rose Njeru, the protestors warned that they would disrupt polls in the county if Waiguru was barred.
Supporters of Murang'a governorship aspirant Mwangi wa Iria protest outside Milimani Law Courts (Nairobi - Westlands) in Nairobi on May 19, 2017
Dr Thuo Mathenge and his supporters protest outside Jubilee Party headquarters in Pangani on April 19, 2017 over the outcome of Nyeri governorship nomination.

21 May: Hundreds of residents of Erigavo demonstrated against the visit of Somaliland Minister of Education who threatened to close one of the secondary schools in Erigavo. The demonstration ended peacefully.
Striking nurses protest in Nyeri town on May 22, 2017
Hundreds of coffee farmers in Embu County held demonstrations at Manyatta market, protesting delays in paying their salaries.
Presiding Officers (POs) and clerks who oversaw Jubilee party's primaries took to the streets of Kericho town to protest the party's bureaucracy and delays in paying them their salaries.
Women protest demanding a man accused of sodomising local children be convicted and jailed.
Students stage a protest in Dandii, central Oromiya.

Two people were injured after supporters of Tharaka-Nithi Governor Samuel Ragwa and Chuka/Igambang'ombe MP Muthomi Njuki clashed at Marimanti town. The group supporting MP Muthomi marched on the highway waving placards against Governor Ragwa. The group supporting Mr Ragwa ran after the other group hurling stones.
ANC party representative's supporters protested against the Independent Electoral Commission (IEBC) after the candidate's name was missing from the IEBC register list.

Lamu residents demonstrated in Malindi on 30/05/2017 against a court case regarding a wind energy project in Baharini in Mpeketoni, Lamu. They called for a withdrawal of a case on land set aside for the project and protesting against the delays that the court case will cause to the project. No fatalities nor injuries are reported.
Two motorists were shot and severely injured during a demonstration against police officers in Moyale town.
Over 300 workers at Kigezi Highland Tea in Kabale district protested over unpaid wages for the last seventeen months
Silent protests against Kenyatta and Ruto over the results of the primaries. In Laikipia, hundreds of residents carried the banners of independent Nderitu Mureithi.
President Kenyatta's convoy faced protests by youth supporting independent candidates in Karatina, Othaya and Nyeri towns
President Kenyatta's convoy faced protests by youth supporting independent candidates in Karatina, Othaya and Nyeri towns
Silent protests against Kenyatta and Ruto over the results of the Jubilee primaries. In Ol Kalou in Nyandarua County, hundreds of residents carried Wanjiku Muhia's banners.
President Kenyatta's convoy faced protests by youth supporting independent candidates in Karatina, Othaya and Nyeri towns.
Dissenting supporters of the Jubilee coalition protested against President Uhuru Kenyatta and his deputy William Ruto over their interference in local intra-Jubilee electoral contests
Nurses in Kisii hold demonstrations to protest failure by the national and county governments to honour CBA
Nurses protested at the County Referral Hospital in Voi. Wards remained deserted as patients were collected by relatives.

Hundreds of demonstrators took to the streets of Afmadow town (c. 120 km North West of Kismayo) protesting about the current Jubbaland local administration. The demonstration was partially related to the arrest of locals who criticized the local clan distribution of the administration. A demonstrator was injured after a Jubbaland local police officer opened fire to disperse the crowd. The victim was taken to a private pharmacy for treatment.

Protests in Ambo erupted after a plan to re-arrange the Oromo alphabet was revealed by the Ethiopian education authority. 50 students were arrested, and 2 students died due to severe beatings received during transfer to prison facilities. One student died in a hospital in Ambo, the second in Addis Ababa. Six police officers are being held in connection to the deaths.
Nurses, striking for two weeks, hold a protest in Kisumu.
Nurses, striking for two weeks, hold a protest in Nairobi.
Residents of Muhoroni took to the streets to protest against the candidature of former MP Ayiecho Olweny.
200 survivors of the 2008 election violence in Kiambaa gathered to call on politicians to avoid hate speech in the election campaign.
A group of elderly women from Ngangarithi held a protest against grabbing of a wetland by private developers.
Continued protests against the changing of the Oromo Alphabet were reportedly being held by students in Ambo.

Three people including two pupils were injured after they were shot by security officers in Mbale District. Shooting happened as the security officers tried to disperse residents who were demonstrating over land.
Police fired bullets and arrested hundreds of supporters of Bobi Wine who were protesting against the rigging of six ballot boxes by NRM's Sitenda Sebalu supporters.
A student was allegedly shot by a police officer in Rakai District as they dispersed a demonstration following a teacher dismissal. He is recovering at Mulago Hospital.
A group of Dervish soldiers withdrew from Galgala to Sugure area (c. 35 km South West of Bossaso) due to unpaid salaries. Security officials initiated mediation.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.

Locals demonstrated against the rejection of the Somali shilling in Beletweyne. The demonstrators were disgruntled by the decision made by business people and other companies of refraining from trading with the Somali shilling. The chief elder and other community leaders spoke with the protestors and requested them to disperse as they would work on resolving the issue.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.
Hundreds of supporters of Governor Nathif Jama on Tuesday poured to the streets over reports that his Sh5.2 billion bank account has been frozen.
Protests in Belet Weyne after rumours or counterfeit currency was being circulated.
Hundreds of Uchumi Supermarket workers took to the streets to protest non-payment of their salaries since May.
Protests in Guri-Ceel after counterfeit bank notes are circulated.
Residents in Karatina town, marched in the streets protesting the disqualification of Mr Mathenge candidacy to run for the elections
Three people carrying a coffin marked with President Yoweri Museveni's name were arrested in Mbarara, after holding the mock funeral procession despite police orders not to gather for a protest.

Residents waving placrads, twigs and blowed vuvuzelas stormed the IEBC offices in Nyeiry Town demanding an audience with the county elections manager. Armed administration officers blocked them from accessing the offices.
Bossaso market was shut down as there were protests due to the new taxation levied by government of Puntland took place.
Nurses in Kissi chanted songs, waved placards and staged a mock burial for Council of Governors Chairman and Salaries and Remuneration Commission (SRC) in protest at low salaries.

A tax levied by authorities on 'estimated sales' on small businesses has sparked protests in several regions of the country. In Chelenko and Chero towns of West Hararghe, protesting residents went to the office of the local administration and disrupted a cabinet meeting. Businesses were closed for the day in the towns.

A tax levied by authorities on 'estimated sales' on small businesses has sparked protests in several regions of the country. In Chelenko and Chero towns of West Hararghe, protesting residents went to the office of the local administration and disrupted a cabinet meeting. Businesses were closed for the day in the towns.

A tax levied by authorities on 'estimated sales' on small businesses has sparked protests in several regions of the country. Protesters in Nazreth (Adama) blocked roads and took to the streets in protest.

Pokot and Tugen herders clash for several hours in Kapkechir after an attack by the Pokot. The Pokot attackers killed four Tugen herder and stole their cattle. The attack led to a protest in nearby Mochongoi.
A group in Ambo protests against federal tax increases.
Anti-riot military unit forces open fire on tax protesters in Ambo, killing two. No reported violence from protesters. The protest began the previous day.

An Oromo activist reported that regime soldiers/police officers have been beating civilians in the town of Burayo. This comes in the context of a protest by small businesses owners and youth reacting to a new tax levied this week.
In Kofale town of West Arsi, business owners staged a protest against a newly introduced tax on small businesses. Soldiers dispersed the protest, with two people arrested and 4 injured.
Protests outside of Gaalkacyo following a currency devaluation.
Business people in Waliso protest for three consecutive days against a tax.

Supporters of Wadani political party held a demonstration against local authorities at Sheikh in protest of the arrest of their fellow party supporters in Sheikh during an anti-Kulmiye political party demonstration (unknown date; details not known). The protestors appealed to the authorities for the release of the arrested.
Business people in Waliso protest for three consecutive days against a tax.
Nurses in Kisii again protest over working conditions. They claim the state has sidelined them after doctors and clinical officers received a pay increase
Business people in Waliso protest for three consecutive days against a tax.
Police in Uganda have arrested at least 53 people including an opposition leader, for demonstrating against a plan to amend the constitution and scrap the presidential age limit.
Shop owners in Kolfe, Axena Tera shut down their businesses in protest of a tax increase.
Residents peacefully demonstrated against Kulmiye party in Gebiley.
Protests in Gaalkacyo against illegally established checkpoints.

A group in ODM t-shirts demonstrated along Oginga Odinga Street. They were then confronted by other ODM supporters who accused the protesters of sabotaging Odinga's election bid. The confronting ODM supporters then burnt the shirts. Kisumu Central ODM Chairman Seth Ochieng who led the group that scuttled the demonstration says as ODM they were not aware of the demonstration.
14:30EAT, KM3 - Villa Somalia, Mogadishu: 100-150 protesters marched to denounce green-on-green skirmishes on 26/07 involving Somali soldiers.
Youth in Kibera constituency staged a march to call for a peaceful election.
Youth in Meru county took to the streets to demonstrate against what they term as poor performance by the county's governor Peter Munya.

30 July. A huge demonstration was held in Buhodle against Khatumo political party. The residents protested of the involvement of Khatumo top officials in talks with Somaliland. Clan elders addressed the protestors to defuse tension. The demonstration ended peacefully.
Shops in the Addis Ababa market of Merkato closed in protest of a tax increase. The market was previously shut down on 24/07 in protest of the tax.
Nakumatt Holdings' workers protest over unpaid salaries along the Mombassa-Nairobi road. Unknown location; Makindu is halfway point.

Youths aligned to the Jubilee Party Tuesday staged peaceful protests in parts of Kisii Town in defence of acting Interior Cabinet Secretary Fred Matiang'i shortly after Nasa leaders left Gusii Stadium.
Human rights groups marched around Uhuru Park to protest the murder of Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission ICT Manager Chris Msando, and demanded justice for those involved in the murder.

Family, relatives and friends of IEBC ICT CEO Chris Msando staged peaceful demonstrations walking for five kilometres from their Lifunga village to Ukwala trading centre, Siaya County, protesting his brutal murder. The protesters asked the government to involve foreign agencies to investigate his murder.
Hundreds of passengers plying the eastern route were stranded at Nakawa Taxi Park following a sit down strike by the taxi drivers.
After hearing rumours that some candidates are missing from the ballot papers, youths in Embu staged a demonstration.

Oromia residents of East Hararge zone, Cinaksa woreda protested a forced transfer of land by the government. Liyu Police, attempting to stop the protest clashed with the Oromia police, who took the side of the protesters. Five Liyu police reported dead. No reported violence from the protesters themselves.
Civilians took the streets to protest against high inflation rate and appearance of fake bank notes. Protests remained peaceful.

ODM and Wiper supporters engaged in a shouting match as each group demanded to be addressed by the respective leaders. Youths from the groups climbed of the stage and had to be removed. No reported violence.

Residents, who opposed the ruling of the Somali Military Court to execute a soldier for murder of the Minister of Public works and Reconstruction, protested after Friday prayers at Tarabunka, Hodan area. The demonstrators chanted slogans against the military court claiming that the ruling was unfair and demanded FGS to intervene. Police and NISA blocked the roads in the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Businesses and transporters have begun a strike and protest in the northwestern Bahir Dar town as part of a protest called to mark the first anniversary of the anti-government demonstrations held last year. Police made four arrests.
Youth in Garissa held a march to call for a peaceful election.

06 Aug, c. 1100 hrs. Hundreds of people, hailing from Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan, staged a demonstrating on the main road of Beergadiid village (c. 50 km North of Beletweyne). The protesters were demonstrating against the three declared districts by the President of Hirshabelle. The demonstration impacted vehicles that use the road from Beletweyne to other parts of Somalia. Some local elders held a press conference at the village and stated that they had no confidence with the administration of Hirshabelle.
More than 300 people camped outside the IEBC offices in Kisumu to protest the fact that they have not been included in the Voters Roll.

In Ambo and Welliso, people restarted market boycott. The road from Wollega to Ambo has been closed. They have begun this second round of protests calling for the release to several Oromo prisoners, who are believed to have been arrested during an earlier protest or strike.

In Ambo and Welliso, people restarted market boycott. The road from Wollega to Ambo has been closed. They have begun this second round of protests calling for the release to several Oromo prisoners, who are believed to have been arrested during an earlier protest or strike.

Demonstrations took place reportedly organised by minister Amongi and MPs Odonga Otto, Lucy Akello, Lucy Aciro and Olanya. Gunshots and tear gas were fired to disperse the protestors and MP Otto was taken into police custody.

12:45EAT, KM4, Mogadishu: the protection detail of a Member of Parliament (MP) opened fire towards protesters, killing two and injuring three. Two civilians were killed and three injured. The reason for the protest is not known. Following the shooting a larger, violent protest occurred. Demonstrators stopped and seized a AMISOM soldier during second protest.
Civil Society groups, organised by the Kenyan Human Rights Commission, held another demonstration protesting the murder of IEBC official, Msando.
Hundreds of Homa Bay youths held a peaceful demonstration on Wednesday, after learning of the president Uhuru's lead on Raila Odinga.
Police dispersed youths in Kisumu who were protesting electoral fraud.
Police in Soroti district blocked a demonstration by a group of youths protesting the proposed amendment of Article 26 of the Constitution

In East Hararge zone, Gursum woreda, Kore(Qore) kebele locals protested against a recently proposed land transfer by the Ethiopian government which re-assigned their village to the Somali region. The protesters were demanding that their land stays in Oromiya region.
One protester is killed by police in Maseno

A six-month-old baby was injured in the head by police during a protest of the election results. The baby later died in hospital. Police reportedly beat also a resident during the protest and harassed journalists that had taken a picture of the incident. Police also conduct door-to-door searches and hospitalise several people in Kisumu.

Relatives and a witness said that police shot and killed Zacchaeus Okoth, a 21-year-old man from Anduro village, Siaya county, on the night of August 11, as the police used teargas and live bullets to disperse crowds of protesters after the announcement of Kenyatta's victory.
Election protests occur in Kariobangi on a 11/08. Police involved. At least one death reported.
Reports of pro-opposition protests in Mombasa on 11 Aug. No reports of violence or clashes with police.

In Buruburu area in Nairobi and in Kiambu on the outskirts of the capital, police lobbed teargas to disperse two rival groups, one celebrating Kenyatta's victory and the other protesting against his victory.

A total of two people killed in Siaya protests after Kenyatta's victory (one fatality coded elsewhere). In Siaya county, relatives and two witnesses said that on August 12, police beat to death 17-year-old Kennedy Juma Otieno, after pursuing him from Kisumu's Busia Road, where they had dispersed protesters with teargas

In Buruburu area in Nairobi and in Kiambu on the outskirts of the capital, police lobbed teargas to disperse two rival groups, one celebrating Kenyatta's victory and the other protesting against his victory.
Baby Pendo was allegedly hit in the head by a police officer using a baton in Nyalenda, Kisumu County, leading to her death on August 15.

Residents in Lasanod demonstrated to protest of the introduction of new Somali currency in town as local businesses refused to trade using the old currency. Lasanod residents transact in both Somaliland and Somali shilling.
Police have dispersed protesters in Tarime District who were marching to the Acacia's North Mara mine to reportedly demand compensation for their land.
Taxi drivers plying the Masaka- Kampala route have parked their vehicles to protest what they termed as illegal taxes being levied on their vehicles by local authorities.
Workers protested at Nairobi's Rift Valley Railways (RVR) offices (Nairobi - Starehe), saying they will only resume work after they are paid their full July salaries.
Residents storm Kaptebeswet Secondary School in Kipchebor Ward after unknown people kill a security guard and a student. It is unknown whether the killings were political, criminal or personal.

Ruling party supporters took to the streets of Soroti Town demanding that Members of Parliament drop the proposed Constitutional amendment and instead amend the Constitution to allow Ugandans above 75 to contest for presidency.

Hundreds of people peacefully demonstrated against the recent (date not known) clan clashes between Cali Geri and Reer Hagar sub clans of Dulbahante clan. The demonstrators demanded for immediate reconciliation between the two clans.

Tax strikes and protests occur over several areas of Oromia including Kofele, Adaba, Asasa, Ginchi, Nejo, Gute, and Burayu among others. Details limited. The source implies these episodes occurred on other nearby areas as well. All points of entry into Addis Ababa were blocked, while transport from Addis Ababa to Oromia were affected. The strike lasted until 27 August.

Tax strikes and protests occur over several areas of Oromia including Kofele, Adaba, Asasa, Ginchi, Nejo, Gute, and Burayu among others. Details limited. The source implies these episodes occurred on other nearby areas as well. All points of entry into Addis Ababa were blocked, while transport from Addis Ababa to Oromia were affected. The strike lasted until 27 August.

Strike:All points of entry into Addis Ababa were forced to close due to an OFC-led worker strike that called for the release of political prisoners and in opposition of tax hikes. Doezns of towns in Oromia followed the strike call, while bus transport between Addis Ababa and Bahir Dar was also affected. The strike is expected to last until 27/08.

Strike:A working boycott has started on 23/08 in several towns across Oromia region, including Ambo, Shashamane, Dodola, Bale, and other cities (not named). The strike was called by the Oromo Federalist Congress (OFC) with an aim for the release of political prisoners and end to a tax increase.

Strike:A working boycott has started on 23/08 in several towns across Oromia region, including Ambo, Shashamane, Dodola, Bale, and other cities (not named). The strike was called by the Oromo Federalist Congress (OFC) with an aim for the release of political prisoners and end to a tax increase.

Strike:A working boycott has started on 23/08 in several towns across Oromia region, including Ambo, Shashamane, Dodola, Bale, and other cities (not named). The strike was called by the Oromo Federalist Congress (OFC) with an aim for the release of political prisoners and end to a tax increase.
