Around 16 September 2020 (as reported), hundreds of miners demonstrated in Muranga (Township, Kiharu, Muranga), camping on the quarry site. They were protesting against the closure of the site.
On 17 September 2020, Ugandan police forces arrested at least 10 demonstrators in Rubaare Town (Ntungamo) who were gathered to protest the results of the elections.

On 17 September 2020, county government workers protested by whistling, blowing vuvuzelas, shouting, singing and chanting as they camped outside the county offices in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi), against delayed pay. Led by the Kenya County Government Workers Union (KCGWU) officials, the workers demanded their pay.
On 18 September 2020, national youth council demonstrated and opposed the amendments bill in Kathwana town (Tharaka South, Tharaka-Nithi), demanding youth representation in national government.

On 18 September 2020, Ugandan police forces fired bullets and used tear gas to disperse protesters who had gathered in multiple locations around Kabale (Kabale), all protesting the defeat of their candidate in the elections.
On 19 September 2020, residents in Munessa, Arsi zone (Oromia) staged a protest against the Prosperity party.
On 22 September 2020, unsuccessful candidates in NUP primaries and their supporters demonstrated at the NUP headquarters in Kampala, citing irregularities in the primary elections.

Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), more than 500 farmers demonstrated in Rushenyi (Ntungamo district), calling for a businessman to honor a substantial amount of money owed to the farmers. The businessman has acknowledged his debt to the farmers, but claims they have exaggerated the total amount owed.

On 24 September 2020, at least 30 dismissed casual workers of the ongoing construction of Kirubia Stadium, held demonstrations outside the facility in Chuka town (Chuka, Tharaka-Nithi County), demanding payment of Sh120, 000 from the contractor.
On 25 September 2020, local residents were protesting against the killing of three of their cows in a hit and run incident in Narok-Maai Mahiu road in Mai Mahiu town (Naivasha, Nakuru).

On 25 September 2020, over hundred residents have peacefully protested against Kenya defense forces movements in Gedo region. The protesters demanded for protection against KDF in El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo).
On 25 September 2020, Kenyatta National Hospital workers took to the streets in Nairobi (Nairobi Central, Starehe, Nairobi) over salary review.

On 25 September 2020, local residents, led by a member of county assembly, protested against the suspension of the ongoing construction of Sh67 million World Bank Absa- Mtangani Prison Road in Malindi town (Malindi, Kilifi).

On 26 September 2020, over a hundred residents protested in Doolow town (Doolow, Gedo) against KDF operations in Yado village, that resulted into the killing of a civilian and kidnapped 4 others along the border Somalia and Kenya.

On 26 September 2020, over a hundred local residents peacefully protested in Bardera town (Baardheere, Gedo) against Kenya defense forces movements in Gedo region. The protesters demanded for protection against KDF.

On 26 September 2020, over hundred residents protested in Luuq town (Luuq, Gedo) against KDF operations in Yado village, that resulted into the killing of a civilian and kidnaped 4 others along the border Somalia and Kenya.

On 27 September 2020, local residents protested in Garbahaarey town (Garbahaarey, Gedo) against the KDF operation in Yado village that resulted into the killing of a civilian and kidnapped others along the border between Somalia and Kenya.

On 28 September 2020, local residents protested in Cabudwaaq town (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud) against KDF operations in Gedo region that resulted into the killing of a civilian and kidnapped others along the border Somalia and Kenya.

On 29 September 2020, hundreds of NRM youths from the far south-west of Uganda marched at an unspecified area of Rubanda East (Rubanda district, coordinates for Rubanda town used at GP2), denouncing the failure of election officials to disclose the outcome of delayed primary elections.

On 29 September 2020, over 100 matatu operators demonstrated in Nakuru town (Nakuru Town, Nakuru) demanding their return to Nakuru town's CBD and accused the county government of failure to properly consult them before their relocation. Police used teargas canisters to disperse the crowd.
On 30 September 2020, over 200 area residents and farmers blocked the road near Kikopey town (Gilgil, Nakuru) leading to a major traffic jam. They protested the invasion of their farms by herders.

On 30 September 2020, over 70 Tuskys supermarket employees protested and took to the streets in Kisii (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii), most of them in the chain's T-shirts waving placards, and blowing whistles while demanding payment of their salaries.

On 30 September 2020, over 50 Tuskys supermarket employees protested and took to the streets in Nairobi city (Starehe, Nairobi) most of them in the chain's T-shirts waving placards, and blowing whistles while demanding payment of their salaries.

Around 1 October 2020, county workers demonstrated by carrying twigs and camping outside the county offices in Kitui (Kitui Central, Kitui), against delayed salaries. Led by their union officials, the group demanded to know why they haven't been paid.

Around 3 October 2020 (as reported), truck drivers protested by waving placards at the Malaba border point (Teso North, Busia), against tight coronavirus measures by the Ugandan Government. The drivers demanded better treatment from the Ugandan officials.

Around 3 October 2020 (weekend of), a candidate for the NRM primary elections staged a demonstration with her supporters in Tororo town (Tororo district), to denounce what she described as the deliberate delay in announcing the winner.
On 4 October 2020, workers of the Berbera Corridor road peacefully demonstrated in Laasgeel village near Berbera town (Berbera, Woqooyi Galbeed). Reason for demonstration not reported.

Around 6 October 2020 (as reported), medical students demonstrated at the Gulu College of Health Sciences at Layibi (Gulu district) after the college was not able to accommodate returning students, after having been converted into a coronavirus treatment center.

On 6 October 2020, residents protested at the police station in Mukono town (Mukono district), calling for the release of their relatives who were arrested last week in Namanve nature reserve for suspected land grabbing, citing their undue period of detention without charge.
On 7 October 2020, local residents demonstrated, demanding the administration to reconsider the decision to relocate people in Afgooye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).
On 8 October 2020, military forces opened fire on students conducting a protest in Asasa, West Arsi (Oromia), wounding one person in the foot.

On 8 October 2020, local residents and boda boda operators in Nyamira staged a protest when police foiled plans by the deputy president to conduct a fundraising event at Nyangoge Primary School grounds in Nyamira town (West Mugirango, Nyamira). Police lobbed teargas canisters at the protesters, including Tangatanga MPs.

On 8 October 2020, over 200 Rorok tea factory farmers protested in Kaptebengwet (Konoin, Bomet) against the low bonus payout. Security officers (presumed police officers) intervened and lobbed tear gas to disperse the group.
On 9 October 2020, local residents demonstrated against increased taxes by the Galmudug administration in Hobyo town (Hobyo, Mudug).

On 9 October 2020, local residents demonstrated in Badhan town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). The protesters demanded the minister of interior of Puntland state to stop interfering in the selection of electoral delegates.
On 10 October 2020, military forces opened fire on unarmed Qeerroo protesters in Bale Robe town (Bale, Oromia), killing one person. Protesters were demanding the release of political prisoners.

On 10 October 2020, supporters (described as being 'huge' in number) of a candidate defeated in delayed NRM primaries demonstrated against the victorious candidate in Kabale town (Kabale district). Police used teargas to disperse the demonstrators.
On 10 October 2020, a group of bikers took to the streets in Muthaiga Estate (Parklands, Westlands, Nairobi) to protest a decision barring them from using Limuru road until the Thika Superhighway.
On 11 October 2020, over a hundred locals staged a peaceful protest demanding equal representation for the Hirshabelle administration in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).
On 11 October 2020, over fifty students protested on the main road leading to the Ministry of Education office in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal), after their school was closed by the ministry.
On 11 October 2020, NRM youth supporters demonstrated at the party HQ in Kabale town (Kabale district), as they had not received allowances promised to them during campaigning.
On 12 October 2020, local businessmen protested over the increased tax by the Galmudug administration in Cadaado town (Cadaado, Galgaduud).
On 12 October 2020, women protested against the rape and killing of another woman in Burco town (Burco, Togdheer). The police disperse the protesters peacefully.

On 12 October 2020, local residents demonstrated in Badhan town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). The protesters demanded the minister of interior of Puntland state to stop interfering in the selection of electoral delegates.

On 13 October 2020, women protested in the streets of Ceerigaabo town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag), demanding justice for a woman who had been raped and killed. Somaliland police dispersed them by means non specified.

On 13 October 2020, NRM supporters attempted to storm the party HQ in Tororo (Tororo district), after their candidate's victory in primary elections was overturned. Police fired teargas to disperse the youth.

Around 14 October 2020 (as reported), donkey owners demonstrated by waving placards and camping outside the Silzha slaughterhouse in Lodwar (Turkana Central, Turkana), against the reopening of the slaughterhouse. The group demanded the county and national governments to help address the problem by shutting down the slaughterhouse.
On 15 October 2020, local residents protested along Mogadishu - Afgooye roads over closed roads in Mogadishu - Dharkenley district (Banadir). They demanded all closed roads to be opened.

Around 15 October 2020 (as reported), more than 1,000 family members demonstrated in Jinja (Jinja district), calling for the payment of compensation money promised to them to make way for the construction of railway tracks.
Around 16 October 2020 (as reported), a group of youth took to the streets in Nyamira (Bogichora, Nyamira).They were protesting after Deputy President William Ruto visit.

On 18 October 2020, over hundreds of local residents protested against the closure of Mzuri sweets by the environmental regulator in Kikambala town (Kilifi South, Kilifi), which left over hundreds of residents without jobs due to suspension of construction works at the company.
On 19 October 2020, over a hundred local residents stage a protest when a young girl was raped by her quran teacher in Mogadishu - Heliwa district (Banadir). They demanded justice.
Around 20 October 2020 (as reported), FDC members marched in Kampala, decrying plans announced by the Ugandan government to build roads in South Sudan and the DRC. Police arrested the demonstrators.

On 20 October 2020, more than 4,000 fish maw traders in Nyanza region protested in Homa Bay town (Homa Bay, Homa Bay), against the setting up of two Chinese firms for the commodity in Homa Bay and Mbita towns. The protestors claimed that the companies would bring unfair competition and render them jobless.
On 20 October 2020, over 20 journalist staged a peaceful protest in Mogadishu - Hodan district (Banadir), demanding the release of their fellow reporter who was detained by the NISA.

On 20 October 2020, members of the Baganda marched to the residence of the Katikkiro (Prime Minister) of Buganda at Mengo (Kampala), to denounce the heavy-handed dispersal of a meeting of elders on 17 October by police. Police intercepted some of the demonstrators as they were en route to residence at Bulange, arresting an unspecified number.

On 21 October 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a peaceful protest on the main road of Jalalaqsi town (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan). The protesters were demanding a fair share of seats between clans and sub clan in the HirShabelle state election.

On 21 October 2020, dozens of boda boda drivers demonstrated in Mbarara (Mbarara district), denouncing the death of a fellow rider in a vehicle accident the previous day. Police used live rounds (presumed to be fired in the air) and tear gas to disperse the crowd.

On 21 October 2020, more than 50 contractors working for a Chinese-owned construction company protested at the company's office at Ntinda (Kampala), calling for wage arrears to be paid; annual leave to be recognized; and for staff to receive promotions.
On 24 October 2020, Qerroo youth held a protest denouncing the police shooting of a taxi driver in Aweday, East Hararghe (Oromia), and the death of 4 young men in Nekemt the previous day.
On 26 October 2020, refugees gathered for a sit-in in front of a police station in the Mtendeli Refugee Camp (Kibondo, Kigoma) to demand information regarding a refugee taken the day prior.

On 27 October 2020, over hundreds of local demonstrated against the remarks and comments of the President of France on Islam at Burco town (Burco, Togdheer). The demonstrators burned the French flag and called the population to boycott all French products.

On 28 October 2020, over hundreds of locals demonstrated against the remarks and comments of the president of France on Islam at Cadaado town (Cadaado, Galgaduud). The demonstrators burned the French flag and called the population to boycott all French products.
On 28 October 2020, local residents protested against poor roads in Kigumo town (Kigumo, Muranga) and accused politicians of habitually using the road problem during election campaigns.

On 28 October 2020, over a thousand locals demonstrated against the remarks and comments of the President of France on Islam at Daljirka daahson junction in Mogadishu - Bondhere district (Banadir). The demonstrators burned the French flag and called the population to boycott all French products.

On 28 October 2020, dozens of artists protested in Kabale (Kabale district) over the lack of funds distributed by the government to local artists. Police intercepted the demonstrators, and prevented them from reaching the Resident District Commissioner's office.

On 28 October 2020, protesters associated with the NAMA demonstrated in Bahir Dar (Amhara) against the killing of ethnic Amhara in other regional states. Military personnel quickly disbanded the demonstrators.

On 29 October 2020, over thousands of local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president's against Islam in Badhan town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). The protesters called on the population to boycott all French products.

On 29 October 2020, over hundreds of local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president's against Islam in Doolow town (Doolow, Gedo). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products.

On 29 October 2020, Chokaa residents took to the street seeking justice for the man who was chased to death by the police in Chokaa, coded to Kangundo (Kangundo, Kangundo). The victim was run over by a moving vehicle as he tried to evade the police observing the Covid- 19 face mask use.

On 29 October 2020, over hundred local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president against Islam in Garissa town (Dujis, Garissa). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products

On 30 October 2020, local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president's against Islam in Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products.

On 31 October 2020, over hundreds of local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president's against Islam in front of main hospital in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products.
On 31 October 2020, hundreds of residents protested against the French president's remarks on Islam in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed).

On 31 October 2020, a group of residents and environmentalists demonstrated along Waiyaki Way in Westlands (Parklands, Westlands, Nairobi) to protect a fig tree from being uprooted for the Nairobi expressway. They wave placards and formed a protective circle around the tree.

On 2 November 2020, over fifty students and the Faca weyne school administration protested against businessmen who have sold some parts of the school compound in Mogadishu - Hamar Weyne district (Banadir). The demanded the ministry for education to help the school.

On 3 November 2020, local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president against Islam in Ceel Cadde town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products.

On 3 November 2020, local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president against Islam in Waajid town (Waajid, Bakool). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products.
On 3 November 2020, local mourners staged a protest accusing the police of taking too long in arresting those linked to the suspected murders of three people in Karatina town (Mathira, Nyeri).

On 3 November 2020, local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president against Islam in Jilib town (Jilib, Middle Juba). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products.
On 4 November 2020, over a thousand matatu drivers marched in the streets in support for the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) in Nakuru town (Nakuru Town East, Nakuru).

On 5 November 2020, local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president against Islam in Kurtunwaarey town (Kurtunwaarey, Lower Shabelle). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products.

On 8 November 2020, local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president about Islam in Galhareeri village (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products

On 8 November 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a protest against the remarks of the French president about Islam in Ceel Buur town (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). The protesters called the population to boycott all French products

On 9 November 2020, over 500 boda boda drivers demonstrated against police extortion carried out under the pretense of coronavirus enforcement measures in Kabale (Kabale district). Police dispersed the drivers with tear gas and live rounds (presumed to be fired into the air).

On 10 November 2020, over a hundred sand harvesters staged a demonstration and set up roadblocks (unspecified means) against Kedong ranch owners when they doubled sand harvesting fees in Mai Mahiu town (Naivasha, Nakuru). Police fired teargas to disperse the demonstrators. Two people were killed and several injured and at least 15 youth were arrested and are in police custody.

On 11 November 2020, local residents have staged a peaceful protest in the front gate of the police in Marsabit town (Saku, Marsabit). The protesters demanded justice for a teacher who had been killed (coded separately).
On 13 November 2020, more than 50 NRM youth marched in Gulu town (Gulu district), denouncing mismanagement of funds and denial of access to the President on the part of senior members of the party.
On 15 November 2020, local youths have staged a protest after the Somaliland ministry of sports-imposed fines on the Hawed regional sports club in Baligubadle village (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed).
On 17 November 2020, over fifty local drivers of Dhaweeye staged a protest against the decision to impose a new tax by the taxi company in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal).

Around 17 November 2020 (as reported), over 100 tobacco farmers protested at the British American Tobacco (BAT) offices in Migori County [coded as Migori, Suna West, Migori] against alleged mistreatment by the B.A.T company. The farmers demanded an explanation of why the management procured overpriced tobacco-handling protective gear.

Around 18 November 2020, residents of the Nyakabungo area demonstrated in Nyakabungo (Kanungu district) against the poor quality of the roads. Police were dispatched to disperse the protesters, but were unable to reach them due to the condition of the road.

On 18 November 2020, relatives of a deceased person protested at the road in front of the Kismayo hospital in Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Police opened fire to disperse the protestors and two people were injured.

On 18 November 2020, supporters of Bobi Wine MP demonstrated in Wakiso (Wakiso district) after his arrest earlier that day. Police arrested over 100 demonstrators from two days of demonstrations in Nansana and Wakiso town.

On 18 November 2020, supporters of Bobi Wine MP demonstrated in Nansana (Wakiso district) after his arrest earlier that day. Police arrested over 100 demonstrators from two days of demonstrations in Nansana and Wakiso town.
On 18 November 2020, supporters of Bobi Wine demonstrated at a police station in Jinja (Jinja district) where Bobi Wine MP was being detained. Police fired tear gas to disperse the crowds.
On 19 November 2020, Oromia state police forces opened fire on protesters in Dire Tayara, East Hararghe, wounding one person. Protesters gathered to denounce the detention of Oromo politicians.

On 19 November 2020, over fifty street traders staged a protest against the trade ministry of Wajir county for failling to relocate all the traders from Soko Mjinga to the new county market in Wajir town (Wajir East, Wajir). They demanded all traders to be treated the same way.
On 23 November 2020, Ugandan police forces fired tear gas to disperse crowds that had gathered to meet NUP presidential candidate Robert Kyagulanyi's convoy in Kyegegwa (Kyaka, Kyegegwa).

On 23 November 2020, the Nubian Rights Forum staged a demonstration over an alleged kidnapping at the Mama Lucy hospital in Nairobi town (Nairobi - Kasarani). The group lamented the arrest of a senior medical officer in connection to the kidnapping, they claim that the arrest was political and demanded his release.

On 24 November 2020, hundreds of local people staged a demonstration against the recent rape and killing of an eighteen-year-old girl in Ceel al village at Caynabo town (Caynabo, Sool). The Somaliland police dispersed the demonstrators.

On 25 November 2020, Ugandan police forces fired tear gas and live bullets to disperse supporters who gathered to see presidential candidate Patrick Oboi Amuriat from the Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) in Masindi (Masindi Municipality, Masindi).

On 25 November 2020, more than 80 KCSE candidates from Matungulu Boys High School demonstrated in Machakos (Machakos, Machakos), against management demands, claiming they were surviving on a poor diet, before walking away.
On 25 November 2020, Ugandan police forces fired tear gas and live bullets at supporters of NUP presidential candidate Robert Kyagulanyi in Hoima (Hoima Municipality, Hoima).
On 25 November 2020, Ugandan police forces fired tear gas at supporters of NUP presidential candidate Robert Kyagulanyi in Kasese (Kasese Municipality, Kasese).

On 25 November 2020, Ugandan police forces fired tear gas to disperse supporters who gathered to see presidential candidate Patrick Oboi Amuriat from the Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) in Arua (Arua Municipality, Arua), with one protester requiring amputation of the hand from damage by a tear gas cannister.
Around 26 November 2020 (as reported), chicken breeders under the patronage of Mustafa Kafeero protested in Wandegeya against overcrowding.

On 27 November 2020, over a hundred locals protested against the brutality of government security forces (SNA) in Leego village (Buur Hakaba, Bay), after soldiers shot and killed a man (coded separately).

On 27 November 2020, dozens of pupils from Kagio primary school staged a protest at a police station in Kagio town (Kirinyaga West, Kirnyaga), demanding the arrest of their teacher whom they accused of sexual misconduct in the school.

On 28 November 2020, local residents, mainly from the Turkana community, demonstrated by whistling, wearing white outfits, carrying banners, waving placards, as they marched to the office of the county commissioner and later proceeded to the office of the governor in Lodwar (Turkana Central, Turkana), against insecurity in Isiolo and Kapedo. The group demanded the government to disarm the residents of West Pokot and Baringo county.

On 28 November 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a protest against the request of opposition leaders who called for the withdrawal of SNA forces from Gedo region in Bardera town (Baardheere, Gedo).

On 28 November 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a protest against the request of opposition leaders who called for the withdrawal of SNA forces from Gedo region in Belet Xaawo town (Belet Xaawo, Gedo).

On 28 November 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a protest against the request of opposition leaders who called for the withdrawal of SNA forces from Gedo region in Doolow town (Doolow, Gedo).

On 28 November 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a protest against the request of opposition leaders who called for the withdrawal of SNA forces from Gedo region in Doolow-Luuq town (Luuq, Gedo).

On 28 November 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a protest against the request of opposition leaders who called for the withdrawal of SNA forces from Gedo region in Garbahaarey town (Garbahaarey, Gedo).

On 28 November 2020, local residents demonstrated by waving placards in Liwatoni estate of Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa), against the move by the government to construct a public service vehicle (PSV) stage terminal within the estate. Led by sheikhs and the county senator (ODM), the group demanded the construction to be stopped.

On 28 November 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a protest against the request of opposition leaders who called for the withdrawal of SNA forces from Gedo region in El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo).

On 28 November 2020, Ugandan police forces fired bullets and tear gas at protesters who gathered in Kalerwe (Kampala Capital City, Kampala). Protesters gathered to denounce the killing of their colleague at the Kalerwe Market who was shot and killed by Ugandan police forces in a security operation the night prior.

On 29 November 2020, about a hundred people protested over the arrest of a leader who organized a protest last week, the protesters blocked (no mention of physical barricades) the main road in front of the police station and the administration gate in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).

On 30 November 2020, local business people protested against the fluctuations and loss in value of the Somali shilling to the US dollar in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). The Enji Market center was closed due to the low exchange rate.

On 1 December 2020, about hundred of people conducted a peaceful protest against the rise in the inflation rate in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari). The current rate of exchange is about 1 dollar to 44,000 Somali shillings and the traders have started refusing the Somali money currency.

On 1 December 2020, over a hundred people, including business people, demonstrated against the rise in the inflation rate in Gaalkacyo North town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The protest comes after Somalia's currency (money) was rejected by the business centers and the US dollar prize increased. The current rate of exchange is about 1 dollar to 44,000 Somali shillings.

On 1 December 2020, local residents of Bula Towfiq staged a protest to appeal to both the national and county governments to stop a politically-connected individual from developing a 'grabbed' piece of land in the area in Garissa town (Dujis, Garissa).

On 2 December 2020, over a hundred people demonstrated against the rise in the inflation rate in Qardho town (Qardho, Bari). The current rate of exchange is about 1 dollar to 44,000 Somali shillings and the traders have started refusing the Somali money currency.

On 2 December 2020, Egerton University lecturers demonstrated in Njoro campus (Njoro, Njoro, Nakuru) for the university vice chancellor removal. They used wooden planks and stones to barricade and impeach the VC to access her office. Members of the press were barred from accessing the university. Anti-riot police officers attempted to calm the situation in vain (means not specified).
On 3 December 2020, dozens of NUP candidates gathered at their regional party headquarters in Gulu city to condemn police brutality during their political rallies.

Around 3 December 2020 (as reported), women in Bunyoro protested and demanded action against the destruction of the Bugoma forest through privatization and the selling of the land. Location coded to Hoima.

On 3 December 2020, over a hundred people demonstrated against the rise in the inflation rate in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari). The current rate of exchange is about 1 dollar to 44,000 Somali shillings and the traders have started refusing the Somali money currency.

On 3 December 2020, local contractors staged a protest outside the Kisii assembly premises in Kisii town (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii), accusing ward representatives of awarding themselves tenders. The police used teargas to disperse protesting contractors.

On 4 December 2020, over a hundred local residents staged a protest against the new HirShabelle administration based in Jowhar and demanded for their share in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The protesters demanded for inclusivity in the HirShabelle administration.

Around 4 December 2020 (as reported), NUP supporters protested in Bududa district against the arrest of one of their people, who was accused by the police forces of hurling an explosive at Bobi Wine (the alias of Ssentamu Robert Kyagulanyi). Police dispersed the protest with teargas.

On 5 December 2020, Chuka university students staged a protest over a proposed fee hike by the university board in Chuka town (Nithi, Tharaka-Nithi). The students vowed to paralyze the university's activities if the ministry of education goes on with the proposed plans which will see tuition fee grow from Sh16,000 to Sh48,000, annually.

On 6 December 2020, local residents, community and religious organisations marched on the streets carrying placards decrying rampant sexual violence and protested against the rise in defilement in Hindi town (Lamu West, Lamu). They demanded the speedy arrest of a Kenya defense forces officer who is alleged to have married a KCPE candidate from the town.

On 6 December 2020, local residents staged a peaceful protest towards the ministries area in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal), calling on the government to resolve the unfavorable exchange rate of the Somali shillings to the US dollar. The protesters were mainly small and medium-scale traders and casual laborers who have been affected by the exchange rate.

On 7 December 2020, about 200 protesters conducted a peaceful protest in the tarmac road and the main market in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari), against the exchange rate of Somali shilling. All markets were also closed.

On 7 December 2020, a youth group raided the NUP party office in Gulu (Gulu Municipality, Gulu), along Timothy Okee road in Pece-Laroo Division, holding placards denouncing the office leadership. 5 people were arrested by the police.

On 8 December 2020, 306 students from Lugulu girls' high school, marched while carrying placards, from the institution to Webuye police station (Webuye West, Bungoma) in protest against recent sexual assault of their colleague by a stranger. The group demanded the police to arrest the perpetrator.

On 9 December 2020, more than 40 people protested in front of the Serere (Serere, Serere) police station with the body of an accident victim, after having failed to negotiate to receive money to pay for the funeral from the man who had caused the accident.

Around 11 December 2020 (as reported), residents blocked the Dodoma road (means unspecified) at Kelema (Chemba, Dodoma) in protest against increased road accidents. The group demanded that traffic officers be deployed and bumps be erected on the road.

On 14 December 2020, local residents joined women political leaders in a peaceful demonstration to demand the arrest and prosecution of a man accused of raping and impregnating his two underage daughters in Gathaka village, near Kagio (Kirinyaga west, kirinyaga County).
On 14 December 2020, at least 500 clinical officers, nurses and laboratory technicians, led by KNUN, demonstrated over six months unpaid salaries and a lack of PPE Nakuru town (Nakuru North, Nakuru).
On 14 December 2020, local residents marched against the brutal murder of a blogger and demanded for justice for the activist in Njoro town (Njoro, Nakuru).

On 14 December 2020, over a hundred nurses and clinicians, led by KNUN staged a protest and demanded for provision of PPEs, health insurance, risk allowances, promotions, job re-designation gathered at uhuru park in Nairobi city (Nairobi - Westlands). The protest was organized by KUCO.

On 15 December 2020, over a hundred people protested over the closed roads in Mogadishu. The protesters demanded the re-opening of the main roads in Mogadishu-Abdiaziz district (Abdiaziz, Banadir). The district police dispersed the protesters.

On 15 December 2020, over a hundred people protested over the closed roads in Mogadishu. The protesters demanded the re-opening of the main roads in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The district police dispersed the protesters.

On 16 December 2020, police forces arrested activists, including students, at the EC offices in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) where the had been peacefully protesting, demanding for NRM presidential candidate Yoweri Museveni's academic papers.
On 16 December 2020, local residents comprising mainly of women and children protested against the Somaliland voter registration process in Buuhoodle town (Buuhoodle, Togdheer).

Around 17 December 2020 (as reported), coffee farmers protested and closed down the Komothai coffee growers' cooperative society offices and gates using welding equipment in Komothai (Githunguri, Kiambu) against alleged embezzlement of funds. The farmers demanded their dues.
Around 18 December 2020 (as reported), people protested in Bwaise (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) after security forces abducted several people from the town.

On 19 December 2020, local residents protested and demanded action over the bad state of roads in Kamore village near Naivasha town (Naivasha, Nakuru). The protesters accused both the county and national governments of neglecting them for years.

On 22 December 2020, hundreds of young men and women protested and demanded justice following the death local phone technician (separately coded) at the hands of police officers in Kisii town (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii). The protesters wore red T-shirts inscribed with the words 'stop killing the youth'. Police intervened and fired teargas to disperse the group.

On 24 December 2020, over a hundred people took to the streets and protested against the delayed and new elections schedules in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The police officers dispersed the protesters.
Around 26 December 2020 (as reported), women protested the destruction of Bugoma Forest to make way for sugarcane growing in Bugoma (Buhaguzi, Hoima).

On 26 December 2020, over a hundred local residents staged protest against the rising inflation and condemned business owners who did not accept Somali shillings. The protesters marched towards the presidential palace in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). Puntland police forces fired several times to disperse the protesters, two persons were wounded.

On 27 December 2020, over a hundred local residents protested against the security operation in the town and the arrest campaign of some men including journalists and other opponents to the HirShabelle administration in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The police opedned fire and at least four people were injured.
On 28 December 2020, journalists protested during a security press briefing at Uganda Media Centre, coded to Kampala, against the violence they face while covering opposition candidates' campaigns.
On 29 December 2020, a group of women and children demonstrated in Burco town (Burco, Togdheer), demanding justice for a university student who was stabbed in Borama town.
Around 29 December 2020 (as reported), traders working at a chicken coop in Wandegeya cathedral, Kampala, protested against the police crackdown on some of their relatives.

On 30 December 2020, over a hundred local residents protested against the new HirShabelle administration and demanded for the arrested journalists and civil society activists to freed in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).
On 30 December 2020, employees of Laico regency held a peaceful demonstration in Uhuru Park (Dagoretti North, Nairobi county) over their unpaid salaries. They called on the government to intervene.

On 30 December 2020, over hundred people, mostly women and youth groups, protested against the attack by the supporters of Banadir region football team against the Southwest state football team after the match played in Mogadishu. The protesters demanded respect and justice for the injured players in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay).

On 1 January 2021, hundreds of Muslim demonstrators in Harar city (Hundene, Harari People), demonstrated after Friday prayers after learning that the historically significant Al-Najashi mosque had been damaged by shelling during military operations. Harari city police dispersed the crowd by firing automatic weapons in the air (no injuries).
On 5 January 2021, residents of Bila, Boji Durmaji staged a demonstration against OLF/Shane militants.

On 5 January 2021, Kisumu Polytechnic students demonstrated by waving placards and carrying twigs, as they marched to the Kisumu central police station (Kisumu Central, Kisumu), against increased insecurity in the area, following the killing of their collegemate by thugs. The students demanded audience with the officer commanding station (OCS).
On 6 January 2021, a group of NRM youths protested in Wandegeya (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) against the violence by other NRM supporters in the region.
On 6 January 2021, a group of NRM youths protested in Katanga (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) against the violence by other NRM supporters in the region.
On 6 January 2021, a group of NRM youths protested in Makerere University (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) against the violence by other NRM supporters in the region.
On 6 January 2021, a group of NRM youths protested in Bwaise (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) against the violence by other NRM supporters in the region.
On 6 January 2021, a group of NRM youths protested in Kawempe (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) against the violence by other NRM supporters in the region.
On 6 January 2021, over a hundred refugees protested against the lack of assistance from humanitarian organizations at the Ifo Refugee Camp (Dadaab, Garissa).

On 7 January 2021, hundreds residents held a protest denouncing violent actions of OLF/Shane in the West Wollegga towns of Sibusa, Baro teta, Kananisa, and Burkat alo woredas (locations could not be found, protests coded up to the capital Dembi Dolo, Oromia).

On 7 January 2021, over fifty tuk-tuk drivers staged a peaceful protest, rejecting the usage of the Somali shilling by local traders in Qardho town (Qardho, Bari). The drivers demanded the local administration to intervene in the matter.

On 8 January 2021, around 200 people staged a peaceful protest on the roads around the main city market in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The protesters cited the rejection of the Somali currency by business owners and economic hardship with the rise of commodities impacting mostly low-income citizens.
On 8 January 2021, NRM members of the LC3 councillors marched in Kampala (Kampala, Kampala) in protest against the 400-strong anti-government movement.
On 8 January 2021, prisoners demonstrated at Manyani Maximum Prison near Voi (Mbololo, Voi, Taita Taveta) over the death of an inmate allegedly due to management negligence.

On 11 January 2021, clinical officers demonstrated in Westlands (Parklands, Westlands, Nairobi). The demonstrators were pushing for signing a deal that addresses serious grievances that concerned the working environment.

Around 12 January 2021 (as reported), local residents demonstrated by waving placards, whistling, shouting, carrying twigs, and singing as they marched in Macalder mines (Nyatike, Migori), against the ongoing mining ongoing excavations in the region. A group of rioters [supporting the excavations], intervened and 'roughed up' the demonstrators and they had to scamper for safety as they had been overpowered. No details on the injuries.

On 13 January 2021, about 150 youth and presumed UDA supporters, disrupted an ODM organized rally by chanting 'Ruto' and 'Wheelbarrow,' at Burma market in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). The rally proceeded as planned.
On 13 January 2021, public transport drivers (buses) protested over substandard infrastructure at Sabasaba bus stand in Dar es Salaam (Ilala, Dar-es-Salaam).

On 14 January 2021, local residents demonstrated by chanting, carrying twigs, as they marched in Kapnandet (Ainamoi, Kericho), against over the quality of work in the construction of the 8km SBI-Kapnadet-Kapspit road. The group demanded the constructor to use better construction materials.

On 14 January 2021, on election day, people protested against the actions of police, who raided the polling station in Bukomansimbi (Bukomansimbi, Bukomansimbi) and forced the presiding officer to handover three ballot paper booklets which they ticked in favor of NRM candidates. Police personnel intervened and dispersed the protesters.
On 15 January 2021, hundreds of protesters in Angar Guti and Bonya Bushe (Gutin, West Wollega), demonstrated against OLF/Shane militants operating in the zone.
On 16 January 2021, a group of protesters blocked (unspecified means) the road at the Nakitokolo cell, coded to Wakiso (Busiro, Wakiso) over rising political tension.

On 18 January 2021, over 200 people staged a peaceful demonstration against the Somali federal government (SFG) around the city center in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). They are requesting SFG to bring the remains of their children who were killed after they had unconfirmed information that their sons were sent to Eritrea for military training and were killed during the fighting in Tigray (Ethiopia).

Around 18 January 2021 (as reported), at least one person was shot dead and another injured in Masaka district when police dispersed protesters with live ammunition in Masaka (Masaka Municipality, Masaka) and Nyendo. Residents demonstrated against what they claimed as theft in the presidential and parliamentary elections. Alternate reports suggest that up to four people were killed. Fatality split across two events.

On 19 January 2021, a section of parents from Aimeel preparatory school demonstrated by forcing their way into the institution in Juja (Juja, Kiambu), against a move by the institution to increase school fees. Police officers intervened and stopped the group through unspecified means.
Around 19 January 2021 (as reported), over 200 workers protested at the Muheza sisal firm (Muheza, Tanga) against delayed pay. The group demanded that the firm's management address the matter.

On 20 January 2021, over 100 people staged a peaceful demonstration against the Somali federal government (SFG) on the main roads of Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). They are requesting SFG to bring back the remains of their children after they had unconfirmed information that their sons were sent to Eritrea for military training and were killed during the fighting in Tigray (Ethiopia).
Around 20 January 2021 (as reported), protests took place in some districts of Kampala after the election tallies were announced. Police forces quickly dispersed the protesters.

On 21 January 2021, about 50 police officers who secured the election protested over their missing allowances and camped at the Bududa District Headquarters in Bududa (Manjiya, Bududa) demanding for payment.
On 21 January 2021, people protested at the Rukiga district tally center in Mparo (Rukiga, Rukiga), shortly after a NRM candidate was declared the winner of the LCV chairperson elections.

On 21 January 2021, local residents, mainly taxi operators, protested in Mundooro village near Gatundu (Gatundu South, Kiambu) against increased insecurity. The group demanded the interior cabinet secretary to address their grievances.

On 21 January 2021, over 100 people demonstrated and blocked the main roads, demanding justice for the district commissioner of Hodan district who was killed in Hawl Wadaag district by police officers during a shootout, the demonstrators blame the federal government for the killing of the commissioner in Mogadishu - Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir).

Around 22 January 2021 (as reported), police officers protested and stormed the Hoima city Electoral Commission offices in Kijungu, in Hoima city (Hoima Municipality, Hoima), demanding for the payment of their allowances.

On 22 January 2021, NRM candidates from Kiruhura, Mbarara, Jinja and Mbale protested in Entebbe (Entebbe Municipality, Wakiso) at the Municipal offices to demand 'facilitation cash' for their electoral activities.

On 22 January 2021, demonstrators, including Ugandans living and working in Kenya, gathered at Jevanjee Gardens in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe), with the intension of marching to the Ugandan embassy in support of Ugandan politician Bobi Wine. Police confiscated the group's placards and dispersed the group for allegedly not having a permit.

On 23 January 2021, some women staged a protest in Kiambu (Riabai, Kiambu Town, Kiambu) over their men's drinking habits that had impaired their marital duties and became weak in bed actions. They faulted the government's failure to curb excessive drinking among their men.

On 25 January 2021, local residents, including elders and women, staged a peaceful protest against the federal government intention to hold elections in 2021 in Mogadishu - Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). The protesters were calling for a free and fair election.

On 25 January 2021, local residents, including elders, women and children, staged a peaceful protest against the federal government intention to hold elections in 2021 in Mogadishu - Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The protesters were calling for a free and fair election.

On 26 January 2021, a joint force of Ugandan soldiers and police fired teargas and bullets to disperse protesters in Entebbe (Entebbe Municipality, Wakiso) and Wakiso (coded separately), killing one protester, a NRM chairman, and seriously injuring two. Protests were led by the National Resistance Movement (NRM) and Democratic Party (DP).

On 26 January 2021, a joint force of Ugandan soldiers and police fired teargas and bullets to disperse protesters, supported by NRM and DP, in Wakiso (Busiro, Wakiso) and Entebbe (coded separately). Three people were severely injured and went to the hospital.

On 27 January 2021, protesters associated with the Qeerroo movement who gathered in Dire Tayara (East Hararghe, Oromia) were dispersed by police forces after around 2 hours of demonstrating. Protesters denounced the continued detainment of Oromo political prisoners.

On 27 January 2021, Khasoko boys high school students demonstrated by walking out of the school in Khasoko (Bumula, Bungoma), against the alleged lack of entertainment. The school closed indefinitely.

On 27 January 2021, residents blocked the Busia and Sigei roads [through unspecified means], in Mukuru (Starehe, Nairobi), in demonstration against the killing of a baby by a truck. Police lobbed teargas to disperse the group and no details of the injuries.

On 28 January 2021, residents of Makutano shopping area barricaded the Meru-Nanyuki and Meru- Isiolo roads, the residents were protesting over the poor state of roads in Imenti town (Central Imenti, Meru).
Around 29 January 2021 (as reported), special police constables held a protest in Kabale (Bunyangabu, Bunyangabu) demanding unpaid allowances accumulated from the recent electoral activities.

On 29 January 2021, protesters wearing yellow and demonstrating in Kullubi town (East Hararghe, Oromia) were arrested by police forces. Protesters denounced the continued detainment of Oromo political prisoners.

On 30 January 2021, residents, mainly women, protested in the Mateves location, on the outskirts of Arusha town (Arusha Urban, Arusha), against the recent killing of a fellow woman in the area by unknown assailants. Police intervened and lobbed teargas to disperse the group.

On 31 January 2021, a group of women and children took to the streets of Buuhoodle town (Buuhoodle, Togdheer) for a peaceful protest seeking for an end to recent clashes between Dhulbahante sub-clans.

On 31 January 2021, hundreds of local residents demonstrated in Nyacheki town (Bobasi, Kisii) and erected a barrier along the road between Nyacheki and Nyangusu, demanding that the Bobasi constituency to divided into two constituencies. The anti-riot police used teargas canisters to disperse demonstrators.

On 5 February 2021, secondary students protested in Ambo town (West Shewa, Oromia) against the continued detainment of Oromo political leaders and the lack of a proper investigation into the killing of a popular Oromo singer some months ago. 40 students were arrested by police forces who dispersed the protest.
On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Batu [Ziway] (East Shewa, Oromia), with demonstrators demanding the release of Oromo prisoners and facing off with pro-Abiy demonstrators.
On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Dire Tayara (East Hararghe, Oromia) by Oromo Qeerroo youth demanding the release of Oromo prisoners.
On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Aweday (East Hararghe, Oromia), by Oromo Qeerroo youth demanding the release of Oromo prisoners.

On 5 February 2021, residents and youths protested in Kokeris village, the junction to Matany trading centre (Bokora, Napak) over the increase killings of people in the last few weeks. People carried cardboard reading 'Napak is bleeding', 'End Gun Violence,' and #KaramojaLivesMatter.
On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Nekemt (East Wellega, Oromia) by students, demanding the release of Oromo prisoners.

On 5 February 2021, local residents took to the streets in Kobujoi (Kobujoi, Aldai, Nandi) demanding police action against increased cases of robberies. The demonstration was led by the Aldai member of parliament Cornely Serem of the Jubilee Party.
On 5 February 2021, local residents demonstrated in Gambella town (Agnuak, Gambella), demanding that development projects resume.

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Dembi Dolo town (West Wellega, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia.

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Kersa town (East Hararghe) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia.

On 6 February 2021, local residents staged a peaceful protest in support of the Hirshabelle administration after the government forces arrested ten persons earlier in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The motive of the arrest is unknown.

On 6 February 2021, 400 secondary students in Shashamane town (Arsi zone, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. Police forces intervened and dispersed the crowd, leaving a few people injured. 30 students were arrested.

On 6 February 2021, secondary high school students in Gimbi (West Wolegga, Oromia) protested, demanding justice for a popular Oromo musician who had been assassinated last year, the release of Oromo political prisoners, and a return to normalcy. The organizers of the protest along with some teachers were arrested.

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Dire Dawa town (Dire Dawa) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia.

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Asabot town (West Harerghe, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia.

On 6 February 2021, over hundred protesters, mostly women and children, protested against Jubaland state officials in the Gedo region and in support of FGS president decision of the election in Buurdhuubo town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). The protest was organized by Gedo regional officials.

On 6 February 2021, over hundred protesters, mostly women and children, protested against Jubaland state officials in the Gedo region and in support of FGS president decision of the election in Doolow town (Doolow, Gedo). The protest was organized by Gedo regional officials.

On 6 February 2021, over hundred protesters, moslty women and children, protested against Jubaland state officials in the Gedo region and in support of FGS president decision of the election in Luuq town (Luuq, Gedo). The protest was organized by Gedo regional officials.

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Nekemt town (East Wellega, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia.

On 6 February 2021, protesters in Weliso town (South West Shewa, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia.

Around 10 February 2021 (week of), residents of Napak (Bokora, Napak) held a peaceful demonstration over the increased insecurity in the district.

On 10 February 2021, secondary school students in Dera town (Arsi, Oromia) demonstrated against the continued detainment of political prisoners, demanding their release and an end to political instability in Oromia. Police quickly intervened and broke up protests.

Around 11 February 2021 (as reported), residents of Kasubi (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) protested against the government inaction in helping the population during the last heavy rain flooding, which reportedly left 3 children dead.

Around 11 February 2021 (as reported), residents of Ndeeba (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) protested against the government and demanded of them not to misuse tax money.

On 11 February 2021, local residents demonstrated by carrying twigs and marching in Nyanturago (Nyaribari Cache, Kisii), against the decision by the family of the late Simeon Nyachae to move his funeral venue from Musa Nyandusi Stadium to Gusii Stadium.
On 12 February 2021, demonstrations were held in Warder city (Welwel & Warder, Somali) in response to the arrest of several ONLF officials the day before.

On 12 February 2021, students in Shashamane (Arsi, Oromia) held a demonstration in support of the opposition Oromo political prisoners currently on hunger strike. The demonstration was reportedly dispersed by security forces with one person injured.

On 12 February 2021, students in Adama held a demonstration in support of the opposition Oromo political prisoners currently on hunger strike in Nazreth (Adama, East Shewa). The demonstration was reportedly dispersed by security forces.

On 12 February 2021, Bixa farmers marched in Marafa village near Mkunumbi (Lamu West, Lamu), against poor prices of their produce as well as mistreatment by the middleman. The group demanded the government to help address their grievances.

On 12 February 2021, students in Ginir (Ginir, Bale, Oromia) held a demonstration in support of the opposition Oromo political prisoners currently on hunger strike. The demonstration was reportedly dispersed by security forces.

On 15 February 2021, residents of Biharwe in Mbarara North City Division (Isingiro, Mbarara) protested over delayed compensation for their land, which is affected by the Masaka-Mbarara 400 KV electricity transmission line.

Around 15 February 2021 (as reported), relatives and friends of the persons arrested in connection with the protests in Kalangala district in December 2020, started protesting in front of the court premises in Makindye (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) after receiving news that the accused had been denied bail. Military police intervened and injured some of those protesting.
On 16 February 2021, protesters demonstrating against a pro-government rally in Senbete town, Jjile Timuga Woreda (Bati, Oromo zone) were arrested by police.

On 17 February 2021, a group of traders took to the streets in Kisii (Kisii Central, Nyaribari Chache, Kisii) over harassment and confiscation of their goods and tables by municipality officers. They carried twigs and marched peacefully until meeting the county secretary.
On 17 February 2021, over a hundred students of Moi Girls High School demonstrated and demanded the removal of principal for alleged arrogance and harassment in Eldoret town (Ainabkoi, Uasin Gishu).

On 17 February 2021, over 1400 students of Moi Girls' High School in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu county) demonstrated by marching to the gate, while carrying placards, twigs and chanting anti-principal slogans. They demanded the removal of the principal, accusing her of intimidation, high-handedness and failure to address their grievances. Private security guards, the police and education officials intervened to quell the situation.

Around 18 February 2021 (as reported), more than 100 Boda Boda riders in Kasese Municipality, coded to Kasese (Kasese Municipality, Kasese) protested against extortion by security officers deployed to enforce the night-time curfew.

On 18 February 2021, local residents protested against the release of a police officer accused of molesting three teenage boys in Matunda town (Soy, Uasin Gishu). The protesters accused police of protecting the suspect.
On 18 February 2021, police shot live bullets at NUP protesters in Jinja (Jinja Municipality, Jinja), leaving several injured. The reason for the demonstration is unclear.

On 19 February 2021, 258 students from Makueni Boys High School demonstrated in Makueni Kwa Kathoka (Muvau, Makueni, Makueni) against the compulsory monthly haircut by the school. They were suspended for 2 weeks.

On 19 February 2021, over hundred people, led by the immediate former prime minister, staged a peaceful protest along the Makka Al-mukarama road towards the airport in Mogadishu - Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The government security forces fired live bullets at the protesters, injuring two people.

On 20 February 2021, supporters of Senator Gideon Moi stormed Deputy President William Ruto's meeting in Kabarnet (Kabarnet, Baringo Central, Baringo). Police officers had to intervene using teargas to disperse the crowd.
On 21 February 2021, members of the business community in Malaba Town Council (Tororo, Tororo) protested the government's continued closure of one of the gates at the Malaba border.

Around 22 February 2021 (as reported), local residents protested along Mwatate-Taveta highway at Maktau (Mwatate, Taita Taveta) against land grabbing. The group demanded the county and national government to help address their grievances.

On 23 February 2021, some women staged a protest in Mwangulu Village in Lungalunga, coded to Kombani (Waa Ngombeni, Matuga, Kwale), over rampant homosexuality among the men, which they claimed had prevented them from getting husbands. They urged the government to strictly prohibit homosexualism among their men.

On 24 February 2021, about hundred people demonstrated, supporting the Somalia president in Carmo village (Bossaso, Bari). The demonstrators were against a recent public speech made by Puntland state president over the political position and the current electoral impasse.

Around 25 February 2021 (as reported), local residents marched in Mweiga, within Nyeri town (Nyeri Central, Nyeri), against the killing of a businessman by attackers allegedly hired by his father. The group demanded justice for the slain businessman.
On 26 February 2021, dozens of people demonstrated, marching through the main streets in Boocame village (Laas Caanood, Sool), in support of the federal government.

On 26 February 2021, Somaliland military demonstrated, blocking roads and stopping all movements from in and out of Ceerigaabo town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). The soldiers were demanding a increase in their salaries and allowances.

On 28 February 2021, a group of Congolese refugees gathered in front of a police station close to Nyarugusu Refugee Camp (Kasulu, Kigoma) and demanded the identity of police officers who they accused were part of an armed group that carried out a robbery the day before. Demonstrators were dispersed with tear gas.

On 3 March 2021, protesters from rural areas surrounding the Arsi Negele town attempted to start a demonstration, demanding the release of Oromo political prisoners. Oromo regional special forces quickly disrupted the demonstration, causing some injuries. No fatalities reported.

Around 3 March 2021 (as reported), street cleaners protested in Lugazi (Lugazi Municipality, Buikwe) against the poor working conditions, as most of them are not given protective gear, and the missing payments of several months of salaries.

Around 4 March 2021 (as reported), police arrested 5 people who protested against the operations of the Chinese Zongmei Construction Company. The people were demonstrating against the activities of the firm at the stone quarry at Pakiri hill (Kilak, Amuru) which they say has caused extensive damage to their houses as well as affected pregnant women.

On 4 March 2021, several youths at Milimani primary school polling station in London demonstrated against bribing of voters in Nakuru town (Nakuru Town East, Nakuru). The youths accused Lang'ata MP of bribing voters. Police used teargas to disperse the youths. Three journalists suffered minor injuries during the incident.
On 5 March 2021, traders protested at St. Balikuddembe market in Kisenyi (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) over suspended market management.

Around 6 March 2021 (as reported), workers in Geita (Geita, Geita) gathered in the office of the Geita constituency to demand a payment they claimed after the government broke a contract with their contractor.

On 8 March 2021, women, including the district vice chairperson and the district council secretary for health and education, peacefully demonstrated in Wakiso (Busiro, Wakiso) to express concern over their relatives who went missing during the presidential election period.

On 8 March 2021, local fish traders demonstrated against job losses, at Marenga beach in Port Bunyala town (Budalangi, Busia), accusing foreign middleman of hurting businesses. The traders have been reportedly incurring losses since the middleman from Nairobi joined the fish business last week.

On 10 March 2021, NUP supporters protested in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) following a protest call by NUP candidate Bobi Wine (alias of Robert Kuagylanyi Ssentamu) to rise up peacefully to challenge 'a regime that has oppressed and exploited them' and to free the people who were abducted during the election. Police arrested several supporters.
Around 10 March 2021 (week of), bus drivers in Mwanza (Nyamagana, Mwanza) gathered to protest against the new electronic ticketing system.

On 11 March 2021, dozens of secondary students protested after completing examinations in Shashamane town (Arsi, Oromia), demanding the release of political prisoners. The students were arrested, with some being beaten badly enough to be admitted to a local hospital.

On 11 March 2021, several students in Manyatta secondary school boycotted classes, stormed out of the school and protested at the county headquarters to present their grievances to senior education and security officers in Bomet town (Bomet East, Bomet). On 12 March 2021, demonstrators protested against land use by Oromia regional government in Borana zone, Yabalo (coded separately), Moyale (coded separately), Dilo (coded separately), Dubluk (coded separately), Arero (Arero, Borena), Dhas, Diree woredas. Hundreds of people participated.

On 12 March 2021, demonstrators protested against land use by Oromia regional government in In Borana zone, Yabalo (coded separately), Moyale (coded separately), Dilo (coded separately), Dubuluk (Dubluk, Borena), Arero (coded separately), Dhas, Diree woredas. Hundreds of people participated.

On 12 March 2021, demonstrators protested against land use by Oromia regional government in Borana zone, Yabelo (Yabelo, Borena), Moyale (coded separately), Dilo (coded separately), Dubluk (coded separately), Arero (coded separately), Dhas, Diree woredas. Hundreds of people participated.

On 12 March 2021, demonstrators protested against land use by Oromia regional government in In Borana zone, Yabalo (coded separately), Moyale (coded separately), Dilo near Sire (Dilo, Borena), Dubluk (coded separately), Arero (coded separately), Dhas, Diree woredas. On 12 March 2021, demonstrators protested against land use by Oromia regional government in Borana zone, Yabalo (coded separately), Moyale (Moyale, Borena), Dilo (coded separately), Dubluk (coded separately), Arero (coded separately), Dhas, Diree woredas. Hundreds of people participated.

On 13 March 2021, a section of boda boda taxi operators demonstrated by chanting, shouting, waving placards, carrying twigs and hooting their motorbikes in Sotik (Bomet East, Bomet), against the disappearance of money raised by the president. The group demanded the area member of parliament to account for the funds.

On 15 March 2021, police arrested NUP leader Bobi Wine (alias of Robert Kyagulanyi) and 11 other as they protested the detention of his supporters by security forces in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala). Police arrested them for holding an unlawful procession, incitement to violence and for inconsiderate use of the road. All of them were released afterwards.

Around 15 March 2021 (month of), residents, mainly fishermen, protested in Lamu (Lamu West, Lamu) against the escalating tensions between Kenya and Somalia, following a maritime boundary dispute. The group demanded that their grievances be addressed.

On 16 March 2021, residents from Tiira Town Council (Samia-Bugwe, Busia) protested against the alleged harassment, extortion and torture they have faced from the police. According to residents, police arrest, beat and take money from people who move past curfew hours. Police fired live bullets in the air to disperse the protesters.

Around 16 March 2021 (as reported), students of the Busitima University in Mbale (Mbale Municipality, Mbale) have staged a demonstration accusing their lecturers of failing to conduct lessons for three weeks. According to reports, the students locked their lecturers inside the campus before taking to the streets.

On 18 March 2021, primary school students of Atim Kikoma Primary School in Mucwini Sub County, coded to Mucwini Camp (Chua, Kitgum) protested against one of their teachers for failing to deliver past examination papers they had already paid for.

On 18 March 2021, a protest quickly erupted around a sky news camera crew as they interviewed residents of Gijet (Southern Tigray, Tigray), with demonstrators being against the federal government's action against the TPLF in the Tigray region.
On 18 March 2021, activists, predominantly women, demanded better health funding to curb teenage pregnancies during a belated Women's Day celebration held in Kamuli district (Bugabula, Kamuli).
On 19 March 2021, people, including former Senior Commissioner of Police, protested in Kitagata town council (Sheema South, Sheema) against the government's plans to improve Kitagata' hot springs.

Around 19 March 2021 (as reported), police arrested 4 members of the People Power Asili group who staged an unlawful protest in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) and on allegations of inciting violence. The group advocated for an overhaul of Uganda's constitution to introduce regional-based presidential selections.

On 19 March 2021, students and FFF activists protested at Kampala International University in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala), with the motto 'No More Empty Promises' for more sustainability, better water management and protection of the forests.

Around 20 March 2021 (as reported), dozens of people who reportedly paid money to carry out farming activities on President Museveni's farm in Omunkondo, Nyaburiza Parish, Nyarutuntu Sub County, protested in front of the office of the District Resident Commissioner in Ntungamo (Ntungamo Municipality, Ntungamo) after they were stopped from using the land.

On 22 March 2021, people, including NUP supporters, protested in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) for the immediate release of all detained NUP members. Police intervened and arrested MP Ssegirinya Muhammad who is alleged to have participated and was later charged with inciting violence.

On 23 March 2021, protesters gathered in Dire Tiyara (East Hararghe, Oromia) demonstrating against conflict occurring in the Wollo area of the country. Police forces quickly disbanded the protest, injuring several students.

On 23 March 2021, students at Ambo university (Ambo, West Shewa, Oromia) held a protest denouncing the conflict occurring in the Wollo area of the country. Police forces quickly disbanded the protest, injuring several students.

On 23 March 2021, protesters gathered in Erer town (Sitti, Somali), demonstrating against a recent announcement by the national election board to exclude several woredas from electoral proceedings following a dispute between the Amhara and Somali regional states regarding the boundary.

Around 23 March 2021 (as reported), a woman and her 7 children protested in front of the district headquarters in Masaka (Masaka Municipality, Masaka), demanding the payment of the pension of her husband who died about 8 years ago.

On 25 March 2021, more than 100 farmers and pastoralists from Kabukero village protested at the office of the Kasese Resident District Commissioner office (Kasese Municipality, Kasese) against the continued suspension of farming activities on their land.
On 25 March 2021, several people peacefully demonstrated in Dhadar village (Iskushuban, Bari), supporting the federal government of Somalia. Puntland police fired live bullets to disperse the group.

On 26 March 2021, local traders protested against the demolition of their kiosks by county enforcement officers in Kisii town (Kisii Central, Kisii). The traders resisted the demolition and blocked major roads. Police fired teargas canisters to disperse the protesters.

On 27 March 2021, truck drivers peacefully protested at the Elegu border (Kilak, Amuru) against the insecurity along the Nimule-Juba highway. Drivers continued a sit-in protest by parking their trucks for over a week.

Around 28 March 2021 (as reported), hospital patients and their attendants protested outside the hospital in Mulago (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) against non-treatment and the provision of less food by the hospital.

On 15 May 2021, street traders demonstrated in Buyaga (Budadiri, Sironko) against frequent thefts and accused local authorities of not taking appropriate security measures.
