On 17 May 2021, students of St Paul's diploma teachers training college demonstrated against the killing of a third-year student along the Bungoma-Malaba highway at Kimaet junction at Bumula constituency in Bungoma Township (Kanduyi, Bungoma).

On 17 May 2021, several people from the Meru ethnic group demonstrated against the killing of their tribesman allegedly by a senior officer. The demonstrators blocked the Garissa - Nairobi highway and the road leading to the police station in Garissa town (Waberi, Garissa). The police dispersed the demonstrators.
On 18 May 2021, a group of pastoralists demonstrated against land concessions in Gombe (Butambala, Central).

On 18 May 2021, local residents demonstrated and blocked access to offices (through unspecified means) of a credit cooperative chairperson in Kiyindi (Buikwe, Central) over allegations of mismanagement of funds.

On 19 May 2021, several Christians demonstrated against an alleged illegal wedding in front of North West Ankole Church in Ibanda (Ibanda, Western). Police asked the protesters to leave the premises and write to the church
On 19 May 2021, 150 sugar cane traders demonstrated over economic losses due to Kenyan laws on export in Busia district (Eastern), asking the government for an intervention.

On 20 May 2021, local residents protested in Makongeni (Makadara, Nairobi) against the planned move by Kenya railways retirement benefits scheme to evict them. Police intervened and fired teargas to disperse the group.

On 20 May 2021, police forces clashed with demonstrators, shouting anti-PP slogans, in Mer Awi woreda (West Gojam, Amhara). A pro-PP rally had been taking place at the same time. 4 students were killed and 12 others injured - with some sources claiming as many as 7 fatalities and 46 injuries.
On 20 May 2021, 220 street traders demonstrated over stalls concessions in the market of Busia (Eastern).

On 20 May 2021, members of the Isahakia community demonstrated against a plan by the World Bank and Nakuru county government to construct low-cost housing estate on their ancestral land in Naivasha town (Lake View, Naivasha). The demonstrators accused the National Land Commission of failing to adhere to a directive by the Head of State five years ago to resettle them within seven months.
On 21 May 2021, fishers and their leaders demonstrated against the heavy presence and activities of the Fisheries Protection Unit in Nakasongola district (Buruli, Central).
On 21 May 2021, members of an unidentified clan demonstrated against and warned 400 Alur people to move away from their land in Buliisa (Western).
On 21 May 2021, protesters gathered in Addis Ababa to denounce foreign interference in Ethiopia's internal affairs. Slogans included 'Hands off Ethiopia'.

On 22 May 2021, about a hundred people demonstrated against the Hirshabelle and Hiran regional administrations on the main road of Nur Hawad section to the Dhagah Jabis waterway in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).
On 23 May 2021, local residents involved in the restocking of indigenous fish species demonstrated over the illegal fishing and lack of control near Bugombe on Kome Island (Mukono, Central).
On 23 May 2021, a group of women demonstrated over the need for more severe penalties for husbands committing violence in Ovujo (Maracha, Northern).
On 24 May 2021, 500 street traders demonstrated at the Resident City Commissioner office over allocations of stalls in the new market in Soroti (Soroti, Eastern).
On 24 May 2021, local residents peacefully demonstrated against frequent criminal acts in Gulu city (Northern).
On 25 May 2021, a demonstration against the latest attacks on security forces was held in Mehal Sheko area of Sheko Woreda (coded to Mizan Teferi, Bench Sheko, SNNP).

On 25 May 2021, Maasai Mara university students demonstrated against the recklessness of boda boda riders, which they said led to the accident killing of a first year student at the main campus along Narok-Bomet road in Narok town (Narok North, Narok). The police fired teargas canisters at protesters, and at least five students were arrested.
On 26 May 2021, local residents demonstrated and stormed some lands over a land grabbing dispute in Kahendero (Kasese, Western).

On 26 May 2021, a group of NUP councillors demonstrated with placards and chains over the liberation of NUP supporters in jail at KCCA offices in Kawempe (Kampala, Central). Police intervened to disperse the demonstration. No fatalities or injuries are reported.
Around 27 May 2021, a group of environmental conservationists demonstrated over the preservation of a forest in Bugoma (Buhaguzi, Kikuube).
On 27 May 2021, a group of women demonstrated over women rights and the need for inclusion in Amudat (Pokot, Northern).
On 27 May 2021, 47 local families demonstrated over a dispute concerning the exhumation of their relatives in Gulu (Northern).

On 27 May 2021, graduate students demonstrated, demanding the stop of online learning, in Kyambogo (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened and arrested 8 students. No fatalities or injuries are reported.
On 28 May 2021, NUP supporters demonstrated against alleged corruption in the party in Bukoto (Kampala, Central).
On 28 May 2021, local residents demonstrated against the expropriation of their land in Kinogozi village (Buhaguzi, Kikuube).

On 29 May 2021, during a medical camp meeting, some people living with albinism demonstrated over the need to fight human rights violations and discrimination against people living with albinism in Merikit (Tororo, Eastern).
On 29 May 2021, over 800 boda boda riders demonstrated and presented a petition against violence and extortion perpetrated by police forces in Gulu city (Northern).
On 29 May 2021, people living with disabilities (PWDs) demonstrated over their lack of access to coronavirus vaccines in Lira (Northern).
On 29 May 2021, the relatives and friends of a journalist, who had died the day before, demonstrated over the alleged negligence of and extortion by the hospital staff in Mengo (Kampala, Central).
On 30 May 2021, a protest under the slogan of 'our voice for our independence and sovereignty' was held around Legehar Adebaby in Dire Dawa (Gende Kore, Dire Dawa).
On 30 May 2021, a protest under the slogan of 'our voice for our independence and sovereignty' was held in Harar (Abadir, Harari).
On 30 May 2021, a protest under the slogan of 'our voice for our independence and sovereignty' was held in Asosa (Asosa, Assosa, Benshangul/Gumuz).
On 30 May 2021, local residents demonstrated over the need to establish more armed forces to control the animal attacks in Karusandara (Busongora, Kasese).
On 30 May 2021, over 35 bibanja holders demonstrated over a land grabbing dispute in Kakuuto (Kyotera, Central), and the police forces intervened to restore calm.
On 30 May 2021, local residents demonstrated over the need for water supply in Lwabiyata (Buruli, Nakasongola).
On 30 May 2021, a protest under the slogan of 'our voice for our independence and sovereignty' was held in Sodo (Sodo town, Welayta).

On 30 May 2021, a protest under the slogan of 'our voice for our independence and sovereignty' was held in Addis Ababa stadium, Addis Ababa (Region 14, Addis Ababa). More than 50,000 protesters took part and asked the U.S. to reconsider its 'wrong' policy against Ethiopia.
On 30 May 2021, a protest under the slogan of 'our voice for our independence and sovereignty' was held in Gambella (Gambela town, Agnewak, Gambella).
On 30 May 2021, a protest under the slogan of 'our voice for our independence and sovereignty' was held in Hosaena city (Hadiya, SNNP).
On 30 May 2021, airport taxi drivers demonstrated against the new coronavirus security measures affecting their business, in Entebbe Airport (Entebbe, Wakiso).
On 31 May 2021, several local residents protested against police brutality after police forces killed a man in Kulmis village in Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).

On 31 May 2021, residents of Pendukeni area blocked the Malindi-Mombasa highway with logs and stones in Msabaha (Malindi, Kilifi) against the arrest of their own by police officers over a land dispute. The group demanded that the person be released.

On 31 May 2021, a group of youth demonstrated over the death of a young man, killed by a policeman the previous day, in Kamuli (Eastern). Police forces intervened with tear gas and live bullets to suppress the demonstration.
On 1 June 2021, demonstrators denounced the imposition of United States sanctions on Ethiopia in front of the Embassy of the United States of America in Addis Ababa (Region 14, Addis Ababa).

On 1 June 2021, local residents protested at the Jomo Kenyatta international stadium in Kisumu (Kisumu Central, Kisumu), against the move by the police to turn them away for lacking invitation cards for the Madaraka celebrations. The residents demanded to know the rationale used in distributing the cards.
On 2 June 2021, college students demonstrated against the increase in tuition fees in Gulu city (Northern). Police forces intervened to disperse the demonstrators.
On 3 June 2021, college students demonstrated against the increase in tuition fees in Gulu city (Northern).
On 3 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the arrest of a group of youth accused of 'rioting' in Gombe (Butambala, Central).

Around 3 June 2021 (as reported), over 150 workers of style industries demonstrated by camping outside the company's premises in Nairobi Industrial Area (Makadara, Nairobi), against alleged victimization and abuse by the company's management. The group demanded their dues.
On 3 June 2021, street traders demonstrated against the death of their colleague in prison, allegedly caused by the police forces, in Nyendo (Bukoto, Masaka).

On 3 June 2021, a christian group demonstrated demanding access to the Martyrs Day ceremony in Namugongo (Kira, Wakiso). Some local residents opposed to this demonstration, and there were risks of clashes between christians and the local community.
On 4 June 2021, a muslim group demonstrated against the lack of clean water, demanding from the local administration to act, in Lukaya (Kalungu, Central).

On 5 June 2021, several local residents protested against the Gabiley local councillor's preliminary results announced by national election commission regional office in Gabiley town (Gebiley, Woqooyi Galbeed).

On 5 June 2021, for a second day, hundreds of sugar cane farmers marched from Lubinu to Shianda market (Mumias East, Kakamega), against alleged political interference in the revival of the Mumias sugar company. The farmers demanded the prospective investor not to bail out of the proposed revival plan.

On 6 June 2021, local residents, together with Civil Society organizations, demonstrated against the health, economic, and environmental damages caused by a tobacco company business in Ajia (Vurra, Arua).
On 7 June 2021, around 300 health workers and teachers demonstrated over salary deductions in Lwengo (Bukoto, Central).
On 7 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the alleged inappropriate compensations for being affected by an oil company business, in different locations of Kyotera district (Central).
On 7 June 2021, cocoa farmers demonstrated over the critical fall in the prices of their production, in different locations of Bundibugyo district (Western).
On 7 June 2021, some students' parents demonstrated against the closure of schools, complaining that they had already paid school fees, in Namilyango (Mukono, Central).
On 7 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictions in Katooke (Mwenge, Kyenjojo). LDU forces intervened to restore calm, and no fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 7 June 2021, a group of around 100 local residents demonstrated against the closure of the only water well, due to a coronavirus infection, in Ombokoro village (Terego, Arua).
On 7 June 2021, 40 people demonstrated in front of the local government headquarters, demanding compensation for the loss of livestock due to the war, in Kitgum (Northern).
On 7 June 2021, several students, who were returning to their residences outside the city, demonstrated against the excessive charges for transports in Mukono (Central).
On 8 June 2021, around 2000 local residents demonstrated over a land grabbing dispute that threatened to evict them of their land in Kata (Kyadondo, Wakiso).

On 8 June 2021, around 500 street traders demonstrated against their eviction from the streets in Gulu city (Northern). Police forces intervened to restore calm, and no fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 8 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the destruction of water pipes by a private water company, demanding compensation, in Seeta (Mukono, Central).

On 8 June 2021, university students demonstrated against increasing cases of femicide and rape in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi county), following the murder of a student at Masinde Muliro University. The protest was dispersed by police, alleging that the students were holding an illegal gathering and breaking the coronavirus protocols.

On 9 June 2021, a peaceful protest, mainly by women, against injustices committed by the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF) and foreign intervention in Ethiopia's internal issues was held in Humera city in Setit Humera (Western Tigray, Tigray).
On 9 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the decision of Lira city administrations to use their land as a burial ground in Akalo (Kole, Northern).
On 9 June 2021, small scale miners demonstrated against the requirement to register their activities with the local environmental and natural resources office in Panyan-go (Jonam, Pakwach).
On 9 June 2021, street traders demonstrated against their eviction from the streets in Lira city (Northern).

On 10 June 2021, a peaceful protest against injustices committed by the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF) and foreign intervention in Ethiopia's internal issues was held in Ba'eker city (coded as Humera) in Setit Humera (Western Tigray, Tigray).
On 10 June 2021, taxi drivers demonstrated against the alleged extortions perpetrated by security officers in Bududa (Bubulo, Manafwa).

On 10 June 2021, over a hundred parents who their sons were sent to Eritrea for military trainings protested and demand response from government of Somalia about the wear about of their children long the KM4 road junction in Mogadishu - Wadajir district (Banadir).
On 10 June 2021, displaced persons from Guraferda woreda gathered in front of the SNNPR administrative office in Awasa (Sidama, Sidama) to demand government action.
On 10 June 2021, a protest against US sanctions on Ethiopia was held by women supporters of Prosperity Party in Debark town in North Gondar (Amhara).
On 10 June 2021, 11 former councillors demonstrated against late payments by the local administration in Arua (Northern).

On 11 June 2021, protests against injustices committed by the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF) and foreign intervention in Ethiopia's internal issues were held in May Cadera ( May Kadra also known as Kadra Wonz) in Western Tigray (Tigray).

On 11 June 2021, a group of Burundian and Congolese refugees in Nyarugusu Refugee Camp (Kasulu, Kigoma) gathered in demonstration against the results of elections of camp representatives held on 9 May, as they claimed the Burundian who presented himself had more votes than the Congolese presented as winner. Police officers used tear gas and live ammunition against the protesters. At least five people were seriously injured. Several people were arrested. Police and protesters accused each other of having used firearms.
On 11 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the closure of a bridge that allowed them to cross the Nile in Njeru (Buikwe, Central).

On 11 June 2021, over a hundred parents who their sons were sent to Eritrea for military trainings protested and demand response from government of Somalia about the wear about of their children long the KM4 road junction in Mogadishu - Wadajir district (Banadir).
On 13 June 2021, a demonstration against US sanctions on Ethiopia was held by women supporters of Prosperity Party in Dansha town, Dansha (Western Tigray, Tigray).

On 13 June 2021, over 100 parents whose sons were sent to Eritrea for military trainings demonstrated and demanded response from the government of Somalia about the whereabouts of their children in Guri-Ceel village (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud).

On 13 June 2021, a section of United Democratic Alliance (UDA) supporters invaded the Jubilee rally in Kiambaa (Kihara, Kiambaa, Kiambu). The supporters were carrying wheelbarrows and UDA banners, dancing and cheering. They also burnt Jubilee T-shirts.
On 14 June 2021, local residents demonstrated over the damages that landslides had provoked to their properties, demanding compensation from government, in Mpatta (Mukono, Central).

On 14 June 2021, several local residents demonstrated against the Kenya airstrikes in Gedo region. The demonstrators demanded justice for the affected family and accused the Kenyans government of targeting civilians in Garbahaarey town (Garbahaarey, Gedo).
On 14 June 2021, hundreds of street vendors demonstrated against the reallocation of their stalls in Luwero (Katikamu, Central).
On 14 June 2021, fishers demonstrated against the environmental damages produced by a company in Jinja (Eastern).
On 15 June 2021, a group of students in Mtakuja village near Katavi (Kaliua, Tabora) gathered in demonstration against the practice of rape and forced labour in the cultivation of tobacco.
On 15 June 2021, 270 households demonstrated against the eviction from their land in Maruzi area (Apac, Northern) (coded as Aluga).

On 15 June 2021, dozens of Bajaj or tuk tuk drivers demonstrated and closed the road between Shabelle and Daljirka Dahsoon Junction roads in Mogadishu - Bondhere district (Banadir) with their vehicles. They demonstrated against the poor conditions of the main roads and a lack of a sewer system in Mogadishu.

Around 15 June 2021 (as reported), a group of rickshaw drivers in Mogadishu - Hamar Weyne (Banadir, Banadir) gathered in demonstration against illegal road blocks and the state of roads. The drivers called on regional authorities in the region to address their complaints. Government security forces dispersed the demonstration.
On 17 June 2021, 150 households demonstrated against the construction of a highway in Nakawa (Kampala, Central), demanding compensation.

On 17 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the confusing circumstances under which the local councilor allegedly committed suicide in Kayunga (Ntenjeru, Central). Demonstrators claimed that the councilor was actually killed.

Around 17 June 2021 (as reported), boda boda taxi operators barricaded an unspecified road with bonfires and stones in Kitengela (Kajiado East, Kajiado) in demonstration against the state of a bridge connecting the area to the Noonkopir village.
On 17 June 2021, a group of activists demonstrated against the annexation of Ayivu district to the Arua district in Arua (Northern).
On 18 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against delays in main street repairs in Nansololo (Bulamogi, Kaliro).

On 18 June 2021, Jubilee party parliamentary candidate and her supporters demonstrated by walking out of the tallying centre at Mangu high school in Juja (Juja, Kiambu), against claims of vote rigging during the by-election. The group demanded for fresh counting and tallying of the votes.
On 18 June 2021, local leaders demonstrated against the death of four miners due to a landslide, demanding compensation for the victims' families, in Makindye (Kampala, Central).
On 18 June 2021, local residents demonstrated over the lack of public services in Arua city (Northern), demanding more funds for the health and road sectors.

On 19 June 2021, street traders publicly demonstrated against the coronavirus measures in various markets of Kampala (Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration, but no fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 21 June 2021, street traders demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictive measures, demanding relax on restrictions and free movement around the country, in Kampala (Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 21 June 2021, Muslim street traders stormed an important meeting and demonstrated against the unfair treatment of their leader in Luwero (Katikamu, Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration and avoid a potential escalation of violence. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 21 June 2021, local leaders demonstrated against the police decision to release two health workers, who were allegedly responsible for the death of five patients in the central hospital, in Arua (Northern).
On 21 June 2021, a section of health workers protested by waving placards in Bungoma (Kanduyi, Bungoma), against delayed salaries. The group demanded the county government to pay their salaries.

On 21 June 2021, street traders demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictive measures and kept their stores open in Jinja (Eastern). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration and to close the shops. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 22 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the increase in crimes, demanding a stronger deployment of security forces, in Ruhira (Bukanga, Isingiro).

On 23 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the lack of food supplies due to the coronavirus restrictions in Wandegeya (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to disperse demonstrators.

On 23 June 2021, a section of youth protested by waving placards in Makongeni (Makadara, Nairobi) against the arrest of 3 of their colleagues over allegations of robbery with violence. The group demanded the release of their colleagues.

On 23 June 2021, some essential workers demonstrated against the police roadblocks in Kampala (Central). Police forces fired teargas and bullets in the air to suppress the demonstration. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 23 June 2021, some labour groups demonstrated against lack of food supplies due to the coronavirus restrictions in Kisimbiri (Busiro, Wakiso).
On 24 June 2021, a group of women gathered in demonstration in Mogadishu (Banadir, Banadir) because their sons were moved presumably to Eritrea for clandestine military training.
On 24 June 2021, street traders demonstrated against the restrictive coronavirus measures in Lira (Northern).
On 24 June 2021, a group of survivors of the 2008 massacre demonstrated against the absence of government support in Ngai (Oyam, Northern).
On 25 June 2021, 25 health workers demonstrated against the delay in the payment of their wages in Hoima (Western).
On 25 June 2021, university students petitioned and demonstrated against the lack of accommodation and learning facilities in Kyambogo (Kampala, Central).

On 25 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the excessive quantity of waste spread on their properties in Luzira (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 25 June 2021, street traders demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictive rules in Arua (Northern).

On 25 June 2021, Kisumu National Polytechnic students demonstrated in Kisumu (Railways, Kisumu Central, Kisumu) against school management calling off student elections over coronavirus fears. Police officers intervened. The school was closed for 14 days.
On 25 June 2021, local leaders demonstrated against the sale of public assets in Jinja (Eastern).
On 26 June 2021, local residents and street traders demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictions in Jinja (Eastern). Police forces intervened to restore the calm.
On 28 June 2021, thousands of people took to the streets in Jijiga town (Fafan, Somali) to denounce the killing of ethnic Somali residents by Afar Militias a few days prior.
On 28 June 2021, milk traders demonstrated and petitioned against the increasing in milk prices in Masaka city (Central).
On 28 June 2021, a group of students demonstrated against the country debt burden in front of the university in Kyambogo (Kampala, Central), demanding appropriate investments in the education sector.

On 28 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictive measures in Kampala (Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 28 June 2021, local residents demonstrated against the incomplete road works in Sikuda (Samia-Bugwe, Busia).
On 28 June 2021, boda boda riders demonstrated against the violence of police, perpetrated in order to enforce coronavirus measures, in Bududa district (Eastern, coded as Bufuma).

On 28 June 2021, local residents demonstrated, erecting barricades (means unspecified), against the road construction planned by a private company in Kapchorwa area (Eastern). Police forces intervened using teargas to disperse demonstrators. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 28 June 2021, health workers staged a peaceful demonstration at Keroka sub-county hospital (Nyaribari Masaba, Kisii county), over mistreatment by police officers as they enforced a dusk-to-dawn curfew.

On 28 June 2021, several local residents demanded justice for the death of boda boda rider and a student in Marani town (Kitutu Chache North, Kisii). The police fire live bullets at the demonstrators who erected barricades (unspecified), injuring two people.
On 28 June 2021, some motorcyclists, who were employed out of the city, demonstrated against the restrictions to the bridge crossing in Jinja (Eastern).

On 29 June 2021, street traders demonstrated against the ban on market access, due to the coronavirus restrictions, in Nakasero (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 29 June 2021, local leaders gathered at the main health centre and demonstrated against converting the entire hospital to the treatment of coronavirus patients in Entebbe (Wakiso, Central).
On 29 June 2021, health workers demonstrated against the harassment acts perpetrated against them by the security officers in Kabale (Western).

On 29 June 2021, 100 boda boda riders demonstrated at the central police station against the chairperson of the town, demanding his resignation, in Arua (Northern). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration, and no fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 29 June 2021, dozens of women joined the Meru female Members of the County Assembly (MCAs) in a demonstration in Kinoru stadium, Meru (Imenti North, Meru county ), by chanting slogans against the Meru Woman Representative, Kawira Mwangaza's demeaning utterances, that the female MCAs' nominations were handed 'under blankets'. Police fired teargas to disperse the group.
On 30 June 2021, watermelon vendors demonstrated against the detrimental effects on their businesses caused by the coronavirus restrictive measures in Katwe (Kampala, Central).

On 1 July 2021, local residents and street traders demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictive measures in Kampala (Central). Police forces intervened with teargas to suppress the demonstration. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 1 July 2021, a group of boda boda riders demonstrated against the consequences on their business provoked by the coronavirus measures in Moroto (Northern).
On 1 July 2021, health workers demonstrated, demanding the payment of risk allowances, in Kitgum (Northern).
On 1 July 2021, boda boda riders demonstrated against the violence perpetrated by the police forces to enforce the coronavirus restrictive measures in Kabale (Western).

On 2 July 2021, tens of casual workers demonstrated against a six-month salary delay at the Isiolo County Referral Hospital in Isiolo town (Bula Pesa, Isiolo). The police used teargas to disperse the group.
On 3 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against a recent increase in kidnapping cases in Jigjiga (Jijiga, Fafan, Somali) after a young girl went missing.
On 3 July 2021, former Special Police Constables demonstrated at the police office and demonstrated against their unpaid salaries in Lugazi (Buikwe, Central).
On 3 July 2021, 50 people with disabilities, after receiving a small relief from charity organizations, demonstrated against the lack of welfare facilities in Arua (Northern).
On 4 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the illegal logging and cutting of timber in the forest reserve in Itirikwa (East Moyo, Adjumani).
On 4 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against a roadblock decided by police forces in Entebbe (Wakiso, Central).
On 5 July 2021, local residents and fishers demonstrated against their poor shelter conditions in Kasenyi (Bukomansimbi, Central).
On 5 July 2021, human rights activists demonstrated against the corrupt policies implemented by the secretary at the Ministry of Health, demanding her resignation, in Kampala area (Central).

On 5 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the arrest of an important businessman, who was providing benefits to the local population, in Kyengera (Busiro, Wakiso). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration.
On 5 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictive measures, demanding relief, in Namungoona (Kampala, Central).
On 5 July 2021, 100 workers demonstrated against the low wages and delayed payments of their salaries in Kitgum (Northern).
On 6 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the lack of food demanding supplies in Mbuya (Kampala, Central).

On 6 July 2021, 20 town councillors demonstrated against the city Commissioner, accusing him of sabotaging meetings, in Nakasero (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration.
On 6 July 2021, bus operators demonstrated against the damage to their businesses due to coronavirus restrictions, demanding financial support, in Kisenyi (Kampala, Central).
On 6 July 2021, traders demonstrated against the damage to their businesses caused by coronavirus measures in Wakiso (Busiro, Central), demanding compensation.
On 6 July 2021, 600 street traders demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictions, demanding cash relief for the losses in their businesses, in Jinja (Eastern).
On 7 July 2021, banana traders demonstrated against the increase of taxes in Rutoma (Kashari, Mbarara).
On 7 July 2021, boda boda riders gathered in the Resident Commissioner's office and demonstrated against the violence perpetrated against them by police forces in Hoima (Western).
On 7 July 2021, several people, including activists, have staged a peaceful demonstration on Saba-Saba day to demand the government to lower taxes in Kamukunji grounds (Pumwani, Kamukunji, Nairobi).

On 7 July 2021, several truck drives demonstrated against the high taxes and demanded Hirshabelle authorities to lower taxes in Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). They claim to pay taxes at two checkpoints.

On 7 July 2021, hundreds of residents demonstrated by carrying twigs and waving placards, blowing vuvuzela's as they marched from Sirimon village to the sub-county deputy county commissioner's office in Buuri [coded as Ruiri, Buuri, Meru], against the disappearance of security analyst Mwenda Mbijiwe. The residents have vowed to hold similar protests every Wednesday until the security analyst is found.
On 7 July 2021, several people, including activists, have staged a peaceful demonstration on Saba-Saba day to demand the government to lower taxes in Kisumu town (Railways, Kisumu Central, Kisumu).

On 7 July 2021, several youths demonstrated in the central business district (CBD) against the high rate of youth unemployment and poor economic conditions in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe). The police arrested some demonstrators and used tear gas to disperse the group.
On 8 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the refuse of a cement company to pay the rights to operate in the area in Tapac (Matheniko, Moroto).
On 8 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the poor state of the roads, demanding improvements, in Rwimi (Bunyangabu, Western).
On 8 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the failure of public administrations to ensure standards of hygiene and environmental quality in Hoima (Western).
On 8 July 2021, taxi drivers demonstrated against the exclusion of their labor category from the coronavirus relief cash plan from government in Koboko town (Northern).
On 8 July 2021, some labor groups gathered in the Resident Commissioner's office and demonstrated against the delays on their payments in Busia (Eastern).
On 8 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the eviction of their land caused by a project funded by the World Bank in Kawaala (Kampala, Central).

On 8 July 2021, protesters in Filakit Geregera town (North Wello, Amhara) blocked roads (means unspecified) and forced a World Food Program to turn back. Protesters demanded that aid be distributed in their area and not in Tigray region.
On 9 July 2021, market traders demonstrated against the incompleteness in market construction in Masaka (Central).
On 12 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the lack of ambulances to respond to coronavirus cases in Hoima (Western).

On 12 July 2021, street traders demonstrated against the coronavirus restrictive measures in a market in Kisenyi (Kampala, Central). Police forces and local defense units intervened to disperse demonstrators. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 12 July 2021, boda boda riders demonstrated against the violence perpetrated by police forces to ensure the respect of coronavirus restrictive measures in Kabale (Western).

On 12 July 2021, private security forces and traders demonstrated against delays in salary payments in a market in Mulago (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to disperse demonstrators, shooting on them, killing one trader and injuring some private security officers.

On 13 July 2021, Tigrayans who live in Humera (Setit Humera in Western Tigray, Tigray) demonstrated the recent call of war by Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF). After the unilateral ceasefire by the federal government, TPLF promised to continue fighting to control Western Tigray which is currently controlled by Amhara region. .
On 13 July 2021, several tuk-tuk drivers demonstrated against the conditions of roads and the high taxes in front of district office in Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud).
On 13 July 2021, Congolese refugees demonstrated against the lack of relief assistance in Bubukwanga camp (Bwamba, Bundibugyo).
On 13 July 2021, dozens of local council chairpersons demonstrated against the delays in the payment of their salaries in Lamwo city (Northern).
On 13 July 2021, former students demonstrated against the delay of local institutions to release their transcript of records, complaining that they could not find work, in Unyama (Aswa, Gulu).
On 13 July 2021, street traders demonstrated against the inadequacy of mosquito nets, which were distributed as a safety measure to sleep in the markets, in Gulu (Northern).
On 13 July 2021, local residents demonstrated against the lack of clean water supplies in Nakawa (Kampala, Central).
On 13 July 2021, Batwo ethnic group members demonstrated against the decision of government to not include them in the cash relief plan for coronavirus response in Kisoro district (Western).
On 14 July 2021, local residents and leaders demonstrated against the violence and extortions of police forces in enforcing the coronavirus restrictions in Masaka city (Central).

On 14 July 2021, boda boda riders demonstrated against the extortion and brutality perpetrated by police forces to enforce the coronavirus restrictive measures in Masindi city (Western). On 25 August 2021, a protest against the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF) and Oromo Liberation Front (OLF)-Shane was held in Negele (Guji, Oromia).

On 25 August 2021, the Gaalkacyo government administration organized a demonstration against Al Shabaab militants in Mudug in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug).

On 25 August 2021, a number of doctors and KMPDU officials demonstrated at the Kenyatta national referral hospital in Nairobi (Nairobi - Langata). The doctors complained about the refusal of study leave for workers and bullying from management. The police arrested more than 15 doctors.

On 25 August 2021, local residents demonstrated against AMISOM UPDF troops for the killing of the civilians Golweyn town (no further details). The demonstrators gathered in KM4 junction in Mogadishu - Hodan (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). They were demanding justice for the affected families.

On 26 August 2021, about five hundred people demonstrated in support of the Galmudug government administration, SNA, and Galmudug Force's security operation against AS militants in Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). They urged business owners to contribute financially to the military operation

On 28 August 2021, residents demonstrated in Daljirka Daahsoon junction in Mogadishu - Bondhere (Banadir) against AMISOM UPDF troops for the killing of civilians in Golweyn town (no further details). They were demanding justice for the affected families.

On 28 August 2021, several local residents demonstrated against AMISOM UPDF troops in Golweyn village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). They were demanding justice for the seven people killed by troops two weeks ago.

On 29 August 2021, environmental activists demonstrated against the death of forest elephants in the Bugoma forest, claiming that the environmental degradation was a responsibility of a private sugar company in the area, in Hoima (Western).

On 29 August 2021, human rights activists demonstrated against the violence perpetrated by an unidentified armed group, that was suspected of being linked with ADF group and responsible for the death of 30 people in a few weeks, in Masaka city (Central).

On 30 August 2021, residents in Kamashi Zone, Mijga Woreda held a protest after militants had attacked the town and killed several people the day before (coded seperately). Protesters demanded that local security forces take action on the perpetrators. Location could not be found, coded to nearby town of Melca Daboch (Kemashi, Benshangul/Gumuz).

On 30 August 2021, local councillors demonstrated in Mpigi (Mawokota, Central) against the truck drivers' activities in the area, claiming that speed in trading centers put at risk the security and the market activities in the city.
On 30 August 2021, 32 district councilors demonstrated against the delays in payment of their allowances in Hoima (Western).
On 31 August 2021, persons with disabilities demonstrated against their exclusion from the coronavirus relief fund in Soroti (Eastern).
On 31 August 2021, local residents demonstrated against the presence in the area of cattle thieves, demanding an enforcement of security measures, in Bukedea (Eastern).

On 31 August 2021, youth under the under the Siaya Accountability Forum demonstrated by arriving at the county government offices in motorcycles, while shouting and carrying a banner [coded as Siaya, Alego Usonga, Siaya], against alleged corruption. The governor's security personnel (presumed police) intervened and beat up the protestors. The protest leader was injured during the incident.
On 31 August 2021, around 100 local chairpersons demonstrated against the delays in payment of coronavirus allowances in Nalubembe (Kibuku, Eastern).

On 1 September 2021, members of a Muslim community demonstrated against the local administration, which had permitted to non-Muslims to slaughter animals for public consumption, in Gulu city (Northern).

On 1 September 2021, local residents protested in Luuwaje village near Kajiado (, Kajiado Central, Kajiado), against the high number of camels in the area are spreading diseases to their livestock. The group demanded the camel owners to relocate from the area within 7 days.

On 1 September 2021, lecturers and non-teaching staff from University of Eldoret demonstrated over the delayed implementation of payments to end the planned strike in Eldoret town (Moiben, Uasin Gishu).
On 1 September 2021, around 100 local residents demonstrated against the eviction from their lands ordered by local authorities in a village near Mukono (Central).

On 2 September 2021, market vendors and street traders gathered in the district office and demonstrated against the closure of their business due to the coronavirus restrictive measures, in Bushenyi (Western).
On 2 September 2021, Alur ethnic members demonstrated against the rampant phenomenon of teenage pregnancy and early marriage in the area, in Nebbi (Northern).
On 3 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the construction of a channel, that was causing accidents in the area, in near Makerere University (Kampala, Central).

On 3 September 2021, local residents demonstrated over the alleged police harassment when enforcing the coronavirus protocols in Maralal town (Samburu Central, Samburu). The group accused police of demanding between Sh500 to Sh5,000 from locals for not wearing face masks. The police disperse the crowd.
On 5 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the illegal entries of Rwandan citizens in the country near Kabale (Western).

On 5 September 2021, local residents demonstrated, demanding justice for family of an ex spy who was murdered at the KM4 junction in Mogadishu - Hodan district (Banadir). The demonstrators were against the report of NISA. Police assaulted a journalist covering the demonstration.

On 6 September 2021, Mombasa county health workers including nurses, laboratory workers and clinical officers, demonstrated over the delayed payment of their salaries for two months by the county government in Mombasa town (Mvita, Mombasa).

On 6 September 2021, Muslim leaders and community demonstrated against the exclusion of 50 children in a Muslim school, made by security forces in the attempt of allegedly fight against religious extremism, in Bombo (Katikamu, Luwero).

On 7 September 2021, several local residents demonstrated against the AMISOM DNDF and government security forces (SNA) in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The demonstrators claimed the forces are giving fire arms to Dir militia in Kabxanley village.
On 7 September 2021, people living with disabilities demonstrated over a land dispute in Nyakagyeme (Rubabo, Rukungiri).
On 7 September 2021, bus drivers demonstrated against the permissions given to a private bus company to conduct business in a bus park in Nakasero (Kampala, Central).

On 8 September 2021, commuters demonstrated, in the presence of police at roadblocks, along the Lamu-Garsen road despite a recent ban by the National Police Service in Lamu town (Lamu West, Lamu). The group demanded the removal of all the roadblocks in the county.
On 8 September 2021, local farmers demonstrated against and rejected the seeds delivered by an NGO, claiming that this was not helping their living conditions, in Bukibokolo (Manjiya, Bududa).
On 8 September 2021, boda boda riders gathered in the District commissioner's office and demonstrated against the alleged extortions against them perpetrated by security forces in Busia (Eastern).

On 8 September 2021, several casual workers at the Isiolo Health department demonstrated against the delayed payments for the past year in Isiolo town (Isiolo). They accused the county government of ignoring their plight despite numerous appeals.

On 8 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the recent attacks that killed one person and injured five in Merti district. They demanded security and protection from the government in Isiolo town (Isiolo).

On 9 September 2021, students demonstrated against the increase in fees at Gulu University (Northern). Police forces intervened with teargas, beating demonstrators, forcing them to escape. Some injuries were reported.

On 9 September 2021, local residents protested by storming into the Huruma police station (Ruaraka, Nairobi), against the fatal shooting of a 17-year-old boy by a stray bullet dislodged from a directorate of criminal investigations (DCI) officer's gun. The residents demanded justice for the slain boy.

Around 9 September 2021 (as reported), around 200 construction workers from China State Construction Engineering Corporation demonstrated in Kwanza (Kwanza, Kwanza, Trans Nzoia) against poor work conditions. They carried placards protesting against mistreatment and abuse from the company management.
On 10 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the death of a churchman, suspected of being killed by unknown assailants, in Kazo (Western).

On 10 September 2021, primary school teachers, mainly refugees from South Sudan, demonstrated at the Kakuma Refugee Camp (Turkana West, Turkana) over the delayed payment of their salaries. The police disperse the crowd.

On 10 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the alleged attempt of a local politician to grab a public school, violently perpetrated by an unidentified armed group during the previous week, in Nakaloke (Bungokho, Mbale).

On 12 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the killing of a member of Laascaanood local councilor in Laascaanood town (Laas Caanood, Sool). They demanded justice for the victim. Somaliland police fired live bullets to dispersed the group.

On 12 September 2021, hundreds of people demonstrated along the main road in Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The group blamed the Jubaland government for not being able to protect local businessmen bringing milk to Kismayo from the outskirts against Al Shabaab stops. Jubaland police fired several rounds in the air to disperse the group, three people were injured.

On 13 September 2021, residents of Kemashi zone demonstrated against attacks by armed groups in Kemashi town, Kamashi zone (Dembi, Benshangul/Gumuz). The group demonstrated against the recent attacks in Denbe kebele in Mizega woreda and asked the government to take necessary action against the armed groups and stated that the Gumuz armed group does not represent the Gumuz people.

On 13 September 2021, Majanji 'B', Namundiri 'A' and Bulwande 'A' residents blocked a construction site in the area of Majanji parish, Majanji sub-county (Busia, Eastern) in a demonstration to demand compensation over land encroachment due to the project.
On 14 September 2021, 45 students demonstrated in front of the university against their exclusion from the list of graduating students in Kyambogo (Kampala, Central).

On 14 September 2021, local residents demonstrated along the Migori-Isebania highway against the hike in fuel prices in Migori town (Migori, Suna West). This is after the government through the Energy and Petroleum Regulatory Authority (EPRA) increased the cost of petrol past the Sh130 per liter mark.
On 14 September 2021, local residents in Lkuroto village (Samburu Central, Samburu) demonstrated against an attempt to evict them from their land.

On 15 September 2021, a group took to the streets in Ongino (Kumi, Eastern) in a demonstration regarding the poor conditions of several roads in the area. The demonstration follow two recent fatal accidents on the Kumi-Ongino road.
On 15 September 2021, truck drivers demonstrated against the order of Somaliland government to insure their trucks under Amaana Insurance Company in Berbera town (Berbera, Woqooyi Galbeed).

On 15 September 2021, Mombasa doctors demonstrated at the Coast General Teaching and Referral Hospital over delayed salaries in Mombasa town (Mvita, Mombasa). They accused the county to have failed to implement the issues they had agreed on before returning to work.
On 16 September 2021, local residents demonstrated over a dispute on community boundaries, accusing the local authorities of land grabbing, in Katwe (Kiboga, Central).

On 16 September 2021, local residents of Kiamaiko Huruma estate in Mathare village (Ruaraka, Nairobi) demonstrated against regular police harassment, torture, and demanding bribes. The demonstrators claimed to have been victimized in the fight against drugs.
Around 16 September 2021, a group of singers and songwriters gathered in Makindye (Kampala, Central) in a demonstration against the lack of work opportunities for the group.

On 16 September 2021, motorists, boda boda taxi operators and business people blocked (through unspecified means) the Migori-Kisii highway in Migori (Suna West, Migori), in demonstration against hike in fuel prices. The demonstrators demanded President Uhuru Kenyatta and ODM leader Raila Odinga to address the matter.
On 16 September 2021, local boda boda riders and truck drivers demonstrated against the hike in fuel price in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu).
On 17 September 2021, around 100 health workers demonstrated against the delays in the payment of their coronavirus allowances in Mbarara city (Western).

On 17 September 2021, dozens of students gathered outside the High Court in Kampala (Kampala, Central) in a demonstration after some student's names were not shown in the graduation booklet. The group was trying to stop the graduation ceremony from occurring (as they would not graduate) before the problem is solved.
On 17 September 2021, local residents, including boda boda operators, demonstrated over the poor road construction of the Machakos-Kitui road in Kaani village (Machakos).

On 17 September 2021, local residents demonstrated over a recent abduction of a civilian in the Kombedu area in Kogony town (Kisumu West, Kisumu). They demanded from the police to take action in the matter.
On 17 September 2021, workers at the Bomas of Kenya demonstrated over poor pay, and accused management of nepotism and corruption in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi).

On 18 September 2021, Yaber Dige sub-clan of Hawadle clan members demonstrated against the termination letter issued by the Hirshabelle Minister of Education to the Head of Education Department in Hiraan region. The militia seized a tax collection checkpoint from police near the airport in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).
On 19 September 2021, fishers demonstrated against the delay in the issuance of their fishing licenses in Rwensama (Bujumbura, Rukungiri).

On 19 September 2021, a section of Samburu pastoral community members demonstrated by waving twigs and carrying sticks in Laikipia (Laikipia North, Laikipia), against the government's move to deploy APC vehicles to beef up security in the area. The group called on the president to help address the matter.
On 19 September 2021, local residents protested against AMISOM UPDF troops in Golweyn village (Marka, Lower Shabelle) over the killing of civilian (coded separately).
On 20 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the destruction of the environment caused by a private mining company in Harugongo (Burahya, Kabarole).
On 20 September 2021, fishers demonstrated against the closure of landing sites over alleged illegal fishing in Mugoye (Bujumba, Kalangala).
On 20 September 2021, local residents took to the streets and demonstrated against the death of a civilian, who was shot by a URA military officer a few hours earlier, in Arivu (Vurra, Arua).

On 20 September 2021, health workers demonstrated against the lack of legal protection, in order to be protected by violent acts of some patients affected by mental illnesses, in Nakawa (Kampala, Central).

On 20 September 2021, Eritrean refugees demonstrated against the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF) attacks and sexual violence on fellow Eritrean refugees who are located in Tigray in front of the UNHCR office in Addis Ababa (Lideta, Region 14, Addis Ababa). They asked UNHCR to transfer refugees from Tigray region to another safe place.

On 21 September 2021, residents who originate from North Wello zone demonstrated in front of the WFP and UNICEF offices in Addis Ababa (Lideta, Region 14, Addis Ababa) asking that international organizations provide humanitarian assistance to victims of the conflict.
On 21 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the local MP, claiming that he was not supporting local populations in facing social problems, in Kalungu (Central).

Around 23 September 2021 (as reported), local residents protested in Majengo, near Pumwani (Kamukunji, Nairobi), against an eviction notice issued by the National Housing Finance Corporation. The residents demanded the government to look into the matter.
On 23 September 2021, taxi and truck drivers demonstrated against the daily parking fees, demanding a lower monthly tax, in Mukono (Central).

On 23 September 2021, workers from Embu Water and Sewerage Company blocked (through unspecified means) the Embu-Meru highway in Embu (Manyatta, Embu], against poor working conditions. The workers demanded the board to revoke the suspension of the management team.
On 23 September 2021, street traders demonstrated against the slow progress of the road works, complaining that this was damaging their business, in Mbale (Eastern).

On 24 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the damage caused by a landslide, complaining that these damages could have been avoided if local authorities had addressed the local population's needs, in a village near Bajo (Bbaale, Kayunga).

On 24 September 2021, several local residents demonstrated against attacks in Mochongoi village (Mogotio, Baringo). The group demanded from the government to start an operation along the border of Lakipia and Baringo counties.
On 25 September 2021, around 200 health workers demonstrated against the delay in the payment of their daily allowances in Lubaga (Kampala, Central).
On 25 September 2021, 23 NUP supporters demonstrated against the election of one of their colleagues as party flag bearer in Kayunga (Ntenjeru, Central).

On 26 September 2021, taxi drivers demonstrated against the demolition of their offices in Mbarara (Mbarara, Western). Police forces intervened to disperse the demonstrators firing teargas and live bullets. There were no fatalities nor injuries.
On 26 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the environmental damages caused by the operations of a private company in Katabi (Entebbe, Wakiso).
On 27 September 2021, rice farmers demonstrated against the wetland conservation measures in Kabuyanda (Isingiro, Western), complaining that this was affecting their business.

On 27 September 2021, tuk tuk drivers demonstrated near the NECSOM road, after being denied access to the Garowe main tarmac road by the local government in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). They called on the mayor to intervene and find a solution as they complied with all tax-related issues.

On 27 September 2021, students from Kaptama Boys High School held a demonstration march from the school to the deputy county commissioner and education offices in Kapsokwony town (Mt Elgon, Bungoma), against the deputy principal whom they claim does not listen to them. The school was closed for more consultative meetings.
On 28 September 2021, some NUP MPs stormed out the parliament and demonstrated against the alleged illegal arrest of an important NUP MP on the previous days, in Nakasero (Kampala, Central).

On 29 September 2021, residents of Chilga woreda held a peaceful protest against the Qemant Committee armed group in Aykel town (Central Gondar, Amhara). Protesters stated that the Qemant people do not have any relations with armed groups working to destroy Ethiopia.
On 29 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the district decision to confiscate a contested land in Kyeigombe (Igara, Bushenyi).
On 29 September 2021, around 200 local residents demonstrated against the dumping of rotten materials in Namanve (Mukono, Central).

On 30 September 2021, local residents demonstrated against the continuous incursions of armed cattle rustler in the area, complaining the government for not acting against these crimes, in Lorengedwat (Pian, Nabilatuk).
On 1 October 2021, over 50 health workers demonstrated against the non-payment of their allowances and salary deductions in Kisoro (Bufumbira, Western).
On 2 October 2021, protesters gathered for the Irreecha celebration in Addis Ababa and chanted anti-government slogans and demanded the release of Oromo political prisoners. Some arrests were made.
On 2 October 2021, traders and street vendors demonstrated against an internal dispute over political representation in Kisenyi (Kampala, Central).

On 3 October 2021, several people protested against the Somaliland administration for the forceful eviction of over 700 families people from Southern Somalia living in Laascaanood town. The protesters marched along the main road in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari).

On 3 October 2021, drivers of local transport vehicles from Mogadishu to Middle Shabelle region protested in Warshiikh town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle) over illegal taxation imposed by SNA on trucks using the main roads along the coastline of Elma'an.

On 3 October 2021, about 10 local residents demonstrated against the curfew enforcement operations that police forces were conducting in a bar in Nsangi (Busiro, Wakiso). Police forces intervened to disperse demonstrators, and shot live bullets, killing one demonstrator.
On 4 October 2021, boda boda riders gathered in the Resident City Commissioner's office and demonstrated against the increasing in taxes, in Soroti (Eastern).

On 6 October 2021, refugees living with HIV demonstrated against the lack of support by the government and international organizations in terms of nutritional needs in Bidi Bidi Refugee Camp (Aringa, Yumbe).

On 6 October 2021, nursing students demonstrated against the inefficient and ineffective administration of their university in Kabale (Western). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration when students started threatening to engage in violent activities. There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 7 October 2021, Galmudug Darwish forces, demonstrating over unpaid salaries, seized two checkpoints after police forces left in South Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). One of the checkpoints is located on Cadaado-Gelinsooor road.

On 7 October 2021, local residents protested in support of the ASWJ group in Guri-Ceel town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud), demanding the removal of government troops that have been recently deployed from Mogadishu to Dhuusamareeb to support Galmudug/SNA security forces.

On 7 October 2021, local councilors and residents demonstrated against the decision of government to suspend local leaders, due to local politics altercations, in Kasubi (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 7 October 2021, local residents staged a protest at Gikonou, near Kenol (Muranga South, Muranga county), accusing the hoteliers and healthcare providers for turning a public cemetery into a dumping site.
On 8 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the alleged political persecution of a local MP in Kiyunga (Luuka, Eastern).
On 8 October 2021, nurses demonstrated and held a strike over the non-payment of their coronavirus allowances in Kamwokya (Kampala, Central).
On 8 October 2021, Kenyan fishers demonstrated against the alleged impounding of five trucks of dry fish carried out by UPDF, in Busia (Eastern).
On 9 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the closure of the office of the local chairperson, in Butambala (Central).
On 9 October 2021, human rights activists and former death inmates demonstrated against the death penalty, demanding political measures to abolish it, in Kampala (Central).

On 11 October 2021, former students gathered outside of the ministry of Education in Addis Ababa (Region 14) to protest against the failure of the ministry to re-assign them or properly inform them about their options for re-assignment for university studies.
On 11 October 2021, road workers demonstrated against the non-payment of their wages for five months, in Kitala (Busiro, Wakiso).

On 11 October 2021, local farmers demonstrated against the presence of elephants in the area, claiming that these were destroying crops, and demanded from the government to dig trenches around villages, in Kiruli (Buruuli, Masindi).

On 11 October 2021, city councilors demonstrated against the transfer of division offices to another location, claiming that this was secretly supporting the illegal operations of land grabbing in the area, in Mbale (Eastern).

On 12 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the poor health service delivery by health workers, in Buseta (Kibuku, Eastern). Police forces intervened firing tear gas to disperse demonstrators.

On 12 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the presence of food vendors near the community water sources, claiming that the waste generated by their business was causing serious contamination dangers, in Kawempe (Kampala, Central).
On 13 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the poor state of roads in the area, in Buhesi (Burahya, Kabarole).
On 13 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the poor state of roads in the area, in Kilembe (Busongora, Kasese).

On 13 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the poor state of a bridge in the area in Kasokoso (Kira, Wakiso), claiming that this was putting their lives at risk. Police forces intervened to disperse the demonstrators.

On 13 October 2021, local residents and business people demonstrated against the removal of solar street lights near Kabale (Western), claiming that this was producing a shortage in energy in the area.

On 13 October 2021, county government workers protested by whistling, shouting, blowing vuvuzelas and holding placards as they camped outside the county offices in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) against the lack of medical cover. Led by their Kenya County Government Workers Union (KCGWU) officials, the workers demanded both the Nairobi metropolitan services (NMS) and city hall to address their grievances.
On 14 October 2021, teachers demonstrated against the non-payment of their salaries in the previous three months in Mbale (Eastern).

On 16 October 2021, health workers from hospitals and clinics throughout Mekele city (Mekelle, Tigray) staged a protest in front of the United Nations office in Mekelle, denouncing the lack of medical supplies throughout the region.
On 16 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the environmental damages on water supplies caused by the waste of an abattoir, in Gulu (Northern).

On 16 October 2021, fishers demonstrated against the spread of diseases, due to lake pollution, in Bukakata (Bukoto, Masaka). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. There were no fatalities nor injuries.
On 16 October 2021, local residents and community leaders demonstrated against the joint military and police operations against cattle rustlers in the area, in Moroto (Northern).

On 16 October 2021, local people, including professionals from the Marakwet community and women, demonstrated in Kaben village (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet). The group accused the Interior ministry of failing to address insecurity in the region.
On 18 October 2021, around 100 tobacco farmers demonstrated against the non-payment of their salaries by a private tobacco company, in the Terego area (Arua, Northern, coded as Ocea).

On 18 October 2021, health workers demonstrated along the Embu-Meru Highway in Embu town (Manyatta, Embu), over poor working conditions. The group accused the county government for failing to address issues relating to failure to pay of statutory deductions, the partial payment of salaries, shortage of staff, and the lack of drugs and equipment in health facilities.

On 19 October 2021, special forces of Somali region opened fire on peaceful protesters in Dhuxun Town (Nogob), leaving one person dead and four others wounded. No further information. Event coded to nearby ADM Fik (Erer, Somali).

On 19 October 2021, local residents demonstrated in Meru-Embu highway at Muchoni junction in Chuka town (Chuka, Tharaka-Nithi) after the body of a Form 1 student who drowned in the River Ruguti was not removed and blamed the country government of not fulfilling their roles and responsibilities. The group blocked (through unspecified means) the highway. Police fired tear gas to disperse the group.

On 19 October 2021, over five hundred local residents, mostly farmers, demonstrated against the poor state of roads in Amukura town (Teso South, Busia). The group demanded from the ward administration to fix the roads.

On 19 October 2021, more than 100 local residents demonstrated against the alleged land grabbing attempts of the local legislator, accusing him of taking advantage of a forest land, in Ayivu (Arua, Northern). Police forces intervened to disperse the demonstrators. There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 19 October 2021, residents from Kinoo, Uthiru and Regen demonstrated along the newly constructed James Gichuru-Rironi highway in Kinoo town (Kikuyu, Kiambu) against the increased accidents on highway, demanding from the Kenya National Highway Authority to erect speed bumps and footbridges on sections of the road.

On 19 October 2021, health workers protested by waving placards and carrying twigs as they camped outside the governor's office in Embu (Manyatta, Embu), against neglect and poor working conditions. The group demanded the governor and the county public service board to address their grievances.
On 20 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the land conflicts in the area, demanding governmental interventions, in Ishaka (Bushenyi, Western).

On 21 October 2021, thousands of residents in Semera (Semera, Afar) held a peaceful protest to denounce what they call 'brutal attacks on civilians by the TPLF rebels'. They voiced a slogon: Ethiopia shall not be destroyed by individual interest groups forces.

On 21 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the construction of an oil road made by a private Chinese company, claiming that this had caused environmental damages on the water supplies, in Kabwoya (Buhaguzi, Kikuube).
On 21 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the damages on their crop fields caused by local pastoralists, in various locations in Pakwach district (Northern) [coded to Pakwach].
On 21 October 2021, several truck and taxi drivers demonstrated against the high fuel prices in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari), demanding from the local administration to intervene.
On 21 October 2021, dozens of women demonstrated against some remarks made by the Gender Minister, in Lira (Northern).

On 21 October 2021, people gathered in front of the police station in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). The demonstrators blamed the police for the 7pm bar closures. This came after the president lifted the curfew in the country during the Mashuuja day celebrations.

On 22 October 2021, more than 200 students from the Mwamgunga Girls Secondary School protested along the Kombani-Kwale road in Kwale town (Matuga, Kwale) over school mismanagement. The students complained about poor services, including low quality food and unreliable water supply.

On 22 October 2021, local residents and some MPs demonstrated against the election of a particular board chairperson, claiming that this would worsen the land grabbing activities, in Kabwoya (Buhaguzi, Kikuube).

On 22 October 2021, local residents and environmental activists demonstrated against an oil pipeline project, claiming that this would cause environmental damages in the area, in Kyotera (Central). Police forces intervened and arrested some environmental activists.

On 23 October 2021, unknown number of Chinhahsan town residents held a protest in Chinaksen Woreda (East Hararge Zone, Oromia), denouncing what they say 'the arbitrary killings of civilians'. The regional police forces arrested 11 protesters accusing them of organizing the protest.

On 23 October 2021, local residents from Kaya of Mijikenda communities demonstrated against the grabbing of forest lands belonging to Kaya shrines in Tiwi town (Matuga, Kwale). Elders demanded from the government to protect the forests for future generations.

On 23 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the presence of a stone quarrying company in the area, claiming that this would cause environmental damages, in Opwateta (Pallisa, Eastern). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. There were no fatalities nor injuries.
On 23 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the killing of a man by a mob over a private dispute, in Kitumba (Kabale, Western).

On 23 October 2021, a group of traders gathered in demonstration in Mwanza (Nyamagana, Mwanza) for the allocation of stalls in official areas so they could continue their business. The protesters included traders who were evicted from Makoroboi market.
On 23 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the damages caused by thunderstorms the previous days, denouncing the lack of aid from local authorities, in Kabowa (Kampala, Central).

On 24 October 2021, over 1200 Kipsigis girls school demonstrated by storming out of school, chanting, and shouting, as they marched in Kericho town (Ainamoi, Kericho), against the transfer of their principal. The school was later closed indefinitely.
On 25 October 2021, more than 20 local residents demonstrated against the violence perpetrated by a police officer against a young woman, in Amolatar (Kioga, Northern).

On 25 October 2021, over 100 local residents demonstrated against the election as the district chairperson of a man, who had been already accused of fuelling land grabbing activities in the area, in Kyangwali (Buhaguzi, Kikuube).
On 25 October 2021, supporters of the Balderas for Genuine Democracy party protested in front of a police station in Addis Ababa (Addis Ababa, Lideta, Region 14) to show support for a jailed leader.
On 25 October 2021, over 500 local residents demonstrated against the delay in the release of funds for a development project in Buwenge (Kagoma, Jinja).

On 25 October 2021, commercial sex workers protested against the murder of one of their colleagues in 2012 allegedly by one or two British soldiers in Nanyuki town (Laikipia East, Laikipia). Both Kenya and UK are working on the investigation of the killing.

On 25 October 2021, hundreds of people, mostly woman and youth, marched through the Tarabuunka streets in Mogadishu - Hodan (Banadir) demanding an immediate end to the ongoing fighting in Guriel city between the SNA and ASWJ.
On 25 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the eviction from their land and the demolition of their house by police forces, in Mbale (Eastern).

On 26 October 2021, traders and local residents demonstrated against the corruption of the anti-money laundering office, in Kisenyi (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration.

Around 27 October 2021 (as reported), residents barricaded the Kisii-Isebania road with stones in Awendo subcounty [coded as Awendo, Awendo, Migori] in a demonstration against increased insecurity following the murder of a local businessman by armed men. The group demanded the officer commanding station enhance the security in the area.

Around 27 October 2021 (as reported), a section of rice farmers from Mwea (Mbeere South, Embu County), stormed the Mwea Rice Mill multi-purpose offices to protest over unpaid dues. No further information.

On 28 October 2021, 'hundreds' of residents of Liben Woreda held a peaceful protest in the Liben town (Guji Zone, Oromia), demanding fromthe government to end the suffering of citizens and livestock death due to drought and condemning what they say is 'arbitrary killings and detention of civilians by security forces'.

On 28 October 2021, 'hundreds' of residents of Gumi Eldalo Woreda held a peaceful protest rally in Gumi Idalo town (Guji Zone, Oromia), demanding from the government to end the suffering of citizens and livestock deaths due to drought and condemning what they say is 'arbitrary killings and detention of civilians by security forces'.

On 28 October 2021, local residents protested by waving placards in Chepchoina (Endebess, Trans Nzoia), against the move by the government to delay their resettlement after they were evicted from their land over illegal documents. The group demanded that government officials involved should be investigated over corruption allegations.

On 31 October 2021, Tigrayans residing in Semera and Logya demonstrated against the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF) in Semera (Samera Logiya town, Awsi-Zone 1, Afar). They condemned the killing of civilians and looting by TPLF forces in Amhara and Afar regions. They also stated that the group does not represent them.
On 31 October 2021, environmental activists demonstrated against the removal of eco-tourism equipment and activities by a private company, in Kijabwemi natural reserve near Masaka (Central).
On 1 November 2021, more than 50 local residents demonstrated against the damages on their properties caused by a private water company business, in Katosi (Mukono, Central).

On 2 November 2021, Puntland Security forces demonstrated and blocked the main road (through unspecific means) towards Laascaanood, demanding their unpaid salaries in the vicinity of Kursho Xuur village near God Qaboobe village (Laas Caanood, Sool).

On 2 November 2021, hundreds of fishers demonstrated at beaches in Faza island [coded to Faza, Lamu East, Lamu] against arrests and harassment by the coast guards over the use of illegal nets in Basuba. They demanded from the government to amend the law forbidding the usage of the nets.

On 3 November 2021, teachers from St Kevin's secondary school protested against the denial of housing allowances for two years in Lodwar town (Turkana Central, Turkana). The teachers claimed members within the commission were denying them the right to access housing allowances.
On 3 November 2021, local residents demonstrated against the lack of clean water in the area, in Lukaya (Kalungu, Central).
On 3 November 2021, environmental activists demonstrated against a motion in Parliament that removed three forest from the status of 'protected areas', in Kayunga district (Central).

On 3 November 2021, a section of Lmisigiyoi group ranch members demonstrated by waving placards and carrying twigs as they marched while chanting in Lmisigiyoi (Samburu West, Samburu), against unfair subdivision of their ranch land. The group demanded their committee to stop the skewed distribution of land.

On 3 November 2021, Kangubiri girls high school students demonstrated by running out of the school in Tetu (Nyeri Central, Nyeri), against being served inadequate food. The students demanded a loaf of bread daily with peanut butter and also be allowed to braid their hair.
On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Gelan (West Shewa, Oromia) and denounced the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.
On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Shashamane (West Arsi, Oromia) and denounced the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.
On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Robe (Bale, Oromia) to denounce the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrate against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.
On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Jimma (Jima, Oromia) to denounce the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.
On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Babile (East Hararge, Oromia) and denounced the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.
On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Dukem (East Shewa, Oromia) to denounce the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.
On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Nazreth (East Shewa, Oromia) and denounced the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.

On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Burayyu (coded to Gefersa, Burayu, Finfine Special, Oromia) to denounce the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrate against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.

On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Bishan Guracha (Hawasa, Sidama, Sidama) and denounced the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.
On 4 November 2021, protesters gathered in Lege Tafo (Finfine Special, Oromia) and denounced the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.
On 4 November 2021, street traders and their leaders demonstrated against the closure of weekly markets due to coronavirus restrictive measures, in Kabale (Western).

On 4 November 2021, fishmongers marched to the governor's office in Migori (Suna West, Migori) against harassment by the Kenya revenue authority officers on the Tanzanian border, after several lorries carrying fish were impounded. Joined by fishers and lorry drivers, the group demanded the governor address their grievances.

On 5 November 2021, residents Dire Dawa city peacefully rallied to demonstrate their support for ENDF, condemning what they say 'foreign interventions', and denouncing the TPLF and Shane militants in Dire Dawa urban (Dire Dawa).
On 5 November 2021, protesters gathered in Gambela (Gambella, Agnewak) to denounce the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and demonstrated against recent gains made by the TPLF into Amhara region.

On 6 November 2021, Stella Maris secondary school students demonstrated by boycotting meals, and pouring their tea, at the school in Othaya (Nyeri South, Nyeri), against unknown reasons to the administration. The school was closed indefinitely.

On 6 November 2021, local residents protested in Githiga town (Githunguri, Kiambu) against police brutality after the death of a man inside Githiga police station cells. The man was arrested for his involvement in a traffic accident while driving his motorbike. The police said the man committed suicide.
On 7 November 2021, residents of Arsi zone demonstrated against TPLF and OLF-Shane attacks in Asela stadium in Asela town (Arsi, Oromia). .
On 7 November 2021, a demonstration against TPLF and OLF-Shane attacks was held in Ambo town (West Shewa, Oromia). .
On 7 November 2021, a demonstration against TPLF and OLF-Shane attacks was held in Bule Hora town (West Guji, Oromia). .
On 7 November 2021, a demonstration against TPLF and OLF-Shane attacks was held in Jijiga (Jigjiga town, Fafan, Somali). .
On 7 November 2021, a demonstration against TPLF and OLF-Shane attacks was held in Arba Minch town (Gamo, SNNP). .
On 7 November 2021, residents of Silte and Worabe zone demonstrated against TPLF and OLF-Shane attacks in Worabe town (Silte, SNNP). .

On 8 November 2021, demonstrators gathered in Hawassa Stadium (Hawasa town, Sidama) to denounce the TPLF and OLF-Shane alliance and against recent advances made by the TPLF in Amhara and Afar regions.

Around 10 November 2021 (as reported), a group of small business owners gathered in Iringa (Iringa Urban, Iringa) and disrupted a meeting of the Iringa Municipal Council, demanding that the fate of their businesses be discussed.
