On 9 July 2023, around 2000 people staged a protest rally in Mekele town, Mekelle (Mekelle Tigray, Tigray), and demanded the government to bring individuals who committed sexual violence against women to justice, to return IDPs to their homes, and resume suspended humanitarian aids. Tigray Women's Association coordinated the protest.

On 9 July 2023, thirty Ethiopians displaced women peacefully protested at UNHCR area in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed). They were reportedly seeking for assistance to return to State House IDP camp where their houses were burnt.

On 10 July 2023, IDPs in Mekele town, protested against the Holy Synod of Orthodox Christian during the visit of the peace envoy led by the Patriarch of Ethiopia to an IDP camp, 70 Kare in Mekelle, (Mekelle Tigray, Tigray). The protesters chanted 'the Holy Synod has abandoned them and sided with the persecutors' during the conflict in Tigray. The Patriarch addressed protesters saying, 'great to voice your feelings' and promised to 'tell the concerned authorities to return you to your village'.

On 10 July 2023, around fifty fish traders protested along the main tarmac road (Gacaa) in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari). The motive of the protest was over the temporary closure of a fish market and its poor hygiene state.

On 10 July 2023, long distance truck drivers protested in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against the new rules by the national transport and safety authority (NTSA). Led by their chairman, the group demanded the government to suspend the rules.
On 10 July 2023, residents, mainly women, protested in Marura (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against the sale of illicit brew to the youth. The group demanded the government to help address the matter.

On 10 July 2023, dozens of clan elders from the Hagar district protested at the Olympic area in Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The purpose of the protest was to show their grievances about Jubaland troops that took control of Hagar and left it the same day.

The group demanded the president to help address the matter as well as refund of their money.

On 10 July 2023, human rights defenders from the social justice movement protested outside Milimani law courts in Nairobi (Nairobi - Westlands) against the new tax measures set by the government. The group demanded the government to repeal the Finance Act 2023.

On 11 July 2023, Kenya Kwanza allied leaders and local politicians marched (while escorted by the police officers) in Kisii town (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii) against the planned anti-government protests by the opposition. The group demanded the residents to boycott the opposition protests.

This demonstration was held a day after the regional interim government announced that over 50,000 militants were discharged from the armed group known as the Tigray Defense Force (TDF). The demonstrators stated that they were discharged in October 2022, which will affect their participation per the Pretoria Peace agreement.

On 2 August 2023, a group closed roads with stones and sticks in Debre Markos town (East Gojam, Amhara) and Bure (coded separately), in a demonstration against the government and ENDF, declaring their support to Fano militia. As a result, public offices and business centers were closed.

On 2 August 2023, a group of residents protested against the sluggish progress of the road works in Kabale (Kabale, Kabale). They blocked government officials who had come for inspection from accessing the roads.

On 2 August 2023, residents gathered in Mwingi (Mwingi Central Sub- County, Kitui) in a demonstration in support of a businesswoman and against an unnamed member of parliament (MP) accused of assaulting the woman. The group demanded the police to arrest the MP and other accused persons.

On 2 August 2023, over 2000 traders protested in the South B area of Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) against the demolition of their stalls by unknown people allied to a private investor (coded separately), following a land ownership dispute. Joined by their member of parliament (Jubilee, Azimio), the group demanded the governor to address the matter.

On 3 August 2023, a group of traders protested in Githurai (Roysambu, Kiambu) against a new directive by the county government on the allocation of stalls in the new market. Led by the chairman of Githurai traders association, the group demanded the governor to listen to the leaders elected by the traders as well as gazette their names ahead of the market launch.
On 3 August 2023, a group of youth gathered in Nomotio (Samburu Central, Samburu) against lack of employment. The group demanded their elected leaders to address the matter.

On 4 August 2023, youths in Durame town (Kembata Tibaro, SNNP) demonstrated the new office distribution following the establishment of a new SNNPR region. Only one office was assigned to the zone. Security forces, coded as SNNPR state police, dispersed the demonstrators (means unknown). There was no causality. According to one witness, SNNPR special forces were involved in dispersing the demonstrators.
On 4 August 2023, a group of local councilors protested against the Chief Administrative Officer's covering of government funds embezzlement cases in Namayumba, coded near Wakiso (Busiro, Wakiso).

On 5 August 2023, ENDF shot at Woldiya University students who were demonstrating against its decision not to provide buses for them to return to their residences in Woldiya town (Weldiya, North Wello). At least one student was killed. The students first asked the university to provide buses so that they could return home. When the university refused, they marched to the ENDF camp in the town and voiced their demands.

On 5 August 2023, Makueni county climate and environmental lobby groups protested in Wote (Makueni, Makueni) against forest logging. The group demanded the president to exclude the county from plans to lift a ban on forest logging.

On 7 August 2023, the police intervened and foiled a protest by students of Kanginima Seed Secondary School in Kanginima (Butebo, Butebo). The students were protesting against the arrest of their ICT teacher and a watchman, who were accused of stealing school computers.

On 7 August 2023, around sixty (60) Ethiopian-Somali asylum seekers from Ogaden region protested in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari). The protesters claimed human rights violation and biased treatment by UNHCR following government's plans to terminate and revoke their asylum status by the end of year 2023. The protest ended peacefully.

Around 7 August 2023 (as reported), Embakasi ranching company shareholders from Kiambu and Murang'a county protested in Kiambu (Kiambu Town, Kiambu) against the delayed issuance of title deeds. The group demanded the president to help address the matter.
On 7 August 2023, youth rallied in support of Fano militias in Gonder town (Central Gondar, Amhara). On 6 and 7 August 2023, ENDF and Fano militias clashed in the town (coded separately).
On 7 August 2023, youth in Woldiya town (Weldiya, North Wello) closed roads with sticks and stones in support of Fano militia.

Around 9 August 2023 (as reported), residents of Kalobeyei ward marched to the office of the deputy commissioner in Kakuma (Turkana West, Turkana) against the relocation of Oropoi location to the newly formed Lokichogio subcounty. Led by area member of county assembly (Jubilee, Azimio), the group demanded the commissioner to revoke the relocation.

On 9 August 2023, parents and their children (students) marched to the county commissioner's office, before heading to the ethics and anti-corruption commission (EACC)regional office in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against alleged fraud in the Finland education program ran by the county government. The group demanded a refund of their money.

Around 9 August 2023 (as reported), residents gathered in Muhohoyo (Muranga South, Muranga) against prolonged power blackouts. The group demanded the Kenya power and lighting company (KPLC) to address the matter.
On 9 August 2023, former county council askaris (county inspectorate officers) protested in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against delayed pay. The group demanded their dues.

On 10 August 2023, residents protested in Intona area of Trans Mara (Transmara West, Narok) against looting of a maize farm by youth allied to an unnamed businessman under the police watch following a land dispute (coded separately). The group demanded lasting solution to the problem.
On 10 August 2023, residents protested in Matayos (Matayos, Busia) against the move by the governor to transfer two senior county officials. The group demanded the governor to rescind the move.

On 10 August 2023, a group of contractors and supplier working on the secondary education quality improvement project (SEQIP) protested in unspecified location within West Pokot county (coded the county headquarters as Kapenguria, West Pokot, West Pokot) against delayed pay. The group demanded the national government through the ministry of education to address the matter.

On 11 August 2023, hundreds of fishermen protested in Lamu (Lamu West, Lamu) against the grabbing of their fish landing site by a private developer. Led by the chairman of the Lamu beach management units, the group demanded both the national and county governments to help them repossess the site.

Around 11 August 2023 (as reported), a group of illegal land settlers in Kamiti forest gathered against an alleged move by local administrators to collude with land brokers to drive them out of their land (coded to the nearest known location as (Kamiti prison, Roysambu, Nairobi). The group demanded the government to resolve the land dispute by allowing them permanent residency.

Around 11 August 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Muguru village near Imenti (Imenti Central, Meru) against the rise in illicit brew and bhang consumption in the area. The group demanded the national government to address the matter.
On 12 August 2023, about eighty 80 Puntland Dervish soldiers protested over unpaid salaries and took over the Xarfo checkpoint in Xarfa village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug).

On 12 August 2023, residents carrying a casket marched before forcing their way into Bumula police station (Bumula, Bungoma) against the killing of their kin at an illicit liquor den. The group demanded justice.
On 13 August 2023, a group of residents protested against the demarcation of a wetland that is a source of their livelihood in Rugaaga (Bukanga, Isingiro).

On 13 August 2023, residents protested in Lokichoggio (Turkana West, Turkana) in support of the relocation of Kalobeyei ward to Lokichogio sub-county. Led by a former Kakuma member of county assembly, the group demanded leaders to stop inciting the community.

On 14 August 2023, local residents gathered in Kimiso kebele (a location coded to Gatira) to protest the Woreda Officials' decision to transfer a communal land to an investor in Setema woreda (Jimma, Oromia). The woreda police and head of woreda administrator opened fire, killed a youth and wounded other ten protesters. This communally owned land used for grazing by local communities has been the source of discontent with the government as the locals refused its transfer.

On 14 August 2023, a group of the Puntland Police Forces (Goodir unit) protested over unpaid salaries and blocked vehicles (through unspecified means) at the southern checkpoint of Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal).

On 14 August 2023, hundreds of farmers protested in Kakamega (Lurambi, Kakamega) over lack of subsidized fertilizer at the National cereals and produce board. The group demanded the ministry of agriculture officials to address the matter.

On 15 August 2023, hundreds of street traders popularly known as 'hustlers' protested in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against harassment by county askaris because of the devolution conference. The group demanded the governor to address the matter.

On 15 August 2023, Students and parents of St. Peter's secondary school Kapomboi protested at the institution in Kapomboi (Endebess, Trans Nzoia) against the move by the teachers service commission to transfer the school's principal. The group demanded the commission to rescind the transfer.

Around 16 August 2023 (as reported), over 30 casual workers protested at Kocholia subcounty referral hospital (Teso North, Busia) against delayed pay. The group demanded the county government to pay their dues.

On 16 August 2023, ethnic Gurage representatives of four districts and three urban administrations in Gurage zone gathered in front of SNNP Regional Council in Hawassa, Hawasa town (Sidama, Sidama) and demanded the establishment of a new zonal administration called 'East Gurage Zone' which include Meskan, East Meskan, Sodo, and Bui woredas, as well as Butajra, Sodo and Iniseno towns. This protest continued on the next day (coded separately).

On 16 August 2023, around 6000 Sudanese refugees gathered in front of Ulala border refugee camp (location coded to Metema), in Metema woreda (West Gondar, Amhara), and called for intervention of donors and international organizations to improve the food and medicine provisions, which they say 'consists of only one meal'. The protesters also demanded their transfer to other camps due to 'absence of security protection and the presence of Fano militias in the area'.

On 16 August 2023, several local residents protested against Kenya airstrike in Jilib town (Jilib, Middle Juba) and Jamaame (coded separately). The protesters accused the Kenya defense minister of targeting civilians.

On 17 August 2023, Taita Taveta county residents marched to the county assembly in Wundanyi (Wundanyi, Taita Taveta) against poor services from the county government. The group demanded members of the county assembly to address their interests.
On 17 August 2023, local resident protested against al-Shabaab activities and supported the government operation in Baxdo village (Cadaado, Galgaduud).

On 17 August 2023, for the second day, ethnic Gurage representatives of four districts and three urban administrations in Gurage zone gathered in front of SNNP Regional Council in Hawassa, Hawasa town (Sidama, Sidama) and demanded the establishment of a new zonal administration called 'East Gurage Zone' which include Meskan, East Meskan, Sodo, and Bui woredas, as well as Butajra, Sodo and Iniseno towns.

On 17 August 2023, residents protested in Taboino (Konoin, Bomet) against illicit brews and substance abuse in the area, while accusing security officers for allegedly not taking action. The group demanded the security officers to be transfers.
On 17 August 2023, a group of Miraa (Khat) farmers protested in Meru (Imenti North, Meru) against harassment by middlemen. The group demanded the government to help address the matter.

On 17 August 2023, a group of Pokot university students association members protested in unspecified location in West Pokot (coded to the county headquarters as Kapenguria, West Pokot, West Pokot) against the new funding model of higher education. The group demanded the political leaders to listen to the student's voices.
On 18 August 2023, residents protested in Karia (Githunguri, Kiambu) against poor state of the road infrastructure. The group demanded their area political leaders to address the matter.

Around 18 August 2023 (as reported), over 50 casual workers from Alupe and Kocholia hospitals protested at unspecified location in Busia county (coded as Kocholia, Teso North, Busia) against delayed pay. The group demanded the county government to pay their dues.

On 18 August 2023, residents disrupted a deputy president's entourage by scolding at the Uasin Gishu senator as the motorcade was driving in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) following his alleged involvement in an education scholarship scandal. The senator was forced to get back into his car.

On 18 August 2023, several local residents protested against Kenya airstrike in Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba) and Jilib (coded separately). The protesters accused the Kenya defense minister of targeting civilians.

On 18 August 2023, a group of private security guards gathered in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against poor working conditions. Led by the chairman of the Kenya national private security workers union (KNPSWU), the group demanded the government to address the matter.

On 20 August 2023, local residents from Jareer-Weyne clan protested in Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The protesters called for the release of General Shegow Ahmed Ali who was arrested in an operation in Mogadishu (coded separately).
Around 20 August 2023 (as reported), casual workers protested at Kocholia hospital (Teso North, Busia) against delayed pay. The group demanded the county government to pay their dues.
On 20 August 2023, residents marched in support of the military offensive against Al Shabaab in Cadaado town (Cadaado, Galgaduud).
On 21 August 2023, a group of FDC supporters protested in Mbarara (Mbarara, Mbarara), against holding party elections that do not meet legal standards and guidelines.

On 21 August 2023, residents protested in Kandara (Kandara, Muranga) against plans by the county government to build a referral hospital on the Del Monte land. The group demanded the president to help address the matter.

On 21 August 2023, local residents from Jareer-Weyne clan protested in Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The protesters called for the release of General Shegow Ahmed Ali who was arrested in an operation in Mogadishu (coded separately).

On 21 August 2023, a group of members of county assembly (MCAs) protested during the County Assemblies Sports Association (CASA) games held at Nakuru ASK showgrounds (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against delayed salaries. The group demanded their salaries paid.

Around 21 August 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Mathare estate of Maragua town also known as Maragwa (Muranga South, Muranga) against alleged an alleged cover-up by the police following the murder of a woman by her husband over a domestic quarrel. The group demanded justice for the slain woman.

On 22 August 2023, health workers under the universal health coverage program marched to the county public service board offices in Busia (Matayos, Busia) against delayed pay. The group demanded the board to renew their contracts.

On 22 August 2023, and for the second day, residents protested in Mathare estate of Maragua town also known as Maragwa (Muranga South, Muranga) against an alleged cover-up by the police following the murder of a woman by her husband over a domestic quarrel. The group demanded justice for the slain woman.

On 23 August 2023, a group of teachers protested in Bomet town (Bomet East, Bomet) against the failure by the teachers service commission (TSC) to employ them on permanent and pensionable basis. The group demanded the president to help address the matter.

Around 23 August 2023 (as reported), hundreds of traders protested in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against the failure by the national and county governments to construct an ultra-modern market as earlier promised. The group demanded the county government to set aside an alternative site for their trade.

On 24 August 2023, residents of Kutere town staged a protest in Kutere (location coded to Worabe town, Worabe, Siltie, Central Ethiopia Region, formerly SNNP), to demonstrate their discontent with the newly formed Central Ethiopia Regional State over their demand to upgrade their town to woreda administration status. The protesters also demanded the Siltie ethnic group to be fairly represented in the newly formed regional state.

On 24 August 2023, residents of Gora Dola woreda staged a protest in Haro Kela town (coded to Wadera) Gora Dola woreda (Guji, Oromia) to demonstrate against the Oromia Regional Government's decision to restructure Guji zone and include the woreda under East Borena zone. Regional Police forces beat and wounded 'dozens' and arrested over 150 protesters including local officials and dispersed the crowd.

On 25 August 2023, Western Kenya supporters of sports cabinet secretary (CS) protested in Kakamega (Lurambi, Kakamega) in support of the CS, following accusations that CS has failed in managing the sports ministry. The group demanded other political leaders from western Kenya, to support the CS.

On 26 August 2023, locals gathering occurred to express support for the Somaliland National Army defending the country against the Laascaanood militia attack in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed).

On 27 August 2023, members of the Jareer- Weyne clan protested along the Bundaweyne -Darwish market area in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). They called for the release of General Shegow Ahmed Ali who was arrested in an operation in Mogadishu (coded separately).

On 28 August 2023, hundreds of female candidates camped outside the Kibaki grounds in Lamu Island (Lamu West, Lamu) against the move by the Kenya defence forces to lock out women candidates from the recruitment process. The group demanded the relevant authorities to address the matter.

On 28 August 2023, residents protested in Nyarugumu area of Kabete (Kabete, Kiambu) against the move by the county government to construct a road through their farms. The group demanded the county authorities to re-route the road.
On 28 August 2023, residents protested for the support of government security forces (SNA) operations in Cabudwaaq town (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud).
On 28 August 2023, residents protested for the support of government security forces (SNA) operations in Guri-Ceel town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud).
On 28 August 2023, residents protested for the support of government security forces (SNA) operations in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug).

On 28 August 2023, hundreds of youth (escorted by anti-riot police) protested in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against First Choice Recruitment Agency foreign jobs scam. The group demand the company to refund their money.
On 28 August 2023, Somalia refugees protested in Dadaab Refugee Camp (Dadaab, Garissa) against the arrest of Shegow. The group demanded his immediate release.

Around 28 August 2023 (as reported), boat taxi riders protested in Malindi (Malindi, Kilifi) against the introduction of e-citizen as a new method of payment for tourists. The group demanded the authorities to address the delays occasioned by the new system.
On 29 August 2023, residents protested in Naminage (Buzaya, Kamuli), demanding for the return of electricity poles which were removed by a rural electricity agency contractor.

On 29 August 2023, a group of Kiambu members of county assembly sang solidarity songs at outside the county assembly in Kiambu (Kiambu Town, Kiambu) against alleged incompetence and mismanagement of county operations by the governor. The group demanded the auditor general to corroborate and undertake a forensic audit of all the procured projects and programs in the county.

On 29 August 2023, a family from Kebeneti village protested at Lazarus funeral home- the Siloam Hospital mortuary in Kericho (Ainamoi, Kericho)- against a mix-up of bodies at the morgue after their kin's body had been released to another family for burial. The group demanded the hospital administration to address the matter.

Around 29 August 2023 (as reported), a group of youth and women gathered in Kericho (Ainamoi, Kericho) against alleged unfairness by a contractor in the recruitment of workers renovating the Kericho green stadium. The group demanded to be included on the list of workers.

On 29 August 2023, hundreds of teachers (described as non-locals) working in Northern Kenya protested at Teachers service commission (TSC) headquarters in Upper hill area of Nairobi (Nairobi - Westlands) against insecurity, discrimination and poor working conditions. The group demanded the commission to transfer them from the region.

On 30 August 2023, war wounded former members of TPLF forces who were released from the force following the peace agreement held a demonstration in Mekele (Mekelle Tigray, Tigry) in protest of the way they were released without any benefits to reintegrate into normal life and accused the local officials of stealing their benefits. After the demonstration, one of the demonstrators was arrested by security forces, while another one was hospitalized after being severely beaten up by security forces.
On 30 August 2023, county workers gathered at the Kisii county headquarters (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii) against delayed pay. The group demanded the governor to help address the matter.

Around 30 August 2023 (as reported), a group of people protested in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against being scammed by NMK investments limited scheme. The group demanded the government through the president to help address the matter.

Around 30 August 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Sigomre (Ugunja, Siaya) against increased theft of livestock in the region. The group demanded the area member of parliament and the cabinet secretary in-charge of internal security to help address the matter.
On 31 August 2023, a group of cleaners protested at Mama Lucy hospital in Embakasi (Embakasi South, Nairobi) against delayed pay.
On 31 August 2023, parents protested at Chemutia secondary school (Tinderet, Nandi) against poor performance of staff. The group demanded the principal to be transferred .
On 31 August 2023, a group of Early Childhood Education (ECDE) teachers protested in Bomet (Bomet East, Bomet) against delayed pay.

Around 1 September 2023 (as reported), farmers blocked the road (by unknown means) in Ngunichine in the district of Nachingwea (Nachingwea, Lindi) demanding the government to remove herdsmen from their village, claiming the livestock eat their crops. Police officers detained 13 people.
On 1 September 2023, residents protested in Kambare (Gem, Siaya) against increased insecurity.

Around 2 September 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Kaloleni area of Nairobi (Nairobi - Makadara) against alleged grabbing of public land by private developers. The group demanded the county government to issue title deeds to all public lands.

Around 2 September 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Rapenji village near Ulafu (Alego Usonga, Siaya) against environmental degradation caused by sand harvesting by their neighbors on the banks of River Nzoia. The group demanded the national government to help address the matter.

On 3 September 2023, protestors held a protest rally in Semera, Samera Logiya town (Awsi-Zone 1, Afar) against the regional administration. Regional security forces (coded as Afar Regional State Police) arrested 10 protest organizers and blocked (means unspecified) the protest.

On 3 September 2023, residents and senior officials including the Deputy Prime Minister attended a protest organized by Banadir Regional to support Somali National Army liberation fight against Al Shabaab at Daljirka Dahson in Mogadishu - Bondhere (Banadir).

On 4 September 2023, hundreds of climate activists from across Africa marched from Nyayo stadium to Green park bus terminus in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) against African Climate Summit 2023 that was being held at the Kenyatta international conference Centre (KICC). The group demanded more action towards climate change rather than boardroom talks.

Around 5 September 2023 (as reported), residents gathered in Thangira (Muranga South, Muranga) against increased cases of electricity transformer vandalism. The group demanded the security officers to address the matter.

Around 6 September 2023 (as reported), residents protested in unspecified location within Kwale county (coded to the county headquarters as Kwale, Matuga, Kwale) against poor state of the roads in the area. The group demanded the government to address the matter.
On 6 September 2023, residents protested in Jakaranda estate within Embakasi (Embakasi South, Nairobi) against the lack of water. The group demanded the governor to address the matter.

On 6 September 2023, residents blocked unspecified road with stones in Waruku in Nairobi (Nairobi - Dagoretti North) in demonstration against the poor state of the roads. The group demanded the governor and the member of parliament to address the matter.

On 7 September 2023, South Eastern Kenya University (SEKU) students allegedly protested at the institution in Kwa Vonza (Kitui Rural, Kitui) against the incompetence of the vice chancellor (VC). The group demanded the VC removed from office. The university later refuted the claims of the unrest in the institution.

On 7 September 2023, a coalition of three opposition parties (Tigray Salsawi Party, Tigray Independence Party, and National Congress of Great Tigray Party) protested against the region's interim administration called in Mekele, Mekelle (Mekelle Tigray, Tigray). Regional state police beat and arrested over 150 protesters (including the opposition leaders and organizers) on their arrival at the town's square. The arrest of organizers had begun a day before the protest.

Around 7 September 2023 (as reported), a group of Uzima university students gathered at the university in Kisumu (Kisumu Central, Kisumu) against the alleged move by the university management to increase their fees. The group demanded government and the university management to help address the matter.

On 7 September 2023, residents blocked an unspecified road with stones for the second day in Waruku area in Nairobi (Nairobi - Dagoretti North) in demonstration against the poor state of the roads. The group demanded the governor and the member of parliament to address the matter.

On 7 September 2023, residents protested in Mumangani in Malindi constituency (coded to the constituency headquarters as Malindi, Malindi, Kilfi) against the alleged invasion of their land by the agricultural development corporation (ADC) by erecting beacons. The group demanded the corporation remove the beacons.

On 7 September 2023, hundreds of residents marched from the Ekonjero market to the sub county headquarters in Khwisero (Khwisero, Kakamega) against increased lack of safety, following the killing of a woman in the area. The group demanded the transfer of the police officers.

On 8 September 2023, workers at Baroda company protested in Isinya (Kajiado East, Kajiado) against poor pay and poor working conditions. The group demanded the company management to address the matter.

On 8 September 2023, a group of teachers working in North Eastern Kenya protested at the Teachers service commission (TSC) headquarters in Upper hill area of Nairobi (Nairobi - Westlands) against insecurity in the area. The group demanded the commission to address their grievances.

On 8 September 2023, residents blocked an unspecified road with stones for the third day in Waruku area in Nairobi (Nairobi - Dagoretti North) in demonstration against the poor state of the roads. The group demanded the governor and the member of parliament to address the matter.

On 8 September 2023, hundreds of residents from Namucha village marched to the Ministry of Environment in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) against a quarry operated by a Chinese company that was allegedly destroying the environment, polluting the air, and threatening the water sources. The group demanded the immediate closure of all quarrying activities in the area.

On 8 September 2023, tens of Kiloriti group ranch members protested in Kisima (Samburu Central, Samburu) against alleged grabbing of their land. The group demanded the county government to address the matter.
On 9 September 2023, Acholi cultural leaders protested against human rights abuse linked to land conflicts in Apaa (East Moyo, Adjumani).
On 10 September 2023, health workers protested over the killing of a colleague (coded separately) in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug).

Around 10 September 2023 (as reported), residents of Manyatta and Kirima blocked the road leading to the Ngong hills with banana stems (coded as Ngong, Kajiado, Kajiado North) against the poor state of the road. The group demanded the national government to help address the matter.

On 11 September 2023, a group of people including businessmen stopped the convoy of a Member of Parliament for Mbeya City in Mbeya (Mbeya Urban, Mbeya) demanding her to intervene to solve the lack of water service in the region, lacking clean water for three consecutive months.

On 11 September 2023, residents and business people protested in Kabuku (Limuru, Kiambu) against persistent power blackout. The group demanded the Kenya power and lighting company (KPLC) to address the matter.

Around 11 September 2023 (as reported), a group of environmental activists protested in unspecified location in Kenya (coded to the country headquarters as Nairobi, Starehe, Nairobi) against efforts of African countries in dealing with the effects of climate change. Under the banner of world clock, the group demanded African countries to expedite the implementation of the recent Nairobi climate summit resolutions.

On 11 September 2023, workers allied to a mining company marched while carrying placards and twigs in Kataryo (Musoma, Mara) in protest against delayed pay, among other grievances. The group demanded that the company management address their grievances.

On 12 September 2023, about a hundred Boda Boda riders protested the killing of a fellow Bod Boda by a truck of law enforcement officers who were chasing him in Kampala (Kampala, Kampala). Police intervened and pepper sprayed the protesters to prevent further escalation.

On 12 September 2023, a group of Boda Boda riders protested in Kampala (Kampala, Kampala), against the death of their own after he was being chased by law security enforcers. Police intervened, fired tear gas to disperse the protesters, and arrested some of them.
On 12 September 2023, residents protested in Gatitu (Nyeri Central, Nyeri) against sell of illicit brew. The group demanded the government to address the matter.

On 12 September 2023, residents protested in Katani (Athi River, Machakos) against the move by the county government to suspend quarry operations in the area. The group demanded the governor to address the matter.

On 12 September 2023, doctors marched from the Kenyatta national hospital to the ministry of health and council of governors (COG) offices in Nairobi - Westlands against alleged poor working conditions as well as delayed salaries. Led by the KMPDU secretary general, the group demanded the county and national governments to address their grievances.

On 12 September 2023, residents blocked the Bondo-Uyawi beach road with tree logs in Uyawi (Bondo, Siaya) in demonstration against the poor state of the road as well as increased insecurity. Led by the beach management unit leaders and joined by the boda boda taxi operators, the group demanded the area member of parliament to address their grievances.

On 13 September 2023, residents of Meda Welabu town staged a protest in Meda Welabu (Bale, Oromia) to condemn what they say is, 'attacks on civilians by security forces'. No further information is available.

On 13 September 2023, a group of residents, religious leaders and lobby groups protested in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against the move by the supreme court to reaffirm the LBGTQ community's right to associate, alleging that the ruling goes against God's will and majority of Kenyans. The group demanded parliament to propose a bill that will ban homosexuality in the country.

On 13 September 2023, parents and their children (students) sang in unison as they marched in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against alleged fraud in the Finland education program ran by the county government. The group demanded a refund of their money.
On 14 September 2023, Intern doctors protested insecurity and lack of accommodation in Kabale (Kabale, Kabale).

On 14 September 2023, members of the Oldonyonyokie group ranch protested in Oldonyonyokie (Kajiado West, Kajiado) against the move by the national and county as well as the group leadership to convene a meeting on the subdivision of the land, alleging it contravenes a court order that stopped any activities on the land until a pending case is heard. The group demanded the leaders to respect the court order.

On 14 September 2023, residents protested in Kabasgei village (Emgwen, Nandi) against the move by a contractor to erect posters showing that water wells have been dug in the area but they are not there. The group demanded the ethics and anti-corruption commission (EACC) and the directorate of criminal investigations (DCI) to look into the matter.

On 15 September 2023, the residents of Gida Ayana Woreda held a protest in Gida Ayana town (East Wellega, Oromia), to denounce the attacks by armed groups on civilians, after 'an armed group from Amhara region' attacked civilians near the town on the same day (coded separately). They demanded that the government forces intervene to stop further violence.

On 15 September 2023, residents protested in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against the move by the supreme court to reaffirm the LGBTQIA+ community's right to associate, alleging that the ruling goes against God's will and majority of Kenyans. Led by Muslim and Christian clerics the group demanded the president to denounce the LGBTQIA+ movement.

On 15 September 2023, University students protested at the Ugandan parliament in Kampala (Kampala, Kampala) over the East African Crude Oil Pipeline Project (EACOP). The police intervened and arrested three protesters.

On 15 September 2023, residents protested in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against the move by the supreme court to reaffirm the LGBTQIA+ community's right to associate, alleging that the ruling goes against God's will and majority of Kenyans. Led by Muslim and Christian clerics the group demanded the president to denounce the LGBTQIA+ movement.

On 15 September 2023, Kisumu girls high school students protested at the institution in Kisumu (Kisumu Central, against the move by the school administration to decline to have entertainment music in the school as well as corporal punishment. The group demanded the administration to address the matter.

On 16 September 2023, residents protested in Majengo Ropa (coded as Majengo, Mvita, Mombasa) against alleged move by a private developer to grab a road reserve. The group demanded the National Land Commission (NLC) to address the matter.

On 16 September 2023, for the second day, Kisumu girls high school students led by one of their teachers protested at the institution in Kisumu (Kisumu Central, Kisumu) against the move by the school administration to decline to have entertainment music in the school as well as corporal punishment. Police intervened and arrested the teacher.

On 16 September 2023, Mukumu girls' teachers and students protested at the institution in Mukumu (Shinyalu, Kakamega) against the media presence to cover a fire outbreak incident at the school (coded separately), accusing the journalists of giving the school bad publicity. The group demanded the journalist to leave the school.

On 17 September 2023, South Eastern Kenya university (SEKU) students allegedly protested at the institution in Kwa Vonza (Kitui Rural, Kitui) against the incompetence of the vice chancellor (VC). The group demanded the VC removed from office. The university later refuted the claims of the unrest in the institution.

On 17 September 2023, Karakuta primary school parents gathered at the institution in Karakuta (Juja, Kiambu) against the poor state of infrastructure at the school. The group demanded the area leaders to address the matter.

On 19 September 2023, Maragua, Kandara and Kigumo residents protested in Kenol (Muranga South, Muranga) against the move by the water service provider Murang'a south water and sanitation company (MUSWASCO), to increase the water tariffs while accusing the water cabinet secretary (CS) of interference. Led by the area member of parliament (UDA, Kenya Kwanza) and ward member of the county assembly (UDA, Kenya Kwanza), the group demanded the CS to stop the interference.

On 19 September 2023, Maragua, Kandara and Kigumo residents protested in Maragua also known as Maragwa (Muranga South, Muranga) against the move by the water service provider Murang'a south water and sanitation company (MUSWASCO), to increase the water tariffs while accusing the water cabinet secretary (CS) of interference. Led by the area member of parliament (UDA, Kenya Kwanza) and ward member of the county assembly (UDA, Kenya Kwanza), the group demanded the CS to stop the interference.

Around 19 September 2023 (as reported), residents gathered in Kericho (Ainamoi, Kericho) against the political differences between the governor and his deputy, that is affecting service delivery. The group demanded the president and his deputy to help address the matter.

On 19 September 2023, Journalists from Meru county sang solidarity songs in Meru (Imenti North, Meru) against harassment, following a recent incident where their colleagues were beaten and their equipment destroyed while covering a charity event organized by the governor (coded separately). The group demanded the police and the media council of Kenya to investigate and prosecute the suspects.
Around 20 September 2023 (as reported), traders protested in Busibwabo market (Matayos, Busia) against increased insecurity. The group demanded security officers transferred.

Around 20 September 2023 (week of), ethnic Kore youths blockaded roads (means unspecified) in Dano Tulto kebele, Amaro special woreda (Kore Zone, formerly Amaro Special woreda, South Ethiopian Region), to protest the new zonal structure and demanded the return of their district to the previous 'Special woreda' status. South Ethiopian regional state police arrested unspecified number of youths who coordinated the protest.

On 20 September 2023, a group of parents gathered and sang in unison as in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against alleged fraud in the Finland education program ran by the county government. The group demanded a refund of their money.

On 20 September 2023, residents protested in Mukuru kwa Njenga (Starehe, Nairobi) against land auctioning and house demolitions by Orbit Chemicals. The group demanded the company to cease demolishing and auctioning the residence and verify their ownership of the land.

On 20 September 2023, street sweepers protested outside the office of the governor in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) against alleged unfair dismissal from the county government. The group demanded the governor to consider them in the upcoming recruitment.

On 20 September 2023, deputy governor's (Independent) supporters camped outside the county directorate of criminal investigation offices in Meru (Imenti North, Meru) in support of the deputy governor as he underwent questioning over the recent chaos that marred the governors event.

On 20 September 2023, hundreds of boda boda taxi operators mobilized themselves, before storming a credit asset finance office and locking the door of the company in Makutano town (West Pokot, West Pokot) in demonstration against harassment and repossession of defaulter motorbikes. The group demanded the lender to be sensitive given the high cost of living and rising fuel prices.
Around 21 September 2023 (as reported), boda boda taxi operators protested in Busia town (Matayos, Busia) against increased fuel prices. The group demanded the president to address the matter.

On 21 September 2023, residents led by environmental activists gathered in Uyombo (Kilifi North, Kilifi) against the planned development of a nuclear project in the area. Police intervened and forced the chairs, public address system and the projector to be removed from the venue, before ordering the group to disperse.

On 22 September 2023, hundreds of residents protested outside the immigration offices in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against the delayed issuance of passports. The group demanded the cabinet secretary for interior to address the matter.

On 25 September 2023, health workers (doctors) protested outside Nyamira County Referral Hospital (Nyamira, Nyamira) against poor working conditions, delayed promotions and understaffing. Led by KMPDU Nyanza region branch chairman, the group demanded the county government to address their grievances.

On 25 September 2023, a group gathered in front of a court in Mukurwe-ini (Mukurweini, Nyeri) in a demonstration against a suspect accused of murder. The court freed him for lack of evidence. Police protected the suspect and moved him to safety.

On 25 September 2023, women protested on the streets of Busia town (Matayos, Busia) against sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV), following the alleged move by a member of county assembly to sexually assault a 14-year-old girl. The group demanded the MCA to be arraigned in court.

On 25 September 2023, health workers (doctors) protested in Meru (Imenti North, Meru) against poor working conditions. Led by the KMPDU Upper Eastern branch chairman, the group demanded the county government to address their grievances.

On 25 September 2023, employees of the Naivasha water and sewerage company (NAIVAWASCO) protested in Naivasha (Naivasha, Nakuru) against the death of their colleague after a hippopotamus attacked him while on duty. Joined by the area member of the county assembly (MCA) (UDA, Kenya Kwanza), the group demanded Kenya wildlife service (KWS) to relocate the hippos as well as the KWS to compensate the family of their slain colleague.

On 26 September 2023, residents protested in Nyamira town (Nyamira, Nyamira) in support of the planned impeachment of the governor by the members of the county assembly (MCAs). The group demanded the MCAs to proceed with the impeachment process.

On 26 September 2023, Nyamira governor supporters (UPA, Azimio) blocked the county assembly gate with stones and raw sewage in Nyamira (Nyamira, Nyamira) in demonstration against the planned impeachment of the governor by the members of the county assembly (MCAs). The group demanded the MCAs to stop the impeachment process.

On 26 September 2023, market traders protested in Machakos town (Machakos, Machakos) against competition from street traders (hawkers). The group demanded the county governor to order the hawkers not to operate along the streets.

On 26 September 2023, health workers (doctors) protested in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against poor working conditions. Led by the KMPDU South Rift region secretary, the group demanded the county government to address their grievances.

On 26 September 2023, residents forced their way into quarry sites and shut down operations (means not specified)in Kinanie (other sources mention Katani) (Athi River, Machakos) against alleged corruption by lorry operators. The group demanded the county governor to address the matter as the lorry drivers ran away for their safety.

On 26 September 2023, a group of Nairobi county casual workers protested outside the office of the governor in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) against alleged unfair dismissal from the county government. The group demanded the county to prioritize them in the upcoming recruitment.

On 26 September 2023, private and public university student leaders gathered in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against delayed disbursement of loans by the higher education loans board (HELB). The group demanded the government to help address the matter.

On 26 September 2023, a group of Makuti market traders gathered at the South B shopping Centre in Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) against the alleged move by a private developer to grab their market land. Joined by the area member of county assembly (UDA, Kenya Kwanza) and a former member of parliament, the group demanded both the county and national governments to protect the land meant for the construction of the market.

On 27 September 2023, Kilimbini primary school parents protested in Mukaa (Kilome, Makueni) against alleged mismanagement and illegal levies charged by the school's administration. The group demanded for the transfer of the head teacher, the deputy and senior teacher.

On 27 September 2023, residents protested in Marsabit town (Saku, Marsabit) against power blackouts. Led by members of county assembly (MCAs) and local leaders, the group demanded the president to address the matter.

On 27 September 2023, staff at the Council of Legal Education (CLE), mainly lawyers, protested at the institution in Nairobi (Nairobi - Langata) against alleged misconduct by the leadership of the council. The group demanded the dissolution of the board and the sacking of a senior official in the council.

On 27 September 2023, street traders blocked (means not specified) unspecified road in Machakos town (Machakos, Machakos) in demonstration against the move by the county government to order them not to operate along the streets. Police intervened and lobbed teargas to disperse the group.

Around 27 September 2023 (as reported), former workers (retired) of Pyrethrum processing company of Kenya gathered at the company in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against delayed payment of their retirement benefits. The group demanded the cabinet secretary of agriculture to help address the matter.

On 27 September 2023, a group protested in Masimba (Nyaribari Masaba, Kisii) against alleged extortion by county askaris from charitable causes. Running battles ensued as the county askaris (county inspectorate officers) used wooded bars to disperse the group.

On 28 September 2023, Tharaka-Nithi farmers protested in an unspecified location (coded to the county headquarters as Kathwana, Tharaka South, Tharaka-Nithi) against alleged unfair allocation of the subsidized fertilizer. The group demanded the president to help address the matter.

Around 28 September 2023 (as reported), youth protested in Umoja Inner Core estate (Embakasi West, Nairobi) against the attack and injury of an upcoming artiste, following a mob incident on 28 September (coded separately). Police intervened and arrested some of the youth.

On 29 September 2023, many Gurage ethnic residents of Kebena woreda held a demonstration in Agumana Herana kebele in Kebena woreda (coded at the administrative center of the zone, Welkite town, Guraghe, SNNP) against being organized under Kebena special woreda. In this protest, they stated that for the last 30 years, they were forbidden to have proper representation in the region. And asked to establish East Abeshega kebele and claimed an administration which does not contain 64% of the residents can not bring prosperity. The newly established South region council recently decided to separate the Kebena woreda from the Gurage zone and be recognized as a special woreda.

On 29 September 2023, a group of Mt Kenya residents and presumed Kenya Kwanza supporters gathered in Thika (Thika Town, Kiambu) against the alleged infighting between elected leaders and key figures in the Kenya kwanza government. The group demanded the leaders to end the infighting, unite and work together to foster development in the region.

Around 30 September 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Ng'iyei village near Daiga (Laikipia East, Laikipia) against the move by some ranchers to close down public road networks and rivers. The group demanded the local administrator to help address the matter.

On 1 October 2023, residents protested in Ijara town (Ijara, Garissa) against extrajudicial killings and enforced disappearance, following the alleged abduction of two men in the area (coded separately). Joined by local leaders, the group demanded the government to produce the two men.
Around 1 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Kokwatoto (Tiaty, Baringo) against construction location choice of a school. The group demanded the school to be constructed in Orus.

On 1 October 2023, a group of students protested at Maranda high school (Bondo, Siaya) against missing meals after barred being from eating on the basis that they delayed going for their ratio. Led by six form four and three students (masterminds), the group demanded their meals. Later one of the masterminds was suspended.

On 2 October 2023, local residents, mainly boda boda taxi operators and local formers, protested along the Sokosik-Kimwani-Sitet road, Tinderet constituency (coded as Kimwani, Tinderet, Nandi) against the poor state of the road. The group demanded the president to address the matter.
On 3 October 2023, traders protested at the Uhuru market in Nairobi (Nairobi - Makadara
On 3 October 2023, residents protested in Nyakariang'a (Oljoroorok, Nyandarua) against poor state of the roads. The group demanded the government to address the matter.

On 3 October 2023, a group of parents forced their way into Eregi girls' high school (Ikolomani, Kakamega) against the move by the school principal to delay communicating the whereabouts of their children, following the outbreak of an unknown illness. The group demanded to know the status of their children.

On 3 October 2023, intern doctors sang solidarity songs at the ministry of health offices in Nairobi (Nairobi - Westlands) against delayed pay. Led by the KMPDU secretary general, the group demanded the government to address their grievances.

On 4 October 2023, residents gathered in Gathaara, also known as Gathara (Kinagop, Nyandarua) against the move by the governor to relocate the planned construction of a Museum from the area. The group demanded the president and the deputy president to help address the matter.

On 4 October 2023, youth blocked the Katito-Sondu road with tree branches at Nyabondo junction (Nyakach, Kisumu) in demonstration against increased cross border insecurity, following recent attacks in the Kisumu-Kericho border area (coded separately). Police used unspecified means to disperse the group.

On 4 October 2023, boda boda taxi operators blocked the Eldoret Malaba highway (using unspecified means) (coded as Malaba, Teso North, Busia) against increased incidents on the road, following the death of their colleague. The group demanded the cabinet secretary for transport to address the matter as well as the transfer of traffic police officers for failing to take action to ensure road safety.

On 4 October 2023, a group of women supporters to a UDA, Kenya Kwanza nominated senator protested in Dagoretti North (coded as Kawangware, Dagoretti North, Nairobi) against the move by the senate to suspend the senator from the house, over an 'unsubstantiated' sexual claims. The women demanded the senate to rescind the decision.

On 4 October 2023, boda boda taxi operators camped at the Athi-river Deputy County Commissioner's office gates in Mlolongo (Athi River, Machakos) against alleged harassment by the police officers. The group demanded top security agents to help address the matter as well as release of their confiscated motorbikes.

Around 4 October 2023 (as reported), a group of Kandara residents association forced their way into the Muranga police county commander's office in Muranga (Kiharu, Muranga) against alleged harassment by the police over their stand on the move by the county government to construct a hospital on the land ceded by Delmonte company. The group demanded the association members to be factored as some beneficiaries of the land ceded by Delmonte.

On 5 October 2023, residents protested in lulungusua in Kajiado county (coded to the county headquarters as Kajiado, Kajiado Central, Kajiado) against the move by a non-governmental organization to introduce carbon projects in the area, fearing they will lose their land. The group demanded their political leaders to help address the matter.

On 6 October 2023, Maikona primary school parents and Muslim leaders marched to the Ministry of Education and the deputy county commissioner's offices in North Horr (North Horr, Marsabit) against the move by the headteacher to ban girls from wearing hijab. Led by a human right defender, the group demanded that girls to be allowed to wear their hijabs as well as disbandment of the school's board among others.

On 6 October 2023, Muslim faithful protested in the Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against the recent move by the supreme court to reaffirm the LGBTQIA+ community's right to associate, alleging that the ruling goes against God's will and majority of Kenyans. The group demanded the court to annul the ruling.

On 6 October 2023, a group of contractors gathered in Kisii (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii) in support of the move by the courts to release one of their colleagues, who had been arrested for failing to pay debt.

On 6 October 2023, hundreds of Muslims and conservative Christians protested in the Nairobi Central Business District (CBD) (Nairobi - Starehe) against the recent move by the supreme court to reaffirm the LGBTQIA+ community's right to associate, alleging that the ruling goes against God's will and majority of Kenyans. Joined by a UDA, Kenya kwanza member of parliament and other politicians, the group demanded the court to annul the ruling.

On 7 October 2023, residents protested against government security forces (SNA) in Belet Xaawo town (Belet Weyne, Gedo). SNA fired live bullets to disperse the crowd. There were no casualties. The motive for the protest is unclear.

Around 8 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Kamanyaki (Chuka, Tharaka-Nithi) against the government planned move to construct the Kibuuka Grand Falls Dam, out of fear of losing their land, potential displacement and a lack of clarity about compensation. The group demanded their area leaders to provide them with more details about the planned project.

Around 9 October 2023 (as reported), presumed Meru County governor's (Independent) supporters gathered in Imenti South (coded to the nearest known location as Nkubu, Imenti South, Meru) against the planned move by members of county assembly (MCAs) to impeach the governor. The group demanded the MCAs to accord the governor more time to deliver on her election pledges.

Around 9 October 2023 (as reported), Tuberculosis (TB) patients protested at a hotel in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against shortage of TB drugs. The group demanded for immediate supply of the medicines.

Around 9 October 2023 (as reported), a group of Munyoyaya community members gathered in unspecified location within Tana River County and started marching to Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against lack of recognition by the state as an ethnic group in Kenya. The group demanded to be recognized and gazette as an ethnic group in Kenya (it is unclear whether the march went on for days).

On 10 October 2023, around 500 youth in Berahle (Kilbati-Zone 2, Afar) protested against alleged widespread arrest throughout the region and maladministration. The Afar region security forces (assumed Afar region police) intervened arresting ten youths.

On 10 October 2023, traders marched in Maralal town (Samburu Central, Samburu) against increased insecurity, following recent incidents of breaking into shops. Joined by the member of county assembly (Jubilee, Azimio), the group demanded the security officers to address the matter.

On 11 October 2023, residents, mainly members of Mailwa Group Ranch blocked the Namanga road (using unspecified means) at Maili Tisa (coded as Namanaga, Kajiado Central, Kajiado) against the election of group officials without the involvement of all the members. The group demanded the county lands office to help address the matter.

On 11 October 2023, traders and residents living around Ruiru Prisons marched, before blocking the road from Ruiru Prisons to the Wataalam area with stones in Ruiru (Ruiru, Kiambu) in demonstrations against prolonged power blackout. The group demanded that Kenya Power restore electricity as well as area leaders look into the matter.

Around 12 October 2023 (as reported), sheep herders living at the border of Narok, Nakuru and Kajiado counties gathered at Suswa police station (Kajiado West, Kajiado) against increased insecurity following the recent incident where 110 sheep were stolen (coded separately). The group demanded security officers from the anti-stock theft unit to address the matter.
On 12 October 2023, families of missing NUP activists protested at the offices of Uganda Human Rights Commission in Kampala (Kampala, Kampala), demanding to know the whereabouts of their relatives.

Around 12 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Kanyungu (Kabete, Kiambu) against the county government's failure to pave unspecified road. The group demanded the county to tarmac the road.
Around 12 October 2023 (as reported), human rights defenders marched in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against rise of human trafficking cases. The group demanded the government to address the matter.

On 12 October 2023, members of Nairobi water justice working group protested in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the move by Members of County Assembly (MCAs) to introduce a bill that seeks to transform Nairobi Water and Sewerage Company (NWSC) into a company under the control of the county executive. The group demanded MCAs to develop a water policy and law that takes into account the needs of all the city residents.

Around 13 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Marafa (Magarini, Kilifi) against the alleged double registration of their land, making it susceptible to land grabbing. The group demanded the land's officers to address the matter.

On 13 October 2023, several residents protested against Israeli airstrikes or ground operations against Gaza in Kuunyo-Barrow village (Jilib, Middle Juba). The protesters supported Palestinian civilians.

On 14 October 2023, a group of Kandara Residents Association invaded Del Monte Kenya Limited land and started erecting structure in Kandara (Kandara, Muranga) during a demonstration against the move by the county government to continue building a health facility, despite an order from the courts restraining any activity to be undertaken on the land. Police used unspecified means to disperse the group as well as arrested two people, and intercepted a personal car alongside a truck delivering construction materials.

Around 14 October 2023 (as reported), hundreds of Rombo ranch members protested in Rombo (Loitokitok, Kajiado) against the ranch's management, accusing leaders of fund embezzlement and corruption. The group demanded fresh elections as well as the government to suspend the ranch activities until a forensic audit is carried out.

On 14 October 2023, residents and local leaders, mainly from the Wiper party- Azimio coalition, protested in Mavoko also known as Athi River (Athi river, Machakos) against the move by the government to demolish houses on the disputed East African Portland Cement land. Police intervened and lobbed teargas to disperse the group.

On 14 October 2023, more than 20 residents, led by a human rights defender, forced their way into Mukuru kwa Reuben police station (Starehe, Nairobi) against the move by the police to arrest a suspected motorbike thief. Police intervened and arrested the human rights defenders as the rest of the group managed to flee.
On 14 October 2023, thousands of residents protested against Israeli airstrikes and ground operations against Gaza in Jilib town (Jilib, Middle Juba). The protesters supported Palestinian civilians.

On 15 October 2023, health workers sang solidarity songs in Busia (Matayos, Busia) against the lack of promotion, poor pay, and poor working conditions among other grievances. The group demanded the county government address their grievances.

On 15 October 2023, residents forced their way into the Kowet police post (Alego Usonga, Siaya) against increased insecurity in the area, following the recent killing of three people. Police lobbed teargas and fired in the air to disperse the group.

Around 15 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Oljorai (Gilgil, Nakuru) against a planned move by powerful individuals to evict them from their land. The group demanded the government address the matter.

On 15 October 2023, dozens of Kenyans organized a vigil in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) in support of Palestine, following the conflict situation in Gaza Strip. The group demanded for Israel to free Palestine and stop the attacks.

On 16 October 2023, residents gathered at Tawakal farm near Masalani town (Ijara, Garissa) against the move by their neighbors from Hola to trespass on their land by digging up ditches. Led by an ODM-Azimio nominated member of parliament and the Masalani member of county assembly, the group demanded their neighbors to respect the boundaries that exist.

On 16 October 2023, taxi drivers and the family of their deceased colleague protested outside the law courts in Eldoret (Moiben, Eldoret), against the move by the court to release on bond two suspects who had been arrested, in connection with the disappearance and murder of their colleague. Joined by Langas member of the county assembly (Jubilee, Azimio), the group demanded the president to help address their grievances.

On 16 October 2023, a group of teachers working in North Eastern Kenya marched to the Teachers Service Commission (TSC) headquarters in the Upper hill area of Nairobi (Nairobi - Westlands) against the decision by the commission to interdict them. Police intervened and lobbed teargas to disperse the group as well as arrested several teachers. One teacher sustained injuries during the incident.

On 17 October 2023, the Meru ethnic group council of elders (Njuri Ncheke) gathered in Tigania (Tigania West, Meru) against the move by a splinter group to endorse the impeachment of the Meru County governor. The group demanded the governor be given time to serve her term.

On 17 October 2023, a group of residents protested against alleged corruption by their local leader in Bumbo (Bubulo, Namisindwa). They accused him of including a Kenyan national on the list of local fund (PDM) recipients.

On 17 October 2023, residents blocked the Gitaru-Rwaka road with tires and stones (coded as Gitaru, Kabete, Kiambu) during a demonstration against delayed compensation for the farms and property affected by the road construction project. Police used unspecified means to disperse the group.

Around 17 October 2023 (as reported), human rights defenders gathered in Voi (Voi, Taita Taveta) against increased land disputes in the Coastal counties. Led by a Haki Africa representative, the group demanded the Ministry of Lands and coastal county leaders address the matter.

Around 17 October 2023 (as reported), parents protested in Mwenzamwenye primary school also known as Menza mwenye (Lunga Lunga, Kwale) against the alleged misappropriation of funds by the head teacher. The group demanded the cabinet secretary for education to help address the matter.

Around 18 October 2023 (week of), demonstrators closed the main road (means unspecified) connecting Addis Ababa and Arbaminch at unspecified place in Misrak Badowacho woreda (location coded to Shone Town, Shone, Hadiya, SNNP). The demonstration was the escalation of weeks of strike by government employees as their salary were not paid for over three months leading to closure of essential public services including hospitals and schools. Police (Central Ethiopia State Police) intervened (means unspecified), resulting in injuries.

On 18 October 2023, Gatundu North residents staged a walkout during a meeting organized by the Ministry of Water, with some making away with the physical participants' registration list at Kiambu Institute of Science and Technology (Kiambu town, Kiambu) against the proposed plan to construct another dam in the constituency. The group demanded the ministry to relocate the dam either at the forest or in another constituency, out of fear of being displaced. The meeting ended abruptly.

On 20 October 2023, hundreds of residents disrupted a Mashujaa Day celebration by scolding a Kilifi women representative, with some making sure her vehicles had left the venue in Kayafungo (Kaloleni, Kilifi). Protesters expressed their discontent with the representative due to her alleged criticism of the Governor's administration. The representative had to cut short her speech and leave the venue.

On 20 October 2023, large number of residents protested against Israeli airstrikes or ground operations against Gaza in Tayeglow village (Tayeeglow, Bakool). The protesters supported Palestinian civilians.

Around 20 October 2023 (as reported), residents gathered in Ramula (Gem, Siaya) against alleged displacement to pave the way for a gold mining venture by a private investor. The group demanded the area member of parliament and the governor address the matter.

Around 20 October 2023 (as reported), over 500 nursing students at Presbyterian University marched in Kikuyu (Kikuyu, Kiambu) against delayed issuance of registration numbers. The group demanded the university administration to address the matter.
On 20 October 2023, residents protested against Israeli attacks on Gaza in Mogadishu - Hamar Weyne (Banadir).

On 20 October 2023, residents gathered near Nanyuki town (Laikipia East, Laikipia) against delayed compensation over a 2021 fire that broke out during a British military training exercise. The group demanded compensation ahead of King Charles III's visit to Kenya.

Around 20 October 2023 (as reported), Technical University of Kenya (TUK) lecturers gathered at outside the university canteen in the Nairobi Central Business District (CBD) (Nairobi - Starehe) against delayed salaries. The group demanded their pay.

Around 20 October 2023 (as reported), Imenti farmers gathered in Meru (Imenti North, Meru) against the move by the Kenya Forest Service to stop them from cultivating in government forest. The group demanded the environment cabinet secretary to reverse the decision.

On 20 October 2023, hundreds of residents including religion scholars protested against Israeli airstrikes and ground operations against Gaza in Mogadishu - Hodan (Banadir). The protesters supported Palestinian civilians.

On 21 October 2023, hundreds of local residents protested against Israeli airstrikes and ground operations against Gaza in Buqda Caqable village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The protesters supported Palestinian civilians.

On 21 October 2023, hundreds of Muslims and Christians marched in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) in support of Palestine, following the conflict situation in Gaza Strip. Joined by Nyali member of parliament (UDA, Kenya Kwanza) the group demanded for Israel to free Palestine and stop the attacks.

On 21 October 2023, a group of business people and residents protested in Nyahururu (Laikipia West, Laikipia) against the move by a private developer to grab and construct on a piece of land used as a public service vehicle (matatu) terminus. Led by Igwamiti member of county assembly (UDA, Kenya Kwanza), the group demanded the building demolished.
Around 21 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Kamwangi (Gatundu North, Kiambu) against the poor state of the Wanugu road. The group demanded local leaders to address the matter.
On 22 October 2023, three Kenyans gathered in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) in support of Palestine, following the conflict situation in Gaza Strip. Police intervened and arrested the group.

On 22 October 2023, residents disrupted a rally by scolding at the President and Kenya Kwanza legislators accompanying him at the junction leading to Satellite Dagoretti (Dagoretti South, Nairobi) following the increased cost of living. The group demanded the president to lower prices of essential commodities. It is unclear whether the rally proceeded as planned.

Around 23 October 2023 (as reported), over 1000 residents protested in Chidze Kibwaga near Tiwi (Matuga, Kwale) against the alleged move by a private developer to grab their land. The group demanded both the county and the national government to address the matter.

Around 23 October 2023 (as reported), public service vehicle (matatu) operators under the Gikakuru Travelers Sacco, protested at Githurai roundabout (Roysambu, Nairobi) against alleged harassment by tuktuk taxi operators, following unfair competition. The group demanded the relevant authorities to address the matter.

On 23 October 2023, family members protested at Kayole 2 level 4 hospital (Embakasi Central, Nairobi) against the alleged stealing of one of the twin babies by the hospital staff, after a woman gave birth. The group demanded justice for the woman.

Around 23 October 2023 (as reported), residents gathered in Mgongeni near Mwandoni (Nyali, Mombasa) against the potential loss of their properties, after suspected land agents threatened to evict them. The group demanded the government to address the matter.

Around 24 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Maina Village on the outskirts of Nyahururu town (Laikipia West, Laikipia) against the alleged move by some individuals to grab their land. The group demanded relevant government officials to address the matter.

On 24 October 2023, Winam Social Justice Centre and the Muslim community marched in Kisumu (Kisumu Central, Kisumu) in support of Palestine, following the conflict situation in Gaza Strip. The group demanded for Israel to free Palestine and stop the attacks.

On 24 October 2023, hundreds of former Postal employees camped outside the retirement benefits authority offices in Nairobi - Westlands against delayed pay of their pension arrears. The group demanded their dues.

On 24 October 2023, 'victims' of fake land deals protested at Thika Magistrate's court (Thika Town, Kiambu) in support of the arrest of the founder of Lesedi Developers Limited, a property firm accused of defrauding land buyers. The group demanded a refund for their money.

Around 24 October 2023 (as reported), members of Pentecostal Assemblies of God (PAG) Ebushibo Church protested in Shiyunzu (Lurambi, Kakamega) against the alleged arbitrary transfer of their preachers by the western region PAG leader, without their consultation. Led by the church secretary, the group demanded the top PAG management in the country to help address the matter.

On 25 October 2023, residents of Mtwapa, Kanamai, and Majengo protested outside the Shanzu law courts (Kilifi South, Kilifi) against alleged police harassment and illegal arrests, following the recent arrest of one of the residents. The group demanded the police to be transferred.

Around 25 October 2023 (as reported), more than 3000 Ashton and Mombasa apparel export processing zone (EPZ) workers protested in Athi River (Athi River, Machakos) against their job securities, following the takeover of the company by a new investor. Led by their chairperson, the group demanded the government to help address the matter.

On 25 October 2023, students protested at Kabale university located in Kabale (Kabale, Kabale) against the sudden increase in surcharges imposed by the university administration. The anti-riot police unit intervened to prevent possible escalation. The school administration later removed the extra charges.

On 25 October 2023, residents forced their way into a homestead in Gichugu (Kirinyaga Central, Kirinyaga) against increased theft and the sale of illicit liquor. The group demanded the authorities to address the matter.

On 25 October 2023, Technical University of Kenya (TUK) lecturers marched around the varsity compound in the Kenya (TUK) in the Nairobi Central Business District (CBD) (Nairobi - Starehe) against delayed salaries. The group demanded their pay.

On 26 October 2023, residents protested in Burat ward (coded as Burat, Isiolo, Isiolo) against the move by military officers from the Kenya Defense Forces' School of Infantry (Soi) to stop the burial of a woman, following a land dispute. The group demanded the minister of defense to address the matter.

On 26 October 2023, traders protested at the Burma market in Nairobi (Nairobi - Kamukunji, Nairobi) against the move by the county government to increase market charges. Police intervened and lobbed teargas to disperse the group.

Around 26 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Keginga (Borabu, Nyamira) against environmental pollution, arising from a nearby pig farm. The group demanded public health officers to address the matter.

Around 26 October 2023 (as reported), residents gathered in Samburu West (coded as Pura, Samburu Central, Samburu) against increased insecurity, following the recent killing of three people by suspected pastoral militia. The group demanded the president to address the matter.

On 26 October 2023, Uasin Gishu residents, mainly youth and parents allegedly lured by First Choice Recruitment Agency into a job scam, gathered in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against delayed refund of their money. The group demanded the government to implement a Senate Committee's direction ordering the firm to be shut down and victims to be reimbursed their money.

On 26 October 2023, Lavington Mbaazi and Hendred Avenue residents protested in Lavington (Dagoretti North, Nairobi) against the move by a Chinese developer to construct a high-rise building in the area. Led by the Kilimani member of the county assembly ( a resident in the area) and the Mbaazi Avenue resident's association chairman, the group demanded the police officers, the city council, and the government to order the halt of the construction.

Around 26 October 2023 (as reported), Muslim faithful protested in Mukuyuni (Tongaren, Bungoma) against the move by a private developer to grab their land. The group demanded the government to help them reclaim their land.

On 27 October 2023, civil servants in Gombera woreda (coded to Soro, Gimbicho, Hadya zone, Central Ethiopia region- former SNNP), staged a demonstration, complaining the non-payment of their monthly salary for over three months. Civil servants in different woredas of the zone were conducting strike, and health, education, agriculture, and other offices ceased giving services for months.

Around 27 October 2023 (as reported), a group of parents gathered at Thimlich secondary school (Nyatike, Migori) against the annual transfer of students from the institution, to neighboring schools to sit for their examinations. The group demanded the education officials to address the matter.

On 27 October 2023, public service vehicle (matatu) operators protested in Karen (Langata, Nairobi) against attacks as well as invasion by tuk-tuk taxi operators, alleging unfair competition. The group demanded protection from the police. The group had previously demonstrated around 23 October (coded separately).
On 27 October 2023, family members protested in Karen (Langata, Nairobi) against an attempt by a private company to grab their land. The group demanded the government to address the matter.

On 27 October 2023, Nyandarua National Polytechnic students marched along the Nyahururu-Olkalou highway to Ol Joro Orok (Oljoroorok, Nyandarua) against increased insecurity around the institution, following the recent death robbery incident that led to the death of a staff member. The group demanded measures to be taken by the authorities.

On 27 October 2023, a group of taxi operators gathered in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the renewal of the operating licenses of foreign taxing hailing apps Bolt and Uber. The group demanded the government not to renew their licenses.

On 27 October 2023, Gatundu residents gathered at the Thika law courts (Thika Town, Kiambu) against the construction of Ndaragu Dam, fearing displacement. The group demanded the dam to be relocated to another area.
