On 28 October 2023, 17 teachers employed by the Board of Management protested at Marereni secondary school (Magarini, Kilifi) against delayed pay. The group demanded the government to help address the matter.
On 28 October 2023, residents marched in Eastleigh airbase (Kamukunji, Nairobi) against a dirty environment and increased insecurity. The group demanded the county government to address the matter.

On 28 October 2023, hundreds of residents from Ngaratuko, Sibilo location and Loruk division gathered and marched in Loruk Centre (Tiaty, Baringo) against increased insecurity by pastoral militia. The group demanded the president to address the matter.

On 28 October 2023, student leaders from public universities gathered at the university of Nairobi (Nairobi - Starehe) against delayed disbursement of funds by the higher education loans board. The group demanded the relevant education stakeholders to address the matter.
On 28 October 2023, a hundred residents protested against the detention of Captain Sheegow Ahmed Ali in Mogadishu - Hodan (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).

On 30 October 2023, at least 3000 residents protested at Loosuk trading Centre (Samburu Central, Samburu) against increased insecurity, following the recent killing of three people by suspected pastoral militia (coded separately). Led by the Women representative and the area member of county assembly (both from UDA, Kenya Kwanza), the group demanded the national government to address the matter.

On 30 October 2023, Pwani University students gathered at the university's car park and held a candlelight vigil at the institution in Kilifi (Embu (Manyatta, Embu) against increased insecurity, following the killing of their colleague by unknown assailants. The group demanded justice for their slain colleague as well as improved security around the university.

On 30 October 2023, a group of Laikipia and Samburu County residents attempted to gather at hotel in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the alleged atrocities committed by the British Army Training Unit in Kenya (BATUK), ahead of King Charles to the country. Police officers used police vehicles to block the entrance of the hotel before chasing away the group.

On 30 October 2023, residents protested in Meru (Imenti North, Meru) against the transfer of county officers, following the recent impeachment of the governor. The group demanded the senate to uphold the governor's impeachment.

Around 31 October 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Lucky Summer area in Baba Dogo (Ruaraka, Nairobi) against prolonged power outage, after Kenya power officials took away the transformer serving the area for maintenance. The group demanded the officials to expedite the return of the transformer.

On 31 October 2023, Nakuru War Memorial hospital staff gathered in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) in support of the court decision, stopping the county government from taking over the management of the facility.

On 31 October 2023, elders from the Kalenjin ethnic community (Muyot) gathered in undisclosed location (coded to nearest known location as Eldoret, Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against the atrocities committed by the British colonial rulers, following King Charles III visit to Kenya. The group demanded compensation as well as the return of Koitalele Arap Samoei's head, a colonial fighter.

On 31 October 2023, hundreds of traders and Meru governor supporters (Independent) protested along the Meru- Nairobi highway in Meru town (other sources mention Ntharene market) (Imenti North, Meru) against the recent impeachment of the governor by the members of county assembly. The group demanded the president and the deputy president to help address the matter as well as the senate to reverse the impeachment.

On 1 November 2023, hundreds of business owners and students protested in Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud) against the revenge killing between two sub-clans in the Galgaduud region. Protesters closed shops, markets, and business centers (means unspecified) as a result of the killing of two of their colleagues by clan militiamen and called for a peaceful resolution.

On 1 November 2023, residents protested in Rumuruti town (Laikipia West, Laikipia) against the planned construction of a wellness and rehabilitation Centre by the county government on a new piece of land, for lack of public participation. The group demanded the Centre to be set up on the previous land that the residents had proposed.

On 1 November 2023, residents marched to the courts before proceeding to the Nakuru war memorial hospital (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against the move by the court to prevent the Nakuru county government from taking over the management of the hospital, following an ownership dispute. The group demanded the hospital to be managed and owned the by county government.

On 1 November 2023, members of the Baringo journalists association, political leaders (affiliation not reported/unknown) and civil society groups camped at the Kabarnet police station (Baringo Central, Baringo) against the move by the police to summon an NTV journalist over his recent coverage of pastoral militia attack on Kapindasum Primary School and a neighboring General Service Unit (GSU) camp (coded separately). The group demanded the police to stop interfering with the freedom of the press.

On 1 November 2023, over 400 Kilifi county employees of a private revenue collection firm, Rain Drops Limited, protested at an undisclosed location (coded to the county headquarters as Kilifi, Kilifi North, Kilfi) against the cancellation of the firm's contract. The group demanded the governor to reinstate the firm.

On 1 November 2023, about 30 members of a group known as the Social Justice network, protested in the Nairobi Central Business District (Nairobi - Starehe, Starehe, Nairobi) against the atrocities committed by the British colonial rulers. Police intervened and confiscated their banner as they dispersed the group.

On 1 November 2023, street vendors living with disabilities camped outside the Governor's office in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against alleged discriminatory policies imposed by the County Government, following the ban on hawking. Police intervened by lobbing teargas to disperse the group.

On 2 November 2023, hundreds of local residents protested against Israeli airstrikes and ground operations against Gaza in Kurtunwaarey town (Kurtunwaarey, Lower Shabelle). The protesters supported Palestinian civilians.

On 2 November 2023, postal corporation of Kenya workers protested in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against delayed pay. Led by the representative from the communication workers union, the group demanded for their pay as well as the resignation of the post master general.
Around 2 November 2023 (as reported), a group of market vendors protested in Kampala (Kampala, Kampala) against the increase in rent fees at Nabugabo market.

On 2 November 2023, postal corporation of Kenya workers protested in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against delayed pay. Led by the branch secretary, communication workers union, the group demanded their pay.

Around 2 November 2023 (as reported), residents blocked unspecified road with tree branches and stones at Columbus village in Karandi village of Laikipia west constituency (coded as Karandi, Laikipia West, Laikipia) in demonstration against increased invasion of their farms by Elephants. The group demanded the Kenya wildlife service to contain the Elephants.

On 2 November 2023, postal corporation of Kenya workers protested in Eldoret (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against delayed pay. The group demanded the cabinet secretary information and communication to address the matter.
On 2 November 2023, postal corporation of Kenya workers marched in Nyeri town (Nyeri Central, Nyeri) against delayed pay. The group demanded their pay.

On 2 November 2023, more than 200 postal corporation of Kenya workers protested in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against delayed pay. Led by communication workers union secretary general, the demanded for their pay as well as payment for the services provided to the electoral commission during last year's elections.

On 2 November 2023, postal corporation of Kenya workers protested in Kitale (Saboti, Kitale) against delayed pay. The group demanded for their pay as well as the president to restructure the management of the corporation.

On 3 November 2023, residents disrupted a rally by scolding at the President in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) following the increased cost of living. The group demanded the president to lower prices of essential commodities. It is unclear whether the president continued with his speech.

On 3 November 2023, students of Jaramogi Oginga Odinga University of Science and Technology (JOOUST) blocked the Siaya-Nyadorera road (using unspecified means) in Siaya (Alego Usonga, Siaya) against increased insecurity, accusing the security personnel of laxity. The group demanded the administration to change the security personnel.

On 3 November 2023, several three-wheeled/bajaj/taxi drivers marched to Hawasa Transportation Authority in Hawassa (Sidama, Sidama) to demand the removal of restrictions of some roads imposed by the authority. Sidama police arrested over 80 drivers for 'their active involvement in the protest'.

On 3 November 2023, residents of the coal-rich Mui basin, organized by the Centre for Human Rights and Civic Education NGO marched to the governor's office in Kitui (Kitui Central, Kitui) against coal mining in the area. The group demanded both the county and national government to shelve plans to undertake coal mining in the area.

On 3 November 2023, residents marched from Kamwangi town to the constituency Deputy County Commissioner's office (Gatundu North, Kiambu) against a stalled water project in the area. The group demanded the county leaders to address the matter.

On 3 November 2023, residents forced their way into a police station and ejected officers in Kebirigo (Nyamira, Nyamira) against increased insecurity and police laxity. The group demanded the police officers transferred.

Around 4 November 2023 (as reported), family and friends of a police officer marched in Lodwar (Turkana Central, Turkana) against the alleged disappearance of the officer since 14 May 2023, while on a security mission in Kapedo. The group demanded the relevant authorities to address the matter.

On 5 November 2023, local residents protested in Xood village (Burco, Togdheer) against the Genel Energy company exploring oil in the area. The protesters demanded Genel to implement the environmental programs promised by the company.
On 5 November 2023, a large number of residents protested for the support of one person and one vote in Burtinle town (Burtinle, Nugaal).

Around 5 November 2023 (as reported), hundreds of tea farmers protested at the Kiairungu collection Centre (Kirinyaga Central, Kirinyaga) against alleged irregular deductions by the Kenya Tea Development Agency (KTDA). The group demanded audience with the KTDA managers.
On 5 November 2023, members of the Jesus Winner Church Karatina protested (Mathira East, Nyeri) against the changes of the church leadership. The group demanded the changes stopped.

On 6 November 2023, residents gathered in Archers Post (Samburu East, Samburu) against unfair employment opportunities at the British Army Training Unit in Kenya (BATUK). The committee in charge to be dissolved.

On 6 November 2023, street cleaners from the Kampala Capital City Authority (KCCA) staged a protest at the Authority's headquarters in Kampala (Kampala, Kampala). The cleaners expressed a wish for the return of the former KCCA Executive Director, and demanded to meet with the current Executive Director, regarding issues related to non-payment.

On 6 November 2023, residents protested in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against alleged move by a church to grab land belonging to St Paul's Primary School. The group demanded the Ethics and Anti-corruption Commission (EACC) to investigate the matter.

On 6 November 2023, hundreds of residents led by the area member of parliament and two members of county assembly (all UDA, Kenya Kwanza), marched to Saba Saba police station near Maragwa (Muranga South, Muranga) against increased insecurity. The group demanded the officer commanding station (OCS) be transferred.

On 6 November 2023, residents protested by blocking the road leading to Kisii university with banana stems at Nyamage (Kitutu Chache North, Kisii) against the poor state of the road. The group demanded the cabinet secretary for roads to address the matter.

Around 7 November 2023 (as reported), residents marched on the Lamu Island (Lamu West, Lamu) against the move by the government and private developers to set up projects that are deleterious to the environment and lives of local population. The group demanded the exploration of gas in the area to be stopped.

On 7 November 2023, local residents protested in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari) in support of the one-person, one-vote election format. The Puntland Maritime Police Force blocked the main road to the airport (means unspecified) and dispersed the protesters.

On 7 November 2023, Nakuru War Memorial hospital staff marched into the facility in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) in support of the court decision, stopping the county government from taking over the management of the facility, following a land dispute.

On 7 November 2023, supporters of Turkana County woman representative (UDA Kenya Kwanza) and Turkana East member of parliament (Jubilee, Azimio) marched and camped outside the Rift Valley directorate of criminal investigations regional headquarters in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) in support of the lawmakers, as they were questioned over insecurity. The group demanded the cabinet secretary for interior to address the matter.

On 7 November 2023, residents, mainly motorists and boda boda taxi operators, protested against the poor state of the road between Tangakona to Kaliwa, in Teso South (coded to the nearest known location as Kaliwa, Teso South, Busia). The group demanded the local leaders to address the matter.

On 7 November 2023, residents protested in unspecified location within Mt Elgon constituency (coded the nearest known location as Kapsokwony, Mt Elgon, Bungoma) against the killing of a man by a forest guard over unclear reasons. The group demanded the guards to stop the conflict.

On 8 November 2023, a group of women marched around the streets of Kairi town (Gatundu North, Kiambu) against the sale and consumption of illicit alcohol and drugs in the area. Joined by one man, the group demanded the deputy president to help address the matter.

On 8 November 2023, women political leaders across the political divide gathered outside the senate building in Nairobi - Starehe (Nairobi) in support of the Meru governor (independent), following the move by the senate to reverse her impeachment by the members of the county assembly. Joined by the public service Cabinet secretary and the Nyeri governor (UDA, Kenya Kwanza) the group demanded the governor to continue serving the people of Meru County.

Around 9 November 2023 (as reported), over 70 workers gathered at the county headquarters in Embu (Manyatta, Embu) against the move by the county to lay them off. Led by county government workers union secretary general, the group demanded to be reinstated.

On 9 November 2023, traders protested against the move by Kenya National High Way Authority and Kenya Airports Authority to divert the road from Arujo to Imbo-Rata through Ogande to allow for the Kabunde airstrip expansion along Homa Bay-Rongo road in Rodikopany (Homa Bay Town, Homa Bay). A group of youth against the protest confronted the protestors and injured some (means unspecified). Police arrested four suspects and used unspecified means to disperse both groups. Three youths sustained injuries during the incident.

On 9 November 2023, residents protested in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) in support of Palestine, following the conflict situation in Gaza Strip. Police intervened and lobbed teargas to disperse the group as well as arrested dozens of the protesters.

On 9 November 2023, residents, mainly supporters of the Meru governor (independent) gathered in Meru (Imenti North, Meru) in support of the senate's move to reverse the governor's impeachment by members of county assembly.

Around 10 November 2023 (as reported), members of the public protested near Marikiti market in Nairobi - Embakasi West (Nairobi) against the move by two police officers to arrest a trader over unclear reasons. The group demanded the know the reason for his arrest.
On 10 November 2023, residents protested over the revenge clan killings in Guri-Ceel town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud).

On 10 November 2023, residents gathered in Munyeti village (coded to the sub county headquarters as Athi River, Athi River, Machakos) against alleged move by land grabbers to disinherit them through threats and forced evictions. The group demanded justice.

Around 10 November 2023 (as reported), Kenya Environmental Health and Public health Practitioners Union (KEHPHPU) protested in Meru (Imenti North North) against the alleged arbitrary transfers of the union members. The group demanded the reinstatement of the director of public health among others.

On 10 November 2023, residents, mainly supporters of Meru governor (independent) gathered at different locations in the county (coded to the county headquarters as Meru, Imenti North, Meru) in support of the governor following the move by the senate to reverse her impeachment by the members of the county assembly. The group demanded the Meru leaders to unite for development.

Around 11 November 2023 (as reported), residents of Rafiki and Kambi ya moto areas protested in Rongai (Rongai, Nakuru) against sale and consumption of illicit liquor, following the recent death of five people in the last one month. The group demanded all liquor stores closed down.

On 11 November 2023, hundreds of environmental campaigners organized by the 'Break Free from Plastic movement,' marched in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against increased plastic production. The group demanded a binding treaty to accelerate the phasing out of plastic production and use.

On 11 November 2023, family and friends protested at Parklands Police Station in Nairobi - Westlands (Westlands, Nairobi) against the alleged abduction of a Nairobi County liaison officer and immediate former South C Ward member of county assembly by suspected security officers (coded separately). The group demanded their kin freed.

On 11 November 2023, a group of nurses (health workers) gathered and sang solidarity songs in Meru (Imenti North, Meru) against poor working conditions. The group demanded better working conditions and promotions.
On 12 November 2023, residents protested against the Jubaland Administration and the Federal government in Bardera town (Baardheere, Gedo). They called for humanitarian aid after heavy flooding.

Around 12 November 2023 (as reported), hundreds of Igembe South residents protested against the poor state of Maua- Athiru Gaiti road (coded as Maua, Igembe South, Meru). Police intervened by lobbing teargas to disperse the group.

On 13 November 2023, residents protested in Lavington in Nairobi - Dagoretti North (Dagoretti North, Nairobi) against the development of high-rise apartments in the area. The group demanded the property developers to consider environmental conservation when erecting the buildings.

On 14 November 2023, dozens of tuk-tuk and boda-boda taxi operators blocked the Namanga road using their tuk-tuks and motorcycles in Namanga (Kajiado Central, Kajiado) against alleged unfair competition from minibuses on the Kitengela-Muigai-Korompoi route. The group demanded the sub-county administrator to revoke permits issued to the said minibuses.

On 14 November 2023, hundreds of Metropolitan National Savings and Credit Cooperative (SACCO) members protested in Kiambu town (Kiambu town, Kiambu) against misappropriation of their funds. The group demanded a refund of their savings.

On 14 November 2023, hundreds of residents protested in Musenka (Kajiado West, Kajiado) against being left out of the subdivision of the Oldonyonyokie ranch land. The group demanded the government to help address the matter.

On 14 November 2023, 275 street vendors living with disabilities led by an ODM -Azimio nominated senator marched and camped outside Governor's office in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against unfavorable working conditions and discriminatory policies imposed by the County Government, following the ban on hawking. The group demanded for justice and a revision of current county laws and regulations.

On 15 November 2023, teachers and students protested in Nyandarua (Kinangop, Nyandarua) against increased insecurity, following the recent killing of a teacher in the area. Led by officials from the Kenya National Union of Teachers (KNUT), the group demanded justice for the slain teacher.

Around 15 November 2023 (as reported), Othaya and Mukurweini residents protested (coded as Othaya, Nyeri South, Nyeri) against the delayed completion of the Mairo-ini, Karuthi-Gichachara road. The group demanded relevant authorities to address the matter.

On 15 November 2023, for the second day, 275 street vendors living with disabilities camped outside the Governor's office in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against unfavorable working conditions and discriminatory policies imposed by the County Government, following the ban on hawking. The group demanded for justice and a revision of current county laws and regulations.

On 16 November 2023, residents protested by blocking the Marigi-Kandakomu road (coded as Kanda Komu, Gatundu North, Kiambu) with banana stems against the poor state of the road. The group demanded the member of parliament to address the matter.

On 16 November 2023, the Bar Hotels and Liquor Traders Association of Kenya (BAHLITA) members gathered in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against several amendment bills being introduced in counties, alleging that they will negatively affect the alcoholic beverages sector and harm the hospitality sector. The group demanded the counties to address the matter.

Around 16 November 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Kawangware in Nairobi - Dagoretti North (Dagoretti North, Nairobi) against the move by the Kenya Medical Practitioners and Dentist Council (KMPDC) to close Muthetania hospital due to alleged negligence. The group demanded their political leaders to help address the matter.

On 17 November 2023, Kenya Private Security Workers Union members marched to the office of the Private Security Regulatory Authority (PSRA) and later to the office of the President in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) in support of the move by the government to increase their minimum salaries to Sh30,000.

On 18 November 2023, women leaders and residents, mainly ODM-Azimio supporters, gathered in Archers Post (Samburu East, Samburu) against the conduct of the ODM secretary general (who also doubles up as Nairobi senator) for allegedly disrespecting women. The group demanded the party to take action against the secretary general.

On 18 November 2023, local residents protested against Hiiraan regional administration and Hirshabelle state in front of the ATMIS main gate in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). This is after the Hiiran governor attempted to visit a site where DNDF ATMIS troops were distributing aid to the people displaced by the floods. The protesters chanted anti-Hirshabelle slogans.

Around 18 November 2023 (as reported), residents blocked the Gwa Kimanga-Kahuguini road with stones, logs, Napier grass and other plantations (location coded to the subcounty headquarters as Gatundu, Gatundu South, Kiambu) in demonstration against the poor state of the road. The group demanded their elected leaders to address the matter.

On 19 November 2023, overnight, Kabarak university student blocked (using unspecified means) the Nakuru-Ravine highway outside the institution at Kabarak (Rongai, Nakuru) against the death of their colleague, who died in a road accident involving a police van. The group demanded justice for their slain colleague. Normalcy was restored after the police were deployed (no mention of interaction).

On 19 November 2023, the family and friends of an Ethiopian businessman, joined by human rights defenders from Haki Africa marched in the Kileleshwa neighborhood of Nairobi - Dagoretti North (Dagoretti North, Nairobi) against the alleged abduction of the businessman by unknown people, two years ago (coded separately). The group demanded the government to help find the missing businessman.

On 20 November 2023, a group of residents protested in Hoima (Hoima, Hoima) to denounce the power blackout at the UMEME offices (national institution in charge of electricity distribution). The police intervened to stop the demonstration.

On 20 November 2023, electric boda boda taxi operators protested in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against increased maintenance costs as well as limitations in performance. The group demanded the manufacturer to address the matter.

On 20 November 2023, demonstrators blocked the road between Hargeisa and Sahil region (through unspecified means) in Abdaal village (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed) to condemn the arrest of traditional elders and youths. Police forces fired live bullets to disperse the demonstrators. At least one protestor was killed, and another was injured.

Around 20 November 2023 (as reported), sugarcane farmers gathered in Nandolia area of Bukembe (Kanduyi, Bungoma) against the deployment of National Youth Service (NYS) personnel in cane farms, fearing that the move will render the locals jobless. The group demanded both the national and leaders from the region to help address the matter.

On 21 November 2023, lawyers and supporters of former Mungiki leader protested along Court road in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against heavy police presence outside Nakuru court, ahead of the arraignment of the Mungiki leader. The police intervened and arrested 10 people.

On 21 November 2023, health workers gathered and sang solidarity songs in Mbale (Vihiga, Vihiga) against poor working environment as well as lack of career progression. The group demanded the governor to address the issues.

On 22 November 2023, a group of women protested at state assembly house, against the electoral law agenda in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). The protesters demanded for peace and stability to prevail in the town.

Around 22 November 2023 (week of), hundreds of students and teachers staged a protest in Shone, Shone town, East Badiwacho woreda (Hadiya, Central Ethiopia) to demand payment of teachers' salaries withheld for over three months. Government security forces (coded as Central Ethiopia regional state police) arrested teachers who participated in the protest.

Around 22 November 2023 (as reported), residents from six villages gathered in Dongo Kundu within Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) in support of the government move to halt the 1.4 billion shillings compensation to establish genuine project affected persons by the special economic zone- Dongo Kundu project. The group demanded transparency in the compensation scheme.
On 22 November 2023, hundreds of former Mungiki leader supporters gathered outside the Nakuru law courts (Nakuru North, Nakuru) in solidarity with their leader's arraignment in court.

On 23 November 2023, students of Misrak Badwach demonstrated in Shone (Hadiya, central Ethiopia) against the non-payment of teachers' salary since August this year and the disruption of teaching-learning activity because of strike by teachers. The woreda's police intervened, physically abusing protesters and detained many teachers accusing them of instigating students to conduct 'unlawful protest'.

On 23 November 2023, street families blocked (using unspecified means) the governor's motorcade in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the challenges they face. Police officers intervened and shoved the group away from the governor's car, with one officer slapping the groups suspected leader.
On 25 November 2023, a group of women protested against the electoral law agenda in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal) and demanded peace and stability to prevail in the town.

On 25 November 2023, Kitengela international parents and students protested at the institution in Kitengela (Kajiado East, Kajiado) against errors in the recently released Kenya Certificate of Primary Education (KCPE) marks by the Kenya National Examination Council (KNEC). The group demanded KNEC to address the matter.

Around 26 November 2023 (as reported), Pinewood Beach Resort staff protested in Diani (Msambweni, Kwale) against a recent attack by a mob linked to an intended bank takeover which left some colleagues injured (coded separately). The group demanded justice for their injured colleagues.

On 26 November 2023, players and fans (suspected supporters of the area member of county assembly - UDA, Kenya Kwanza), disrupted a football tournament by scolding at the Cabinet Secretary (CS) for roads (who had sponsored the tournament) in Kabarnet (Baringo Central, Baringo) against the importation of players in a Mogotio team. The group demanded the authorities to address the matter. The CS had to cut short his speech and the tournament postponed.

On 26 November 2023, residents demonstrated in Kiplombe (Turbo, Uasin Gishu) against the killing of four people (other sources mention five) by military officers and farm guards (coded separately). The group demanded justice for the slain victims.

On 26 November 2023, Kitengela international school parents camped outside the Kenya National Examination Council (KNEC) offices in Kilimani neighborhood of Nairobi - Dagoretti North (Dagoretti North, Kilimani) against errors in the recently released Kenya Certificate of Primary Education (KCPE) examination marks. The group demanded KNEC to rectify the errors.

Around 26 November 2023 (as reported), a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Igembe Central and Kiengu sub counties gathered in Meru town (Imenti North, Meru) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. The group demanded the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 27 November 2023, hundreds of residents gathered at the main entrance of Moi University (Kesses, Uasin Gishu) against the poor performance and bad leadership by the university Vice Chancellor (VC). Joined by human rights defenders, the group demanded the VC removed from office.

On 27 November 2023, a group of women blocked (using unspecified means) the Ngarariga-Limuru old road (Limuru Central, Limuru) against the assault of the MCA by her male colleague. Led by human rights defenders from Groots Kenya, the group demanded the society to respect women leaders as well as justice for the MCA.

On 27 November 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Kisii County protested in Kisii town (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. On 27 November 2023, hundreds of residents marched to the Kesses Sub-County Commissioner's office (Kesses, Uasin Gishu) against the poor performance and bad leadership by the university Vice Chancellor (VC). Joined by human rights defenders, the group demanded the VC removed from office.

On 27 November 2023, a group of family members forced their way into Naivasha Sub-County hospital (Naivasha, Nakuru) against the death of their kin as a result of negligence by the medical team at the facility. The group demanded justice for their kin.

On 28 November 2023, Kawere and Maranyona village residents demonstrated in the area (location coded as Maranyona, Bondo, Siaya) against increased insecurity. The group demanded the security authorities to address the matter.

On 29 November 2023, residents protested in Giathugu (Mukurweini, Nyeri) against increased cases of sexual assault and murder, following the recent killing of a four-year-old girl child by an unknown assailant. The group demanded security officers to address the matter as well as justice for the child (it is unclear whether the area member of parliament joined the protestors).

On 29 November 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Nandi County gathered in Kapsabet (Chesumei, Nandi) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. On 29 November 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Homa Bay County protested in Homa Bay town (Homa Bay, Homa Bay) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. On 29 November 2023, boda boda taxi operators protested in Kitengela (Kajiado East, Kajiado) against motorcycle theft. Led by the area boda boda chairman, the group demanded the security officers to address the matter.
Around 30 November 2023 (as reported), residents gathered in Kipng'etket Centre (Mosop, Nandi) against the government move to close down a local bar. The group demanded the bar reopened.

On 30 November 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Tharaka-Nithi County gathered in unspecified location (coded to the county headquarters as Kathwana, Tharaka South, Tharaka-Nithi) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. Led by Lolgorian Ward (Jubilee, Azimio) and Kimintet Ward (CCM, Kenya Kwanza), members of county assembly, the group demanded the DCC dismissed.

Around 30 November 2023 (as reported), a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Trans Nzoia County protested in unspecified location (coded to the county headquarter as Kitale, Saboti, Trans Nzoia) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. The group demanded the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 30 November 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Muranga County protested in Muranga (Kiharu, Muranga) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. The group demanded the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

Around 1 December 2023 (as reported), a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Kiambu gathered in Kiambu town (Kiambu Town, Kiambu) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. On 1 December 2023, residents blocked the entrance leading to the office of the municipality manager by locking the gate in Malaba (Teso North, Busia) against appointment of a new manager. Led by human rights defenders, the group demanded the Senator to help address the matter among others.

On 1 December 2023, health workers (doctors) gathered and sang solidarity songs in Kitengela (Kajiado East, Kajiado) against unresolved concerns. Around 1 December 2023 (as reported), a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Baringo county gathered at unspecified location (coded to the county headquarters as Kabarnet, Baringo Central, Baringo) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. Around 1 December 2023 (as reported), a group of junior secondary school intern teachers gathered at unspecified location within Migori county (coded to the county headquarters as Migori (Suna West, Migori) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. The group demanded TSC to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

Around 2 December 2023 (as reported), residents (likely fishermen as this is a fishing community/village) protested along Nyang'wina beach in Muhuru Bay (Nyatike, Migori) against the move by Ugandan authorities to capture four Kenyan boats over alleged trespass in Lake Victoria. On 2 December 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Trans Nzoia County gathered in Kitale town (Saboti, Trans Nzoia) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. The group demanded the Teachers Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.
On 2 December 2023, Bejaj drivers protested over the killing of a colleague who refused to pay an SNA soldier in Mogadishu - Waaberi (Banadir). They Blocked the port road on 21 October.

On 2 December 2023, residents of Nyacaba and Witeithie villages blocked unspecified road with rocks and twigs (coded to one of the villages as Witeithie, Juja, Kiambu) in demonstration against increased Hyena attacks after a woman was mauled to death. Local leaders intervened using unspecified means to allow the police to pick the woman's remains at the mortuary.

Around 3 December 2023 (as reported), a group of residents most from the Kibarbeig Community marched in demonstration to the village office in Three Hills in the district of Babati (Babati Urban, Manyara) against the failure of the government in solving land dispute, demanding residential address in their area. The group closed the office of the village by unknown means. They claimed they were removed from Malamboi and replaced to Mfulwang'ombe.

On 4 December 2023, over 100 lawyers drawn from the Law Society of Kenya (LSK), protested outside Nakuru Law Courts before entering the court premises in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against unfair treatment and restricted access to the court premises following the move by the judicial officers to close one of the gates. The group demanded unrestricted court access as well as an audience with the presiding judge.

On 4 December 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Kisumu County marched to the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) offices in Kisumu town (Kisumu Central, Kisumu) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement.
On 4 December 2023, parents protested at Kapchesir primary school (Cherangany, Trans Nzoia) against poor management by the head teacher. The group demanded the head teacher transferred.

On 5 December 2023, pastoralist community members protested in Pangani area of Lamu county (coded to the county Head quarters as Lamu, Lamu West, Lamu) against increased cases of abduction and killing by security officers. Joined by Haki Africa representatives and a lawyer, the group demanded government to address the matter.

On 5 December 2023, over 700 Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Kwale County marched along the Mombasa-Lunga-Lunga highway at Ukunda (Msambweni, Kwale) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement.

On 5 December 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Narok County gathered Narok (Narok North, Narok) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. Joined by Kenya Union of Post Primary Education Teachers (KUPPET) representatives, the group demanded the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 5 December 2023, residents protested in Tunen village (Cherangany, Trans Nzoia) against the recent attack and injury of a man (coded separately), following a land dispute with a private developer. On 5 December 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Makueni County gathered Wote town (Makueni, Makueni) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement.

On 6 December 2023, members of Coast Digital Cabs Association (CDCA) (other sources mention Mombasa Taxi Drivers Association) gathered in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against travelers using Bolt and Uber online taxi services, citing safety concerns. The group demanded the travelers to boycott the taxi services.

On 6 December 2023, residents protested in Gatwe (Kirinyaga Central, Kirinyaga) against the downgrading of Gatwe health center. The group demanded the county government to reinstate the facility to a health center.

On 6 December 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Bomet county marched in Bomet town (Bomet East, Bomet) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. Joined by Kenya Union of Post Primary Education Teachers (KUPPET) representative, the group demanded the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 6 December 2023, residents protested in Ndunyu Njeru (Kinangop, Nyandarua) against the move by a road contractor to prolong roadworks. The group demanded the contractor to provide an alternative route.

On 6 December 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Nyeri county gathered and sang solidarity songs in Nyeri town (Nyeri Central, Nayeri) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. Joined by Kenya Union of Post Primary Education Teachers (KUPPET) representative, the group demanded the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 6 December 2023, residents of Kaimosi in Vihiga County marched to the Ministry of Public Service in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against alleged corruption, nepotism, and poor leadership by the acting Vice Chancellor of Kaimosi University. The group demanded the Ministry not to confirm the VC as the substantive head of the institution.

On 7 December 2023, residents of Mavoko marched to Joska Police Station (Matungulu, Machakos) against alleged move by a businessman to grab public land in the area. The group demanded the county leadership to recover the land and put it to its designated use.

On 7 December 2023, boda boda taxi operators protested in Busia (Matayos, Busia) against increased insecurity, following the killing of more than 20 of their members in the last three months. The group demanded the cabinet secretary for interior to address the matter as well as justice for their slain colleagues.
On 7 December 2023, climate activists marched in Homa Bay (Homa Bay Town, Homa Bay) against climate change. The group demanded justice for families affected by the changing climate.

On 8 December 2023, residents from Kiganjo, Mumbuini, Kiawanding'a, Githembe and Gitwe villages, mainly farmers and boda boda taxi operators, protested by blocking the Kiganjo-Gitwe road (coded as Kiganjo, Gatundu South, Kiambu) with banana stems against the poor state of the road. The group demanded the member of parliament to address the matter.

On 9 December 2023, Waterfront Gardens residents blocked the entrance Qaribu Inn Hotel, wiht their vehicles, in protest against the noise pollution from the facility in Loresho neighborhood of Nairobi - Westlands (Westlands, Nairobi). Police officers from the Anti- 'Terror' Police Unit (ATPU) intervened and dispersed the group by removing number plates from the vehicles.

On 10 December 2023, Puntland Darawish Soldiers staged a protest by blocking the main entrance of the seaport and the Bossaso-Armo-Qardho highway by unspecified means in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari). The protest aimed at demanding payment of their unpaid salaries, and lasted for about an hour.

On 10 December 2023, ethnic Agaw residents protested in Kilaj town, Zigem woreda (Awi, Amhara) to condemn attacks by an armed group in the Amhara region. They also demanded that the Federal government recognize their constitutional rights to rule themselves and exercise self-determination.

On 10 December 2023, members of the Full Gospel Church protested in the Kawangware neighborhood of Nairobi - Dagoretti North (Dagoretti North, Nairobi) against the move by the bishop to request the members to buy him a vehicle (Prado) as well as the bishop attacking the church elders while preaching among other grievances. The group demanded the bishop to leave.

Around 11 December 2023 (as reported), leaders and residents entered a Rift Valley security meeting, likely at Naiborkeju (Samburu Central, Samburu) in a demonstration against the loss of 100 livestock, following a recent raid (coded separately). The group demanded the authorities to address the matter.

On 11 December 2023, teachers and supporting staff of Andinet International School (privately owned) protested inside the school's premises in Yeka Sub city (location coded to Kotobe, Yeka, Region 14, Addis Ababa), opposing the summary dismissal of four teachers and a librarian who was elected by the teachers to represent them in their interaction with the school's administration including facilitating the formation of workers union.

Around 12 December 2023 (as reported), a group of mitumba (second hand clothes) traders marched to the Laikipia Governor's office in Nanyuki (Laikipia East, Laikipia) against an alleged move by unknown people to grab the land they have been operating from. The group demanded the county government protect the land.

On 13 December 2023, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers marched in Kitui (Kitui Central, Kitui) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. Joined by Kenya Union of Post Primary Education Teachers (KUPPET) representative, the group demanded the Teacher Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 14 December 2023, residents protested in Mwarustwa near Shimoni (Lunga Lunga, Kwale) against delayed construction of the Mwachande bridge. Led by the community's Mwachande Bridge Taskforce chairman, the group demanded the government to construct a temporary bridge, while waiting for the completion of the main one.

On 14 December 2023, residents protested in Sironga (Nyamira, Nyamira) against the intimidation of the controller of the budget by the government following her recent arrest and arraignment over corruption allegations. The group demanded the president to address the matter.

On 17 December 2023, teachers staged a protest in Shire town, Tahtay Koraro woreda (North West Tigray, Tigray) to demand the payment of their unpaid salaries withheld for over 18 months due to the Tigray conflict. Around 18 December 2023 (as reported), residents, mainly women and youth, protested in Marigat town (Marigat, Baringo) against increased cost of living. The group demanded the government through the president to address the matter.

On 18 December 2023, businessmen protested in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against the government's move to demolish their properties. The group demanded justice from both the county and the national governments.

On 18 December 2023, traders operating within the stalls owned by the Salvation Army church protested in Nairobi Central Business District (CBD) (Starehe, Nairobi) against the move by the church to increase the rent for the stalls. The group demanded the church council to address the matter.

Around 18 December 2023 (as reported), public service vehicle operators (matatus) blocked a road using unspecified means in Malindi (Malindi town, Kilifi) against alleged harassment by local authorities, following the move by the local authority to relocate them to the New Malindi bus park. The group demanded county government to address the matter.

On 18 December 2023, thousands of residents protested in the Gikumari area of Ruiru (Ruiru, Kiambu) against an alleged plan by high profile people to displace them and develop estates on their land. The group demanded the government and human rights defenders to help address the matter.

On 19 December 2023, residents protested in Birunda (Kiminini, Trans Nzoia) against an alleged move by a police officer to go after villagers' wives in romantic pursuit. The group demanded the officer transferred.

On 19 December 2023, residents blocked the Kimbimbi-Kanjinji road by digging trenches in Mwea area in Kirinyaga county (coded as Mwea, Mbeere South, Embu) against the poor state of the road. The group demanded their local leaders to address to address the matter.

Around 19 December 2023 (as reported), former Absa Bank Kenya staff gathered in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the alleged mismanagement of the Staff Pension Fund and sidelining of members. Led by the chairperson of the Pensioners Association, the group demanded the pension fund regulator-Retirement Benefits Authority (RBA) to help safeguard their interests and benefits.

On 19 December 2023, members of the Kenya National Private Security Workers Union gathered and sang solidarity songs in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the move by their employers to refuse to honor a legal notice to pay the minimum gazette wage. The group demanded the parliamentary committee on administration and internal security to look into the matter.

On 20 December 2023, traders protested outside the Mombasa law courts (Mvita, Mombasa) destruction of their wares allegedly by a private developer wanting to displace them. The group demanded justice.

Around 20 December 2023 (as reported), casual workers protested at Isiolo referral hospital (Isiolo, Isiolo) against delayed pay. The group demanded the governor and deputy governor to address the matter.

Around 20 December 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Garissa (Garissa, Garissa) against their exclusion in the selection of the newly created sub-county headquarters. The group demanded the internal security cabinet secretary to help address the matter.

On 21 December 2023, residents protested in Otiiri village (Nambale, Busia) against the move by the police officers to raid a homestead, shoot in the air and arrest residents in unclear circumstances. The group demanded the inspector general of police to investigate the matter.

Around 21 December 2023 (as reported), small-scale traders protested at Misori beach (Bondo, Siaya) against poor working conditions. Led by their chairperson, the group demanded the county government to address their grievances.
On 22 December 2023, a group of Kiosk owners protested against eviction at the city offices in Mbarara (Mbarara, Mbarara).

On 22 December 2023, members of Ruiru land buying company protested in Ruiru (Ruiru, Kiambu) against alleged encroachment by a road contractor. Led by the company chairman, the group demanded proper procedures to be followed as well as compensation for those affected.
On 23 December 2023, residents protested in Changamwe (Changamwe, Mombasa) against eviction by the National Housing Corporation to pave way for the construction of the affordable housing project.

On 26 December 2023, residents gathered in Lamu (Lamu West, Lamu) against frequent and lengthy power outages in the region. Led by a nominated senator (Wiper, Azimio), the group demanded the Kenya Power and Lighting (KPLC) company regional manager transferred as well as the government to help address the matter.

Around 26 December 2023 (as reported), residents protested in Maungu (Voi, Taita Taveta) against the withdrawal of the development of carbon credit project, following allegations of sexual harassment at the workplace. Led by a former executive in county administration, the group demanded fair administration of justice and compensation if human rights violations are proven.

Around 26 December 2023 (as reported), residents gathered in Soi (Aldai, Nandi) against the poor state of the roads. The group demanded the county government and Kibos sugar company to address the matter.

On 27 December 2023, Puntland Darawish Soldiers protested and blocked vehicular access to the main (through unspecified means) for about one hour in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). They demanded the payment of salaries.

Around 27 December 2023 (as reported), residents gathered at Links Butterfly estate in Nyali (Nyali, Mombasa) against poor drainage, following the move by a contractor of a nearby mall to block drainage systems. Led by a former area member of parliament, the group demanded county government to address the matter.

On 27 December 2023, residents, joined by human rights defenders, and social media influencers, marched from Mitunguu, while making stop overs in Nkubu, Mtindwa, Makutano, Mriri, Kangeta, Lari Maili Tatu, to Maua town (Igembe South, Meru) against the murder of blogger Daniel Muthiani (coded separately). Led by a section of leaders from the region, the group demanded justice for the deceased blogger.

On 28 December 2023, beneficiaries of the Affordable Housing Project including architects, sand harvesters, masons and slum dwellers (other sources mention Jua Kali contractors) marched (under police escort) through Moi Avenue, Tom Mboya and Kenyatta Avenue in Nairobi Central Business District (CBD) (Starehe, Nairobi) in support of the Affordable Housing Project, following the recent court injunctions. The group demanded the government to implement the project.

On 29 December 2023, demonstrators closed the road with stones in Edo Kebele (location coded to Wendo Genet, Wondo-Genet, Sidama) on the border between Sidama and Oromia, demonstrating against guests visiting the school. One motorcyclist sustained injuries and was admitted to hospital. The roadblock was lifted, and the transport service resumed following the arrival of Sidama region security forces. It is unclear if the security forces intervened and how the motorcyclist sustained injuries.

On 29 December 2023, secondary school teachers protested in Kericho town (Ainamoi, Kericho) against the planned move by the Cabinet Secretary (CS) for education to release the Kenya Certificate of Secondary School Education (KCSE) exam early, following the anomalies witnessed in the recent Kenya Certificate of Primary Education (KCPE) results. Led by the Kenya Union of Post-Primary Education Teachers (KUPPET) the group the CS not to hurriedly release the results.

On 30 December 2023, residents forced their way into the Kigumo deputy county commissioner's (DCC) office (Kigumo, Muranga) against illegal felling of eucalyptus trees around the DCC's office. Led by the area Member of Parliament (MP) (UDA, Kenya Kwanza) the group demanded the DCC to be transferred.
On 1 January 2024, residents of Harar staged a demonstration in Harar (Abadir, Harari), supporting the Memorandum of Understanding signed between Somaliland and Ethiopia.

On 2 January 2024, residents of Dire Dawa staged a demonstration in Dire Dawa (Gende Kore, Dire Dawa urban, Dire Dawa), supporting the signing of the Memorandum of Understanding between Somaliland and Ethiopia (coded separately).

On 2 January 2024, hundreds of the population protested at the Khayre square in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed). The protesters gathered to celebrate and express their support to the recently signed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ethiopia and Somaliland. Several Somaliland officials joined the crowd.

On 2 January 2024, residents protested at Kihara Level 4 Hospital (Kiambaa, Kiambu) against lack of healthcare services. The group demanded the authorities to equip the hospital as well as avail emergency services for women.
On 2 January 2024, residents protested in Kadenge (Alego Usonga, Siaya) against environmental degradation by the Rai-owned Company Lake Agro. The group demanded the company to stop the degradation.
Around 2 January 2024 (as reported), a group of secondary school teachers protested at the district hall in Busia (Busia, Busia) against the delay in salary payment .

On 2 January 2024, health workers at Mediheal hospital protested in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against delayed pay. The group demanded their employer to address their grievances as well as the government to help address the matter.
On 2 January 2024, Puntland maritime police protested over unpaid salaries in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari). The forces blocked (means unspecified) the entrance to Bander Qassim International Airport.

On 2 January 2024, youth recently arrested over suspicion of being members of the outlawed Mungiki Sect protested inside cells at the Nyeri Divisional police headquarters (Nyeri Central, Nyeri) against their arrest and detention. The group demanded for freedom and solidarity.

On 2 January 2024, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Trans Nzoia County gathered in an unspecified location (coded to the county headquarters as Kitale, Saboti, Trans Nzoia) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. The group demanded the Teachers Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 3 January 2024, several hundreds of the population protested in Gebiley town (Gebiley, Woqooyi Galbeed). The protesters gathered to celebrate and express their support to the recently signed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ethiopia and Somaliland.

On 3 January 2024, several hundreds of the population protested at the Khayre square in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed). The protesters gathered to celebrate and express their support to the recently signed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ethiopia and Somaliland.

On 3 January 2024, hundreds of people protested at Daljirka Dahsoon monument (Tomb of the Unknown Soldier) in Mogadishu - Bondhere (Banadir). The protesters rejected the recent MoU agreement between Somaliland and Ethiopia for access to the Red Sea coast.

Around 3 January 2024 (as reported), traders protested in the Sunton neighborhoods of Nairobi - Kasarani (Kasarani, Nairobi) against alleged harassment by officers from the Kenya Bureau of Standards (KEBS). The group demanded the agency to look into the matter.

Around 4 January 2024 (as reported), political and community leaders gathered at Larisoro in the outskirts of Archers Post (Samburu East, Samburu) against alleged move by the management of the Losesia Group Ranch to irregularly sell a portion of community land. Led by the Governor, Senator and Woman Representative (all from UDA, Kenya Kwanza), the group demanded that any land transactions must get the approval of the County government.

Around 4 January 2024 (as reported), residents protested in Kapsabet town (Chesumei, Nandi) against increased cases insecurity, following the recent electronic shop break-ins. The group demanded the county commissioner to address the matter.

On 22 January 2024, 300 South Design and Construction Supervision Enterprise employees demonstrated in front of the enterprise's office in Hawasa (Hawasa town, Sidama). The demonstrators requested payment of different benefits and entitlements due to them, according to the labor proclamation following the dissolution of the enterprise by the government order.
On 22 January 2024, residents protested against the Banadir regional administration's efforts to evict them from land in the Dabdamiska neighborhood in Mogadishu - Daynile (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).

On 22 January 2024, Nyaribari Chache and Nyaribari Masaba residents protested in Nyabisabo near Nyamache (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii) against the alleged failure by South Mugirango Member of Parliament (MP) to respect the governor. The group demanded for mutual respect and good working relationships among the political leaders.

On 23 January 2024, ethnic Agaw residents and internally displaced persons (IDPs) held a protest in Birbita town (location coded to Sekota town, Sekota, in Wag Hamra, Amhara). The protesters demanded the return of IDPs to their homes, the resumption of public services, and the recognition of their constitutional right to self-administer.

On 23 January 2024, residents protested in Kibwaga near Tiwi (Matuga, Kwale) against alleged resurgence of private developers targeting community land and evicting residents. The group demanded the President to help address the matter as well as land adjudication carried out afresh.

On 23 January 2024, traders protested at the Nyawita trading center near Ulafu (Alego Usonga, Siaya) against increased cases of insecurity. Joined by the area boda boda operator's association chairman, the group demanded for a police post or chief's camp to be developed in the area.

On 23 January 2024, residents of Olmoran, Rumuruti, Sipili, Kinamba, and other areas protested in Ol Moran (Laikipia North, Laikipia) against increased pastoral militia attacks. The group demanded the cabinet secretary for interior to address the matter.

On 23 January 2024, Kitui County workers' trade union leaders gathered and sang solidarity songs in Kitui (Kitui Central. Kitui) against alleged move by the county government to violate their rights. The group demanded the county government to address their grievances.
On 23 January 2024, residents marched in Nyahururu town (Laikipia West, Laikipia) against increased cases of insecurity. The group demanded justice for the victims.

On 23 January 2024, more than 400 families living in Dupot Darfur farm gathered in Kiang'ombe along the Nairobi Mombasa highway (coded to the nearest known location as Kitengela, Kajiado East, Kajiado) against alleged move by the government not to compensate them for surrendering their land up for the construction of the Standard Gauge Railway (SGR). The group demanded the Kenya railways authority to address the matter.

On 24 January 2024, thousands of Ethnic Tigrayan Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) staged a peaceful protest around Martha Square in Mekele (Mekelle Tigray, Tigray). The protestors criticized the Federal government for the failure to fully implement the Pretoria agreement and appealed to the international community for humanitarian assistance. They demanded the government to repatriate them to their hometowns without delay. Tigray Interim government's president apologized to the IDPs for the situation and promised to take all the possible measures to end their suffering.
On 24 January 2024, coffee farmers gathered in Gachika (Gatundu South, Kiambu) against the delicensing of Kiambu millers by the government. The group demanded freedom to sell their produce anywhere.

On 24 January 2024, health workers (doctors) gathered in unspecified location (coded to the county headquarters as Kitui, Kitui Central, Kitui) against alleged labor exploitation experiences. Led by the KMPDU secretary general, the group demanded the county government to address their grievances.

On 24 January 2024, about fifty clergy attached to the Diocese of Kigezi, including priests and catechists protested the killing of a catechist in Rubira (Ndorwa, Kabale). They walked in protest from the Rubira Church of Uganda to the Rubira trading center.

On 24 January 2024, thousands of CHADEMA supporters, including the chairman and vice chairman, marched to the United Nations offices in Dar es Salaam (Ilala, Dar es Salaam), opposing proposed changes to electoral laws, particularly three bills recently presented in Parliament, seen as protection measures to the ruling party. Protesters also demanded better living costs and the reduction of presidential powers.

On 25 January 2024, women protested in Kisii (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii) against infighting among the local political leaders. The group demanded the cabinet secretary for international secretary to help address the matter.

On 25 January 2024, parents protested in Kaptumo (Baringo Central, Baringo) against the exclusion of Kaptumo Primary from having a Junior Secondary School (JSS) program. The group demanded the government to help address the matter.

On 25 January 2024, human rights defenders protested outside the German Embassy at 113 Riverside Drive neighborhood of Nairobi - Westlands (Westlands, Nairobi) against Germany's increased support of Israel, following the conflict situation in the Gaza Strip. Police intervened and lobbed teargas to disperse the group. Three foreigners (German, French and American) and a Kenyan were arrested (other sources mention three people) during the incident.
On 26 January 2024, residents protested in Esoit (Narok West, Narok) against alleged grabbing of their land by unknown people. Police intervened and lobbed teargas to disperse the group.
On 26 January 2024, residents disrupted President Ruto's rally by scolding at the area governor in Kiutine (Igembe Central, Meru) over unclear reasons. The governor had to cut short her speech.

On 26 January 2024, Dulmidiid/Garxajis clan militia based in Ga'an-Libah protested against the Somaliland electoral law in Dari Maraa village (Owdweyne, Togdheer). There is ongoing election dispute in Somaliland.

On 26 January 2024, hundreds of human rights defenders, people living with disabilities, survivors of torture, gender-based violence and human trafficking marched in Nyeri town (Nyeri Central, Nyeri) against increased femicide cases. The group demanded the government to declare femicide a national emergency.

On 26 January 2024, a section of members of the Supreme Council of Kenyan Muslims Supkem protested outside the council offices in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the refusal of the current chairman (Hassan Ole Nado) to leave office, following the gazettement of a new chairman (Yusuf Nzibo) by the registrar of societies. The group demanded the government to help address the matter.

The group demanded the government to address the matter as well as justice for the victims.

On 27 January 2024, residents marched in Machakos (Machakos, Machakos) against increased femicide cases. The group demanded the government to address the matter as well as justice for the victims.

On 27 January 2024, thousands of women, joined by feminists, civil society, political leaders, Law Society of Kenya representatives, and human rights defenders marched (with some scolding at the Nairobi women representative) in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against increased femicide cases. The group demanded the government to address the matter as well as justice for the victims.

On 27 January 2024, residents protested in Thika (Thika Town, Kiambu) against the alleged move by land grabbers to invade cemetery land. The group demanded the deputy president, the governor and other leaders from the area to help address the matter.

On 28 January 2024, traders, mainly food vendors, protested at Kware market in Ongata Rongai (Loitokitok, Kajiado) against uncollected garbage. The group demanded the county government to address the matter.

Around 28 January 2024 (as reported), residents of Sidundo and Mulambo gathered in or around Sidundo (Alego Usonga, Siaya) against sand harvesting that is destroying their environment. The group demanded the National Environment Management Authority, to stop sand harvesting in the area.

On 29 January 2024, residents of Mana Sibu woreda staged a protest rally in Aleltu Gombi kebele (location coded to Wama Tobera, in Mana Sibu woreda, West Wellega, Oromia) to condemn the government and demonstrate their solidarity with OLF Shane. On 29 January 2024, residents protested in Mukunike near Kilimambogo (Thika Town, Kiambu) against a court order that has allegedly blocked them from developing their area, following a land dispute. On 30 January 2024, residents of Seyo woreda staged a protest near Dembi Dolo, Denbi Dollo town, (Kellem Wellega, Oromia) to condemn the government and demonstrate their solidarity with OLF Shane. The protesters demanded the government stop airstrikes targeting civilians in Oromia.

On 30 January 2024, a group of NUP supporters protested at the high court in Kampala (Kampala, Kampala), urging for the immediate release of their relatives whom they claim have been detained by the security operatives, and are unaccounted for.

On 30 January 2024, construction workers marched and camped outside the Milimani law courts in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the recent court orders suspending the government run affordable housing project. On 31 January 2024, residents protested in the South C neighborhoods of Nairobi - Langata (Langata, Nairobi) against the move by the county government and the National Environment Management Authority (NEMA) to approve the development of substandard buildings, posing risks to their lives and their children.

On 31 January 2024, women protested in Thigio (Limuru, Kiambu) against increased selling illicit brew and hard drugs. The group demanded the security agencies to help address the matter as well as the county government to recall all licenses of bars in the area.

Around 31 January 2024 (as reported), residents protested in Kiabiraa (Manga, Nyamira) against the move by both the county and national governments to close down the quarry in the area, following an alleged land dispute.
